hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booked for 5nights, unfortunately due to coronovirus advised to return to UK early so only stayed 3 nights. Fantastic hotel & staff, lovely breakfast & a real pleasure to stay with you. Would definately recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect central location, view of the Empire State Building from our room and the roof, amazing breakfast included and with coffee in the room along with comfy beds - what more could you possibly need? The staff throughout the declared city emergency were just fabulous - calm and remarkably helpful when they were personally affected by the measures too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent 1 week enjoying our trip to NY city for the first time. Hyatt place responded to all our necessities, from room cleaning to breakfast. In any of the days I had any issue. They helped to make it an unforgettable trip to this beautiful city. On our last night we ate at the bar. Jamal made it feel like we were dinning in our home! Don’t hesitate to come in here, it’s a great deal!Thank you Hyatt crew, you’re all so nice and responsible people, nothing would’ve been the same without you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are in New York with a fat wallet and wish to drop $500+ per night for your basic 4 star room without a view, life in The Big Smoke can be east peasy.However, if you are on a retired couple's budget, it is difficult to locate a midtown hotel under $175 that meets 4 star expectations. Permit me yo introduce you to The Hyatt Place on West 36th Street. For the price of a room you get (if you are a Club member); free breakfast, free high speed wi fi, bottled water, fab location, outdoor terrace for enjoying the view, fully equipped gym and the friendliest staff in town.So what are you waiting for? Make your reservation now.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved this hotel! Had a great stay for one night. Friendly staff, helpful with suggesting things to do in the area. So many options for food within the one block. Clean hotel. Loved the free breakfast in the am! Abundance of options for food and they had soy milk for my coffee (usually rare)! Definitely will stay again and recommend to friends I would just say would be great if they updated their bottled water from nestle pure life to Fiji or at least carried it as another option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at Hyatt Place Midtown. The check-in was straight forward, the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The location is superb! Located very close to the Empire State building, getting to Macy's, 5th Ave, Times Square, Flat Iron, and other tourist hotspots is very easy.I took a walk to Brooklyn (out on the Brooklyn Bridge and back on the Manhattan Bridge; I thoroughly recommend both those bridges for a walk. So the location of the hotel, for me, was very good. The bed is comfortable and the TV is nice and large.The shower is excellent. Strong pressure, access to hot water all the time. If you are looking for a luxurious break, there will be other hotels that may serve you better. If you are after something comfortable, practical and convenient (when on a tourist break), this place worked. I would definitely stay again.Tip: Join Hyatt's loyalty scheme to get two free bottles of water per day. Enjoy your next break.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We highly recommend this hotel as a member since the benefits exceed those of many other Hyatt hotels. The staff was excellent, the room clean and convenient, and the option to behave with environmental integrity, foregoing service on any given day, was an added benefit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location and condition of the property are excellent. Breakfast was a bit hectic on Sunday and the coffee ran out but the staff did everything they could. The elevators get a little busy during checkout but that should be expected in a 26 story hotel. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Within walking distance to numerous sights. Great view of Empire State Building. We stayed in winter but friends tell me it is possible to sit out and eat and drink on the hotel's outside terrace in warmer weather.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location is Great in the heart of everything. Rooms are always clean and very spacious especially for a NYC Hotel. Staff is always accommodating, professional and friendly. Breakfast is good, tea is always available along with the microwave. Great Overall Value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a great stay and very memorable. Staff was excellent and morning breakfast options were wonderful and delish. Room was clean and had a great view of the Empire State Building. First time in the city

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a great stay here, rooms were clean with a comfortable bed. As a World of Hyatt Member we got free breakfast included in the rate we were only expecting some coffee and pastries, but came down on the first day to fresh fruit, toast, cooked food, cereal and pastries, which set us up for the day. Views from the roof terrace are great, we saw the Empire State Building lit up at night and sunrise on our last day. Good location, easy to get to subway and walk up to times square. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: great location. 1 min walk from Macy's. polite and helpful staff. The room was big enough, with a double bed and couch. flat screen tv, and fast enough WiFi.breakfast was good and included mainly of fruits, eggs, breads and cheese. My room was clear, the air condition worked well and I had no background noise from the street (level 11). Great hotel for good price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is the best value. Very clean. Comfortable room. Helpful staff especially hostess Evelin. Breakfast had a good variety. Complementary water was appreciated. Great bed. Great t v. You can walk all over using this as a base. If you need something you get it right away. Nice lobby. Good for meeting a friend to walk around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you just want a simple room, clean and comfortable, great value and super location, and treated as a valued Hyatt member, then this is the place to stay. Hyatt members get free breakfast which is more than enough considering you want to also venture out to try all great eateries in Manhattan. Simple and sweet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you just want a simple room, clean, comfortable, great value and super location, and treated as a valued Hyatt member, then this is the place to stay. Hyatt members get free breakfast which is more than enough considering you want to venture out to try all great eateries in Manhattan.  Simple and sweet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A great place to stay during your NYC trip. Very free and social to their guests. You can do whatever you like, whenever you like. Don't hessitate to ask the friendly staff where to go for a drink, bite or a (cheaper) taxi. They're very honest! We had a drink at the Hotelbar with bartender Jamal. Unfortunately no liquor license (yet), but despite that: great evening and service! We would recommend this hotel because of it's place in the city, the friendly service and the 24 hour fitness.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Plenty of positives :-Recently renovated,centrally located,free breakfast(including bacon & scrambled egg)Couple of issues which could be addressed easily with more staff. Room was sparkling clean on arrival however room only replenished towels etc for 2 guests instead of 3 and cups not replaced. Breakfast supplies were in short supply at timesRooms were on the small side but overall good value for money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had paid in advance for early check in and even though the front desk had no record of it they were quick and courteous to rectify the error. Our room was ready with only a 10 minute delay. Thumbs up to the check in staff. The room was small (but in NYC that's to be expected) but comfortable and clean. My only real criticism was the breakfast experience. The food was perfectly fine and pretty standard Hyatt fare. It was busy and the tables were full. I do not have a problem busing my family's table. I will make sure that at the very least the all the table would need is a wipe down by staff. That was the problem..in the 45min we were there not one table received any attention. We saw people having to clean the dirty dishes of the prior occupant! This is hopefully a constructive criticism and Hyatt will address and remedy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here for one night. I liked the central location next to the Empire State Building! The room was clean, but not that spacious, but it was fine for me. I would choose this hotel again in the future!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful location in the city to begin daily excursions. Easy walk to metro, but many attractions within walking distance. Great breakfast daily, wonderful staff very helpful. Rooms clean, comfortable and well configured. Website advertises parking garage nearby at reduced rate, but upon check-out we were told no such relationship with that garage exists. Beware! Call ahead to confirm if they are still advertising such an arrangement.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I strongly recommend Hyatt Place Midtown South! We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights, it was great. The breakfast was good with many food options. The staff, location, price were amazing! I will be going back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In its class, you will not outdo this hotel, including its extensive real breakfast on real plates.The staff is more than helpful.The location is simply optimal, the heart of midtown with public transportation in every direction a minute away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms are fine, but with so many options literally within one block, I’ll stay at a Marriott or Hilton next time where they make me feel like they value my business. There’s not a lot to differentiate these convenience hotels, but a rude front desk eliminates this hotel from future stays for me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location in Midtown perfect, only 3-5 minutes to next subway stop and about 15 minutes to Times Square. Hotel is very nice, received a nice room update with city view. Earplugs are recommended, but that was ok. Breakfast was included in our booking, but probably it is always!? Every day fresh fruits, bacon, oatmeal, scrambled eggs... Not our first hotel in midtown, but by far the best experience. Room had a good size, nice view and most of all it was very tidy and clean! Can only recommend. Prebooked a long time in advance and had a very good rate!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is so well located in NY you walking distance from all major attractions Very very nice little restaurant next to the hotel if you missed breakfast. From there you can go and explore the cityStaff is very friendly and helpfullHotel is super clean Perfect place to crash only

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We booked this hotel at the time because we wanted a decent size room and we wanted to be in a convenient location. This hotel ticked all the boxes and I'd definitely stay there again when going to New York! The room was a great size and had a couch too, and the location was great - close to several subway stops, shops and restaurants! Staff were nice too, and you have a nice view of the Empire State Building from the terrace on the top floor.I wouldn't rely on the free breakfast though. We didn't use this once during our stay because the queues were crazy and there was nowhere to sit, and the elevators were too busy to take the food somewhere else. Not a very relaxing experience - but I guess it's free. I wish they would restrict access to the breakfast area a bit, or maybe have a separate area where people can take away things. We always went out for breakfast, there are a lot of options within a short walk of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just spent three nights at the Hyatt Place while in town for Gift Show. Great location and we were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and bathroom. Such a great "bang for your buck" we had a wonderful room with desk, couch, large tv and comfortable bed. Shades do great job of blocking out street traffic and light and temperature in room was pleasant. Friendly and helpful employees at desk and in dining and housekeeping areas. Much better than expected complimentary breakfast with different menu daily. Cage free eggs, yogurt, bacon, sausage, hash browns , pancakes, french toast, good coffee and tea all day. Wewill be back next year for sure. Many thanks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I loved the hotel, it was exactly what were looking for. Short walk to Herald Sq, Bryant Park and Statue of Liberty. The room was large for NYC and was clean and QUIET! i didnt hear a thing. I will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The bed was comfortable water pressure was good two important things for me. Breakfast was good with a nice variety . There was a lot of street noise that you could hear from our room which is why they supplied ear plugs. Hotel staff were very friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was a great pick for me! I travelled to NY alone and didn't want to have to use transport to get to anywhere. This hotel is perfect! Close to every store, restaurant and tourist attraction you can imagine. I will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed at Hyatt Place for 11 nights and were very impressed by the hotel. Great location and the subway was around the corner. The staff were always helpful with all our requests! The room was very clean and comfortable. We really liked having the seperate sitting area of the couch, and the bar fridge under the tv. Being located close to Herald Square it is very close to lots of attractions, within walking distance of Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building & Macy's.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall what you would expect, unfortunately my toilet was broken and running all night, but it still worked, also the window was blurry due to some sort of tint or screen which was upsetting as I paid extra for the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is centrally located. Nice bar and restaurant on the block. Rooms are small, but we were literally there for 1 night. Very clean. I would definitely recommend the hotel. The breakfast was great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The overall condition of the hotel was great, the staff warm and welcoming....the room was clean, the cleaning crew did a great job everyday....good location, easy walk or subway ride to many parts of the town.....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I would stay here again in a heartbeat and I don’t often feel that way. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. The location was GREAT! Most of our 4 day visit was spent sightseeing in Lower Manhattan and we were able to do all our venturing out on foot. The Empire State Building was literally out our window and for a first timer like me, it made the trip magical. Very clean room. Cool observation deck on the top floor. Great place!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Awesome experience staying in this hotel. The room had a empire street building view. It’s located at the heart of NY Manhattan. I would come back again here. Most recommended hotel!!!Good one!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: location is perfect 2 mins from macy's and a subway, 5 mins from times square, less than ten min walk from port bus station or grand central. Plenty of great restaurants nearby.staff are wonderful - particularly Michael – they can’t do enough to help their guestsThe empire view rooms have a better view than the roof terrace.Breakfast is nice, never any problem with seating, even at peak times – a good selection, and nice coffee with optional syrups to choose from.Rooms are decent size, beds comfy with good pillows

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel has a good location, close to everywhere we needed to go. They were in the process of remodeling the lobby, so our luggage was stored right out in the open, but we did not have any problems. The construction around the hotel did cause for a little noise and the room temperature did fluctuate frequently. Other than that the hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a very good hotel for our trip, all staff we came across where very friendly and helpful, rooms where good size and beds very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent quality and choice each day which as it is included was a great saving. Hotel very close to lots of attractions and places to visit, easily walkable to Times square etc but so much quieter area. Subway at end of block

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel will never disappoint you! It in a perfect location with 4 fantastic restaurants steps away! Book today, you will not regret it! Make sure you go to the Tradmark Restaurant just a few doors down, or go across the street to the Keg Room!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After the response of my last review (very poor) we were basically kicked out of our queen size room one from last day. We had the room for extra night as original member of group booked an extra night. When another party checked out we presumed they could put case in this room and both check out at 2.30 pm to airport. But on checking my room was ok to stay in, the reception staff gave a whopping lie and said no, you booked to swop into a King size room! Who would book 4 nights in one style of room then change on last night! Clearly they had over booked and required it for a family! Instead of asking nicely, they demanded I hand room back. When I said well give me the other room, all of a sudden they couldn’t check me in until 3pm!!!!! They knew I was leaving at 2.30 it was now 10am! They then said they would charge me to remain in room! So not only did they get use of the free room to re-sell they threw us out! I witnessed people arriving late afternoon being told there rooms were not ready! Why? Because they are happy to charge people to extend but keep you waiting to check in! The blankets for beds had holes in! All very shabby! The staff are unhelpful, obviously on bonuses so they are money orientated to charge for everything! I will never stay in this chain of hotels again! You have been warned!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel room is small but hotel is in a great location. Overall hotel is clean and bed comfortable. Good value/price for New York. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Like the bar and bar food. Good breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a perfect location for our family for a holiday visit. Short walk to Times Square. You can walk up 6th to 42nd and see the ball ascend at 6pm and then drop at midnight, totally out of the chaos. The staff was so very kind and genuine and helpful. The only complaint that we had was an issue with gnats around the coffee station and another area or two in the breakfast area. I reported it very early in our stay but it was never rectified. That is the only reason I gave the average score on cleanliness. Everything else was great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel several times and find it perfect for a mid-town stay, whether I'm going to a play or a NY Rangers game. Location is excellent for shopping. The hotel is clean, the beds are very comfortable and the breakfast is great. Staff is helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We selected this hotel due to location - it's within walking distance of Broadway and our trip was scheduled around a particular show. Because we were staying in January, we wanted to be sure we were able to get around on foot, in case of snow or ice. This is a great option- close to Broadway, TImes Square, great restaurants and walking distance from NY Penn Station. Room was surprisingly large for NYC, exceptionally clean, and quite comfortable. We recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: great location, convenient, perfect as a base for a family city break. very close to transport links, walking and exploring tourist hot spots. staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: On arriving at the hotel I found the reception to be nice and clean, the staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble if you need their help with anything.The rooms could be better, it was clean however I have overly high standards so I did find some hairs in the bathroom/bed linen, the carpets were very dated and have seen better days, this bothered me as it felt slightly unhygienic. The breakfast was amazing, we especially enjoyed the crispy bacon and waffles. There wasn’t particularly a great choice at brekkie, bacon, waffles or pancakes, the fruit looked good but I didn’t try it. However the coffee bar was great with a good selection of coffees and teas. The only downside was how busy the breakfast area was and I was quite disgusted at some nationalities; the greed, taking ridiculous amounts of food and also their lack of respect for the hotel staff and not clearing away after themselves, it’s the first time I have ever felt like a reserved Brit abroad - I’ve realised myself and my boyfriend definitely are! Overall a nice stay, although I’m not sure I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms size and decor good. No bad smells. Mattress/pillows good. Issues: Hairs found in several places in bathroom and not fully cleaned up after requesting that this be dealt with. 50% of elevators not working in the morning. Had to walk up 18 flights of stairs. Large stain on the carpet just outside our room. Closet door latch broken and removed and sprinkled white dust in closet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is my favorite Hyatt in NYC - I’ve stayed here at least 6 times in the last 5 years. Good staff, nice rooms with big windows, and they recently re-did the lobby to modernize it. It looks great. My husband and I recently stayed here for our annual holiday trip to the city and had a great experience. The location is just far enough from tourist attractions to not be crazy traffic/tourists/etc, but is close enough to walk almost anywhere in Manhattan. Overall, I’ve loved staying here multiple times and am always eager to return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booked room for 5 people never left correct number of towels. Bed was comfortable but lots of noise from elevator during the night. Breakfast was good. Fairly close to subway and places to eat. Good for families.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff at the hotel was warm, professional and charismatic. I enjoyed their personalities. The room was comfortable with some of the Hyatt signature touches. Yet everything at Hyatt Place felt more relaxed and not stuffy like sometimes a hotel can be. And only $15 for a deposit at this locations when i stayed. Wow! Thank you Hyatt Place

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The stay was uneventful but the hotel was sold out and there are only two elevators which isn’t good. It is a pretty good part of Manhattan but pricing was high based on if being a very busy week of the year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Amazing time and great location easy access to subways to get you to other areas. Plenty of restaurants close by and within close walking distance to Time Square and Rockefeller Center . Complimentary breakfast every morning was a great bonus! Made it very convenient to wake up and fuel and go see the many sights NY has to offer . I recommend asking the friendly front desk staff to help you navigate which subways to take to get you where you are going for the day but overall it’s pretty easy and close by. Even late night places to eat close to hotel. If you want to be close to Time Square without all the traffic and noise and congestion this is the place to stay! Rooms are clean and spacious as well. They come with a small fridge too which was a nice feature for our leftovers or late night dessert ;)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: *roof was dusty , could spleep well becouse could breathe well , we all got sick dou to dust * but personnel was very nice exellent service , hotel position is exellent , breackfast was very good, you should integrel at the room a macriwave,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Took a short trip to NYC with the family and stayed at this hotel. Room was unique in New York, nice size with 2 queen beds and pull out couch. Nice size bathroom. Kind of pricey but expected for NY. Was able to check in early through app which was great. $49 parking per day at garage down the block. Not worth it for day you check out to pay the $49 at the hotel for the day, check with the parking lot for rates. Went to free breakfast first day. Was annoyed because they had no coffee and no oatmeal. They seemed a bit overwhelmed and it was mobbed. Next day only one elevator was working. Overall, hotel is comfortable for NYC, they just seem to have some kinks to work out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Arrived at hotel after travelling for more than 13 hours from UK to find that because all the rooms were booked by someone in our large group, I couldn’t check in! An E mail was sent to hotel when main leader of party cancelled to hand over to another member prior to the check in date! They insisted on seeing the ID of one of the other members of the part, even though I knew their names! They expected me to wait another 5 hours! Luckily an E mail with another members name meant she was arriving within 2 hours! I noticed other people checking in were offered free bottles of water, our party did not! I’ve been all over the world, and travel once a week in the UK, never heard something so bloody ridiculous! The pictures on the website bare no resemblance to hotel! Do not book into this hotel, staff dreadfull, rooms noisy, and no apology from staff having to wait to get into my room!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Free breakfast was fantastic. I'd hazard to say it is the best free breakfast I've had at a hotel. The room was nice for NYC. It is not a big room but fairly large for NYC and very clean. Don't confuse this with the Herald Square Hyatt which is not nearly as nice as this hotel. I'll try to stay here on all of my business trips.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice stay, great location. It was very nice to have one hotel room that could accommodate our 4 children and my spouse and me. Free breakfast and amenities for all Hyatt members would be a plus no matter who the hotel was booked with.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Breakfast was excellent, a nice surprise since we did not realize it was included. staff was very nice and it was a great location. Came for one night with the family and it was a very good experience. Hopefully we will return soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great central location! Very clean hotel! Would definitely stay again! The breakfast each morning was delicious! Help cut down costs on eating out and kept us full usually until evening! I always try to stay in a Hyatt because of the service I’ve received in other cities and this Hyatt Place did not disappoint!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt is the best hotel I have stayed at by far. The staff was genuinely very nice, helpful, & caring. The hotel rooms were comfortable and quiet- especially for NYC. It was centered around multiple NYC attractions, stores, great food, and subways. Yes, I would return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall, this was a nice clean and comfortable hotel. Not far from many attractions, like Times Square and Macy’s on 34th St. Hotel staff were attentive and helpful. The rooms were comfortable, but would have been perfect had they had microwaves. All in all a great place to stay with the family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I had an enjoyable stay here. The highlights of the hotel for me were the great location - close walking distance to Macy's/Herald Square, Empire State Building, Bryant Park and Times Square - decently large room with a couch, great views including a 26th story deck area to take in the skyline, clean rooms and friendly staff. It is not a luxury hotel but I felt like it was a good value and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great location for seeing Times Square, Broadway, Macey's, Empire State Building etc The accommodation was comfortable and the breakfast had a good variety of choice. This is not a 5 star hotel - but you don't pay 5 star prices. We had checked various prices for this area with other hotels and this seemed to be the best value - we were not disappointed with service provided.The reception staff were very helpful and friendly - not something you always get in NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I asked the receptionist to give me time to check out because i feel sick and weak. I needed to wait for my friend. I was granted up to 2pm since i was a member.. unfortumately, i passed out and the hotel staff had to call 911. I was pressured to bring my luggages by this lady in a tight ponytail while i was being brought to NYU ER.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location and wonderful staff. We were treated to a swift and friendly check-in even though we were early. We received a “room with a view on high floor” as I had requested in advance.We were amazed to look out and up and be staring at a perfect view of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location in Herald Square and Bryant Park with subway one block away, great breakfast with variety, loved the view in the room due to the big windows. Hospitable and attentive staff. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was a great night out Keen restaurant for dinner Madison Square Garden for a concert visit in Rockville Center, Christmas tree Had a lot of fun visiting the city Set at the Hyatt on West 36 street was a wonderful overnighter

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is literally close to everything. Had a great stay. The staff was generally very nice. Always wonder who decides to have the safe close the floor. See attached picture. How are elderly people suppose to get down (and up) there? Breakfast was a great surprise. Included in the rate and definitely on very high standard for an American hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In the busy holiday weekend in the middle of the city we found this to be a good quality property for our stay tucked away in a really convenient area to everything. The staff was very nice and attentive to our needs and very nice to everyone actually.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was in the perfect location. Close to most major tourist attractions. The staff were friendly and helpful. You could tell they wanted our experience to be a positive one and it was. There were 3 adults and one child. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds and 1 pull out sofa. Plenty of sleeping space for us. The rooms are not huge but that is expected in all reasonably priced NY hotel rooms. It’s walking distance to some great food. Liberty Bagel is a must, Ragtrader for cocktails and an excellent Korean restaurant a couple doors down: Yoon Haiundae Galbi.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent two nights here on a recent trip. Very clean hotel with friendly staff. Room was nice, clean and comfortable. Great location with Empire State Building and Macy’s only few blocks away. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The noise from the street was very loud. The sink was clogged. The room very small. The staff was helpful and responsive, but they were busy and I felt like I was bothering them with our requests for an extra pillow and extra shampoo.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As i mentioned in the title, this is an excellent property and I highly recommend it. From the free breakfast, great location, and cleanliness, I was very happy with this location. Another great stay at a Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great experience from start to finish! Got a room on short notice. Front desk was extremely helpful, friendly, and accommodating. Check-In was a breeze, room was clean and comfortable, breakfast was good, and check-out was very easy. Will be staying here again, for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful hotel, perfect location to walk so many places. Lots of great restaurants right on the block. Every team member was absolutely wonderful, so nice, so helpful and just a pleasure to talk to. Rooms were clean, loved that the Hyatt gave options to only clean the room when you wanted and gave you bonus points for doing so. I was here for work but brought my husband along and he said it was such a great location he had a blast. Free breakfast for members was great, it does get crowded but it was expected as there are very few hotels that offer free breakfast and it was good many options to choose from to start your day! Thank you Hyatt we will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice property for 5 people. Away from terrible traffic and noise. Took ubers to many locations as waking was 20 minutes away and too hard to do with young kids. Breakfast excellent and staff kind and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great choice in midtown. Not too big, not too small. Great service. Comfortable room. Breakfast is far better than average hotel buffet. Very quiet property. Seedy check in/out. Lots of choices for restaurants within a short walk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place for 3 nights during a "ladies trip" to NYC during the holiday season. The hotel was convenient to shows and shopping, as well as to the subway and Penn Station. The staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location in Midtown New York CIty. Very clean! Great breakfast in the morning! We would deinately stay here again. Walking distance to many NYC attractions, Times Square, shopping, restaruants, etc

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a Great stay at the Hyatt Place. Very clean room. Convenient area to all shopping (Macy’s/Mall/outdoor Market) landmarks (Empire State Building) and all transportation (subway and LIRR). Employees very friendly and welcoming. Great area for great Restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed our stay in Midtown South very much. Very friendly staff. Nice breakfast. The Hotel is situated in the very center, Broadway, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Briant park - just a few minutes walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is nice other than the fact you cannot adjust the air in the room. Every single room is set to 68 degrees no matter what you try to change it to. It is unbearably cold at night due to the fact there is no heat. Very disappointed in this stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for a short Christmas break, and found it to be well positioned - walkable from Penn Station, and close to Times Square and Bryant Park.Although not the last word in luxury, it was clean and efficient, and our room was a good size for New York. Our only issue was that the shower was rather weak.Breakfast was fine considering we didn't pay extra for it, and all the staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed for 2 nights and it was not too bad. I knew it was not a 5 star hotel so my expectations were very minimal. It’s conveniently located in mid town and staff were all very friendly and helpful (this is one of the most important factors) so overall I am quite satisfied and I would consider this hotel for future trips. One thing I needed personally was extra blankets as I thought the comforter was too thin for winter so I had to ask for extra which I received later. Overall nice and comfortable stay! Thank you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Highly recommended this hotel. Great value for money with room price, location to subway stations (such as Herald Square and Penn Station) and being right in the middle of Midtown. It might not be as flashy as some of the more well known hotels, but that does not matter when you are out and about exploring the city. The staff really were lovely and went the extra mile for our Honeymoon - we were upgraded to a higher floor amd had wine, cheesecake and berries waiting in our room with a note saying 'happy honeymoon'. Being a World of Hyatt Member also is a bonus for complimentary breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very helpful, friendly staff. Clean room. Bed was very comfortable, and for NYC, it was very quiet. We find this location near Herald Square to be so handy to so many of the sights in New York. We will use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This place is close to everything Nice rooms and comfortable bedsThey serv a delicious breakfast Don’t miss to go up on the roof it’s a beautiful view over the cityThere is a subway station five minutes away

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Three stars as it s marked as a maximum. Poor breakfast of low quality. No additional duvets, cosmetics, towels, water no matter how many persons live in the room - all is equipped maximum for 4. Room was really small. Hair dryer smelled like after fire.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is located at W 36th, only a few blocks from the subway, Bryant Park and the Empire State building. The rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms are large and clean. We chose to include breakfast in our reservation and did not regret, although food and beverage options were the same during our all stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First impressions of the hotel was essentially: tired looking and would benefit from a little TLC. We did have a serious issue with our first room, when I discovered a condom at the side of the bed!!! Very concerned about the cleanliness of the room, we were given another room. Disappointed that the manager wasn't available to talk and the receptionist said "it wasn't a used condom" It felt like it was a regular occurrence. No goodwill gesture was offered so I asked for a free taxi to friends 14 blocks away. Disappointing experience to be honest.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our second visit at this property - it is in a great location with a neighborhood feel. The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome. There is a free breakfast and a car was waiting to take us to the airport the day we left! We will return -

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: it was a treat,made our trip to Manhatten joyfull,looking forward to come back,everything was professionally handled,when sitting outside unepected company of people looking forwar to tell their stories was an experince,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is very well located - tight in the heart of midtown just a couple of blocks from Penn Station and round the corner from Macy's. If you're lucky enough to get a room with an Empire State view, it is even better! Room was clean, breakfast amazing, and overall very well priced for its location. There is a rooftop terrace which directly overlooks the Empire State which is great... my one and only suggestion would be that I think a bit more could be done with the terrace to make it more appealing as it is just a bit drab at the moment. But otherwise had an amazing stay in a fantastic city - thanks Hyatt Place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Old building and interior ..location was excelent .very close to majpr lamdmarks ..macys and other plcaes pf new york..heart of new york..however the interior pf the hotel was not in line with the charges..over charged and not upto hayatt standards

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt midtown. The included breakfast help us get our day started nice and early. Locations fabulous only about five or six blocks from Penn station five or six blocks from times square an easy access to the city bikes

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Fantastic, comfortable stay and will definitely look here again for the next trip. Friendly staff. Convenient location. The actual hotel and the rooms are very nice and it's pretty easy to feel at home here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Apart from the location this hotel is not somewhere I would recommend. Firstly it’s very noisy, no soundproofing at all. Cleaning services are minimal, elevators are useless, we used the stairs from the 16th floor! Breakfast was adequate but same everyday and bland. You get what you pay for.. I suggest you pay more! Will never visit a Hyatt again even though I’ve had a lot of other great experiences elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is in a great location and easily accessible to Penn Station and Times Square. The breakfast was a nice perk and offered a variety of options which was great. As for the room, size was good but the accommodations were terrible. Our beds were soft and I was not able to sleep on them. I chose to sleep on the couch in the room that was as bad. My family woke up sore and complaining about the beds and lack of any support. It is clear that Hyatt purchased the cheapest mattress, or they don't care to upgrade them. Also, there was blood on the sheets and pillow cases when we checked in. I told the front desk and they said they would have house keeping look into it. Shockingly no one decided to call or switch out our sheets. The bath tub was clogged and we had to take showers in the 6" of water. I am personally done with Hyatt. Their properties are not up to snuff . I would recommend the Holiday Inn Express next door or any of the other properties in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Check in was fast and efficient. Few items of concern were thin bath towels, fruit on the floor from previous carpet, no shampoo in the bathroom until requested twice, holes in the bedsheets. Overall great location and walking distance to many places, attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The check in and check it experience were good. The room was big for Manhattan, very clean and comfortable, although the noise from the street was somewhat loud at times, even at night. It was a nice experience overall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice hotel with good sized rooms (especially for New York). Staff are excellent and very friendly. Only issue is street noise even high up. They do have complimentary ear plugs in the room! Free breakfast for Hyatt members is a great benefit. Worth signing up just for that. Location is great, right in the heart of Midtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel's staff all around was gracious, welcoming and not at all "New York-like". Room was comfortable - ask for a high floor b/c the noise level at our original 3rd floor room was atrocious. Breakfast was suitable but not over-the-top. Bed was comfortable, HVAC worked and bathroom had what is needed - the 3 things one needs most of all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: we stayed 4 nights in the Hyatt Place recently and it was overall a very pleasant and enjoyable stay. The hotel is 3star and the extra little touches such as chilled flavoured water available all day in the lobby was really appreciated. Breakfast was great and we availed of it every morning even getting up early to avoid queues at busiest times.Our room was facing 36th street so.it was very noisy. Thankfully I read the reviews in advance so I brought earplugs. The hotel provided ear plugs in our room so they are aware of the issue. I guess if you want to stay in midtown you've got to expect noisy rooms.The only disappointing thing for me was the use of single use coffee cups at breakfast without any other option. I don't know why a hotel would choose to do this when we are all becoming more aware of the environmental cost of single use disposables. Ceramic cups are provided in the bedrooms so why not in the breakfast room as well

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice hotel. Perfect with sofa bed if more than 4 people are travelling. Close to Times Square and Empire State building. Good breakfast. Free 2 bottled of water each day. Perfect for families of 5-6 people.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good location near 34 street and Penn station. Though the rooms aren't huge, they feel quite wide. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was polite and courteous. There's always a person at the front desk, and they're vert willingness. The price is also fair.We enjoyed our staying there

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Didn’t appreciate what an excellent location this hotel has until we arrived, 2 blocks from Empire State Building, 10 from Rockefeller Centre!! And 8 mins from Times Square... and Macy’s is across the road. We are a family of five, two teenagers and a 9 yr old. We fit comfortably into this hotel room, which was beautifully clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially in arranging transport back to JFK on the day of the Marathon. I would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was going to give this hotel 5 stars until I lost my purse in the hotel room. I left my purse in the hotel during my stay for 5 days( never used it as it was my purse from home and all my dollars were in a separate purse) when it came to packing it away on the last day it was nowhere to be found. I honestly think it fell into one of my rubbish bags and then dumped by the maids. My problem is that the hotel was no help at all. All they did was phone housekeeping. They didn't help at all by looking for the purse. No-that's awful we will search right away or contact you if it is found....nothing , which is a shame cos my stay in the hotel was brilliant

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff and crew are polite and courteous, the rooms are quite large and clean. The breakfast is uneatable though. The hotel location is great - near 34st, near grand subway station, and near Times square.Will come again and will recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is well located and the service from staff is generally good but the hotel rooms do not appear to be updated in 40+ years and the rooms are clean but gloomy. For our next stay in NYC we will look for another hotel rather than one in the Hyatt Group.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Worked out perfectly for dinner and then overnight in mid-town. We needed to head to MetLife Stadium the next morning - very good experience. Other hotels are double the price so the value here was appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Second time around at the Hyatt Place! I must have had a room facing the street this time, because my first visit, I slept like a log. This time, the street facing rooms, were full of garbage trucks rolling by, oy-vey. It was not fun. Also a little cold. Could've used a cozy comforter, not sure the thermostat worked as accurately. But over all, the room is quite nice. The STAFF makes this hotel though, their energy is the best!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you want to stay in NYC and not spend top dollar...this is a great place. The service was great, rooms quiet and clean. It s HYATT. I will stay here again and have been here before. It’s location is very close to Macy’s and walking distance to Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Short trip to the NYC, first time for my husband. Great central location that enabled us to walk everywhere. Fab view at night of Empire State. While great to visit the usual sightseeing places in NY, take a 20 min walk to Chelsea Piers and walk along the pier and even have a skate or hit a few golf balls with a unique view over the Hudson. Don't forget to walk along the Highline too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt Place NY Midtown South was great! The rooms are bigger than many of the other hotels, the breakfast was better than most hotel breakfasts, the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the subway station is just around the corner. We will definitely stay there again next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Accommodation cleanKept awake by nosy fridge - not rectified during 7 night stayDark room (lower level floor at back of building)No bar facilitiesAverage stay - expensive for services providedLocality very good however

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great stay, the rooms are very small but it's New York City so you cannot expect much more. Very clean and the staff is super friendly and helpful with any accommodations you might need. Overall great service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booked this hotel 11 months ago on a no cancellation lower rate fee via booking.com however Hyatt cancelled my reservation giving me less than 48 hours to find alternative accommodation! They maintain my credit card was rejected by card company ... not true. They didn’t even try. Obviously overbooked hotel room. Beware! Disgraceful

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was amazing, less than a block from the subway, walking distance to the Time Square area (but thank goodness not in Times Square), near Penn Station, etc. The whole area is full of shops and eating establishments. And it is right in Korea-town, with probably the best selection of Korean and other Asian establishments on the East Coast. The hotel was very comfortable, clean, and the staff was friendly and responsive. We have absolutely no complaints!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hotel Staff at the front desk were great. It was my first time in New York so they moved me from the 2nd floor to the 22nd floor. They insisted I would need to see the views! Had recomendations of places to eat and they were spot on. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was my second time staying here. I came last year for a wedding. The staff was both times equally pleasant, friendly, and “yes culture” attitude. Facility is awesome, clean, and well maintained. The breakfast in the morning is great too, especially considering it’s complementary. To the General Manager- please keep doing what you’re doing. I have worked in this industry before and I can tell your staff is treated very well there! It shows in the way they take such good care of their guests. (Shout our to Jonathan and Mim(?) who were awesome!)I will absolutely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was great! The staff was phenomenal!And the view from my room of the Empire State Building and NYC was pleasing! Very Relaxing and Highly Recommended. This is the best Hotel I have stayed at in the past 3 years and I am New York every year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms are small but sufficient for a NYC weekend getaway! Everything was clean, great amenities (as expected from a Hyatt stay) and service was kind and attentive. Beautiful rooftop view in midtown Manhattan made this stay perfect. However, be warned - the earplugs aren't there for decoration!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: very well located hotel (Midtown) - next to Empire State Building and many other well known places; rooms are clean, much space; little bit old fashioned; "big" bathroom (regarding price), very good hair dryer, water pressure fine; could see Empire State from our window; breakfast: do not expect too much but we have been satisfied; metro within 5-10 walking mins; on top: Roof Terrace at the 26th floor

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was at this place during the 74th UNGA in NYC, USA in September 2019. I had a good experience. The location was ideal for business and pleasure, close to my meeting venues, easy access to my events venues and good take off points for my city tour. Clean rooms, good breakfast. But the electrical sockets need to be more universal. Lol!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It was a great hotel with an excellent atmosphere. I loved the roof top views and the breakfast. I would stay here again. The lobby was great as well. This is good for the business traveler. Definitely among New Yorks best.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is rated as a level 5 Hyatt hotel but the condition of the room feels like a motel. It’s old, outdated and doesn’t feel clean /bright. The quality of breakfast is another let down. We will not consider coming back to this place u less they renovate it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Noisy 'package holiday' style hotel with only advantage its good location. Have to wait for lift considerable time especially morning hours. If location is paramount, better save on the money & stay at Holiday Inn next door...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very well located, room was more spacious than average hotels in NYC. Breakfast quite reasonable, fruits, eggs, jueces, etc, near subway, bus stops, penn station, central station, etc....elevators time not a problem (as it is in most NYc hotels). I would come back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were extremely satisfied with the helpfulness and courteousness of the entire staff. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. Our shower didnt work and while that couldve been a major frustration after a hot day of walking around NYC, the staff more than made up for it with their pleasant response by the front desk crew, the mechanics, and the morning manager. Breakfast was fresh and delicious and well stocked. Excellent experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Convenient Location to Macys and Metro. Some at front desk all the timeStaff helpful with Metro. Comfortable bedsBreakfast was good, but at times meat and eggs were cold. Beverage selection was good...coffee line was long. To clean up plates, not easy or convenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room is spacious and the bed comfy. The location is excellent. There's also a great view of the Empire State Building from the 26th floor observatory. But the biggest reason I enjoyed staying here is because the staff are great. Friendly, helpful, pleasant, polite and always with a smile.Special shout outs to Jonathan and David. You both made my time at Hyatt Place a good one. Thank you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location in midtown. Very nice property, room was spotless, staff was extremely nice. Visit NYC several times a year on business and will stay here again. Breakfast was excellent as well and the 26th floor terrace has an amazing, and close up, view of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great staff and location. Quiet room and super comfortable bed. Slept like a baby. Breakfast was yummy with many delicious, healthy options. Everything was fine, nice sized room. Huge TV. Clean room. Great staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location, great staff and great service. "Standard" Hyatt breakfast, but this one was much better than others I've had at different properties. Location is close to subways, and also within walking distance of many places, if you prefer walking.Room was more spacious than expected. Even on an upper floor there was some road noise, but the hotel provides earplugs if you need them.I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a major business event to manage and selected hotel for it close location to CUNY for my entire team and hotel staff and services was awesome and showed off New York at its best with hotel staff was spot on!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Came to NYC for a yankee game and getaway with the wife. Wanted a hotel within walking distance of Penn station which had good reviews. Not only was the hotel clean and fresh, but the staff was awesome. From the moment Eddie checked us in, I knew we chose the right hotel. Housekeeping even asked us what time of the day was best for our room to be done. Very professional and polite. Great breakfast buffet. Love the coffee. Must check out the terrace on the 26th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stay at the hotel for 6 days and we definitely had a pleasant stay. The location is perfect for us which was located at the center of midtown and you could approach to subway easily. Macy’s, JC penny and Manhattan mall were also just minutes away from the hotel. The room we stay was in average size but had great view of New York City that we enjoyed waking up everyday under the sunshine rose between skyscrapers. The hotel had complimentary breakfast which was in good quality considering it’s a 3 star hotel only. The only things we though it could be improved is the escalator number is not enough for all guest. Overall we would choose this location if we came to New York again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very poor breakfast quality and variety. Terrible bed. Slow service maintenance (I had to wait two days for them to fix the bathroom bulb, and in the third day, the mirror bulb went off, never to be fixed...). But it is a good location...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is fine but because of 3-day cancellation policy and no price adjustment as they reduce the prices, we paid $ 80 more per night (like a penalty for early reservation) compared to guests with last minute reservations. Our reservation was based on $ 249/night while 1-day prior the rate was $ 179/night. Hyatt needs to change their policy. Definitely Hyatt is no longer on the top of our list for our business.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location is central but far enough away from times square to be quiet. No noise heard at night. Room was a good size, always clean on return at end of day. All the staff from check in to housekeeping were helpful, friendly and looked happy. Much better experience than I have had in some higher starred hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is my favorite hotel whether I am travelling for business or personal. Our most recent stay this weekend was clean and comfortable. Staff super friendly. Close to both PATH and Subway stations. Close to Bryant Park, Times Square, shows. There is a terrace on the 26th floor which is great to eat breakfast or relax and look at the views. Oh and breakfast was fantastic - anything you could want to eat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good location. Near to the metro station and to the shopping area of the city. Near to all other city interesting places. The room is nice but not big enough for 5 people by my opium. The hotel is very nice. Team is very friendly and help with all problem.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hotel was nice, and it was very good placed central on Manhatten, New York.Ask for the room in the top of the hotel, because in the lower Rooms youu can head the noice from the street below, further to this please be aware that on the rooms which do not face the street, but the other way can have some noice from big ventilators to central air cooling systems.But besides this it is a very good hotel, with clean rooms .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location. Comfortable, quiet rooms. Good breakfast buffet. Friendly staff. This survey requires 200 characters minimum in this comments section. Not only does this make comments difficult to write but also difficult to read!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First time I've ever provided feedback of this nature. Lady at check in could not have been any more unhelpful has she tried. Contradicted herself a few times. Room was not ready when we arrived @ 3:00pm and she was unable to tell us when we it would be available. When we finally got our room, it wasn’t the one we booked and she (receptionist) point blank refused to change it. I had to ask to speak to a manager who thankfully changed the room to the correct one.Lift wasn’t working properly and all guest had to wait around 20 minutes each time. Breakfast was awful, and on one occasion me and my family couldn’t find a seat, so we had to eat standing.untidy hotel, I wish I'd taken some photos.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: hotel is nice and central nice location easy work to everything like time square and macy's . They only thing i would say there was some maintain work going on when we arrived which wasn't aware about so bit of a surprise when we arrived. Breakfast was okay at the hotel as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The elevator being out of service was extremely inconvenient for all the guests. We had to walk down 16 flights of stairs with our luggage. The staff did not apologize or try to assist. The elevator should have been repaired ASAP.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: One of the worst hotel experiences of my life sadly. Booked the hotel for my 5th wedding anniversary, and was disappointed to learn the hotel was under renovation. That wasn't particularly a problem, but it would have been courteous to inform paying guests prior to arrival, especially given my stay was 8 days.What compounded that, was I learnt all guests received complimentary breakfasts owing to the renovation. I'd already paid for breakfast, so had paid extra for no reason. Furthermore, it meant the breakfast lounge, which is already ridiculously small, was impossible to obtain a seat in. This meant on a few occasions, either hanging around, taking a plate outside, or attempting to get the lift upstairs (5 minute wait), by which point the food was unbearably cold and pointless. So I had paid for breakfast but couldn't get a seat, and people who had complimentary breakfasts were over the moon. One of the managers said this was normal, with a big smile on his face. I was witness to at least 2 other guests absolutely lose it - they had families and were told to load up a tray and take it back upstairs.Lift situation is a joke - 2 lifts and a hotel full of people. We ended up walking up and down 14 flights because we waited over 10 minutes and still couldnt get a lift.The standard of the breakfast was worse than I could have imagined. The eggs were not eggs - they were absolutely some form of powdered variety. The hot options abysmal. Cold options not much better, absolutely loaded with sugar. The manager assured me he would rectify the fact I had paid for breakfast and adjust the rate I paid. He lied. Upon checkout, he had done nothing, and I was left to argue with the reception manager, who also tried to lie to me and insist there was no complementary breakfast - I caught her out and she backtracked. Rooms were fine - relatively clean except for a few dusty spots & dirt behind the sofas and in the corners. No minibar.I was encouraged to sign up to the Hyatt World membership on arrival. Essentially a pointless membership which I will be cancelling. Supposed to be complimentary breakfast included, but as alluded to I'd already purchased breakfast in my package, and they didn't offer to adjust this. The only benefit we received was complimentary water, which we couldn't get for 3 of the 8 days, as the renovations were occurring and the confused people at the desk didn't know how to navigate that massive obstacle of finding a few bottles.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice, clean, currently having minor renovations in lobby. Nice rooftop area with great views. Rooms were clean. Our room was quiet and faced the back. Have to wait for elevators during breakfast time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed 6 nights. Walking distance to ESB and time square. Great rooftop area. 2 minutes from major subway hub. Room clean, bed very comfortable. Very quiet, slept well. Would definitely recommend and stay again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our stay at Hyatt Place was excellent! The staff was great! Our room was comfortable, quiet, and seemed larger than we were expecting. The location was good for everything we were wanting to do. We would definitely recommend and will certainly stay at Hyatt Place in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Family of 5 with three kids under 12 stayed here. It was very comfortable and reasonable. The kids loved the breakfast in the a.m. The location was great with lots of things nearby to do - eating, shopping, etc. Would definitely book again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights on our honeymoon to New York. We stayed on the 5th floor. Obviously, New York is expensive but I do feel that the price for the room was reasonable (compared to others) given its fantastic location. The subway station is just a 5 minute walk away (although it is the hottest subway station we encountered!). Many of the main sights are also within walking distance including the Empire State Building, Macy's, Madison Square Garden (7-10 minute walk) as well as Times Square, The Rockefeller Centre, Bryant Park, Central Library, Central Station, Chrysler Building (15-20 minute walk) plus much more. However, I would highly recommend getting a 7 day subway pass if you are there for almost a week. It is $33 and really easy to use and you can use it on any of the subway lines, we definitely got value for money and it means you can be a bit lazy if you're feeling tired and just travel one stop without worrying about cost.The room was cleaned daily and we didn't have any issues with the room. It was a very standard room with air-con, a fridge and a king size bed but there is so much to see in NY you won't spend much time in your room. Even when we were tired on some afternoons we would take our own drinks up to the roof terrace and relax up there, it is a really nice space with great views of the Empire State Building. The only reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars was because of breakfast. We found that there were often not enough staff on at breakfast so tables wouldn't be cleaned very fast and the food wasn't always topped up if it had ran out so you ended up missing out. We would often have to sit at a table covered in crumbs or with dirty plates and bowls still on them with no sign of a member of staff ready to clean them. My other issue about breakfast is that it is only served until 9am downstairs which seems really early, I know it is served on the terrace until 10am but sometimes it was too windy to sit on the terrace, we did this once and everything was blowing everywhere. The food served at breakfast is nice and we never had any problems with the food itself, there is a choice of hot food, toast, bagels, doughnuts, yoghurt and lots of nice fresh fruit as well as juices and hot drinks.The lobby area is currently under construction but this didn't impact us on our trip.I would stay here again because of the location but I hope breakfast time is improved.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, just 2 blocks away from main metro stations, close to Times SQUARE, Front desk employees speak Spanish and English, which is great. all of them very helpful especially Michael Riter, he was very helpful with me. Very professional and kind to me. Great attitude towards guests!!!!! No doubt at all I will be coming back to Hyatt New York Midtown South. Room was bigger than average, comfortable, clean sheets, and fantastic views of New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel, great service and clean. We enjoyed the view and the distance from the activities we were doing was perfect. The side street where the hotel is located made easy access for Uber’s and Lyft rides so made it easier for us non-New Yorkers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location.staff keen to assist. Room a bit small for 6 but we enjoyed. Breakfast met our dietary needs - kosher. We had a plenty to eat in addition to that we had a kosher restaurant across the street from the hotel. Perfect location we could walk, take subway or bus and

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Based on overall value, the hotel was centrally located and convenient. The metro stop was less than a 5 min walk away. There was lots of shopping options and dining nearby. The hotel was near a Shake Shack and Mc Donald’s. The rooms were clean and more spacious than your average NYC hotel. There is a rooftop where you can enjoy a great Manhattan view. Based on my stay, the hotel was going through some renovations in the main lobby so I do recommend you ask for a higher floor if possible. Also noted, the bathrooms were a little outdated. The hotel is easy to locate but is a little quieter at night it’s on a garment street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent a few days there and really enjoyed it. We didn't mind walking to the theatre district and time square. It was only .4 miles from Penn Station. It was really easy to get to and from the hotel from JFK. We would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well located and great value for the price. Breakfast on the rooftop was excellent and the set up was unique. I will go back for sure and hopefully spend more time. The place would gain by having room service. There was construction work going on in the lobby/lounge and that was perhaps the reason why there was no food service except for a small refrigerated counter (besides breakfast).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here by myself and they gave me a 25th floor king room. It was fantastic. Staff throughout my stay were wonderful and very helpful.Breakfast was mediocre. Buffet, but the only items that were actually warm were the bacon/sausages. The waffles/pancakes/french toast (alternating days) were very cold. But there was always looks of yummy fruit. Coffee and tea were available all the time in the breakfast room.The windows were pretty dirty so the view was a little obstructed, but I imagine it's near impossible to keep them clean.The room was clean and the bed was really comfortable.I got a good deal online, so it was even better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We took the train into downtown to see a show. Stopped by the hotel and checked our bags. Came back late due to weather and were upgraded to the 26th floor. What a room and view and you can have free breakfast on the terrace with the Empire State building as a backdrop. The staff is pleasent and could not be more helpful. When we come back I know where we are staying. Great central location

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Recommended. Last was here 3 years ago and was bit newer. Electric outlets starting to yellow and be a tad loose - meaning they've gotten some wear. This is a popular hotel with tourist, busy, and convenient walking to Penn Station, touristy neighborhood but good central spot. ++ Rooms is large for NYC, comfortable bedding, lighting good, big bathroom, desk area. -- Internet is a bit pokey, only 2 elevators sometimes a bit of a wait, door slamming on the small floors a problem (only 8 rooms per floor though).The lobby is under brief renovation and I got a rooftop room (26th floor) which has an open terrace (nice feature and is locked after 10 pm). Unfortunately, hotel was serving breakfast on the terrace during renovation and awoke at 6 am to banging about, opened my door at 7.30 am to find the hallway filled with people. Not pleasant. Front desk did change my room however felt hotel shouldn't have rented rooms on that floor given noise (they turned one room into a storage area and public WC).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt place for 7 nights in May. This hotel is in a great location just a few blocks from Penn station which is great for using the air train to get into the city. But also a great base to get around the city. We arrived at around 8pm and were greeted by a very friendly lady on reception, she informed us that there were no high floor rooms left but we could move in the morning. True to her word we moved the next morning. All the staff were helpful and friendly, breakfast was simple but a great amount of options for everyone. Our room was a great size for New York, there was a good size fridge and the bed was very comfortable. House keeping was great and our room was cleaned everyday.Overall we had a great stay and would 100% return to stay here again. Only thing that could of been better was the coffee provided in the room, it was drinkable but not great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everything was very comfortable. Great location, helpful personnel, functional room. The only drawback was the breakfast. No tea, only coffee and poor selection of food. However, as I understood, it's a standard breakfast in the US hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel has a lot going for it. Great location, clean, big rooms and friendly efficient service staff. The downside are a breakfast that is substandard compared to the usual Hyatt Place breakfast more on the order of La Quinta level. In addition, the towels are thin and not plush. The main problem is the sofa beds. Rooms with two beds are hard to find in NYC so we booked this thinking on using the sofa bed. Normal Hyatt Places have great sofas with thick mattresses that are a pleasure to sleep on. Here the mattress on the sofa bed is a s thin as a pancake and will kill your back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Close to many spots and easy to reach via Penn stationNice rooms and efficient serviceElevator is a bit noisy and breakfast was below expectation, May due to ongoing Renewal of the lounge. Overall Food experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location is great but hotel in need of TLC, expected better from this chain. Staff are great but cant cover up the lack of investment in the primary structure of the facilities.As a family room, others such as premier do a better job at the moment.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: his place is right next to Macy's , Times Square and Broadway. The rooms were clean and staff was professional. What dampened my entire experience was I was there for 4 nights and they had issues with the rooms . I was supposed to check-in after 12 AM , plenty of time to inform and prepare me for this unexpected change. However , they moved me to a different hotel for 1 night but then I was being asked to pay for cab from the new hotel to Hyatt ! Of course when I insisted they agreed to it but having travelled for so long and then when running on 4 hrs of sleep , arguing for such issues is the last thing you to do. Breakfast was ok... out of 3 nights that I stayed in Hyatt , I did not eat more than fruits there :( . It could be because I am used to vast spread in Asia or atleast more than 2 options ( Cereals , eggs+ side , fruits) for breakfast buffet in Europe . Anyways , if you wish to choose , I would recommend the hotel because of location and professional staff .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice stay with good breakfast and nice ambience with kids were happy to stay clean rooms clean stay suitable for family stay no other hotel would have given this nice stay I would recommend friends and family

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Suite said sleeps 5, but it was very cramped. Very small room for 5 people to stay in. Location wasn’t the best for a family. Party and bar area. Great view though. Breakfast was okay but it was free.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
