review_body: Amazing location, clean, great hot breakfast, perfect location!! Everything we wanted and more! We would highly recommend a family vacation here. The room sizes were larger than expected too and such a great price!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Whenever we travel we try to find a Hyatt Place. We stayed here due to its central location to many sites in NYC, & we loved it. Our room was very clean & comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We’ll stay again when we return to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location and very clean. The room was bigger than I expected for NYC and the couch was a bonus. Good restaurant very close by and subway nearby as well I would definitely stay here again Hyatt place brand very consistent

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Business. I would say I would come back to this hotel, but I need to know everything will be working. The breakfast needs to be better. Only the oatmeal was good. Everything else wasn't good. The cookies are great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Love the rooftop view accessible to hotel guests.Great location, metro stop incredibly near. Near K-Town as well, macy's, Penn station, empire state etc.Room was quite large compared to same hotels in vicinity.Breakfast included if you are a member of hyatt rewards club (or if you are genius member in booking). But as many have said - really don't expect too much, but it's already good as it is free.Coffee, tea and water available the whole day at the lobby. Seats outside if you want to hang on the street.No issues with admin or checking in/out. Guy for storage was super nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location of this hotel is pretty good since it is very near the important places you need to explore the city. The room is clean and beds are comfortable. The bathroom is fine except that we were given a room for people with disability (no tub) which makes showering a mess because water is spilled all over the bath area.I like their 26th floor terrrace view of NYC. The front desk people weren't exactly friendly and accommodating. There is no water provided for non-Hyatt members though they have infused water in the lobby. We ate breakfast but it was really so unappealing especially their donuts and waffles. I cannot even recognize the taste of their waffles. The hotel is relatively small.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Fab stay at this hotel. Rooms had plenty of space. Even a sofa in the room which was a bonus. Breakfast had a great choice. The room was a little small but always found somewhere to sit. Staff were very friendly and helpful.They had everything kn a room which was needed. Hairdryer. TV. Iron and ironing board.Location was perfect on 36th street. Close to all main attractions macys, times square and the empire state, which you can get a fantastic view of from the 26th floor roof terrace. I would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location was good, walkable to many prime location, breakfast was minimum.Rooms size was big and overall neat and clean. When asked for an extension for 2 hours for room they said they said no and when we were ready to pay for half a day they said we need to charge for full day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We love staying at this Hyatt. It is a perfect location, same block as the Empire State Building. It is close to Times Square as well. The hotel has been clean every time we have stayed there and the staff is awesome.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It’s exceptionally difficult to find a hotel in Manhattan with three beds. For what we paid for three nights, I would expect better. The pullout couch had only a thin blanket. When asked for a duvet , was told they had none. The whole hotel had not one clean duvet? Really. They gave my son three lightweight blankets. Not good. Later that evening they found another duvet. This is my second stay at a Hyatt Place in two months. Both hotels, the sheets were damp. Why?

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good place to stay. Located in the heart of Manhattan. Prime location to major subways. Definitely recommended to stay... walkable to many of the prime locations with in the downtown. Good service and room quality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have been a guest many times at this great hotel. The staff are excellent and first class all the way! The location is perfect for shopping, sightseeing and is clean and modern in design! When I arrived at 2:35 pm, it was busy. I was waiting my turn to check in and Eddie, who was helping another guest, stopped for a second to call another front desk employee to help! That really helped me so much! Wow! Talk about great service! Andres checked me and he was so great! I remember him from my last visit! He gave me two waters and I was on my way to the 22nd floor! My room was so clean and quiet! I love the shower with the sliding glass doors! Love coffee maker too, as I am a early riser!Breakfast was amazing every morning. Clean and organized with great employees!As I stayed a total of three evenings, I saw David, who is super! Great personality! Then a super lady, Gwendolyn, who helped me several times during my stay as well as check out. She is such a professional and I greatly appreciate her help so very much! I remember David and Gwendolyn from my last visits as well! My Hyatt Place New York City Family! I’m closing, To the General Manager of this fine hotel, I am grateful to Eddie, Andres, Housekeeping staff, Breakfast staff, David and especially Gwendolyn for all you did to make my stay wonderful! You are to be commended! Thank you! Lisa H (Florida)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For a family of 6 your options are limited. This was perfect for us to not have to split into different rooms. As long as we stayed organized the room was big enough. Elevators were hot. Breakfast was decent. Staff was nice. View of the Empire State Building was awesome. Not a bad location proximity wise to everything. Not a bad area but not a great one either (but you get what you get for the price).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was on a business trip in New York during a very busy week. I found the room for a good deal. The room was nice had all I needed plus a sofa. So good price for that area and the space I had in the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is at a Good location which helps quick and easy access to subways and all places, friendly and happy to help staff, Excellent service & good amenities. Would defiantly recommend for families. ..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: There aren’t too many options for a family of five in NYC. We were pleased with our stay. Room was clean, well appointed and somewhat larger than expected for a NYC hotel room. Refrigerator in room was handy. Subway station is close by. A good walk to Times Square. Complimentary breakfast for members was helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were on a short vacay with family and friends. The staff was very pleasant and the location of the property was ideal. Funtime over all. We will do it a again! We took the subway, saw two Broadway Plays and had great food!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Love love the location! I asked the upper floor on my check in and my room was huge, with big bed and sofa and has huge windows the city view! The room was super clean and quiet. Also I loved the breakfast- big choice and yummy. Loved fresh fruits and berries you can add to your porridge or yogurt. Definitely gonna back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Most central location in New York. Very convenient to all attractions and public transportation. Extremely pleasant and helpful staff. The room and facilities was well equipped and very clean. Highly recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel represents great value and has a great location for seeing all of Manhattan by foot and by Subway. The rooms are big by Manhattan hotel standards, scrupulously clean and with everything in working order. Good choice for the buffet breakfast. 26th floor terrace view directly onto the Empire State Building. Not a brand new ultra modern hotel, but recommended nonetheless!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I celebrated our 23rd wedding anniversary with you and enjoyed every minute of it! Thank you for your hospitality and making us feel welcomed. We look forward to a return trip in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: An amazing hotel. Stayed in room 2501 which had a great view. Would definitely recommend the breakfast buffet which was delicious. The staff go out of their way to help and the room was super clean. NYC is a great city to explore and the hotel added to our experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location and helpful staff. Room standard is good. Only complain was the our room in 3th floor that had an extremely noisy ventilation system right outside the window. Recommend to change room to a higher floor or on the other side.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect midtown location for seeing all of Manhattan. Well appointed room with, most importantly, a really comfortable bed, a spacious shower with plenty of hot water, a desk and a couch - this is not a claustrophobic NY hotel room. WiFi (a tad slow but adequate) and a large TV and a mini-fridge plus coffee-maker - you really could stay in the room if there wasn't so much to see and do outside the door! World of Hyatt members (do join) offered complimentary breakfast which ranged from very good to excellent with an amazing array of choices (vegans and carnivores would approve). Pleasant staff. A mid-range hotel that offers many extras. We had the most glorious city view from our room - it added a certain magic to our stay - but it was really the icing on a very nice cake. Will come again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Really liked this Hyatt Place. Good locatio . Great staff. Very clean. Very safe. Very comfortable. Jonathan at Front Desk was a GREAT guy. Friendly. Professional. Very welcoming. Wonderful first impression.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good experience overall and a hidden gem in mid town Manhattan. I enjoyed the stay here for 2 nights and will keep coming back whenever I have an opportunity to visit Manhattan again. Kudos to the stafd

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location! Friendly customer service! The breakfast was good! Family Friendly! We would definitely come back to this same hotel in the near future. The deli next door is a great place to eat for families on budget.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We visited New York to celebrate special birthdays for my wife and myself, and chose this hotel as it was close to many attractions, restaurants, bars etc. We stayed 12 nights and on the whole we were very satisfied.On arrival we were welcomed by a lovely employee called Evelyn who kindly arranged a bottle of sparkling wine with cheesecake and fresh fruit for our room, a nice gesture... Thanks Evelyn, you are a star!We were slightly disappointed to be given a room without a view of the Empire State Building, but it was clean and big enough for us, however the window was filthy to the extent we could barely see out of it.The included breakfast buffet in our room rate was very good! An extensive selection of quality hot and cold food which gave a useful start to the day (and the coffee was good, always a good sign).The hotel is situated on a busy street, and it is quite noisy, but in New York it’s less hectic than some. On the same street are two deli’s and several bars & restaurants.Nearest subway is five minutes walk, and Bryant Park, Times Square etc are easily walkable distance.Overall this is a great place to stay in New York if you want to be in the centre of Midtown, close to the action.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is in the middle of the city. It is comfortable, clean and the staff were very professional and courteous with nothing too much trouble. Good choice for breakfast and only 2 blocks from the Empire State Building with great views of this from rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hotel is situated near Empire state and the view from your room is just wow. You can see the Empire state building if the right room is assigned to you. very clean hotel and the staff is great. Rooms are small but manageable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For a family of five room 503 was too small. We stayed in NYC before and rooms were never this small. Clean with friendly staff, but size not good for larger families. If we weren't 2 adults and 3 kids it would have been a better stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel sits at a great location in midtown Manhattan. The staff are very friendly, professional and welcoming. Sadly, the hotel lacks modern styling and comfort. Having stayed on the 8th floor, I wouldn’t recommend it; waking up at 5am each morning due to busy street below with trucks and other construction vehicles. The choices for breakfast are limited - hot counter food was actually not as hot as it should be.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a very clean hotel, central to Midtown Manhattan. Staff were very friendly and helpful. No problems at all. Room was nice, a little smallish, but really it was everything we needed as somewhere to sleep between seeing the sights of the city. The breakfast was plentiful and cheap, but was laden with sugar. Pretty much what I imagine is called a typical American diet. So I suppose if that is what you are used to it will be fine for you. Personally don't eat that much sugar so found it hard to find anything suitable. Overall a very good experience, but just for the health conscious look elsewhere for breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Thanks to misinformation on the staff's part there where double charges on my account to do some error during check in. If it wasn't for my bank giving my account and credit I would have been out of money and a room. On call manager tried to make it ok by leaving a nasty bottle of champagne in the room. Thanks to double charges I had to go though my vacation with Very limited funds. I drove 8hrs from NC to NY and I wished I had stayed at another hotel. Very disappointed in Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We wanted a room with 3 beds, and this delivered, with 2 queen beds and a large sofa bed. Amazing view of Empire State from our room. Only downside was breakfast, which was basic and in a very cramped space.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good hotel. The staff is nice and helpfull. Lovely breakfast. Very good location close to many things. I would recommend this hotel at any time. We had a pleasant stay and we would love to go back. there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is about to be refurbished. It was super dirty, the room had stains and wet carpet, coffee was a joke with dirty hardware. I have stayed in Hyatt before and it was way better than this. Blinds in the room did not cover sunlight. Stay away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Lovely rooms, with tea coffee maker. Friendly staff. Loved every moment... you will not be disappointed!! Best of all was the location. Next to Empire State building and short walk to Times Square and theatres etc. When you need a taxi, don't book with the hotel but call from road. It's a fixed price to airport...£52

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Went for a combination of business and pleasure. The staff was the most helpful in allowing me to check in early, and check out late. Everyone that I encountered was completely and absolutely accommodating. I could not have asked for better service. The hotel itself is modern and nice, nothing too fancy, but the maintenance and cleanliness is immaculate. The location is good as well, convenient to many of the NYC attractions. 10/10 for this property. Fantastic experience. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a last minute booking for me and turned out to be a great choice. Clean, comfortable, quiet room. Though a bit on the dark side. But the breakfast was GREAT. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have had one of the worst holiday stays in a hotel. Full stop. The thing is, our expectations aren’t high being used to London and it’s outlandish price/quality ratio. But the Hyatt Place Mid-town appears to defy the odds. We have been in touch with the hotel via Twitter (DM) but that didn’t trouble the hotel as no one approached us to discuss. So what’s the snag? Essentially, the breakfast room setup is worst what we have seen and we travel a lot both on business and privately. For disclosure, I lived in a Hyatt hotel for three month and no issues. So (a) I believe I have been loyal to Hyatt and (b) with a family one does take convenience discounts into account (although should one, really?). Regardless, the breakfast room is too small/narrow and overall not fit for purpose. We could barely move (chairs back to back and no room to pass! - see picture) and as family of five could not sit together, once. On one day, we had to split up into three tables. Given the inadequate space, it brings the worst out in people with unfortunate scenes at the buffet bar. Equally, no staff appears to be present to clear away plates and it became all a bit of youth hostel feel to it all. Despite having Explorist Status no offer of room upgrade, nor any service offer that generally comes with Hyatt frequent user status. Shocking how Hyatt Place is, IMHO, a very poor brand ambassador for Hyatt. In a single word: AWFUL.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We are a family of 5 and stayed here end of May. Room was small, but enough for the 5 of us and our luggage. We arrived at noon, and even though check-in was not until 3PM, they had a room ready for us at 1PM. And it was a great room, as we could see the Empire State Building from the window. The free breakfast was good, and their upstairs terrace is nice. It is a great location and easy walking to subway or most places in midtown. Beds were super comfy, and we all slept well. The complimentary bottles of water that we got each day were also a nice touch. My kids loved it here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nasty piss stained sheets. When I told the hotel they said they will get them changed and even lied about doing so. When I told them they were never changed they lied . Then charged my card $685 after I had already paid in full. Wouldn’t even pay forMy overdraft fee

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, from 8th to 12th May, and were very happy with everything. The rooms were clean and reasonably sized, with a very comfortable King size bed. Breakfast was good but the room was very crowded with the tables very close together. The location was excellent and very central to everything. We would definitely recommend this hotel as good value for money for New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stay at this hotel every time we visit Manhattan (2-3 times a year). Great location and close to subways. Great shopping down the street. Staff are always nice. Good FREE breakfast. Highly recommend this Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place was honestly the best. Place was clean. Staff was amazing. And location was perfect! We booked this place last minute after our airbnb was cancelled but we are so happy we stayed here. We will definitely book here again~

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good hotel located in ideal location for visiting all the sites. Hotel staff were brilliant and very attentive to any issue raised. There was a good choice of food breakfast which good quality. The only think that was slightly disappointing was the hotel itself is in need of modernisation as it is now probably untouched since being built. The rooftop area was nice but not fully exposed to the sun due to the roof above.Ideal if open top roof area could be established.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It was a great trip for us. We love Hyatt hotels. The room is a little small for us, but the location is perfect. The breakfast was healthy and good food. We would stay in this hotel again if we come back to New York.Customer service was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location in Midtown Manhattan. Courteous and efficient staff. Comfortable room that was well appointed. Appreciated the fast check in and check out. Morning breakfast was adequate. Will recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The good: Room was largeService was friendlyAble to check in early Held luggage after checkout for freeThe bad:Windows were extremely dirty.Room had a musty smell.Price was very high.No hand lotion.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location and clean hotel is how I would describe this hotel! Was a short stay- the view outside of my room was just walls! The rooms were clean and well maintained!The elevators are not sufficient- long wait time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff extremly helpful and pleasant. Location was close to everything we needed. Close to theaters. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance and Times Square. Modern property with well appointed rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It's part of the Hyatt group, from what I understand. From the moment I checked in and until the time I checked out, I felt that I was treated the way a guest deserves to be treated. The hotel is also walking distance from Penn station. The free breakfast was a decent spread and the staff were all very polite. Although I stayed only for one night, I had a wonderful experience, overall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We crowded five women into a room with two queens and a sofa bed for a girls weekend in NYC. The room was small, but it's NYC so as expected, but very comfortable. We appreciated having the couch. We found the bathroom to be clean. There was also adequate bedding for the pull-out sofabed. We also appreciated the included breakfast (free Hyatt members club) which was more generous than expected. The breakfast room was also pretty spacious and staff were attending to it regularly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very comfortable and safe environment felt like home. The staff was helpful and the location is convenient and close to any attraction you will like to visit we used MTA and walking. The coffee and tea was always accessible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent two nights. The location is great. Breakfast was quite good as well. The decor is plain, but not unexpectedly so. There was no mirror in the bedroom (only in the bathroom) so that caused some slight inconvenience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: it has a great location and the service is more than expected for a business trip. At night can be noisy because it is a crowded city but still it is preferable to have everything near by and make better use of the time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location near both Empire State Building and Time Square. Clean, comfortable and nice setting. Staff was wonderful and very accommodating. Breakfast included when booked on Hyatt site. This location has a great rooftop deck with outstanding views of the city and Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very handy with most things within walking distance . The all inclusive breakfast was very good but does get busy at certain times and seating can be a problem! The staff are very friendly and knowledgable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First off the hotel and staff were exceptional. I had an issue with the billing and the manager took care of it. I have never had such a good complimentary breakfast. One day they had fantastic bacon crispy on the outside and moist on the inside, potato medley of 5 different types of potatoes, fresh fruit mix, delicious breakfast breads, pastries and a lot more. The only part of breakfast that was not particularly good was the scrambled eggs which were the quality of a lower end hotel. The staff was helpful and the view of the Empire State Building from the top floor was stunning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is prefect, with subway stations near by and close to Times Sq.The hotel staff were super nice and helpful. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable and Breakfast was a real treat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, decent size room, comfortable beds, complete black-out curtains (highly important to prevent young kids from waking up at dawn!), very friendly and helpful staff, wonderful breakfast buffet. The only downside , ONLY FOR FITNESS FANATICS LIKE US IS the fitness room - a tiny gym in the basement, crowded in the morning, insufficient space and equipment. All and all, we found our stay to be absolutely perfect :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Expensive compared to service levelGood locationBreakfast limited and with no service. Morning so busy that people need to take breakfast in the lobby!Had a too small room for 5 and not enough towels on arrival.Staff okRoof terrace has no service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well situated, very calm hotelNothing fancy about it but great for a visit in NYC, as it is close to many Manhattan sights and several subway linesSmall irritating issues (noisy refrigerator, no HBO, soap instead of shower gel) but all in all good value for the price

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Located in the centre for shopping, restaurants ( Korean,Chinese, Indian and Italian) super bakeries and theatres. All within 10-15 mis walking. Rate for 'Vegan friendly'- Soaps have no animal ingredients. Breakfast offers vegan food as well as healthy options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The "grab-and-go" option was very nice and overall the food and beverage options quite nice. The room was equipped with everything you would want and was actually a little larger than many NYC hotel rooms. We would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We've been to many of the Hyatt's (Regency, Place, .) and we do NOT think this Hyatt is up to the Hyatt standard. The room we had was shoddy, old and overall just plain sad looking. At check in, we asked the concierge if he could tell us what restaurants were in the area....he really didn't know of more than 2. Free breakfast for Hyatt Card holders?? OK, free if you consider they have it in a room that doesn't accommodate the amount of people using the room. The "hot" food was cold, need I say more? They can keep the "free breakfast"!! All in all for a hotel in Manhattan it didn't hold up to our standards. Hyatt staff & CEOs, take note. This hotel is NOT worth staying at when there are so many others to choose from. Oh yes, need I forget, the bathroom shower was just an area toward the back of the bathroom, no door, just a curtain which didn't reach the floor. It was more like a "wet bathroom" like they have in certain places in Europe where the whole bathroom is the shower & everything gets wet. Super great experience...….NOT! What we had was a roll-in shower for the handi-capped (which we are not)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is so outdated it’s not funny, floor in the room is uneven you could trip on the indentation. No shower GIVEN A ROOM WITH WET FLOOR SHOWER ONLY, Breakfast was disgusting as everything was cold, inadequate seating for guests, closet door, bathroom door and interior entrance door scratched and gouged. 2 elevators that are lucky to be running as they are slow as s—t. When checking out I had to ask for a print out of my bill as the clerk behind the desk did not know that? This particular location is off my Hyatt list and we have been to quite a few this Hyatt should have the name changed as it does not represent the Hyatt Organization

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great location an easy walk to Time Square/Theater District and also 5th Avenue shopping. Subway was nearby. The staff are great. David, Michael, Luz were some that I can recall but they were all excellent. I love the Hyatt Brand. The Hyatt Place is one of the more reasonable properties. It was clean, welcoming, great breakfast... I’d stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location made it easy to access from Lincoln Tunnel. Parking is literally steps away from the hotel. The room was larger than expected given that it is in Manhattan. The breakfast was the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. We booked room 203 and it was perfect. We never had to wait for an elevator and it was very quiet on the back side of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The property has always been one of my favorites. Great location, room size & prices, extremely clean with a compassionate Staff. Everyone was great, but David was exceptional at the front desk and helped to make my stay Wonderful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, very nice and helpful staff. Breakfast was tasty, though everyday almost the same and not much variaty. The room was clean, everything worked. Matrasses were to the soft side but still goed. There is a very nice terrace you can bring some food and drinks and make nice pictures. Only one minus here - the price. But unfortunately this is normal for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 6 nights during our Easter break. Great location, walking distance to all main attractions. Dur to central location, we could hear the street nouse, but on thr higher gloors it was not a ptoblem at all. The staff was very frienfly and helpful. Buffet breakfast was very good, with nice selection for each taste.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Modern, clean hotel in a good location, just a few blocks from the Empire State Building and Macy's at Herald Square. Great views of the Empire State Building in some rooms. Excellent staff who were very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown from 7 . - 13 . April 2019 . 2 adults and 2 kids , aged 7 and 10 . We had a room on the 5th floor , good size room , loads of space for New York Standards , had a big double bed and a big sofa bed for the children . Had no view what so ever , but no noise either . Beds were very comfortable and we all slept perfectly well . Also the 5th floor was quite handy , it’s not too high to walk up and down . Since there are only 2 lifts , they can get really busy . Check in was all fine and quick and everyone friendly and helpful . Breakfast was fab , it had everything we needed , a really big choice . Had a selection of fresh fruits and yoghurts , juices , eggs / bacon / sausages , cereals and porridge , big variety of breads / banana breads and bagels , tea and coffee . The only thing I would say , go early if you can , on our check out day we went around 9am and had to queue for a table and it was absolutely mobbed and felt a bit manic. The other days we went between 6.30 and 7.30 and it felt a lot more civilised and calmer . What we really appreciated is that you get free tea and coffee and water for free 24 hrs . It’s really handy with the kids , can top up water bottles before you head out . The only thing I would say , there was 4 of us in the room , but every day we only had 2 big towels in the bathroom . But as soon as we asked for more we got them straight away . The location is absolutely amazing . 2 walking minutes away you have got 34th Street herald square subway station , you can also walk to broadway , Times Square , Empire State Building , flat iron building , 230th roof top bar . One day we even walked back from Central Park . Also the rooftop deck is very beautiful and has an amazing Empire State view . The rooms are a bit dated , but it was all clean and tidy and the staff were always friendly and helpful . On arrival day we took a cab from JFK , on way back we took the subway from Penn station . If you have not that many bags it’s super easy , roughly 10 walking minutes from the hotel ( 8 dollars per person including the air train ) . We had a lovely stay and would definitely recommend the Hyatt place .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: noisy, not super clean, smelled of cigaretes. staff was ok, breakfast ok. nothing special, definitely too expensive for what you get. but i guess that is the New York standard. Still, would expect more from such a chain as Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My first time in New York, the room was nice. The elevator wait time and the sirens and night were a problem. The breakfast was great! i was disappointed to hear that when I tried to use my points it would make my rates go higher. Why have it then???

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent Midtown location, decent size room, quality amenities , superb staff. I had a nice view of Rockefeller Plaza looking north from 24'Th floor. The room was quiet and very little street noise. My only hangup was the fact there were only 2 elevators, so at certain times it took awhile, but that was rare. The breakfast was part of my package and I thought it was very good, with a large variety of options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent Spring Break with 3 kids (12, 10, 8) in New York. Included breakfast was great, as was location to sightseeing and subway. Room is small, but expected that in New York City. Would stay again and recommend to friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times on both business and family travel. It's a convenient location and the staff is professional, friendly and helpful. It may not be fancy but you can't beat it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, great a accommodation. Good size rooms and a free breakfast for Hyatt members. Highly recommended for a vacation in Manhattan, mostly for the location wich is a couple blocks from Pen station and walking distance to any major location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Ideally situated for all the main attractions, sub way was one block away and there was easy access to the bus service. The hotel was clean and the breakfast had plenty of choice. We were checked in by Eddie who was extremely friendly. The room was average for New York and was well appointed. We had an issue with our toilet not flushing and the room not being cleaned and refreshed one day, but his was promptly dealt with by the lovely lady on reception. We would have no hesitation in staying here on our next visit to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent service, nice rooms, on the small side but that's to be expected for location and price. Nice free breakfast for Hyatt Members. Short walk to Times Square, and subway stations, great little bars and coffee shops within a block.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room too small for 5...don't trust the pix. Holes in the linnens. Not enough towels the first night. We were at the 10th floor.. too nous because of external ventilation. Sun protection broken..no botte of water received if you don t ask.. people ok..employees ok..good breakfast..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everything was clean and staff was amazing. The location was perfect for our trip and close to the 34th st Subway and a short walk to Times Square. I would definitely stay here again...The value was wonderful. Get the breakfast! It was such a great deal and there is something for everyone. Very fresh.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After a 15 hour travel day the check in process was quick and easy, staff were friendly and made me welcome, room was clean and comfy, and they held my bags after check out before my flight as it was later in the evening. Perfect, and would recommend anyone use this hotel for a short stay in the heart of manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was very nice and great location. Only 1 1/2 miles from Grand Central. . Staff very friendly and helpful, We had road side room on 2nd floor and did not have any noise. Next door great little place for lunch. Optional breakfast was ok. Room very small but we had king size bed and a sofa. Small bathroom also but all adequate

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice rooms, great to have a sofa to watch TV. Coffee machine and complimentary water. The Only downside was road noise, however ear plugs were provided. Great breakfast, lovely choice and good variety. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was in a great location, staff were very helpful and friendly. Enjoyed the optional breakfast which was very good value and lots of choice. Our room location was at the front of the hotel on the 5th floor and the noise started around 6am in the morning. Apart from that I would return, maybe looking higher at a higher floor. Hope to return next year..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at this Hyatt for a week, the location is ideal for its proximity to Time Square, Broadway Theaters, and all the fine eating and entertainment places in its immediate vicinity. Breakfast was great and substantial. All the staff were helpful with especial mention to David and Eddie for their extra attentiveness and and hospitality. Will definitely stay in this hotel again whenever we visit BYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights in April 2019. Welcomed by lovely and informative staff. Great room, very quiet from both inside and outside the hotel - we did not hear a peep. Room was large enough for us, huge window with blackout blinds and fab views of the ESB. Great heat/AC unit which was a blessing. Tea/coffee facilities in room, daily bottled water on request. Big, comfortable bed which we slept very well in. Fridge provided in room. Large bathroom and shower cubical and plenty of large and small towels provided. From a female point of view - long length mirror with a light directly above and 4 power sockets within close reach - this is a must for hair and makeup needs. Hairdryer provided and very powerful. Breakfast was plentiful and well presented although more tables needed for everyone at the busy times. I will miss my daily banana and yoghurt loaf. Lifts were very fast and never had to wait long. Rooftop open terrace was a great place to enjoy a coffee and gaze at the views especially the ESB.Computers available to check in to airport and to print off boarding passes.Transfer to airport with the hotel transfer service, great price and efficient. Overall a great location, very clean hotel and will most probably stay here again if we visit NYC in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel and rooms were very clean, great breakfast that was always well stocked (hot foods, fruit, yogurt, variety of breads, oatmeal) and staff were amazing! My only complaint is they need to soundproof room doors, to stop banging that woke me multiple times each night. I'd stay there again and room ear plugs. Overall, great location, easy walk to Empire State building and Times Square to catch a show after business meetings were over.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Not completely worth the money. Rooms were small and bathroom furniture's lacked a premium finish. The breakfast was really good but the hotel didnt meet the expectations of the Hyatt brand. Could gave been better if the furniture's are renovated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our stay at this hotel was very enjoyable, the staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful. The king room (no sofa-bed) was spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed. There was a good size sofa and footstool in the room as well as a standard coffee/tea machine, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. Our room was on the 14th floor and although you could hear some street noise it was not loud enough to disturb us or keep us awake. We went for breakfast between 7.30 and 8.00 and always found a seat quite easily. Breakfast was self service with plenty to choose from. The location of the hotel was ideal as it was far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but close enough to walk to as well as Bryant Park, Grand Centra Station l, Empire State Building , Macy’s,Penn Station, Rockerfella Plaza and Radio City Music Hall and most theatres. Plenty of places nearby for food and drinks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Second time staying here this year it is a great location , great restaurants and shopping all around. Lifts are always fast. The roof top terrace has amazing views of NYC. The free breakfast and water bottles daily being Hyatt rewards member, is an awesome perk. Will come back for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was perfect for sightseeing. I would have given 5 stars, but the room wasn’t vacuumed well upon our arrival. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. I was traveling with 4 teens and the double queen plus sofa bed was a good size for us. Not much closet space, but this is NY. The decor in the rooms is a little dated. The pics you find online are accurate representations. The staff makes this a hotel I would happily recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was beautiful. Location was close to Times Square and Empire State Building, and was only 1 block away from the nearest subway station.Bathroom was clean, room was plenty big for a New York room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I found the hotel to be very well situated and easily accessible. The staff were excellent in all dealings and the breakfast was good and appreciated as part of my membership. I would definitely seek out Hyatt place in future holidays.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Where do I begin? Hyatt Place Midtown South is a brilliant hotel to stay at. The rooms are comfortable and they come with many perks, including a large television, free office spaces to use (with free printing) and more. Our room had an Empire State view and we were only a few minutes walk away from Macy’s, Empire State and plenty subway stations. The room could comfortably fit 6 people and 7 with a squeeze. We only had 5 and it was very comfortable. A safe is included too. The hotel is reasonably large and has an Empire State viewing platform at the top, a bar that serves many drinks and snacks foods, dining features and free wi-fi (that was actually a very fast connection). Overall, the Hyatt Place Midtown South was a brilliant place to stay. Totally recommend. Attached image was taken from the viewing platform.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We've stayed in so many hotels in NYC during the last ten years and this was one of the most pleasant experiences. The staff was courteous and gracious. The breakfast was filling and wholesome and included GF and DF options. The room was exceptionally clean and reasonably large for NYC. And the location was top notch. Easy walking distance to the NY Public Library, the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Central Park.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I came in early from a flight and front desk staff were very accommodating. They helped me find an available room, get me setup quickly and get me to breakfast. After a cross country flight, their service was a difference maker.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed for two nights at the Hyatt (and was traveling on work). Location was convenient (there's a deli next door, a burger joint a block away and the subway <5 min away). The breakfast was better than what I expected (continental breakfast) . Staff were helpful and welcoming. The room was clean (though the bed and linen didn't seem the best). My biggest gripe was that the street noise ( I was on the 6th floor). Choose a higher (17+) floor room if you can. The staff tried to find me a bette rroom but unfortunately the couldn't

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Kiss the end of the road tour we had a great time we checked and they let us check in early the staff at the Hyatt was the best very courteous and professional helped us out with everything we needed the room was a little small but it was a beautiful room clean the shower was clean everything was clean in the room had a great time the breakfast was beautiful we checked out early the next day and they said they watched our bags for us and we we walked around the city came back very courteous staff in the morning there is a couple guys that were there I don’t remember their names beautiful location real close to our Madison Square Garden like this it was only 10 minute walk the observation deck was pretty cool too I really never experienced that in a hotel oh that was my first day in a hotel in the city to as well never stayed overnight in New York yes I would go back there under one condition you charge me $49 for parking and I don’t think I should’ve paid that should’ve been included in the room but I paid it and I am not complaining about it I think give you a free parking to your patrons you have more people there but all in all it was a great little getaway we got to see our concert last time for cash no more concerts for them and we made some beautiful memories to as well Hope to see you again soon thank you from the Kistner’s

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. A big shout out to Jonathan Santos who was always kind and patient. My friend was turning 30 and the staff were all happy to help decorate her room before she arrived.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It’s convenient location to Penn Station, Bryant Park, and Times Square puts this Hyatt Place hotel in a perfect location! Plus, it’s only a short enjoyable walk to Broadway! Everyone we met couldn’t be more helpful. We’ve stayed here numerous times and have never had a bad experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: While a hotel facility is extremely important the hotel staffing is what makes clients return. From check-in to check-out, and each time we walked through the doors, we were welcomed with surprising cheer! Even speaking with the cleaning crew on the elevator was positive! The location and facility are what lured us here. The staff will be the reason we return. Thanks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was very central. A minute’s walk from 6th Ave where there was great shopping and many good restaurants around. Staff were friendly and attentive. Check in experience was great and definitely would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Have stayed at Hyatt’s across the country & globe and was very disappointed. The location was perfect but check in was a disaster. Rooms were adequate, missed a cleaning 1dsy, charging stations didn’t work and the tv glitched. Breakfast was good and Jonathan (front desk) was fantastic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I flew into New York City on a Sunday night, worked the next day, and then flew out the day after. It was a quick, work oriented trip. The Hyatt Place is very down to earth, comfortable and just enough of a luxurious a hotel to make you feel like you're in the heart of New York, but still be able to breeze through the door to see the night staff having fun with each other while cleaning up from another day in the city. The rooms are comfortable, the water is hot, and the beds are firm. I had a view of the Empire State Building from my room. The next day before my flight, I ordered room service breakfast, asked for some bacon and eggs because I knew I had an 8 hour flight ahead of me with no time for food in between. They brought it up and when I checked out a few hours later, found out that breakfast was only $6.00. The Hyatt Place in NYC is probably the only reasonably priced establishment in all of NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was in town for a week on business over New Years. Wanted a place away from Times Square, but still close walking distance to my office which was just 1-2 blocks south of the madness that is Times Square over NYE. The Hyatt was a perfect choice. It was affordable for my last minute booking over such a famous holiday in NYC, and it was quiet and bed was comfortable for a great night's sleep after each long day. My only complaint is the TV wasn't working for one evening, seemed to be a problem throughout the hotel, not just my room. And, the elevators were small and slow, almost too crowded each morning to get on the first time around, sometimes had to wait for next elevator. Other than that I would recommend this place, too bad its prices went up for my upcoming weeklong business trip next week, and now I can't stay here :(

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The best hotel in Manhatten that I stayed in! The rooms are verg clean and the staff is simply amazing. This is my second stay and there will be many more to come. Very close to the subway and walking distance to times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: clean and easy location... I was there with a group on business but I think the majority other guests were there on holiday... Much like me, I am sure the guests on holiday were able to walk to many sites as I was able to walk to many of my meetings... But taxis were easily had from hotel front, 6th or 5th Avenues...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff is very pleasant to help you and are great to accommodate any needs you may have. The rooms are clean, spacious for NYC, and the beds are very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was a great perk to start off the day. The location is prime to major attractions such as Broadway shows. I would definitely stay here again, and I have!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice room on 19th floor. No noise from street below. Big room for NYC. Perfect location for reaching north and south on Manhattan. Great places to eat nearby. Friendly staff. Great varied breakfast every morning. Coffee to go.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It is hard to find a room for 5! We enjoyed the delicious breakfast each morning and loved the view of The Empire State Building from our window and the rooftop deck. The location was perfect - right in the middle of town - and the staff was always very kind!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place has a great location, just off Herald Square. Once inside, you immediately feel that this is a classy place, even though the price is reasonable. The desk crew is very warm, courteous, and efficient. Lobby well-appointed with coffee, tea, fruit, and computer with printer. The room was large for midtown Manhattan, with king-size bed, couch, floor-to-ceiling windows. Bathroom fairly well appointed. Stall shower (no bath) and as one of us had a broken arm with a cast, we requested some kind of bucket to wash ourselves, and staff member Jonathan S. immediately searched and got one for us. Our room faced 36th St., and at night there was periodic banging from the street; we checked that out in the morning and saw that there is a large, steel plate down the street, presumably placed there by the City to cover a large hole, and when vehicles went over it at certain points it banged (the hotels in the area need to press the city to fix this!); but we kept the fan on low all night which softened this disturbance. Can't rate the breakfast as it was not included and rather pricey to add on in comparison with breakfast places nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I found the location of this hotel very good, walking distance to macys,the empire state building and times square. The staff were always pleasant and helpful, the breakfast was good, could be slightly improved but ok. Room was clean and sufficient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: liked the location. Michael at guest services was very helpful. was staying on the 25th floor - view was amazing from there. breakfast was of good variety and had vegetarian options as well. Being a hyatt member, got 2 complimentary water bottles everyday

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful location, great free bfast included, convenient, slightly discounted parking less than half a block away on the same side of the street, staff are friendly. Great view of empire state from roof terrace. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My plans got changed and I only had one night in NYC, but we made the best of it! The Hyatt Place was really nice and super clean. Our room was a decent size for the city. We loved the obersavation deck! Bed was super comfy! The shower pressure was amazing, I never thought I’d have a decent shower in the city but it was great! We got a free breakfast for being of World of Hyatt member which is good.. because if I would have had to pay for it I would have been a little disappointed..they say it starts @ 7... but it was not already then..and they had toaster issues..no big deal but I had to complain about something! The staff was excellent! I would definitely stay here again and recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Housekeeper asked us every day when we were leaving and multiple times the day of. Hyatt refused to extend our reservation by ONE day due to winter storm closing our arrival city of Denver AND the government grounding the Boeing aircraft. Was said to me, they could make $75 more for the room than extend my stay with my original rate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was conveniently in the heart of everything! Clean and the complimentary water bottles and coffee and tea was a nice touch. Friendly and helpful staff especially Jonathan and Clarissa were lovely and greatly appreciated. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were several days early and chose to stay here … it was perfect! Comfortable … and located in Midtown. The Hotel staff is very attentive. We had an issue with the heat and the fan in the bathroom and the handyman was there in a jiffy to adjust everything without any fuss. We booked through a 'third party' so we were NOT able to have breakfast but if YOU book through Hyatt or are a member … breakfast is free.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location in the City, close to Penn Station and Times Square. Never needed to use a cab. Room was clean and was a very enjoyable stay. Breakfast was great and the staff was pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, ten minute walk from Times Square, Empire State, Grand Central and midtown sights. Perhaps a thirty minute walk to Central Park.Rooms a decent size for central NYC and very clean and well maintained.Welcome from staff and service throughout was very friendly. Luggage storage for 3 dollars per item good value and helpful after check out.Tip- ask for a high floor to minimise street noise which is loud but you have to expect that in a city and you can get used to it. In fact, the fridge in the room was noisier and more disruptive than the street noise most of the time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place Midtown was a great choice for us. We are a family of 5. 3 of those being Teenaged Boys. We appreciated the free breakfast each morning. It was delicious and we alsoLoved the location as it was super convienient to everything we wanted to do. Very nice staff and room was super clean and just what we needed. We will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was my 5th visit to NY and was a very quick one. The location of the hotel was perfect to access lots of important/popular areas we wanted to visit in such a short stay. The subway (Herald station) is right there on 6th Ave. and 5th Ave., my favorite street to walk in NY, takes you downtown and uptown with ease. Hyatt Place was a great pick this time, we loved having the convenience of the breakfast for members, plus complimentary coffee and tea to keep guests warm. Room is small, but just perfect for my mother and I to share. Street noise overnight was tolerable and it helped that we stayed in one of the top floors. Honestly mini-fridge noise was more bothersome than street noise (also tolerable). Staff was very attentive. Overall great experience. I recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are okay with walking the hotel is about a mile to a mile and a half to the convention center and Greenwich Village. Easy walk straight down 36th to the convention center. Food options were conveniently located within the immediate area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Have stayed here several times. We travel to NYC by train. This property is a short walk to or from Penn Station. Very convenient. Macy's is even closer and a frequent visit when we are in the city. Clean and comfortable hotel. Good customer service and affordable. The Hyatt membership is well worth it for the free breakfast and daily water bottle.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff was welcoming, friendly, and professional. Room was very clean, especially bathroom. Had to have key cards replaced when they stopped working, not a deal-breaker, but needs to be addressed. Free breakfast was top-notch. Dining area clean. Plenty of breakfast options including fresh fruit. Presentation very good. Overall good value for the money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Big room and good bed. The breakfast could have been better. It`s not an european standard. But the hotel is located near fifth avn, Broadway and it`s a short trip with the tube to Soho, Brooklyn for shopping

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My brother suggested Hyatt Midtwon South for it's location. My mom and I were very pleased with the room size and location. Plenty to do near by and easy access to train. Staff was friendly, hotel is clean and modern. Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First time staying at this Hyatt location. Place is relatively new and clean. Rooms are similar in size to other hotel chains in NYC. 6 rooms on each floor with two elevators & so during peak times, hard to get up or down efficiently. Buffet breakfast quality is generally good; and similar to other NYC hotel chains. Windows in hotel seem to be pretty thin, as the street noise was pretty loud all night long. Bed was reasonably comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: we chose a standard room at this hotel as didn’t feel we would be in the room too much. The room was a reasonable size for New York and was kept very clean by the staff. The TV reception was very scratchy and internet pretty slow. All the front desk staff were pleasant and helpful and as far as location went it was just great so close to subway stations and great shopping. Breakfast was just average but does save buying it if you are a Hyatt member.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were in the city for a concert at Madison Square Garden. It was an easy walk not only to the Garden but to many restaurants, deli's and fast food. It was near to so many stores, Macy's in particular!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was greeted by friendly staff that had my room ready in the morning as we had got off a cruise. The house keeping staff were excellent and personally checked on us each day. Breakfast was included and was different each morning, fresh and hot. The front desk staff made recommendations for local restaurants and they were "bang on". This hotel is close to everything as they say and they will set you up with the Hop On Hop Off bus which is a bonus. We will be back. Great job team.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Impeccable customer service and staff. The room and view were both very nice. Breakfast was a delicious large spread selection of fresh fruit, continental & hot breakfast items. I had no noise in my room on the 7th floor facing the street. I felt like I was on vacation vs a work trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very friendly and accommodating! Excellent stay for 10 of us on our trip. All very helpful and rooms were great. Breakfast in morning was awesome especially for the kiddos. The location is fantastic!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: located in the heart of NYC. very close to everything, nice restaurant , time square, broadway show, korean town. nice breakfast in the hotel and top floor viewing points. nice staff members. very clean and night view from the window., next building has the monarch roof top bar. 5 mins to Korean town with barbeque and cocktails and bakery . Korean town has lots of culture to visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Decided to pay the extra for a room with the view of the Empire State Building. Greatly worth it as we saw the Westminster and Valentines colors. Rooms are super clean, great shower and large TV. Only things that need work is speeding up a very slow Internet, and fixing the TV reception issues. Many channels did not come in and others had poor signals.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A super friendly staff, great accommodations and the perfect location for our trip to Westminster Dog Show. Complimentary breakfast for World of Hyatt members was very good with lots of selection. Bed and linens were the nicest I’ve ever slept on. Highly recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good hotel for a few days. Very clean. Room is small, but thats normal for Manhattan.Breakfast is ok, but not spectacular, usual for an US Hotel of this price.. Good location in the heart of Manhattan. Good bed. Nothing else to say.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice and pleasant staff. We requested a room with a view of the Empire State Building since it was my girlfriend's first time in NYC. They accommodated our request and upgraded our room so we could check in early which just made our trip so much better. They even brought us a cookie and cake with a sweet note. That extra touch was everything and we really appreciated it. Will definitely look to stay at the Hyatt again when we return to NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice newish Hyatt Place. Rooms are smaller than most Hyatt Place locations (I have stayed in at least half a dozen) but more than sufficient and quite large for Manhattan.Location is great, on a fairly quiet street but a quick stroll to Broadway, Time Square, etc.The hotel does not have its own parking but has an arrangement with a garage down the block. $49 a night at the front desk which is a little below average for the area and cheaper than if you had just payed the parking charge at the garage itself.Breakfast was the typical Hyatt Place spread which fills you up but doesn't excite you. I did not find it crowded at all but I am an early riser and got there when it opened at 6:30. I also had no problem with waits for the elevators as others have written but I suspect Sunday night is a fairly low-occupancy time for them.The only complaint, and it is a minor one, is that you cannot take care of the parking when you check in, they will only validate and charge it upon checkout. The reason I don't like this is that I usually check out via the Hyatt app and don't need to go to the front desk but at least when I checked out there was no line and the desk attendant was very friendly.One piece of advice -- keep checking prices even after you have booked. A few weeks after I made my reservation I noticed that the price for the same evening had come down by $30 so I cancelled and rebooked. I guess this is actually true of virtually any hotel these days with dynamic pricing based on demand.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very pleased with my stay here. Had a room on the 19th floor with an Empire State view. Room a little tired with stains on carpet and some frayed edges. Closet not very big and the door would not close, but not a big deal if not staying more than a week. Room and bathroom serviced everyday and it was always clean. Breakfast was a little manic, but choice on offer is varied and plentiful. Location wise this hotel is ideal, subway a block away and due to midtown location most things are a walk away. All staff, with the exception of 1, I encountered were very pleasant and willing to offer advice or have a chat. Definitely recommend and will definitely consider for my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Beware if you get a lower room on the street side. The music from a club across the street makes it impossible to sleep. If you don’t mind wearing earplugs or don’t mind loud music then you will be fine. Otherwise staff, cleanliness and accommodations are very good

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Let the hotel know what time you will be arriving, and they may be able to confirm an early arrival. Then they email you when your room is ready.Breakfast is great. everything you need and more in a buffet. Room size adequate and clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is a nice hotel in NYC. Our room had floor to ceiling windows so a lot of light, a sofa in the room so a little bigger then other hotels in NYC. Breakfast was very good and staff was very friendly. The hotel is in a good location close to MSG and the subway system.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place provided a good place to stay for a short trip into the City. The staff were very helpful, the included breakfast was good, though the space was quite crowded. The hotel lobby needs some updating as did our room, but it was overall in reasonable shape. Our main complaint was the housekeeping, which was spotty at best. Mostly we expected the coffee, mugs, water glasses, and other supplies to be replenished daily, but we needed to ask at the front desk each evening to get fresh towels and cups.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We often stay at this Hyatt when we travel into New York, via train. It is a less than 10 minute walk from Penn Station, and minutes uptown to go to our favorite restaurants, the stores, or a play. The price is reasonable and accommodations pleasant. Membership in The World of Hyatt is free, and guarantees free breakfast. It's worth it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice hotel and good location and room very clean and staff just great I recommend that everybody visiting new to chose this locationt . The breakfast is great . Next time I will stay her when I visit NY

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It is challenging to find a hotel room that will work for a family of 5 in Midtown, and I can recommend this Hyatt Place for those families. We stayed in a room with two doubles and a pull-out sofa, and it was larger than expected for Manhattan.I have only Discoverist status with Hyatt, and yet upon arrival, I was surprised to find a variety of snacks waiting for us in our room. We had extra bottles of water, chips, a cookie, candy, fresh fruit...it was much appreciated!Breakfast was hot and well-serviced. You have to book direct at Hyatt for breakfast to be included.The room was clean and functional. Fridge, but no microwave.The front desk and housekeeping staff were excellent.The location is good if you're wanting to stay in Midtown. Walkable to lots, and you're close to Penn Station if you're taking the train from the Newark airport. I'd definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We visited this hotel for a four day trip to NYC to celebrate my 50th birthday. From the moment we checked in we found the staff amazing. The room was superb, clean and with an amazing city view (25th floor). The location was central to all the highlights of NYC. We felt extremely safe in the area around the hotel. The breakfast was fantastic with fresh fruit, cereals and a different hot option every day. Housekeeping was second to none and felt each day we were walking into the room on our first day. The bed was very very comfy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As far as this class of hotelGoes it is very nice. Room is decent size for nyc and the staff was very nice. My only complaint is i booked on Hotwire so the hotel has a new policy where booking on a site besides Hyatt you do not get the breakfast. If that matters to you be aware of it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This has been my "go to" hotel for the past 6 years and the hotel and it's staff are always excellent. The rooms are much larger than most standard rooms in the city and if you're lucky your room may have a gorgeous view!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Thank you. Excellent location. The staff is very helpful and friendly.Rooms are clean with acceptable mattresses. Breakfast is not very variable however always fresh and tasty. Coffee, tea and water available for guests 24/7.If you need more quiet time try to book a room on higher floors from the other side than 36 street.Hotel has a terrace on the top floor with a stunning view of, among others, Empire State Building and available seats to spend time if the weather allows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was ideal and loved the view from the top terrace. Out room on the 6th had a very uninteresting view but overall very clean. Coffee was free for all guests but noot that good. Overall a good value for money

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed there as a family in January 2019for about a week. The hotel was in a great central location, Most major sites within 20 minutes walk.The rooms were good, clean but manage your expectation, this is NYC, so it will be small compared to anywhere else (decent size for NYC). The breakfast was better the expected. We generally found the staff to be stoic, rarely smiles & not friendly. There was one particular staff, Leslie that was condescending to my aunt who was asking for the additional daily water as she had forgotten to take it the day before. An explanation that it was hotel policy not to give would hv sufficed instead of talking down to my aunt & comparing the bottles to breakfast. (The bottles don’t get place in your room; you have to pick it up daily at the lobby)Good exceptions:1) Dane: went out of his way to make things easy 4 my family who arrived with no bags due 2 the airline2) Wendollin who was quick to smile & chat making us feel welcome

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff do not know what they are doing. Room was tiny and dirty. Avoid this place. There are many other good Hyatt hotels in New York City. I have tried all the Hyatt hotels in NYC and this the definitely the worst.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel has the best staff, first class all the way. This is why I keep returning! The hotel is very centrally located to great shopping, restaurants and more! I stayed three evenings and requested a quiet room hopefully in the middle floors. When I arrived, I was greeted by Andres, who was so great. He informed me that I was assigned room 2607! The top floor! Oh my! This was a great and welcomed surprise. Love the shower here! Good water temperature!David also cheerfully greeted me when I arrived at check in. David is first class and amazing! Kind and true professional to the max! We spoke several times during my stay and he portrays the Hyatt spirit!Eddie was also very friendly as were the ladies in the Breakfast area. I really appreciate all their hard work in making the delicious morning foods so great! Clean and orderly!Upon leaving, I met Gwendolyn, who was super! A very kind, professional young lady, who checked me out and asked if I needed anything else before I left.So to the General Manager of the Hyatt Place, New York, I commend you for your great staff, facility and care shown to me today and in my past stays! Will return soon! Thank you! Lisa H./Florida

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at many hotels and this location had some of the best customer service I have ever experienced. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, air was quiet and most of all the staff was friendly to me and my 3 teenagers. Great location and concierge service; they were willing and able to answer my tourist questions. The price for the two bed and sofa was perfect and full breakfast was included. Thank you for helping make our visit awesome!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for a couple of days and thought it was as advertised. Clean rooms and polite service. You're about a five minute walk to Penn Station and about a ten minute walk to the theatre district. Koreatown is a few blocks away as well as a subway line. I thought it was a convenient location and would consider staying here again the next time I have an overnight stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After a six day business trip in rural NJ, wanted to stay in Manhattan for my last night. The hotel room was nice and clean (although the bathroom was quite small with nowhere to put much toiletries. The staff was the highlight of the visit. Very friendly and helpful at giving good directions. Will go back to that hotel just for them. :-)Hotel was in a great location for walking, as the first section of town I wanted to go was Herald Square for vendor shopping. Unfortunately, it had already started raining and the vendors had closed shop.:-( Then I wanted to finally see the Christmas decorations, so walked up 5th Ave. The highlight and most decorated was Saks Fifth Ave. A must see if you're in the area. It was a little bit of a hike in the rain at night but worth it. They had a laser light show across the entire front of the building. Very nice! After that, I was too tired so didn't continue up to Rockefeller Center.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at this Hyatt Place location in the past and have had some negative experiences. From the moment I stepped on to the property until the time of checkout, I was treated so well! My brother and I were originally staying in a King Bedroom, but were upgraded (at no additional charge) to a room with two Queen Beds and an Empire State Building view! That upgrade was just one of many individual positive experiences of this stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room clean, guest services awesome and appreciated the note in room for best times to eat breakfast. If you get there late, chances are no place to sit and minimal food left. Overall excellent experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: room type - double queen, high floor, empire state viewThe room was spacious, spotless, warm. Everything was newish. The staff are lovely, all of them, so friendly, the gym was good, but could have done with AC. The hotel is perfectly located, stones throw from Macy's, ATM, Pharmacy, Times Square.The breakfast is good - they dont use disposable cutlery or plates cups etc, so thats a good environental aspect. The choice was very good, eggs, roasted root veg, lots of cerials, bacon, bagels toast cakes etc.The view from our room 2403 was better than the roof terrace on floor 26I couldnt really fault this place at all

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. It was smaller than anticipated especially for 4 adults (room was advertised to sleep 5 adults). View of the Empire State Building was very nice. The breakfast included with the rental was very tasty with a wide selection of breakfast options such as eggs, bacon, roasted potatoes, oatmeal, waffles, fruit, yogurt, banana bread, toast etc. The dining area is small and often does not accommodate all guests. Dining hours are too early and food was taken up early every day we were there sometimes a half hour early with no restocking of depleted items.
