review_body: We were very happy with our stay at Hyatt Place NYC Midtown. The location is excellent, with short walking distance to many things. It is located just next to Empire State Building and Macy's. The staff were very friendly and service-minded, both before and during our stay. We were taken care of by Ruben at the front desk, and he was providing excellent service and friendliness, much appreciated! We stayed with our two kids and can also confirm that the hotel is family friendly. Lastly, the complimentary breakfast is very good! We definately know where to stay next time we're in NYC! Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean, it is located in a good location, and the breakfast is wonderful. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. The views from the 26th floor are really nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It seems every hotel here has incredibly slow and inefficient check in. Hyatt or Hilton. Even with early on line checkiin..worthless, just an excuse to charge your cc. Early requests like feather free room never done. Crappy check in service. But staff nice. Rooms here clean and nice. Ironing board stained. Alot of noise from street. But they give ya earplugs, one set. Pillows stained under pillowcase.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Time Spent At The Hyatt Was A Disaster. There Was A Bug On The Bed Biting Me Up And iFinally Found It And Killed It. The Day We Arrived It Was Late Night And Still Had To Wait For Pillowcases To Arrive To The Room Also The Pillows Were Dirty And They Said They Didnt Have Any Additional Washclothes For The Weekend And Gave Me Hand Towels To WashUp With.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room is small and old. Lower floor have noise from street traffics. Good location and easy access to many spots. I am a Hyatt Globalist member and did not receive special treatments. Do not expect them to recognize Globalist at all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: the street noise often woke me up in the early morning. The ice machine broke and it did not fix during our 1 week stay at this hotel. However, the over all experience is good. The room is clean and morning breakfast provide good hot food and healthy fruits.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, friendly staff, excellent service and delicious breakfast. Definitely recommend this hotel. Great value for money. Stayed here for six nights and was close to Empire State Building and a ten minute walk to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is good hotel with great location. The rooftop terrace with a view of the Empire State Building was a pleasant surprise. Easy walking to a variety of sights as well as Subway stations. Nice basic hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Pretty generic hotel, no frills. Room size is adequate. The location is good for MSG events. The buffet breakfast closes at 9AM on weekdays which is not exactly convenient. The rooms was functional and clean. Not much more to speak of.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here 5 nights in June.Hotel is in a superb location,you can walk to a host of places of interest.Good bars and restaurants on the doorstep.Room was a good size and bed was super comfy.Staff were the epitome of helpfulness and courteous to a fault.Breakfast was varied and tasty and coffee facilities available all day.Viewing gallery on the 26th floor was a bonus to take a drink up and enjoy the views.Would not hesitate to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family of six stayed at this Hyatt Place Midtown South location for two nights in a double queen with queen sofa bed room. I was really happy that we got this particular room for our family because everyone got a bed to sleep in. Having six people in any one room can be a little cramped but we all did just fine here. Air conditioning was beautifully cold and beds were comfortable to climb into after a long hot day in the city. This location is a quick 5 min walk to Macy’s/H&M. Also close enough to walk to Times Square. Complimentary Breakfast at the Hyatt is very good, like restaurant quality food. Real eggs and sausage. Fresh yogurt with berries, hot oatmeal, all the juices you could want and of course their coffee is excellent. Lastly, with deep heartfelt appreciation, I want to thank the housekeeping staff who found my son’s watch and turned it in. This watch is very special to us because it belonged to my father who passed away. The watch had fallen under the sofa bed and we didn’t realize it was missing until 3 hours after we had checked out. We immediately called this Hyatt, they knew exactly where the watch was and when we arrived back to retrieve it, we were so relieved and happy that Hyatt staff was so honest and willing to help us on the spot. God bless all the staff at Hyatt Place Midtown South.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed comfortably in a 2 queen suite with Sofa bed in the lovely Hyatt Place. The property is in an excellent location to explore both uptown and downtown New York. Staff was very friendly and even helped out when our airport transport was late to pick us up. Breakfast was very good and everyone enjoyed their stay, even the kid allocated to the sofa bed :) Great place to stay in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Need top floors to enjoy sleep as there is a ton of traffic noise. Requested to move up floors after night 1 and experienced resistance. Location is good to Times Square but way to many people for me. Next visit I would stay north of Time Square as close to Central Park as possible as it is a short train ride anywhere. I would stay with Hyatt again but maybe not this location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff was excellent. Room was clean. Location is great. Close to everything. My family and I stay here twice a year and our experience has been consistent - excellent- Staff is always trying to please. Responsive to guest request. Breakfast is very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was in New York for an AIA Conference and had multiple locations to attend the Conference and Seminars. This was a central location to do that and I have been a World of Hyatt member for quite a while.So this was a logical choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I went to NYC on May 31 to June 3 and had a great time. However, during our stay a new Michael Kors purse that my wife purchased was removed from our room on Saturday June 2. We did not realize that it was gone until we were getting ready to catch our flight early Sunday morning. Apparently, the cleaning staff thought it was trash and it ended up in the lost and found. Unfortunately, none of the hotel staff made any effort to contact us regarding this error on their part. I even sent a lengthy email detailing our experience to Ms. Jemima Arcos (Front Office Manager) on June 4th as we thought the purse had been stolen. To this day (July 1) I have never received any response from Ms. Arcos. One would think that someone in management would make an effort to reach out to us with some sincerity and apologize and explain what happened as I provided both my email address and phone number. Nope. Nothing. My wife had to call the hotel several times before she found out what happened to her purse and it was finally sent to her. Absolutely terrible customer service by the management staff at this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We couldn’t have been happier with this facility. Staff was uniformly helpful, the breakfast options were what you’d get at a fine restaurant & the room perfect (especially the mattress). From the time you step inside and right into your room, everything was clean, crisp and of high quality. Price was moderate, the quality of the experience was worth much more.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice - great location - friendly staff and very nice room.Good Room - although a bit noisy but it is NYC! Easy access to everything. Wonderful breakfast. Comfortable bed. Everything went very smoothly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are in New York as a tourist, this hotel is at an excellent location - whether you want to go to Times Square or the theatres or down towards SoHo or up towards Central Park. The subway station is within walking distance and most places are a short cab ride away. The rooms are compact but comfortable. The complimentary breakfast spread is pretty good. On the minus side, there are only 2 lifts for this 23 storey building and that can sometimes lead to long waiting times in the lift lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed here several times and always found it convenient and with good service. But on my most recent trip I went up to the top floor terrace.This has tremendous Manhattan views, especially of the Empire State building a few blocks away. The best thing about the terrace is that it is an informal setup with couches and chairs, not a fancy bar setup with crowds like other NYC rooftop lounges. You can bring your own sandwich up there and get great vibes from the world's greatest city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good hotel, great welcoming front desk staff, nice big room 502 (on the back side of the hotel), no view at all.small lobby, free wifi through out your stay, in the room, in the lobby. Free fruits in the lobby for guest. free internet access on computers in the lobby for guests, free prints.breakfast area is not very big, so it is crowded during breakfast time, hotel have facility to keep your luggage for free (before check in, and after check out). staff very helpful for this.Hotel is walking distance from Time square (about 18 minutes)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room is very spacious compared to most of the hotels around. Good Complementary breakfast is served every morning. And specially the WiFi is with a better speed. Staff & front office team is very cooperative & friendly. Reasonably priced hotel near time square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very much enjoyed my stay. The front desk staff was welcoming and helpful every time I had a question. They told me about the terrace on the top floor which is definitely a must see. Nice workout area and great breakfast. They let you know best times to get breakfast in many different areas so I knew to go early. In comparison to other hotels in New York it was reasonably priced for the comfortable accommodations including a refrigerator in the room. Would definitely stay again if I come back to New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at this hotel with a friend for 3 days. It was a fantastic small hole with friendly welcome and great service. We loved the breakfasts and they were plentiful. My room was large with 2 king size beds and shower over bath. It overlooked Empire State Building

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel, great location, clean room and bathroom. Great view from bedroom view of skyscrapers. Helpful staff. Reception staff gave good directions for sightseeing. Great bvariety for breakfast. Some hot options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: 1. Benefits of Hyatt membership of given despite being an explorist.2. Dry cleaning cloths were misplaced and due to which were not sent for dry cleaning.3. The room provided considering I am an explorist member was very average.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: the odor in the room was bad. musty smell. uncomfortable mattress and sunken sofa. there was a fire bell that was loud and the front desk was not even aware what was going on. nice convenient location. close to the subway station and the ESB

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First location:great, I loved it stones throw from Fifth Avenue and we walked everywhere bar liberty cruises so central. Macy's around the corner, what more can I say!! Staff -amazingly helpful after been treated like crap at The Inn at Gracelands by a receptionist. They were just so well trained and professional. Hotel lobby comfortable but small. Breakfast from a European standard below par but I have never found a good American breakfast at a hotel. Room bigger than the normal New York three star but could do with a paint job and the couch though comfy needs recovered. The windows were filthy outside but hey pollution and New York and the logistics of window cleanings! It was like the photos but not as fresh, somewhat dreary and tired but the bed was comfy enough and the room very clean. Would I stay here again yes, if I got the room a little cheaper than what I paid but I have to say the location is fab. I would also know again to request a higher floor with a room to the back as the front is very noisy but I expected that and it did not bother me. Top marks on staffing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place for two nights, a family of 5. We had ordered a big family room but at the arrival we got 2 separate rooms. The next day we had to change to one bigger room. This changes went very smooth and everyone was happy. The breakfast was fine but the breakfast room was very narrow.I needed help with my reservation at United Airlines since the computer-voice on the phone did not understand my name or anything else I said ;) I asked Jonathan in the reception to help me and he did that with a big smile on his face. Thank you Jonathan! The Hyatt Place is very well located. There is a terrace on the top floor from where you can admire Empire State building and other monuments nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed in the Hyatt place new york midtown 6days.The hotel is situated nicely within walking distance of all the things to do.The rooms are small but big anough to give it a comfy feelingThey where clean and so was the hotel.The breakfast was included. Its was a nice start off the day.Mainly the standard stuff eggs pancakes fruits and cereals.We had a nice stay and would recommend this hotel to people who are visiting. New york.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff is very friendly and professional! Especially Jonathan and Justin are nice guys with a great sense of humor! The hotel is located on a great area with a lot of attractions near by. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Place for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay. Our room was clean and much larger than other NYC hotels we have previously stayed at. Our room had a king bed, spacious shower and bar fridge. Our room was located on the 21st floor, and we had a view of the street (sooo much better than a view of another wall!) however, the best view was on the 26th floor where there is an open rooftop space with spectacular views of the Empire State Building. This hotel is in a great location with easy subway access (one block) and offered a good range of hot and cold breakfast options, which was included in our room price.I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to family and friends on their next stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: 36th is a cross town street. If you are a light sleeper, you will be awoken at 4am by the traffic. Hotel was clean/comfortable and rooms were larger than many other nyc rooms. Hotel staff was accomadating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here three nights on business. The location is perfect for activities in the Broadway and Times Square area. Tons of restaurants nearby. Penn Station and Macy's are very close by. Staff was very efficient at check-in and check-out. I had a King room that had a mini fridge, sofa and desk. Plenty of room. The bathroom was ample and included a walk-in shower. The floor to ceiling windows were a nice touch.The subway entrance is just around the corner making it very convenient. The hotel serves a very nice complimentary breakfast buffet that is a cut above the usual fare. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Traveling with family for Mams 80th birthday. Holiday paid for since November. Reception refused holiday vouchers and would only accept credit card as security. Charged credit card 500 dollars every night and took hours of precious holiday time to sort issue each day. Would not facilitate late check out despite charges of 5000 dollars on credit card.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed four nights here with two kids. We had two beds and the sofa pullout. Rooms were small when the sofa was pulled out, but I think that is the norm for New York. The room seemed a little worn but was definitely clean which is most important for us. They offered free breakfast daily which was great. There were many choices available.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very close to subway station on 34th Street, this hotel has an optimal position if you decide to visit Manhattan.Some rooms has clear sight to the Empire State Building...beautiful, staff courteousness as well as room cleanliness are remarkable, beds are comfortable and breakfast choice is various, just the breakfast room is a bit small considering the amount of guests.Plenty of restaurants/diners/steakhouses nearby.Strongly suggested

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We chose to stay at a Hyatt Place because we knew what we would get - great service, attentive, enthusiastic staff, a fantastic hot breakfast, free wifi, microwave in the lobby, fridge in the room, and comfortable accommodations with room for the kids on the pull out couch.The location is in the middle Manhattan, South of Times Square, about 1 mile from a lot of major attractions, 1.5 blocks from a subway entrance, and my favorite, 1 block from the massive Macy's store. If you have stayed at a Hyatt Place before, then the rooms are definitely smaller, but well, it is NY! A surprise gem was the 26th floor terrace - gorgeous views of the Empire State Building and a peaceful place to read a book with a cup of Starbuck's coffee or glass of wine (both sold in the lobby).Thanks to tripadvisor reviews, we requested a room on the 2nd floor. There are 6-7 rooms on 26 floors - it was a huge time saver to take the stairs instead of waiting on the elevator.There were plenty of places to eat nearby - our favorite was Habaneros Mexican.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: memorial weekend ruined by a lot of troubles caused by the Hyatt hotel.First we arrive with a pre-paid reservation - Saturday 26th - for a room with two queen beds for 5 person and they told us they have just a room with ONE queen bed !!!!!! How we can stay in 5 !???? after some argumentation they "find' two rooms , but telling us we need to make a change the day after for the original "2 beds" rooms that will be free Sunday night !!but during the night my credit card alert warn me that HYATT debit 420$.I jump down immediately and the HOTEL manager ( mr Justin) was not able to refund the credit and ask me to wait until the check out.At check out they grant me the refund will be done ....... today I receive just a partial refund ( they keep 30 $ ) ???!!!In all honesty , never happened something similar !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: When I stayed at the Hyatt I went with my son. The Hyatt is a great place of town and at a great price. The only downside is the fact that there elevators are very slow. But we got a view of the Empire State Building and we were on the 22nd floor. If you are going to stay there I suggest that you ask for a room on a higher floor so you can block out the street noise. The staff was very friendly and they would always get my son a warmed up chocolate chip cookie. This hotel is very good I loved New York but the hotel made it just so much better. I do recommend this hotel and you should book it right away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very unprofessional...i booked an Pay via Hotels.com.Hyatt staff give a wrong room ( one bed instead of 2) , trying to push to accept, than charge one room payment (440$) on my credit card without notice.... when asked to refund, i wait so long for an answer....still waiting ( hope Amex will bring good news).Location is great.... probably Hyatt do not care if you want to return.I will not for sure.... if you have reservations be aware and check Credit Card.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After recently staying at the Hilton Garden Inn on 42nd Street by Times Square I wondered if I would like the Hyatt Place at 36th St. I was pleasantly surprised. The location in midtown is almost as convenient and the room was larger. Also, there is a small casual restaurant next to the hotel that sells snacks, soft drinks, etc... which is open early and late. And, there is a subway stop just around the corner. In addition the complimentary breakfast was one of the best that I have had at a hotel in recent memory. Eggs, meat, a different entre each day and fresh fruit accompanied all of the "regular" items that are ordinarily on a buffet. The only problem was the buffet became crowded at peak times. I also found the staff friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good people and very comfortable for all. I would recommend it anytime. Best Free Breakfast I have EVER had in a hotel! I would stay here again the next time I visit New York. Location in NYC is everything and this is very comfortable and convenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place - Midtown South is close to our cruise port, Times Square, Broadway and all of the sites we wanted to see. The hotel is clean, the staff was exceptional and truly made you feel welcome.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt staff cannot be topped. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Eddie at the front desk, especially, made my son and me feel like royalty. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Safe and clean with friendly staff, great location , awesome pub across the street called the Keg Room, Starbucks and the subway stop are around the corner, Free breakfast could use some improvement and if you are looking for a view make sure you choose a room on a higher floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is great for everything you need to do. The hotel room was comfortable clean and spacious every person that I came in contact with at this hotel is friendly polite and greeted me. Breakfast was great ... all around a great stay. Even on a foggy day still a great view!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great hotel. It is a very large hotel and a very busy hotel!!! The room was clean and of average size. If the hotel is at full occupancy the lobby can get very crowded and loud. Also, you may have to stand in line to use the elevators when crowed. This was the worse part of staying at the hotel.I liked that the lobby had a couple of different places to grab a bite to eat and relax. We had checked out of the hotel and we had to wait about an hour before going to the airport. They have a comfortable section where you can buy a snack, water or coffee and relax. Plus, the coffee and snacks were pretty tasty!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place for 4 nights and we were really impressed with its location and the standard of the rooms for a reasonably low price in comparison to most NY hotels! It's only a 10 minute walk to Time Square, 5 minutes to Macy's and 5 minutes to the Empire State Building! Our room was large with two queen size beds, a sofa, mini bar, desk, bathroom and an incredible view of the whole of the empire state building! It was great to have breakfast included and we found that the selection of foods on offer changed most days and we always found it tasty, if not sometimes a little cold but this usually happens when it is a buffet style.Overall we were very impressed with our stay and would recommend it to anyone!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place in NYC is not the same as a Hyatt Place outside NYC. The rooms are small, hotel is very basic. This is in a nice location on a side street. Just outside Time Square (so you don't have all the noise and lights when you are ready to go to sleep) and central to everything. The hotel is a basic three star property. Nothing really negative but nothing positive either - it serves its purpose. If you get a good price, there is no reason not to stay there but there a lot of other options in the same hotel category that offer a little more.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is nice clean and well located. The service is just right . The only problem is the breakfast so I’m not sure whether to recommend it. I guess it was good price - value balance and mostly it was good to have a breakfast in the hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Me and my wife visited New York for 6 days sight seeing and stayed in Sheraton Tribica(Review for this hotel already submitted on trip adviser) then we traveled to Cancun and on our return we stayed at the Hyatt Place and we liked the hotel it is conveniently placed within the vicinity of many bars and restaurants,Also a 20 minute walk to broadway and 5 minute walk to Macy’s,There’s also a shake shack a 2 minute walk away.Our stay was 2 nights the only issue was that there was major works going on a building opposite the hotel which was noisy during the night,Check in was good and the staff were all pleasant there is a small bar at the in the hotel and an area where you can get tea and coffee throughout the day and evening,Breakfast was nice there were cold and hot options which was better than the Sheraton tribica breakfast.Did not use the roof terrace as there was work going on.If we returned to New York we would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Love the complimentary breakfast, and it's not just a continental but full blown hot AND cold. Love how they mix up the breakfast menu and the coffee/tea bar. It's cafeteria style. Jonathan was amazing at check-in. He accommodated all of my requests - asking for higher floor (because it's quiet) and facing preferably West or North. I will definitely stay here again on my next business/personal trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is walking distance from Penn Station and Times Square, and is a good place to stay if you're planning to attend the theater or a Broadway show. The rooms are smallish but this is not surprising for the location. Staff is very helpful in providing information to navigate the city. I would have given this hotel a rating of five (excellent) if its breakfast offering of fruit was improved: the fruits are soggy and lie on a watery bed, and the juices taste over diluted with water.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Along West 36th Street, the hotel is set back so that there is comfortable sitting area with nice landscaping in front of the hotel. You will see the Hyatt Place name and logo when you are directly in front of the place or driving by. If you are being dropped off at the hotel, beware that it might be easy to miss. Adjacent to the Hyatt Place hotel, there are two other hotels built right up to the sidewalk.There are over 25 floors in the hotel. There is a beautiful rooftop bar terrace. We went in early-April and it was still cold (40-45 degrees) so the bar was closed for the season, but you can bring your own drinks and enjoy the living space. The city view is very nice of the buildings during the daytime and sparking lights of buildings at night (rooftop doors are locked at 11:00pm). The upper floors have views of adjacent building rooftops. I like this view compare to lower floors where you might be looking into the next building windows. (This is New York city landscape - rooftop or windows) Note: Elevators tend to be busy and crowded during peak morning hours....if you are in the middle floors, ride up and then back down. It is a nice way to meet the fellow visitors. This hotel appears popular with overseas visitors. While I was in the elevator, lobby sitting area, or in breakfast area, I heard at least four different languages. Sometimes, we traded tips on where to eat, what to see, and what to do. The compliment breakfast tends to be hearty and adequate. Fresh juices - orange, apples, or pineapple; milk- regular, 2%, non-fat; hot and cold box cereals are available; fresh fruits - oranges and apples; fruit bowl; Greek and regular yogurt; hot scramble eggs and meat (rotates every day -- sausage, sausage patty, or bacon); waffles; bread - white, wheat, rye, and bagels; and hot tea or coffee. Hot tea and coffee available all day. I enjoy drinking their coffee. When I come back from all day outing, I stop by for a cup of coffee to bring up to my room, (I am a regular coffee drinker every day at home - drip brew or on the go - chain cafes)Our room on the 25th floor was well decorated, nice room colors, clean and bright with the sunlight coming in. There were good space to walk around the bed without bumping into each other. The shower stall was large and roomy....I didn't touch the walls if I dropped by soap bar. I also enjoyed looking at the building rooftops and taller buildings over in the next block. This hotel is well located in mid-town New York. It is right in the middle of the shopping district. Macy is one block away. Victoria Secret, H&M, Forever 21, and Target are 6-minute walk away. (I have been to NYC seven times; this time we skipped the Broadway shows and stay Midtown to be different) I really like the Hyatt Place location. Only 3-minute walk to Herald Square subway station and 6-minute walk to Greeley Square subway station. Only 7-minute walk to Koreatown where there are over 30 restaurants, cafes, and bars. Several restaurants are open 24 hours a day. (nice if you are arriving in town late at night)Shopping all day and Eating all day and night. I am coming back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very pleasant and accommodating staff. I enjoyed our entire stay. The breakfast was really tasty and more than the continental fare. Hot food and plentiful. Staff was so helpful from fixing room mix up, giving directions, arranging car service, etc. The location was ideal as it was close to everything without being close to everything. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms are very clean, well maintained and very comfortable. The staff is caring and have a wealth of knowledge and recommendations for restaurants and events in the area. The hotel is centrally located and one block away from the subway lines. Great experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Central location and short walk to subway (34th St/Herald Sq station). Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. One evening, we bought wine in the lobby and brought it up to the 26th floor observation deck, which has a great view of Empire State Building, which is only 2 blocks away. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location, nice room, clean and comfortable facilities, aceptable breakfast, nice people at the front desk. For my business trip to the big Apple it was a wise decision. Everything that I requested was satisfied. I surely will come back next time

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff were great. Very respectful and helpful on every front. The room was quiet and comfortable. We did not eat breakfast there, but it seemed like a nice spread. I would certainly stay there again, as it was convenient to our destinations of choice within NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Always a comfortable stay at a Hyatt Place, this one is a great location. Close to subways, 5th Ave., Times Square. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was good. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Purpose of business was for travel and overall stayed in this hotel for about two weeks. Overall staff were friendly and helpful when needed but also gave me a lot of space. My favorite staff was housekeeper Elizabeth – she is such a joy, please give my thanks to her for her hospitality, I always look forward to greeting her in the morning. The hotel was also accommodating of a request to change rooms, as the room that I was initially assigned to was on a lower floor, which wouldn’t work. As a business traveller, it is important to have a guaranteed space in the elevator as it gets very packed particularly during the morning rush hour. I always return to this hotel as I like its convenient proximity to transport, dining, and entertainment, but will have second thoughts after a recent encounter.I think that the hotel could improve on communication. We intended to extend our reservation by half a day but were left confused as various staff provided us with differing accounts on pricing, process and timing. We decided to book the extension anyway as we needed it to accommodate our flight timing. We were clear to communicate to the staff that we had a late flight so a paid extension would put us in the ideal situation. To cut the long story short, instead of being checked out, we ended up getting kicked out on checkout day as “the hotel was full”. We were given a 15 min grace period to move our stuff or risk being charged an extra day despite the hotel being “full” (which I assume means that were paying guest next in line). While we were not looking to play the blame-game as there was clearly a miscommunication, the manager on duty had failed to take ownership of the situation and instead left us in the lurch. It was already difficult on us to be taken by surprise but we felt more intimidated by the manager who was extremely defensive and spoke to us with a obey-my-policy-or-be-at-my-mercy tone. When we were a foot out of the door, the manager called us back to let us know that a reservation was cancelled and we were at liberty to book it for an extra day if we preferred. This was in my opinion a slap to the face after the inconvenience and unpleasantries and all the more affirmed my view that we were forever at their mercy.thank you Hyatt Place, it's been a great couple of years, but I think I will be moving on from here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel location was amazing. It was close to all major attraction and the subway, which made things easier to get to. However, the food was not great and the beds were horrible. I don't know if I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a well located beautiful hotel, very close to the 34 St. metro station and the Macy's. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The view above the 20th floor is magnificent and the layout of the room with the glass only façade gives you a wonderful portrait when you wake up. The room is equipped with mini fridge and filter coffee machine. Bathroom is spacious. Housekeeping does a great job on cleaning the room. On the loby there were 2 dedicated desks with online computers and one printer for the guests to print their seightseing tickets, boarding passes etc. On the downside, it was the breakfast which was average and not to our taste and there were not many options (possibly a tray with ham and cheese would easily make things better). Surely I would stay again there but I would choose not to take the breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was extremely pleased with the location, service and room at the Hyatt Place Midtown South. The room was not large, but very clean and functional. The location was great. This hotel is easy to get in and out of. Being close to Penn station is a plus, especially if you fly in and out of Newark Airport so you can take the NJ Transit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is in a great location in Midtown. The rooms are spacious and clean, and, unlike many other hotels in NYC, have a small kettle and a selections of tea and coffee. The staff is very friendly and a ready to help. The breakfast is great. Good selection if cold and hot items, fruit, pastries etc. The doors of the rooms are very close to each other, so you will hear people going in and out. On each floor only two rooms are far enough from the lift. The major problem is the fact that most of the rooms have their windows onto a noisy street, with a large bar just opposite. So make sure that you are given the highest floor possible, or you won’t be able to sleep without earplugs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel Team was nothing short of Outstanding. Everyone we came in contact with was helpful, knowledgeable,caring and friendly. Rooms were small (its NYC after all) but very clean and well equipped. Location is excellent for sightseeing and shopping. Breakfast is much better than expected.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall, I had a good stay at the Hyatt Place. Check-in was the only truly disappointing part of my stay. That is because I booked an accessible room and it was not ready when I tried checking in at 3:30 in the afternoon. Apparently, the prior guest broke the blinds and they needed to be fixed. But considering I had tried to check in early (I arrived in the city about 10:30 AM), I thought they should have been aware that I wanted to check in and should have been on the issue first thing. Unfortunately, we didn't actually get into the room until about 4:30 PM. One bright spot was that David had the intelligence to offer us a little something for the wait, so we each got a drink on the hotel. :)Having said all of that, the rest of my stay here was good. The staff was very friendly, the breakfasts were really good with lots of choices (eggs, waffles, toast, cereal, oatmeal, etc...), and the room was decent. Some stains here and there on the floor and couch, but otherwise clean and the accessible room was a nice size.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel. What ca you say then? Well extremley nice and helpful staff. A really nice breakfast bufe. Not that common in the US. Really nice position on Manhattan, close to Times Square, Macys, Empire State and a lot of other must visit places. Rooms a little smaller than expected but nice bed and as we got a room on the 23 rd floor really quiet beeing NY. Recommended in every aspect if your not going to spend your stay in NY in the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: No AC had to sleep with window open for two days.No sleep from all the horns and sirens going off. Phone didn't work either. Staff was very nice and facility was clean. Rooms to small for a family of five with luggage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms were very clean. Staff was friendly. Location is awesome. Good value for our money. Surroundings are safe. Easy to get anywere. All is in walking distance. Metro closeby. A lot of food around

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a frequent guest at the Hyatt Place in Santiago, Chile- a hotel which I really like so I thought I'd stay at this property on my trip to NYC in April 2018. This hotel comes nowhere near to touching the heals of it's Santiago sister....but different cities means different prices, spaces etc.Let's get the bad out of the way first.- The rooms are on the tiny side and storage space is, well, awful (a closet with only enough space for 5 coat hangers and some drawers).- the hotel feels run-down (no surprise when you see the immense traffic flow through this hotel on a daily basis)- the hotel has ridiculous breakfast hours (ends at 9 on weekdays and 10 on weekends). For a hotel that goes after leisure guests, these times seem ludicrous. The cynic in me says this is done on purpose.....as the hotel hopes that people might not even bother.- those who do bother to come down pretty much all arrive in the final 45 mins......which leads to massive queues and nowhere to sit- the breakfast is touch and go, but all in all, not half bad (though I wish they'd come up with an option to offer guests an alternative to eco-killing disposable cups for coffee)- the hotel needs some new towels!- at around 370 USD a night, this was not a cheap hotel The good:- the bed is super comfy and the linen is actually quite nice- ALL of the staff I spoke with were incredibly helpful and attentive- the hotel's location is absolutely excellent (the Empire State Building is, quite literally, on top of you!). Most major sites are very close by with even the far away sites (WTC) only taking some 15-20 mins in an Uber- a snack bar is open 24/7- the hotel has some outdoor space on the ground floor at the front-handy for us smokers!- The WiFi is free and very speedy- The OnDemand Movie service is loaded with incredibly recent films Would I come back? Actually, yes.......but would be more tempted if on a vacation than for work (on vacation you are likely to want/need to spend more time outside of your room exploring and less time....working!).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We are a family of 4 and stayed for 5 nights in room 1503 an accessible room which was very spacious, had two queen beds, fridge, sofa and a view of the Empire State Building. The hotel is close to the metro and in walking distance of Times Square (15 mins). The hotel staff were very helpful especially Brandon, Andres and Jenny who helped us with general information, directions, printing tickets etc. The free breakfast is good with cereals,fruit, waffles,and a small selection of hot food, but gets very busy after 8am and has limited seating, We had a fantastic time in New York and thoroughly recommend this hotel as you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We came to Hyatt Place Midtown from Florida and checked in on 4/27. The service was spectacular. The front desk got us a room right away and we were in our rooms shortly after. Based on my membership status, he offered us a couple of waters a day for our 4 night stay. I obtained the waters with no problem for the first 2 nights. On 4/29 however, I casually asked for the waters on the way up to my room and the lady at the front desk questioned it and proceeded to look up information in the computer. I didn't get her name but she very well might have been the manager. It was around 5 pm on the 29th of April. After looking up my information, she explained to me how I was not supposed to be getting the waters and that because of the miss communication, she will give them to me. I was caught a little off guard since we were wasting time talking about $2 Aquafina bottles. At that point I responded by asking her to keep the water bottles. I did not appreciate the attitude by the employee because of something small like this. I have been using Hyatt Hotels for a long time and most of the time they go above and beyond for customer satisfaction. But this wasn't the case. I am disappointed how this was handled. Keep in mind, the water bottles were originally offered by the Hotel. Other than the encounter with this particular employee, it was fine.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 5 nights as a family of 4. Our original booking was for a smaller room, but we were upgraded by the front desk to 2 Queens with a view of the Empire State Building. I used a combination of free nights with Hyatt Points and confirmed everything with Hyatt to make sure that when we arrived everything would be seamless. Obviously, if you book each night differently, their system doesn't initially see it, so I received a call the next morning telling me that I needed to move to another room. After a few conversations with the morning staff, we finally sorted it out as he was unaware of the "multiple bookings" into one reservation; however, this gentleman decided he would school me on how I should properly book my Hyatt stays in the future (this person really needed to have his manners checked). That was the only hiccup.The rest of the staff were extremely helpful and polite. Breakfast was crowded and fortunately we were able to find seating for 4. The dining room is super tight and very difficult to pass thru, but it's NYC so hotel space is limited. Our room and additional space were so welcomed after being out in the city all day. My only issue was the A/C unit was very finicky and not easy to use. I think the thermostat had a mind of it's own because I kept changing the temp and it would never change. I asked the front desk to take a look at it, but I'm not sure they got around to it. We received 2 bottled waters every day complimentary.This location cannot be beat. I am so glad I picked this over the Hyatt Centric as it was more convenient to be away from Times Square and have easier access to the subway system. If we're ever back in the area, we will not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place Midtown for our girl's trip of 13 girls. It was close to everything. We walked a few blocks to Times Square to pick up all tours. The hotel staff was nice and accommodating to our needs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Thank God I checked before traveling into the city. A mistake was made during booking, but I was able to rectify the issue before check in. Hopefully in the future, the world of hyatt customer service is better informed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel in prime location right by Herolds Square, MSG, Empire State Building and K-Town. Staff was very nice and welcoming. Rooms were clean and quiet with a nice view. Breakfast was good and plenty.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent stay at the Hyatt. Warm welcome with quick and very accommodating service overall. Very clean room, warm shower, and was very quiet where I stayed on the 12th floor. The breakfast had many choices for all tastes. I fully appreciated my stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was little a bit small for 5 guys, there was not enough closet space for clothes. Views from our room was very nice (22nd floor)Room was quiet and tidy. Special thanks for cleaning lady's in our floor.Breakfast was ok, basic but good.Location is great, near to subway station and Times square. If your requirement is location and reasonable price, this is your hotel. Good value for money. 8/10

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We booked a Double Queen room with Sofabed for our family of 5 for a week recently. This hotel has a wonderful location, The staff were wonderful, even accommodating a later checkout on the day we left! They had free hot breakfast which was such a money saver. We also took advantage of the free printing in the lobby to get our boarding passes. The room was comfortable with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. The hotel also has a terrace on the top floor which would be amazing in the summer to sit outside, but we went up there everyday and looked at the wonderful view. The 34th St Herald Square subway station is around the corner with access to anywhere you want to go! We will definitely stay again when we are in the city and recommend to others as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Surprisingly spacious room. Included full hot breakfast. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely book at this hotel again without hesitation. Location was superb and located close to subways.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our family of 6 while visiting Manhattan on vacation. The room had an excellent view of the Empire State Building and was within walking to so many things like Broadway, Times Square, the Rockefeller Center and much more. The two doubles and sleeper sofa worked well for 2 adults and 4 kids. The staff were great, also.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for a recent getaway and was very satisfied with the comfort of the room and convenient location. The breakfast is included in the room rate and was very good, offering hot selections (eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes etc) as well as fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc. The location is close to Times Sq (15 minutes brisk walk, 7-8 blocks) and Herald Sq (2 blocks.) The king sized bed was quite comfortable and the room and hotel in general were clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have just returned here from this hotel. Turned up knackered to find there was no record of our booking which was made 6 months prior and even had a confirmation email 2 days before we left. So were left waiting til this was rectified for 15 minutes. I requested a room with a view as it was my birthday whilst we were there. When we eventually got to our room you couldn't really see well out the windows as there was obviously film between the panes of glass which had bubbled up and ruined what we could see Gutted at this as it was my partners 1st time in NY and being my birthday I'd hoped for something a bit better. Breakfast is included and always a good choice. Staff are very friendly and rooms are a great size though.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Be careful when making a reservation with the Hyatt through Expedia, because although they have the possibility of free cancellation, they can debit the value of a day of stay. In my case I canceled the reservation one week before the deadline without any cost, confirming Expedia that the cancellation had no charge and nevertheless they charged me the one day of stay. Despite all the claims made, I never received the amount charged. Especially Expedia, on the last claim of February 7, informed me that despite their efforts Hyatt refused to return the amount.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect place to stay at for a holiday and for a family visiting the first time, the staff is very accommodating to help visitors find their way through the area.You can see and take pictures of Empire State Building from hotel terrace which is behind this hotel. The breakfast is also so good and many variety.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I went to NYC to celebrate his birthday and stayed 2 nights in the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable but lacked normal amenities such as a shower cap! A good breakfast was included in the rate, and well worth it. The location was great—we walked or took the subway, easily accessible, everywhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: was given the key to the room of an existing guest and i entered the room without knowing that - only to be abused by the guest staying there. I had checked in at 7 am after a red eye that got delayed only to experience easily such a terrible check in experience. I was astonished at the carelessness of the front desk - jonathan was his name.To top it all, the breakfast area was crowded with no space between rows to wade across and sit in your table. I would like a full refund of the day's rent as the experience was far from satisfactory

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was corner room. Very happy with it. Staff attentive and helpful. Breakfast was excellent. Location fantastic. Price very good. Not a fancy hotel, but the standard was well above budget hotel. Very safe, quick lifts even to the highest floors. Would recommend to others. Free wifi.Please, put real tea in the rooms - decaf is NOT tea!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a nice little hotel in a great location with a friendly staff for a reasonable price. The room is small but comfy for two people. It is updated and nicely appointed with a King Bed, small built in night stands, a dresser, charging port and good lighting. There's a TV, small desk and couch, compact fridge and coffee maker. The bathroom ( in our room) has a walk in shower (no tub), and plenty of towels.Everything is compact but has everything you really need. The free breakfast has the basics...coffee, some eggs, cereals, juice, breads and fruit. Decent restaurants and bars are right next door. Walking distance to Madison Square Garden and Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I asked for a high floor quiet room and spent three of the quietest nights in Manhattan that are possible. It was delightful. Everybody that worked there was super nice and friendly too. From the housekeeping to the front desk. I like the midtown location giving good access to downtown uptown and a lot of trains. It's not the Best neighborhood in Manhattan or anything but the convenience can't be beat. Hotel also has a complementary breakfast that's pretty varied and decent and the coffee is good too. Room is a good size for Manhattan too. It's not the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in but it was fine. I also left an item in the room and the hotel actually found it and sent it to me. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and left a lot of things behind and getting them back is not always easy so many extra points for this.I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The look and field of the hotel is average, staff are friendly. Rooms can be slightly noisy if you are facing the streets and not up in floors 10 and above. The pluses of this hotel are the location near Herald Square and complimentary breakfast (which had all the basics and even fairly decent on some days depending on the menu). Overall, I wasn't wowed but I am satisfied that I stayed with Hyatt Place for this business trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a wonderful hotel! The room was clean and comfortable ( we had 6 people in our party) and the breakfasts were absolutely delicious! Definitely something for everyone. Great location as well! We were right around the corner from Macy's and within walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and many other attractions. Cute pubs, delis, and pubs just doors away. The price was also very reasonable for New York David at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. We had a great experience here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A great spot to stay in New York. Room was not huge, but well appointed, modern and had a sofa and small desk, so all the things needed. Good price and very central so could walk too many attractions or close too the subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I regularly travel to NY for business but I’m writing this review from the perspective of a tourist not a business traveler because that’s the customer this hotel is designed for. In that sense, the Hyatt knocks it out of the park.The Hotel - attractive hotel with ample lobby seating and even small front patio. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The bed and furnishings looked newer than most I’ve seen in NYC hotels. I found the refrigerator to be too loud so I unplugged it. Problem solved. I stayed on a high floor so the street noise was subdued. The front desk staff are very friendly, helpful, and quick. Check out took less than a minute. I usually scoff at “breakfast included” marketing, but the food was quite good. The buffet is in a well-spaced area so you don’t feel like someone is constantly standing in your way, and the choices will satisfy most visitors: cereal, oatmeal, bagels, toast, eggs, French toast, fruit, and bacon. The coffee is hot & robust- just as you’d expect in NYC. Finally the location is ideal for someone looking to get the most out of their visit to The City. It’s walking distance from Penn Station, a couple blocks from a main shopping area, and close to many subway lines. Would I return for a business trip? Probably not. However, I would return for a fun trip to NYC. I’d also recommend it to others in this regard. It’s a 1st rate budget hotel without the budget feel (smelly cleansers, bad food, lumpy bed, paper-thin walls). The Hyatt gets inexpensive travel right!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Always a great experience and the staff is wonderful. We always stay for a special occasion and it is in walking distance to a restaurant we love. I do prefer the rooms in the back of the hotel due to it is quiet

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Me and my family stayed here for 1 week at the beginning of January. This hotel did not disappoint. We arrived early evening, check in was swift and the staff were informative and told us, we were allocated a room on the 5th floor but we could change the next day for a higher floor if we wished. Which I thought was a nice gesture!! But we dropped our bags and kept the room we were given it was spacious and both the beds were massive not to mention so comfortable which is just what you need after a day of sightseeing.Breakfast was included and again surprisingly good and it varied a little from day to day. The dining hall was compact but we always managed to get a seat no problem.The hotel was spotless always someone cleaning and keeping the place looking tip top. But for me the front of house staff are a fantastic friendly bunch who took time to say hello and ask about your day. As well as point us in the direction of some hidden treasures in the city that only a New Yorker would know we're there! Andreas was a particular charming chap very good at his job! This hotel is ideally located on a quiet midtown street. Not many sirens or honking car horns like you hear a few streets up! Grand central station a short walk one direction and the Empire State Building a short walk away in the other direction.The Roof terrace is a real bonus with amazing views. The top and bottom of reviews are would you stay here again and the answer is definitely a yes!! And I'd recommend to all my family and friends visiting the city aswell!! Thank you Hyatt we had a wonderful time

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice rooms Breakfast was nice many different things to choose fromGreat staff Lovely wiey from the rooftopThere is also a good place to sit outside in the front of the hotel Close to everything Many good restaurants in the area

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Have stayed at numerous hotels in NY in the 4-5 star rangeAt the end of 6 week holiday, currently staying here for 4 days.Great convenient location, a street away from Macys, 5th avenue etcStaff friendly and welcoming..... rooms are fine and great breaky is included in the price. Service is goodWould stay againGreat hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was clean and big enough and comfortable. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The breakfast is a disaster as it finishes at 9am weekdays and 10am at the weekend. Therefore it is absolutely packed at 8.30am weekdays and 9.30am weekends. This problem would be resolved if they extended their finishing time by 1 hour. Even for people sightseeing it is way to early to be up on your holidays and as the breakfast is included most people want the value for the money they've spent. I went to breakfast once in 4 days because on the first day while carrying a very hot cup of tea another guest bumped into me (it was not his fault it was because of the large volume of people in the small breakfast room) and my wrist was scalded. The member of staff got me ice and an ice pack but when I asked for burn gel they had none. I went to the pharmacy straight away and got some so this saved the burn blistering. The staff member was very nice and helpful but I can't understand why a big hotel like this does not have burn gel for instances like this. So although your stay includeds breakfast I wouldnt count on it. There is a PAX deli around the corner which is perfect for breakfast although it's not free but at least you can take your time in the morning. Overall it was a good hotel and good value for money and I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at this place during one my official visits. The hotel is located at a very prime place and located very near to my office at Empire State. Complimentary breakfast is served and is very good. The staff is also very cordial and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Can't really fault this hotel in any way. The location is great for pretty much anywhere you want to go in NYC, either walking or via subway. Rooms were nice, staff on desk were friendly at check-in, there's a viewing platform on the 26th floor and the fact that breakfast is included is a huge bonus. There is sometimes a wait for a seat at busy times, but never too long. (The only thing I'll say is that I wish there was more of a choice for vegetarians when it came to hot food. Just eggs and waffles most mornings - which was fine, but I think the promo material on the website is a little misleading.) Overall, I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here with family over the New Year period. I chose the hotel because of its location. Relatively close to Times Square, good transport links close by (34th Street/Herald Square subway). It was a good choice. The rooms were an OK size for New York. We managed to get four people into ours with not too much difficulty. The view was fantastic, staring at the Empire State Building just two blocks away. Front desk staff were very friendly and questions/assistance offerred promptly. We had two minor issues that required maintenance to help during our stay. Both were addressed very quickly and satisfactorily.New York was a bit crazy given the time of year. People everywhere, however we found the hotel to be a bit of a quiet sanctary, even though it was full. Breakfast was the only time the place seemed full on. Get down early to get a table. Great that breakfast was included, basic selection, but satisfied hunger pangs. Eating in NYC is not cheap so to have an included meal was good.As noted by others, waiting for elevators (lifts) can be a bit of a pain. Only two for a 27 storey building. if you are on a lower floor use the stairs as quicker than waiting. We had no choice but to wait as on 17. This however is the only negative I can think of. I would stay here again. Good beds, good service, great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel have a great location in New York City with many subway near and several attractions within walking distance. The breakfast is very good and the mini market have all the things that you can need for a wonderful stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booked in May to stay at this hotel in December 2017. We were doing a cruise from New York so stayed at another hotel for 4 nights, a 2 week cruise then a further 2 nights in New York. Booked through booking.com paying slightly extra as we were paying the hotel on arrival and there was no payment due before check in. Night before we were due to arrive we received an email stating our reservation had been cancelled. I emailed the hotel and asked them why they had cancelled our booking, to be advised it was due to non payment. I use a debit card specially for international payments that I transfer money into from my current account and as the payment wasn’t due until arrival at the hotel I had not transferred money to that card. I then transferred the full amount to the card and advised the hotel via email, who didn’t reply for 2 days. By that time I had already managed to book the hotel we had previously stayed in for 4 nights at the start of our holiday the hotel @ Times Square for £120 (approx $150) less than this hotel was charging. Would never book this hotel again it ruined the last night of my cruise.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good hotel with just the right amenities at the price point for a room night. true to it;s 3.5 stars rating ( really good). In the heart of NYC , giving easy access to major attractions of NYC. ( walking distance , even in the cold winter - Macy's / Empire State Bldg/ Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for five days in December 2017. Location is perfect, a short walk from Herald Square (Macy's), Penn Station, Bryant Park and only a few minutes to Times Square. Plenty of subway stations located nearby.Rooms are great. Maybe not chic like a boutique hotel, but roomy (by NY standards) and very comfortable. We had a "city view", looking north from the 23rd floor. Loved the rooftops, they looked like a stage set of old NY.Daily breakfast is quite good, with a selection of eggs, waffles, pancakes (they change daily), cereals, fruits, etc. Gets crowded on weekends though. The small deli next door also has a good breakfast for under $10 if you miss the free one in the hotel.Staff is FIRST RATE. Super friendly and helpful, they all went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect.There is no doubt we'll be staying here again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hyatt Place has a very helpful and friendly staff. The location on 36th St. is safe and near a subway. The room was excellent and quiet. The breakfast offers variety of hot and cold items. I would return to this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We like staying in this area, a few blocks from Penn Station. This hotel was the best one we've found so far. For NYC the rooms are nice-sized, with a sofa and desk as well as king-sized bed. Only a few rooms per floor so the room was quiet. The lobby is fairly spacious with seating areas.The free breakfast was over at 9 on week days but plenty of cheap cafes are in the same block. Several subway lines are steps away and Amtrak is a short walk. Although the location is busy, 36th street is very quiet and safe.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I love this hotel. It's a great location, modern room, helpful staff and a lovely complementary breakfast. I've stayed here in the past and plan on returning next year. I have stayed at other Hyatt Hotels in Philadelphia, Washington and NYC. This is a top shelf company that prides itself in excellence. I will always stay at a Hyatt Hotel when I travel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was in a great location - next to Macy's Hearld Sqaure, and short walk to Times Sqaure and Bryant Park. The hotel was clean, and the staff, especially the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was adequate, although I found it strange, and honestly a bit off putting to have to clear my own dirty breakfast dishes from the table !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was very small for Hyatt Place standards. Housekeeping was hit or miss. We had to steal towels and toilet paper off cart so that we had enough. They never placed enough in room. Went down for breakfast one day (1 hour) prior to end of breakfast hour and literally everything was empty and it didn’t appear that they were going to refill any of it. Didn’t try again. Rooms were clean. We rented a room for 5 people and it was certainly not big enough for 5 people. This room had 2 queens and a sleeper sofa but they were piled on top of one another. There was no floor space. There was one tiny dresser. Not what we are used to for Hyatt Place

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stay elsewhere. The front staff is nice but management fails to follow through. The room had issues, and while the staff attempted to fix, the manager snubbed her nose at my request for a reasonable discount, and then copied all other staff not to help me out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Arrived at 12:30 and was able to check in early. Beds and pillows were very comfy. Slept like a baby the entire time I was there! Spacious room for NYC. We had 2 queens beds with sleeper sofa which worked out great for two teenage boys (14 & 19). Had fabulous view of ESB. Location is excellent. Keen’s Steakhouse is right down from hotel. Several deli’s close to the hotel. And McDonalds is also down the street which was a plus for my picky 14 year old. Subway station close too. It’s right down from McDonald’s. Macy’s, Herald Square and several other places to shop nearby. Only ate breakfast once. It was fine. Pretty good selection just crowded. Hotel has a terrace on the 26th floor open from 10am-10pm. Nice views of the city. Elevator is slow but it was no big deal. Hotel staff arranged for car service to the airport which was a plus. We were a little leery of using Uber because we had to leave at 4:45am.Highly recommend using car service. Our driver was a super nice guy. Housekeeping staff were great also. So nice to come into a nice clean room after a day of exploring in the city. Will definitely stay here again in the future!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: staff is terrificcheck in easycheck out easygreat breakfastgood location...this is Manhattan where location is important. You can walk to just about any area in the city from this hotel.Staff makes it a nice place to stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Few times in this industry I felt my money to have so much value as I felt in this humble but good New York City hotel.It has two major but excusable flaws 1):only two elevators for a 25+ floor hotel is just insufficient specially when everyone is trying to catch the elevator to reach the lobby level for breakfast end time and 2) breakfast area is too small for a holliday situation in which all guests tend to arrive for breakfast near the end of service (in most Hyatt Place properties tipically ranges between 9:00 and 9:30, which let's face it is ridiculously early.)What really impressed me and gave me this great impression on the hotel was the attending staff who I met at front desk: Eddie, Hector and Brandon. They will anything to solve a guest problem as they did for me.Congrats to Hyatt Place New York Midtown South for having them!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Went to New York at the start of December to see the Christmas decorations and the "buzz" you get walking around The streets, was not disappointed. The hotel was in a great location with a view of The Empire State Building from our room and Macy's a five minute walk. Hotel lovely and staff exceptional helpful and friendly. A wonderful Christmas experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here over Christmas family of 5 ,Great location 4minute walk to Herald Square subway get trains all around the city from here.Staff are really friendly and always seem to have a smile on their faces.Breakfast is typical of most hotels these days But is included in price and is more than adequate to set you on your way in the morning. But the best thing is the view from the terrace on 26th floor of the Empire State Building , my 11 year old used to go up there every day just to look at it ,Overall a nice hotel , lovely staff , nice size rooms and a Great Location and yes I would come back

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is great, near several subway lines, easy walk to theaters. The rooms were well kept and spacious for New York City. The wifi worked great. Nice lobby area for meeting local family. Would definitely stay again,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had an early flight and arrived to the hotel around 11:00 am. Although we were early for check-in, our room was already ready for us and we were allowed to check-in early at no additional charge. The top floor has beautiful views of the city- including views of the Empire State Building. Breakfast was included and was a great selection. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was worried about the business of this area but it turned out to be an exceptional choice. Location is everything in New York and while the walk to Broadway is busy, it's no more than a ten minute jaunt making this hotel very accessible to those seeing shows or visiting Times Square. Hotel was very quiet during the night. There are only six rooms per floor (I think) and so the traffic on each floor is very light and makes for a peaceful experience. It's clean and comfortable. The rooms are small, as expected in the city but large enough for a sofa by the bed, a fridge and plenty of space for luggage. The shower was amazing - and TALL (for us over 6 feet.) They offer the rare complimentary breakfast down in the lobby area, which is so popular it is hard to find seating, perhaps extended hours could make this option more possible for everyone. Wi-Fi was a little slow, but included. Can't complain, this hotel doesn't charge the dumb "resort fees" all the hotels are starting to add. Another reason we chose it. The staff was great, very friendly and the check-in/out process took no more than 5 minutes. We really enjoyed this hotel and it's amenities. Very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice accommodations in the heart of the city. I was disappointed that the App didn’t notify me when my room was available for check in and in the wee hours of the morning neither one of my room keys were functional.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Enjoyed 3 nights, had a quiet room, clean. Elevators ran quick and efficiently,not a long wait for the elevator. Breakfast included was good,with fresh fruit,eggs,cereal. Plenty of room to sit for breakfast. Has a nice rooftop terrace,where you can see the Empire State Building. Our room was a little crowded,but spacious enough for New York! I would go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hyatt Place always delivers for me. I have stayed there multiple times over the last five years. It's a small-ish hotel as far as footprint but does have 26 floors of guest rooms. All the rooms are the same footprint for the most part but the rooms on the South side of the building have a view of the Empire State Building!Breakfast is solid and consistent. Typical Hyatt Place fare. TIP: Go earlier in the morning where there are NO LINES.It is very close to 34th Street Herald Square where you can take the subway most anywhere. The shops of this area are well known and it makes me feel more like a local when I shop here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A lovely stay. The staff were extremely kind and very accommodating. You could definitely tell they cared about the guests. Every staff member we encountered was nice, I think it goes to show a lot about an establishment, when every staff member has an upbeat caring attitude towards guests, it definitely made our stay enjoyable. Not only was everyone incredibly hospitable, but the fact that there is a full buffet breakfast included in your stay is awesome. I was told that wasn’t common, especially in New York, so what a treat. Also the location is ideal, if you’re wanting to be central, Empire State Building 3 mins away, Times Square 10 mins. My husband and I walked practically everywhere we wanted to go. It was a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel. It was in a fabulous location. The rooms were clean and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. My only complaint was the wait times for the elevators. You have to go to the 26th floor terrace to see the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were very pleased with the price, quality & location of this hotel. The breakfast was hot, had a good selection and was very tasty. We only live four hours away & will definitely return back to this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a great 4 night stay at the Hyatt Place Midtown South during December. It was a perfect central location with easy walking to shopping, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the subway. Staff was always cordial and willing to assist or answer questions no matter how many times I asked them to confirm which way to Sixth Ave! Room was clean and comfortable and housekeeping did a superb job as well. We were in room 2001 with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and the rooftop terrace was a plus! We read reviews mentioning the speed of the elevators but in our four night stay I think there was only a single occurrence where that seemed to be noticeable, and seeing as how this was a busy December weekend I believe the hotel had to be full. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Having stopped on Times Square on our last visit we felt Herald Square, nr Macy’s would be a different and cheaper option. The hotel looks very new and we were quickly checked in. Although there are 26 floors there only appears to be 8 rooms on each floor. We were really surprised how big the room was for NYC, plenty of storage space, Safe, King Bed, Sofa, tea, coffee, ironing board and iron. The bathroom was also large with a great walk in shower. We were on the 7th floor and slept well for our 4 nights, no noise issues.Plenty of people moan on here about the breakfast- I cannot understand why. It’s free, it has a massive array of items and a different hot option everyday such as bacon, sausage, egg, French toast, pancakes and there are signs everywhere, including in the lifts telling you at what times it gets busy.
