I'm still kind of shocked at the nonchalance of the front desk. Are we talking diamond jewelry, no, but this was extremely important to her and they are irreplaceable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect high level room, not big, not small, just good for two. Great bed, bathroom and wonderful blackout blinds. Staff were very welcoming, helpful and gave the impression they cared (how do they do that!), I guess the probably do! Breakfast area is chaotic on busy days, but food was good, coffee was brilliant and enough to start your day of sightseeing or whatever. Will stay again, great location, great views of ESB, pop over to Macy's for a walk around late evening, grab some food to go from Herold square or deli, very relaxed hotel and as I say again great helpful staff. Oh and before I forget, the maid service too. They always get forgotten but did a great job clearing my room and tidy as new. Thank you. Simon Ja

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Took off a whole star for the incomprehensible price for a 16 oz. gatorade. I was soooo thirsty after walking around all day and nothing sounded better than a gatorade. I spent the remainder of the evening wondering and drawing mental on my mental whiteboard all the possible scenarios that led the price of $5.25. I was not able to come up with any rational or sane theory.Hotel was nice. Don't buy gatorade from there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My stay at Hyatt Place was overall a good stay.The room was clean and in good condition.Breakfast was good but the room was small and found it hard to get a table.The Hyatt Place is in a great location and walking distance to Time Square and subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After a long day of travelling, Hyatt fumbled the credit card info during the reservation process made by my employer. When I arrived they claimed they did not have a proper authorization on file from the reservation despite me showing the approved reservation. The next day my employer confirmed with Hyatt that they did indeed have the correct authorization and Hyatt admitted fault that they failed to see they could have ran the card. No apology was offered. This mess cost both me and my employer hundreds of extra dollars not to mention time and frustration not being able to get to a room after a 12 hour travel day. I will never stay with Hyatt again after their mistake, unwillingness to understand the situation, admit fault when I initially tried to check in, and lack of management offering a solution to the issue. Absolutely TERRIBLE way to be treated as a customer who has paid thousands of dollars to this corporation in the past.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location within walking distance to most NYC famous places. Can get a little loud at night because of all the bars around the area, but it's a great value for the location. Breakfast included was very nice as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Typically has a great room rate, friendly staff, nice hotel. I'd certainly consider staying here again. Very convenient location. I'm pretty loyal to Hyatt properties and when the Grand Hyatt isn't available - this is the second hotel that I check.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is in the middle of everything and for the price it's not bad. The views are spectacular. The staff was amazing at making sure everything was right. Colleen at the front desk was amazing! She made the stay perfect

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was below average for most Hyatt Place hotels we have stayed at. Great location next to all of the Empire State Building. Unfortunately the room was dirty and musty smelling. Breakfast was below average compared to other Hyatt Place hotels we have stayed at.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A really nice place for a moderate price. Room was bigger than expected and bed was excellent. Refrigerator didn't work but I used the ice bucket to chill the champagne, they provided nice glasses. Lovely view from the 26th floor terrace, overlooks the empire state building. Close enough to the action but a few streets off which makes it quiet and convenient

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Reasonable sized rooms for NY. Clean, comfy with iron, coffee etc. staff friendly. Excelent location. Comfy bed. Quiet in room. Breakfast included which is unusual for a NY hotel at the orice we paid. Would def go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location for subway travel food, drink and shopping Macy's just round the corner as is the Empire State. Costs over priced but that's New York for you. Room was spot on very clear and comfy breakfast was kaos food ok

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was not clean in the bathroom area, the front desk staff was not nice or friendly, we booked for 3 night and the second one it was 3:00 pm and room was not cleaned, the parking is in a complete different building. I was just very disappointed with the way I was treated

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The front staff was super friendly and helpful. Rooms were very clean and ours had an awesome view of the Empire State Building! Breakfast had choices and was nice. Very centrally located, short walk to everything! Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed at Hyatt Place for three nights so we could explore NYC and we were very happy with our choice. Every employee was very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and quiet. The continental breakfast had a wide variety of quality selections, both hot and cold. The hotel is walking distance to several subway stations, the Empire State Building, many mall-type stores, souvenir shops, restaurants, and pharmacies. Not to mention, the hotel is centrally located amongst the most popular city attractions--we couldn't have asked for a more convenient location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was a Great choice, located in the heart of New York. The rooms are good size for A New York hotel. Had to wait a few times for the elevator but overall great stay. Two staff members that are subperb are the front desk workers Rayana and Coleen. They are so accommodating and resourceful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are looking for a decent hotel close to attractions such as Times Square, theater, subway etc....this is your hotel. Nothing fancy but is affordable. Decent bars close to the hotel to stop for a drink before or after dinner.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved this place, very NY! Great mid town location, nice Irish pub across the street. Free breakfast was awesome! We felt safe, the customer service was awesome, and rooms were a nice size for NY. We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location for theater and great restaurants. Wonderful buffet breakfast and food available 24 hours. Staff friendly. We saw 2 broadway shows and walked everywhere. Highly recommend Hyatt for a broadway vacation !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We always enjoy our stay at Hyatt Midtown. The front desk staff is very welcoming and willing to take the extra steps to ensure you enjoy your stay. The rooms are modern and very clean. Enjoyable place and nice location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Rooms are decent size. There is not much counter space in the bathroom. Allow extra time in the mornings for catching the elevator. Free breakfast is good and changes slightly each day. We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our family of four stayed for 7 nights and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, we were able to leave the sofa bed out during the day and still move around easily. Great location- easy walk to Times Square and the high-line and near to subway stations. The breakfast was fine, however the room is quite small. Additional lifts would have been beneficial as there was often a wait!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice hotel, central location close to all the attractions of central NY, which is very convenient, but everything in the hotel (rooms, breakfast area) was compacted.More expensive than what was expecting.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for a couple nights for work. Rooms are a good size, but the bathrooms were huge for New York City. Free breakfast was excellent. Conveniently located. Lyft showed up in minutes. Would recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt has always been my first choice, great hospitality,friendly and warm staff members. Always warm to welcome you and never an effort to answer any of my questions. It's almost like you treated as a family member no matter at which Hyatt hotel you stay at.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was really nice and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The rooms were very clean! The location was perfect! One block from 6th Avenue! I will definitely be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great hotel at a great location in NYC. Close to Times Square and Macys. Breakfast is very good, with a variety of fruits and cold cuts. Great staff with very helpful tips about the city. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stopped at this hotel for 8 nights: 05th December 16 - 13th December 16.The main reason we decided on this hotel was due to the location and price, given we knew we would only be in the hotel 1st thing at morning and last thing at night - so why pay much more for a really swanky hotel!?The breakfast included was more than enough for first thing in the morning and nice & quick before setting out for the day.The room was more than sufficient, had all of the qualities needed, spacious, comfy firm bed and we even had a nice view of the Empire State Building out of the window.. where we could see last thing at night what the colour was (: We didn't hear any noise either which was perfect for us.The location of the hotel was great.. a 2 minute walk from the Tube Station which we used daily as we bought a 7 day pass for $33'ish.We did all of the main attractions during our time in NYC.. and even got engaged whilst on a 3 Course Bateaux Dinner Cruise, which completely topped the holiday off.In conclusion; I'd recommend this hotel if your not planning on spending all day in the hotel and want a nice central location to see the main attractions. A very good base to keep coming back to :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very well located Hotel...roof terrace a big secret but a wonderful view of the ESB! Staff were always friendly and welcoming. The hotel is well located to be able to move uptown or downtown. Herald Square and Bryant Park very close by for all transportation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place Manhattan has become my go to business hotel when I'm in New York. Good midtown location, friendly energetic staff, comfortable rooms, great sleep. In addition, there are lots of restaurants and bodegas in the neighborhood as well as transportation options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stay here often very convenient location great staff that is always friendly and courteous close to all main attractions. Breakfast is included daily with a decent selection.Rooms are clean and pretty quiet if your not in front of building. Very quick and easy check in and out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: TV did not work in our room - I notified the front desk after our 1st night and it was still not fixed, The breakfast was a joke - over crowded no place to sit, pretty much a zoo! We ended up eating breakfast at another location. I was charged for our 2nd night even though I had enough reward points to cover the 2nd night. I had to address this with the front desk, not once but twice. Will not stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: staff very helpful and accommodating excellent location in the center of Manhattan accessible to Herald Square subway Times Square a short walk away Numerous restaurants in a short walking distance great shopping nearby roof top with an excellent view Delicious hot breakfast with a lot of choices which changes daily

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: You can have a nice Hyatt standard with a quite fresh property in the middle of Midtown for a great cost. Living in the heart of Manhattan means either spending more than you want on accommodations, or standing the smell of the mold. At Hyatt Place Midtown you can have a great location with a brand new place. Perfect for young couples, lonely travelers or entrepreneurs business trips. Recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent hotel for a short stay the rooms are clean and the staff is attentive. Centrally located and not over priced. There are views of the city on the higher floors and couches in the king deluxe room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I went in to the City to enjoy a couple days away and we always love staying with Hyatt. Clean, inviting and friendly. Great location.... a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building and about 4 blocks from Penn Station. Perfect all around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location from MSG, midtown, Empire State Bldg, and Stern division of Yeshiva University. 10 minute walk from Penn Station. Modern facility. 8 rooms per floor, 25 stories tall. A mini skyscraper squeezed into a small lot using modern architectural techniques. High quality breakfast. Probably worth $25/person if you had to buy similar nearby. Not many kosher options, despite being near major orthodox Jewish university. But, a good kosher restaraunt is right across the street. Clean modern rooms. Bath towels a little thin but adequate. Good quality shower. Unstocked refrigerator in the room so you can bring your own food/drinks without worried about getting charged. Pleasant front desk staff. Efficient checkout. On line bill, so no printed receipt on the floor at day of checkout. USA Today for free in business area on main floor. No WSJ or NY Times. As expensive as the typical hotel in Manhattan. They're all overpriced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms are small, but clean, comfortable, and quiet - at least ours was (room 1708). The desk staff is outstanding and very helpful in answering any questions about anything New Yorkish. A pretty good value for your money considering that it is located in midtown Manhattan. The breakfasts are hot and good, but the hours open are too short for the number of guests jamming the area at one time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I spent one night at Hyatt Place Midtown South. The hotel is clean and the beds are great. It is a simple hotel----no mini bar or room service----but definitely a very good value. They offer a free buffet breakfast, which was very good. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accomodating. I would definitely recommend it as a mid-range hotel at a good price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was very clean and quiet. Quick walk to broadway, Madison square garden and Times Square. We had a pull out sofa which was very comfy and plenty big enough to fit 5 adults more than comfortably. Room was ready upon arrival. Only annoyance was waiting for a verrrrry long time for the elevator at one point, but it was dinner time so I'm sure everyone was trying to use it at the same time. Great deal!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfectly situated for easy sightseeing, this hotel was all that was expected. I was forced to have car with me but the convenient parking half a block away took away my previous apprehension. The rooms are quite large by New York standards, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms equally well sized.My tip would be to avoid the fuster cluck of the buffet breakfast and find yourself a nice deli nearby of which there are numerous. Enjoyable stay. Would go back,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It's a good hotel, close to Times Square and metro with amazing view of the Empire State Building. But there are a few disappointing thing that you always expect from Hyatt but here this things were simply not provided. Room is big enough even for Manhattan, where you don't expect big rooms. But the hotel does not provide you with lotion and shower gel. Only shampoo and soap. Also no cotton sticks, no slippers. Not a big deal but from this level of hotel you expect much more. Also The breakfast is too basic: Fruit salads, two-tree choices of cereals, coffee from thermoses and paper glasses, synthetic omelet, no bacon, no yogurt. Sad and two crowd. So not really bad hotel but does not worth the money

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: stayed here for anniversary trip, told staff about our special occasion , they made sure our room had a great view and presented us with a celebratory dessert platter......hotel is clean , room is beautiful, staff is friendly ....location is perfect for a NYC trip ....delicious breakfast included

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hotel was very small, rooms small, but then this is mid town Manhattan. My expectations from hyatt were way higher, but this turned out to be a high priced ordinary hotel. We stayed for 2 days and were only there for 2 nights, no big deal.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Short walk to ESB & many restaurants. Very convenient location & rooms are away from the noise on the street. The staff here are very helpful & many are bilingual. This location also offers free breakfast!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Unpretentious hotel in a great location near Macy's. The pre check in email requesting special requests was sincere and acted on. Rooms are large by NY standards with fridge, coffee machine and free wifi. Breakfast is quite substantial and freshly prepared.The hotel is ripe for modernization.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A little secret hideaway. Extremely comfortable rooms (King bed), free breakfast and convenient location at a really affordable price (for Manhattan). The service is terrific too. Excellent Wi-Fi included, exercise equipment in LL, and a cool bar/eating room in the back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife had never been to NYC, so for our anniversary this year I decided to take us both on a trip. I found the Hyatt Place through Booking.com and got a very nice deal for the week. I phoned the hotel and informed them of our anniversary, and the hotel staff took care of the rest from there.Upon check-in, once we got to the place (getting lost in Manhattan while walking is not a fun experience when carrying luggage, a cab is highly advised!), we found ourselves at the top floor, in one of four penthouse suites (I suppose... not big enough to be called a suite really but it was far more than what we expected!) with a gorgeous skyline view of the city. A care package had been left in our room, and the first night we decided to just order in. The hotel does offer room service, as it were, but it's pick-up. No big issue there.We felt like we were in the Waldorf-Astoria (which will no longer be the same once it reopens... so sad!) we were treated so well. The room was superb, although a tad cramped for space towards the window. We wound up putting the ottoman on its side and tucking it away so we wouldn't trip over it. The in-hotel breakfast was excellent!! Everything was refilled constantly, and the hot stuff kept hot, cold items kept on ice... excellent job, Hyatt!! This is a good hotel for the center of Manhattan, and within walking distance to the Empire State Building. Very friendly red-vested CityPass or NewYorkPass agents outside the hotel will direct you wherever you need or want to go, and will remember you for multiple-day stays. Some even become friends ;)We'll definitely be returning. Now if they'd only lower their one-night-stay prices a little... I could afford to stay more often :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights on a combination of points and cash. Due to an error with reservations, we were booked for the same hotel for 3 nights on 3 different reservations but when I checked in Andrea, who was a delight during our stay, took care of us and helping us with the check out and immediate check in process that was required. This was close to Herald's Square's subway stop which we used for our 2 full days that we were in NYC and it was a fairly decent location. Empire state building was just a block away, Shake Shake was 2 blocks and plenty of Walgreens nearby in case you forgot something like we did. The included breakfast was as expected for the Hyatt, eggs, toast, pancakes, occasional potato, cereal, fruit,etc. The rooms seemed tight but since this is my first trip to NYC I have heard they were spacious for a NYC hotel room. My only complaint would be that the pillows are extremely flat. I never did ask for a new one and they may have been accommodating had I done so but i just doubled up my pillows. The staff was always friendly and helpful when I needed something and the rooms were nice and cozy (minus the pillow situation). I would stay here again for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place for 3 nights. When we arrived we checked in on the app which made check in when we arrived a breeze. We were not happy, however, with the room we were first given. We were given a second floor room. New York City streets are too noisy to get a room on the second floor. We complained and they quickly moved us to the 10th floor. Much better and much appreciated. The free breakfast was good, but they did run out of some food items the morning after the Derek Day at Yankee Stadium. Happy with the friendly and helpful staff. Will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Decent price, good breakfast included. Great price when considering room slept 6 possibly ( 2 doubles and a pull out sleeper sofa). Needed it due to mom in law coming so we had 5 in there... bit over stuffed for room size. Overall a 3.5/5 so I rounded up...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very well located, just minutes walk from Times Square, very clean, modern and great customer service. Breakfast was good but at times you may have to wait for a seat depending on the time you head down. Between 8 and 9 weekdays is packed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family is very loyal to Hyatt. We have a hyatt credit card and we love their points system. As such, we've come to expect the Hyatt service that has always been outstanding as platinum members. The location is great! Close to Time Square and lots of shopping! Korea town is 3 blocks away for some awesome food and drinks! What I was disappointed in is the lack of necessities in the bathroom. We had to ask for lotion, and Kleenex. We also had to ask for the complimentary water bottles instead of having them available in our room. Free breakfast is a big plus!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Really enjoyed our stay here at the Hyatt. We were here for three evenings and couldn't ask for a better location. Just a few blocks from Bryant Park, Macy's, Empire State building, etc. We had a suite on the ninth floor which was spacious enough for our needs and immaculately clean. The free breakfast each morning was really nice and the free Wi-Fi worked perfectly. The staff at the front desk and housekeeping were friendly, efficient, and eager to please. I would not hesitate to recommend I stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is clean, staff is friendly and free breakfast is a deal! The only hesitation is the price. Otherwise, the location is just a few blocks from many local attractions. Half a block from parking garage ($49/24 hrs).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved our 4 night stay at Hyatt Place. The location was perfect for walking to Times Square, Broadway, subway to 911 Museum and restaurants. Hotel staff was very friendly, free breakfast had great options and rooms were large by NYC standards. I was also pleased with how quiet our room was and the view of Empire State building was a bonus. The overall affordability was excellent and even though it was busy the staff always greeted you with a smile and a hello.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a good time staying here, top floor, the room was efficient for a family of 6 with 2 queen beds and 1 pull out couch, the huge window view of the empire state building and Manhattan was the highlight of the room. Nice large bathroom, clean. The only complaint we had was the wait for the elevator, it took about 6 to 8 minutes to get onto the elevator to leave, but stairs are always optional. Parking costs extra $40 a night at the Icon parking garage just 1 block away but if you check in night beware there is a night club next door and draws a crowd of drinkers you may have to encounter as we did although nothing bad happened. Also, it's a NY thing that trash is piled up outside on the streets in the city during certain hours, we are from the country so this was unusual but I guess necessary given it has to be hauled off somehow! Over all we really liked staying here and would come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We went to NYC to introduce our grandchildren, twin 6 year old twins to a Broadway show. They loved the view of the empire state building from our room. The hotel is well located, reasonable value, provides quality service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Awesome hotel near Times Square and one block from the 34th Herald Square subway stop! Staff was very personable and helpful. Breakfast had a lot of choices and very plentiful. Room size was larger than I expected for Manhattan. Beds were very comfortable and noise was minimal.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is in the ideal location. It is only one block from 5th Ave shopping and eateries. It's walking distance to Empire State Building. They even have a small outside patio on the main street. The all natural breakfast put the icing on the cake.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Prompt & friendly front desk agents. Very pleased with location of room, cleanliness, comfort & view. Quiet floor. Many breakfast choices for all diet preferences & refilled quickly when items ran out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown South and were overwhelmed with the affordability, the location and staff. If you have stayed in NYC you know how expensive hotels can be due to the extremely high cost of space. This hotel has managed to offer an affordable option. To get the same quality you find at this hotel you would expect to pay 20-30% more per night. The rooms are slightly larger than many other hotels in NYC we have used in the past. Beds are very comfy. We were on one of the higher floors and heard no street noise at all. The bathroom was nicely done and arranged with plenty of hot water in the shower. We had a couple of special requests and the staff made sure to quickly respond. In fact the staff went out of their way to accommodate not just us but others as we learned from talking to folks at breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, there was plenty of great options on the breakfast buffet with the main items changing daily. No stale everyday menu here! Regarding location, the hotel is just a few minutes walk away from Times Square, Herald Square, Penn Station (for trains coming in from Newark Airport), and the subway. The affordability, location and staff makes this hotel a winner!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for a New Year Stop Over and found hotel, staff and amenities all very welcoming. The room was a good size with a comfortable bed and decent shower.The staff was friendly abd helpful with storing luggage on check in abd check out days. The breakfast was included in our stay and was overall a quite hectic experience. The food was ok, but nothing to get excited about. Generally there was one egg dish and one sweet dish, both empty very fast upon refill. The best hotel feature is its convenient location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Me and my husband spent our honeymoon here. From the view, to the clean rooms, to the huge showers, and the friendly staff, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. It was less than 5 mins away from Herald Square, so close to subway stations, perfect location! Thank you Hyatt Place it was so magical!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Really an excellent location for exploring NY, even close enough to take the train from airport to Penn Station and walk to the hotel. Lovely view of Empire State Building from our room. But be warned - two elevators for many rooms makes for a wait in the lobby. Also, if you are used to staying in other Hyatt Place's (almost all of which are new build) this one is a renovated office or apartment building and not what you will expect from their sub-brand. Rooms are small, NY style size, not they typical Hyatt Place size. It is laughable that they still advertise the "cozy corner" when that corner barely fits the couch while at any other Hyatt Place that area is as large as a 2nd room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Yet again, another GREAT stay with Improved breakfast selections. Always feel very spoiled at the Hyatt. They take care of you!! they were able to allow me to check in early to my light and airy , spacious room. Staff were welcoming and friendly wherever you go in the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice small hotel, clean, full breakfast, staff nice and friendly, in walking distance to time square, there are a lot of eateries close by, only two elevators, not a full bar small selection. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We came with friends who booked our reservations but we liked the place. Room was nice and staff friendly. Arrived during a driving rain storm and were soaked. Had to wait awhile to check in (early). Would have liked a bar/restaurant to make our wait more convienent but enjoyed the rest of the stay after we dried out!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I always stay at the Hyatt whenever I need a hotel. The staff is always so friendly and accommodating, from the people that check you in to the room maids. I've stayed at the Hyatt in multiple cities, and the same standard is upheld each and every time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was clearly cleaner than my last stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean - bed comfortable . Liked the upgrade to highest floor w/ my Hyatt status. Overall pleasant stay. Hotel is centrally located w/ easy access to major shopping and restaurants. Nightly rate was good for a Sunday night...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hotel is within easy access to all the tourist sites in New York City. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff is very cheerful and accommodating. It was relaxing to enjoy breakfast each morning in our hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have been with the family first time and it was a good choice. Amazing location (50m from 5th avenue) and walking distance from many hotspots, good room size, breakfast (although extremely busy) and nice surrounding. The staff was helpful.The view from the room was maybe not the best but that would be maybe the only drawback from the entire stay :-)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was our first time in NYC. The hotel was in a great spot. Everything was in walking distance, which was very important to us. It was roughly a 15 minute walk to Times Square, a 5 minute walk to Macy's. We even walked to Central Park one day (that took a bit longer).The hotel itself was very clean. We got a room on the 3rd floor and it was facing the street. The only thing I didn't love was the noise of the traffic and the garbage trucks. I believe this can be avoided by getting a room on a higher floor or not facing the road. But the noise didn't disturb our sleep or anything, it was just very noticeable.The free breakfast was outstanding (compared to others that I've had). It was a different selection every morning and I was very pleased with the options.I would definitely stay here again and the time of year we went was very reasonably priced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: With the issues I incurred during my stay, if it weren't for Shandel, Marlinne, and Kyle, I would have lost it.Third party bookings caused so much confusion, and overcharging mistakes.Kyle made sure that I was credited for overcharges, and did it with a smile. No matter how long it took.Marlinne made up for the harsh and inconsiderate actions of Brandon(a manager there) and made me feel welcomed and satisfied with her expertise Customer CARE! We called her Sunshine.And last but definitely not least was Shandel. He's there overnight, but after hours didn't make a difference. This young man handled every issue I had expeditiously. He made calls to necessary departments. He relentlessly catered to the need of the customer(me). He made me feel good about my choice in hotels. If I have to book anywhere again, no matter where is closer to my endeavor, I will make an extra travel to place myself in his hands. He is obviously an asset to this company. I even tried to snatch him up as an employee. We'll see if he gives me a call.Great job Hyatt Place! You chose your staff well. They truly make the difference.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a great Hotel! The mattress were very comfortable and breakfast was very nice. Get into Breakfast early. Everything we wanted to see and do was very close to this Hotel. The one day was went to Lower Manhattan, the subway was right around the corner. Know that you have to buy a Metro card for every four passengers (it only lets you swipe 4 times)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff was awesome from start to finish. Room was clean. Awesome view of the Empire State Building from our room. Location was very convienient to Times Square and other attractions. Breakfast basic but ok. Overall great place to stay. Will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff is awesome, hotel and rooms are clean and best included breakfast I have ever had! Not a high profile location, but one of the best deals in NYC. I was expecting an average stay at best, considering the location and the pricing, but I was blown away by the experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for a long weekend getaway. We arrived on Amtrak and the property is easily walk-able from Penn Station. It is just close enough to all the tourist spots for walking or short rides in a car or train, but far enough to not be bombarded by millions of people as soon as you walk out the door. Very clean and the staff is friendly. The breakfast is free and has a good selection of items. The fitness center has the necessities. Overall a very good stay. We will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is an easy walk from Penn Station and a two block walk to the subway lines taking you up or downtown. Very comfortable bed and pillows as you would expect from Hyatt. Breakfast does end early at 9:00 M-F and the hotel warns guests of lines in that final hour. If I could change one thing it would be to extend the breakfast to late morning as not everyone here is on business. Otherwise folks on holiday likely miss out on the free included breakfast. Service at the front desk is very good with caring, efficient staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is an unassuming hotel in an excellent location, very close to Times Square and round the corner from Macy's and 5th Avenue; we also walked to Central Park and the start of the High Line from here. Our room was on the 24th floor at the back with an incredible view of the Empire State Building, especially at night. Whilst the room was small for our family of five, it was adequate and was kept clean. Breakfast was decent and the take-out hot drinks and wrapped fruit proved very useful. The staff were extremely helpful and Colleen greeted us with a smile when we first arrived. Overall, this was a lovely stay in a great location - central yet quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After a relatively nice visit to this hotel, my partner and I experienced an unpleasant loss as we had to leave in a rush due some personal circumstances. Soon after our departure, we called the hotel to inform them that we had left some clothing along with an expensive pair of Bose Noise Canceling Headphones. After a few days of insisting and being told that there was nothing left behind, we were told that our clothing had been found but no headphones. Clearly, the item had not been returned by the cleaning staff, but the hotel did not assume responsibility. They referred us to their insurance company who told us the item was not covered. The hotel was highly irresponsive, the hotel manager never returned our calls, only his assistant who in turned transferred us to the housekeeping department. If you stay at this place, do not leave expensive items laying around and do not leave anything behind.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Location for visiting Times Square was perfect. Breakfast at hotel was "ok". More options would have been nice. Bedroom pretty tight(for family of 5). Asked for more pillows- staff delivered almost immediately.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Until this morning I really enjoyed this hotel. The facilities are quite nice and centrally located. It's a relatively short walk from Penn station and close to everything in NYC. The staff is quite nice and helpful such that check in was a breeze and offered with a smile. The rooms are also quite nice and a decent size. I had a king room with a couch and a proper work area. The showers are also very modern and well kept.All that said, this morning was a bit of a mess. I attempted to go down for breakfast at 830, but it wasn't until 8:45 that I made it. Seems that the hotel elevators aren't quite up to the task of handling such a rush. Everyone that got on the elevator, eventually, was a bit annoyed. Seems that this hotel would really benefit from an update to their elevator system such that the cars more intelligently determined where to go. The food for breakfast was decent, but their staff was clearly not prepared for such a rush. Silverware was missing and they were a bit slow in refilling the food.Overall I'd consider staying here again considering the facilities, staff and location, but the delays this morning were a real negative.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Accessibility is superb since hotel is in the midtown! Supreme location. Breakfast wasn't that great! Inclusion of more variety is what I would recommend. Mostly it was French food, may be including few continental items would help!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel isn't fancy, but if you are looking for a clean room in an excellent location, it is a great fit. Most importantly, the hotel is quiet, both inside the small hallways as well as minimal street noise. We were here for ten days and found the front desk staff to be exceptionally friendly and welcoming, especially Colleen. A very unassuming hotel that provides a very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: They had our reservations mixed up, and we didn't get the room we had booked, but other than that it was a great hotel. The breakfast was very good, beds were comfortable, we loved the location, could walk everywhere, but it is far enough off Broadway to be less crazy busy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I wasn't entirely sure what to expect when I booked this hotel. I usually stay at other Hyatt options as I generally steer clear of 'budget hotels' in NY. All that said, I would have no hesitation staying here again - clean, friendly staff and surprising nice rooms. While not quite my favorite Hyatt in any, it's probably up there with Herald Square in terms of value for money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Simple, clean room, with comfortable beds and a narrow view of the Empire State Building. Excellent service. Staff were helpful with directions and with bag check. Much better than the Grand Hyatt and less expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you've stayed at a Hyatt Place, you know what to expect. The rooms are standard. Nothing especially noteworthy. We stayed in a handicap-accessible room so the space was greater than a regular room. To note, each floor only has 4 rooms due to the narrowness of the building. This helped keep the hallway noise down. The hotel is located blocks from the Empire State Building, THE Macy's, Madison Square Garden, and a large number of amazing restaurants. We were able to walk to Times Square with no problem and even took a long walk to Rockefeller Center. We loved: Bryant Park, NY Supreme Pizza, and Shake Shack

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: 4.9.17 overnight for 1 night. Well they give you a bed which at least is firm. The location is good close to Madison Square Garden, Macy's, Empire State Building. Also nearby by are Shake Shack (slow service), Chick Fil A, Pret Manger, etc. Rooms are tiny in fact my bathroom at home is bigger than the entire hotel room but not as tiny as some London hotels where you can't even turn around without running into a wall or another person.The breakfast is a disgrace frankly, loads of sugared up cereals, no yogurt, pathetic looking eggs, with some kind of bacon never seen before in my world travels. I would not feed this breakfast to a dog it was shameful, so I went to Pret Manger and spent $$$$$ to avoid eating sugar loaded foods which are very bad for my health.Anyway if you want a bed, and if they give you a good room rate for NY it is probably just ok as you could pay a lot more and not necessarily get more so on this one it is simply buyer beware.the Doctor hit me with a helpful vote please this is a totally objective review from a massive world traveler!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed during the week of Columbus Day, 2016. I love the city in the Fall and have already booked the same dates for 2017, although in a different hotel. Friendly staff, comfortable bed and a nice city view through the floor to ceiling windows. In room fridge, coffee maker, safe and iron. Breakfast buffet is way above average and seats around 80 people. Great location, safely away from the chaos of Times Square and near subway stops and dining options. I would gladly have rebooked this place again for next Columbus Day but the prices jumped substantially so I had to book the property right next door. Otherwise, I certainly would have been happy to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved the terrace on the corner of the building with the map identifying all the landmarks visible from there. Should tell guests about that at check-in, we just happened upon it. Nicest staff, very clean, on the small size but, hey, it's NYC. Floor to ceiling windows in room very cool.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location. Very nice and clan hotel room. Breakfast could be better. Price was kind of high. Over all experience was very positive and if your budget allows it would be a good place to stay at while in NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good value for money and a great experience overall! Good location, breakfast and beverages. Staff very caring and helpful. But, heater could be working a bit better! However, it didn't change my positive view

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a quick 3 night stay. Located very well in Midtown. 5 min walk to Empire State/Herald Square/Macys. Our room was on the 5th floor so unfortunately no view. Room was clean, looked a bit tired in places but overall a very good stay. Breakfast was basic but sufficient...cereals/juices/porridge/small hot plate section/toast. We travelled with x 2 girls, they were on sofa bed in room and slept very well.The only thing which was slightly strange was the noise of the fridge in the room. Every hour during the night it would 'turn on' really loudly for about 5 minster.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt place is a terrific place to stayIn nycVery helpful staff Great rooms and lots of surrounding hot spots just the right size hotelLooks new. And has very comfy bedsAnd well designed bathrooms.High floors have an amazing view

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We'd asked for an early checkin yet ended up waiting a good couple of hours before going up to our room. We were exhausted after a long haul bus trip from Kentucky. The room was great. Fantastic views from our room of the Empire State Building, and the hotel is in a great location, close to everything. One big mishap which probably wasn't the hotel's fault, but I'll never know, was I handed my laundry to reception for them to hand over to the laundry service I'd organised to pick up. Somewhere along the way my washing was lost. Hotel said they handed it over, and the laundry service said they never picked it up. To this day I have no idea who's telling the truth. Lost hundreds of dollars worth of clothes. Also disappointed in the breakfast service. A couple of mornings we arrived about half an hour before breakfast was to finish and it was almost all packed away, including coffee! I would have expected more given the price of this hotel. I know everything is expensive in New York, and for this reason, I'd expect better service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good room, good view of empire state building (if a little too close!). The rooms were large enough, and clean, with a safe, hairdryer, big tv, and usb charging outlets byvthe bed (nice touch).The breakfast was sufficient (although no meat on thd third day).The staff were very pleasant and helpful (as was everybody we met in NY with a couple of very minor exceptions). I spent some time talking to reception staff and they are all a credit to the hotel (and very useful for gettingvthe weather forecasts for the following day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great value with breakfast included, and free WiFi. Good location for shopping in Times Square, Macy's and 5th Avenue. Walking distance to entertainment destinations on Broadway. A short walk to Grand Central Station. Nothing fancy, but super clean, friendly staff and excellent value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Fairly quiet considering the location in a busy area. Great proximity to subway stops and restaurants. Staff friendly and extensive breakfast. Clean and inviting, high recommendation all around--thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location near Broadway in NYC. However, the hotel was cramped with narrow hallways and very small rooms. While clean, Furniture, carpeting and bedding were worn. Expected at a motel 6 but not an Hyatt. I will not be returning to this location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed in this great hotel for a few nights as a result of the great storm that pummeled New York in early February. Great convenient free bfast typical of many other hotels with cereals, hot items and others. Found the dining area a bit on the crowded side with many guests in town apparently but not a major issue. Never ran out of food and there was always a place to sit.Excellent location close to anything in Manhattan with Uber, subway stations or taxis. Walked all over the place and the hotel was in the right spot. Nearby coffee shops and restaurants.Friendly staff and great modern decor.Room and bathroom was rather "large" for NY standards and enjoyed the street view I happened to have.Really can't go wrong with this place and if you get a good rate, cannot beat it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel, friendly and caring staff. Breakfast was awesome. Food choices changed daily. Great location with access to many activities within walking distance. Loved the terrace view, especially after the Noreastern.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: LoveEverything ❤️ Location was the best mins from everything or a quick cab ride... The view was fantastic so close to the Empire State Building, was able to watch the colors change felt like I could reach out and touch it....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Not a bad place to stay, not a great place to stay - especially if you happen to have paid at the higher end of the scale due to timing. If I'd gotten a deal and the hotel was sub $175, or even $150, I might feel a little different. The room is well appointed and clean but not particularly interesting in the way of decor. Definitely no complaint here though, especially if you are on a little weekend getaway. Location is excellent and you can walk to a lot of places and easily get several metro lines.Breakfast is okay and varied from day to day a little, which was nice. Lines do form around 8:15/8:30 but they notify you of that on posters in the elevator so it is no surprise.I was on a higher floor, which was great with nice view and less noise but the elevators in this hotel are truly awful. There are only two and they are slow. So if you are trying to get anywhere during a busy time (breakfast, evening when everyone comes back) plan ahead. My key stopped working and I had to go back down to get it re-coded. It took 20 minutes - and it was not the staff/desk that was the issue. They were speedy. It was the elevator waiting and then stopping on every floor on the way up. Oh, and in the morning the cleaning crew uses the main elevator so expect a few more stops for that. They really should get a service elevator. Staff was okay. Nice enough but mostly lackadaisical. Clearly not a four star + hotel. It is a Hyatt Place after all. Overall it is a solid place to camp out for a few days; for business, however, I'd prefer a different type of hotel. This one is much better for a quick weekend to the city or a few days with family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Amazing! We enjoyed very much our second stay in New York. The breakfast, the room spacious and clean, the location, the staff, everything is fabulous!The hotel is near Times Square and Macy´s. From the rooftop you have a good view of Empire States. I would like to thank all the staff, mainly Andrea and Tamon from the front desk. Their work is outstanding!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was a guest of the Hyatt Place NY/Midtown hotel for three nights and my experience was first class from beginning to end.I was sent an email from Mr. Weiss a few days prior to my arrival outlining some of the hotel's amenities and locale items. I have only had this type of pre-welcome care a few times. Once in London, Beverly Hills and San Francisco. I think it sets the tone for a great stay!The evening prior, I called just to confirm my arrival time and spoke with Jonathan, who was super kind and helpful!Upon arrival, Sandor checked me in. He was the ultimate professional, so great and really made me feel very welcomed after my long day of travel. He gave me an amazing room! No. 1101. It was so clean, (thank you Housekeeping!) very quiet and a view of the top of the Empire State Building. I was blown away! The room was equipped beautifully but the thing I liked was that the shower doors slid sideways so you could start the water without being splashed. Every morning there was a great complimentary breakfast! I met a wonderful lady, Jemima, who was very kind and welcoming. Mario and Maritza were super helpful and worked hard to set the food up and any help I needed!The hotel is in a great location. Close to Herald Square and lots of areas to explore. In my comings and goings, I met other front desk staff who were friendly and kind and also met David, who is super and amazing! When I had to leave to get to the airport, Andrea at the Front Desk checked me out. She was wonderful and asked how may stay was. I told her it was amazing!So to the Management if the Hyatt Place New York/Midway Hotel, I say Thank you!Your staff: Mr. Weiss, Jonathan, Sandor, Housekeeping, Jemima, Mario, Maritza, David and Andrea are First Class!I hope to return soon to your hotel!Thank you again! Lisa H. Florida

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was clean and comfortable. Nothing special that other hotels were not offering. I would stay here again knowing what I can expect in a room. Bed was a bit hard for my liking. The view from the window in the room was somewhat ugly as a water tower was in direct line of site between the hotel and the empire state building. I could not see the top of the ESB due to the couch blocking access to the window--the angle needed to see the top could not be achieved unless standing very close to the window to look straight up.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is clean, the staff are great and they will go above and beyond to help their guests. I wish all the hotels can learn their customer services. Breakfast is ok but lacks of diversity for non pork eater. This hotel is near penn station and near many tourist place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were warmly welcomed by William (the Manager and his staff) I had spoken to William previously and told him we were coming in for my birthday and would it be possible to have a room on a high floor facing the Empire State building. William was very pleasant and accommodated us with a high floor and indeed a view of the Empire State Building. William also was very generous and kind to send up a bottle of wine to our room. I think William and his staff did an excellent job.Our housekeeping experience was less than we expected. The only other thing that we did not like was that guests in the room next to us smoked pot all night on Saturday and we had to put a towel under the door to stop the odor from entering our room. The free breakfast is plentiful and very organized. The staff again is very pleasant here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I went to NY for a holiday weekend and stayed in this hotel. I really liked that has a great location close to the subway, and a few blocks from Times Square. I found a good deal online so I think it was worth the price. The building is quite, breakfast is good, the staff is friendly, the WiFi works perfectly (I've stayed in good hotels with poor WiFi)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great no frills hotel. Clean and modern, but no bells and whistles. It met my expectations. It is a 10 minute walk to Times Square. The free breakfast was o.k. at best, but I was not expecting a 5 star meal. The walls are thin. We could easily hear conversations in the hall, but with a room on the 24th floor, there was no issue with street noise. The service was very good! We arrived early and a room was available. We also received a couple of complimentary bottles of water...Kudos! The rooms include a mini-fridge for guest use. If you are looking for basic accommodations that are clean and comfortable, I would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place W 36th is great location with everything, shopping - Macy's, Gap, Urban Outfitters, restaurants, taxi, subway, Amtrak, walking, everything and Madison Square Garden only a few blocks to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everything was perfect. Complimentary breakfast was wonderful, staff was friendly, check in and check out was seamless. We went to check our bags and roam the city around 11am, but they said they already had our room ready, check in was supposed to be at 4. We were happily surprised by that, check out was at 12, so we didn't feel rushed in leaving either.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: hotel is tired the water was not working and when it did was cold water for about 1 hour and it was dark brown. they had a water issue not sure if it got fixed. there was a note put under my door as i was checking out

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Close to Grand Central and the theatre district. Nice staff and decent rooms. Great view of Empire State Bldg. For the money, you could not get anything that sleeps five anywhere near the theatre districts that has all this.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The service at reception was helpful and very friendly. The room was big enough for three of us to stay in, and was clean. The location was perfect as it is a short walk to plenty of landmarks such as the Empire State Building, Times Square and more. The breakfast was ok, there wasn't much choice but enough.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had 2 rooms both on the back of the hotel. Kids stayed in a 2 queen plus pullout. We had the King with Empire State Building View, Comfortable, quiet rooms with good water pressure and heating/cooling. Breakfast was very good for being included. It had eggs, cereals, breads, sausage, fruit and yogurt. Will definitely be back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First, I must say every staff member we encountered was extremely pleasant and helpful. Our room was compact but contained a king size bed, sofa and desk. Our room was on the 10th floor facing 36th Street and we were able to hear the garbage trucks quite clearly. That is the only complaint I have. The hotel is walking distance to Madison Square Garden, the theatre district, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center and tons of stores. There's a great Irish bar/restaurant, The Keg Room, right across the street. I would absolutely stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A very convenient place to stay in Manhattan. Walking distance from Penn Station and along the NRQ subway line. 36th W is a decent place to stay. Enjoyed the friendliness of the staff and love the morning breakfast included. Value place to stay. I will return at every time I am in New York City. The place downstairs have nice business area for printing boarding pass if needed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful place!!! great location!! Friendly staff!!! we had a great weknd! Its my 6 time in this Hyatt ...and I will came back! The breakfast was great...we used the fitness area... the staff speaks spanish and english..so that is a plus!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was very impressed with the hotel, the location was great, the view on the empire state building was beautiful, the room was very clean, staff was extremely friendly (especially Tamon). The only downside was their breakfast, very poor, food was not tasty.. I

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: THE GOOD Close to several midtown landmarks and tourist spots but away from the tourist crowds. Tons of eateries around. The rooms were fairly clean, good quality sleep. Great staff. THE NOT SO GOOD No self-service laundry room. No complimentary bottle of water. B'fast menu doesn't vary much from day to day (fine if your stay is a 2-3 days, tiring if your stay is longer)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We came for Fashion Week and stayed one week in this hotel. It was easy to get in and out of the hotel. It was fairly convenient to the subway, about 2 blocks. It was quiet. If you stay on floor 18 or above you should get a view of rooftops. There were 3 of us sharing the room and we had enough space. Most NY hotel rooms are tiny and this one is too however there is a couch to put your luggage on and out of the way. There was not enough room to pull out the sofa and use it as a bed if you want to walk in your room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend and found several reasons to think this was the right choice of a hotel you'd want to stay when you have a weekend in NYC.First up, its great value for money - the staff including Tamon and others are super friendly, always willing to chit-chat and help with queries on everything around travel, cabs, museums, shopping etc. and show genuine warmth in their conversations.Andrea from the reception was super nice in giving me a south-side facing room. I woke up all mornings to a beautiful view of Manhattan buildings and the Empire State building. The rooms are reasonable size for a mid-town hotel, well done, modern in design and with contemporary fittings. And the rooms also achieve that rare state of nirvana where the heating is perfect.A couple of things for the management to think about - the coffee shop is tiny and the breakfast spread is basic, so on a weekend there's mad squander for breakfast, and when you're travelling from Asia, you're not really used to lining up or jostling for space when you serve yourself breakfast. The elevators are slow, but honestly, waiting times aren't as long as I read about prior to checking-in. All things said, I would totally stay at the Hyatt Place again! Its the best value for money that you could think of..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for a week . Staff were so polite , helpful , and welcoming . From the minute we got there , we felt very comfortable. We got room 1002 which was fantastic , large room, king bed , 49" tv , with a view of the Empire State . It's situated in a perfect place for seeing all the main attractions, literally 5 mins walk to everything . Breakfast was plentiful of the same stuff everyday , catering for the American market , but us British found enough items to fill us up . Toast and jam, scrambled eggs and cereals . Big shout out to Eddie on reception who went the extra mile to answer all our questions . Thanks so much for a fantastic week and would highly recommend!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is located near Penn station and a short walk to Empire state ,Macy's and Time Square. The hotel is clean and very modern looking. We were on the 20th floor with a good view on the skyline. The bed is very comfy and it also had a sofa in the room, In room safe and TV. The room was clean and if you have forgotten anything the staff are more than happy to assist. There is a free buffet breakfast which a vast choice from cereals, yoghurts ,fruits ,eggs, sausage, toast ,bagels ,Danishes fruit juices coffee and a range of teas. Excellent staff service would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place midtown south is well located in Manhattan for both tourists and business travelers. The hotel is a short walk from Penn Station and conveniently located near multiple subway stops and about a 15 minute walk to Times Square.The hotel is cookie cutter Hyatt Place both in the decor and free breakfast offerings. The rooms are reasonably sized for NYC and served by 2 elevators. I was on a middle floor at the rear of the property and there was no issue with noise nor adequate light.My only downgrade was that the overall service was quite up to what I expect. The front desk staff were great but I was disappointed to see the housekeeping cart parked on my floor at all times during my stay (corridors are small). My neighbor also put some trash out in the hall and it remainder there all evening and night.The price point was great for a stay in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've traveled to New York several times and I've stayed in different hotels .This time I was surprised with the quality of the hotel. Every thing was excellent : the room, bed, shower, service, delicious breakfast,location.I'll be back with sure!Marli Apparecido-São Paulo

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I'm not interested in luxury. This place is clean and simple. Very comfortable and somewhat basic. Nothing unique for the good and the bad. Two blocks from the subway station. I had a sofa and a big bed. The closet is a bit small.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: * well-located * genuinely hospitable staff * spacious rooms (by NYC standards) * good breakfast (if busy at times) * don't overthink this - just stay here (except on the dates we will most certainly be returning)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed at the Hyatt Place Manhattan 2 or 3 times before and was here last week. The staff are the best: when the first room we got facing 36th Street was noisy and we couldn't sleep, the desk clerk changed us to a better room in the back of the hotel the next morning, and besides quiet we were treated to a stunning view of the Empire State building, plus slept a lot better. Breakfast is still pretty good for a free deal (which also means lots of parents with little kids so expect that) and the location is the best. Everything is close by. Finally the Hyatt Place is a true bargain for Manhattan, especially in mid-winter. I've stayed in much more expensive hotel that weren't nearly as nice. Keep up the good work, Hyatt Place Manhattan staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: What a bargain in the centre of Midtown. If I ever come back to NYC I will be staying here - we even had a view of the Empire State from our room. All staff were fantastic all through the stay, even the cleaners.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We choose this hotel due to its location.. near Penn Station, subway links and 5th Avenue. The added bonus was the inclusive breakfast. A lot of the hot food wasn't to our taste however toast, fruit and tea/coffee was great. There are notices in the lift advising of busy times however unless you fancy a very early start (7-7:30) it's steadily busy until 9am. Downfall... 2 out of the 3 times we had breakfast we had trouble locating staff to refill empty stations. Once staff were found though they were quick to refill stock.If you have children or are a large group.. hotel breakfast is perfect and will save you a fortune from eating out. 2 minute walk to Herald Park subway station and Macys. Rooms were very generous size especially for NYC. Comfortable bed and plenty of storage.I think it would be great if the tea/coffee station could stay open for an hour or so after breakfast so you can grab a fresh cuppa to take out with you.. especially in the winter.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have often stayed at this hotel, but I do not want to anymore. The hotel's location is very good and convenient. Breakfast is delicious. cleaning of rooms and service need to improve, I wish that things got better

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed at the Hyatt Place NYC a couple times before and still really like it. It's a newer property close to everything (hint - visit the Morgan Library a few blocks away) and it still feels clean and well cared for. Breakfast is decent in an era where free good hotel breakfasts are rarely found. The best thing about the Hyatt Place are it's staff: our first night was so noisy on the front of the hotel we couldn't sleep; there was a grinding sound coming from the street like someone cutting metal, even though we couldn't see any construction. So the next morning the guy on desk duty promptly moved us to a big room on the back of the hotel, with a full view of the Empire State Building. Sweet! We slept much better on that side of the hotel, thanks to the Hyatt staff. This hotel is a very good value in an expensive city and also the location can't be beat: close to many sites, subway, bus lines, Penn Station, theatre district, shopping, etc. We'll definitely be back sometime.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt place in NYC has one of the most impressive staffs I've experienced in some time. Everyone is kind and friendly. The front desk staff were very solicitous and helpful. The condition of the hotel is superior to the grand Hyatt which is supposed to be a level up from this hotel. I prefer the Hyatt place in every way.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent a week here in late January on vacation. Excellent staff at front desk, clean rooms, and great proximity to major subway lines. Had an issue with one of the free hotel wifi access points never getting a connection, but they located and disabled the bad access point allowing us to connect easily to the other working access points. Nice having both privacy shades and blackout shades.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This property exceeded all expectations. A room in the back on a higher floor gave me a close up and personal view of the Empire State Building. Comfortable room. Great bed, sofa and more. Too bad I was there for only 2 nights. Staff were wonderful from start to finish.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Suprisingly peaceful sleepover in the middle of Manhattan!Ouf first visit in a smaller hotel was really succesfull.Between 5th/6th Av ,Macy's,Empire Ste Bldg,Madisson SquareGarden,theater distr.,Time Square in the hoods and still the hotel so tranquille.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: From check in to the room, breakfast, location, staff everything was great Very highly recommendable. I traveled with my 3 kids and we were expected about the location, however all my concern were clarified as soon as I felt the safety and comfort of the hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice and clean, good continental breakfast. Very close to sights and shopping. I wasn't in NY very long but it was very comfortable to stay here. It is very consistent with other Hyatt Places that I have stayed at.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed 3 nights, location was close to perfect, it was 5 min walk to Macy's or other stores. Breakfast area was very small and bit disappointed about foods there as it was lower quality than I had at other Hyatt place. Hot foods i.e. Breakfast sandwich, waffle, pancake were not so tasty. Room was big, it was nice to have a sofa, fridge, comfy bed, good size of bathroom but no bathtub.My room didn't have a view, only office windows but the shade worked quite nice to cover the view, with getting a light. Since my previous stay at other Hyatt Place was so good, I might have expected too much, this hotel was not bad but I try somewhere else next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed 6 nights at this excellently-located NYC hotel, my new favorite in the city. Rooms on the back side are quiet, I prefer a low floor at this location due to the slow elevators (mentioned in many reviews). It's easy to walk down to lobby/street level from a low floor. Rooms at this Hyatt Place are larger than most NYC hotels, although they are not the usual layout of most Hyatt Place locations with a totally separate living area. The sofa and ottoman in the room make a big difference in comfort. My stay this time was greatly enhanced by excellent service from front desk employee William H. He went over and above to help me several times, especially at check-in. My only complaint from this stay is the hotel has removed the full-length mirror in the room, it used to be on the closet door. The closet door was not there, I thought that very odd. A floor-length mirror is a must in any hotel room, not having one is a problem.I would definitely stay at this property again and do recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location, great modernized rooms, excellent facilities. Compared to others offerings, this was a superb offering. Bed wad comfortable, TV selection was good. Plus great view from my room. I'll be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We've stated several time. The price is right, the people friendly, the breakfast good, the location superior and the hotel amazingly comfortable. Although the hotel is small and the lobby looks a bit crowded, the rooms are spacious and well fitted. Our room had a window replacing an entire wall; it was almost like standing in space. We had a desk, a great bed, and a comfortable bathroom. In short, we had everything we needed for a magnificent price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good location in Manhattan Midtown, surprisingly spacious room with respect to the location, based on my previous experience with other hotels in Manhattan. All the rest is rather standard - breakfast, room amenities, etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed there for 8 nights recently. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Location if intending frequenting Broadway theatre and Times Square area it is ideal. The rooms are roomy for midtown and bed and pillows very comfy. My only minor complaint is room service not available, one has to collect food from reception. This not great after a long flight.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Found this hotel brilliant,perfect for a break in the city . Right in the heart of everything. hotel is very clean. Staff are very friendly and welcoming to the hotel ... Highly recommended.If your on business or a short romantic break to see manhatten then the Hyatt Place is the place to be....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are a little small, but clean and comfortable. Breakfast is a buffet and it can be a bit crowded at peak times. The staff on reception were all very helpful. Good place to stop for a day or two.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For my first time in New York this hotel was absolutely perfect and affordable over the holiday period. We were given a room on a high floor with a magnificent view of the Empire State Building. Breakfast was great every day, they had a good variety of foods and it was complimentary which was even better. They have computers and a printer in the lobby which is so convenient if you have tickets etc you need to print out. We had no problems with noise whatsoever however we were on floor 19 so I'm not sure what the lower floors would be like. Location was fabulous, 10 minute walk to Time Square, 2 minutes to Fifth Avenue and about 5 minutes to Madison Square Garden. Will definitely stay here again next time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was in a great location and the room and bathroom were large. Such a pleasant surprise. Spotless and great front of house staff. Computer in the lobby. No room service but you can order from a menu and come down to the lobby to pick it up. They have a small kiosk in the lobby. There is a restaurant next door with much better prices and a great selection of desserts and dishes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The place is nice to stay but choose a room which is at higher floor to stay away from the noise from street. I wish I could have at least one hot vegetarian option. Also tea or coffee should be served 24 hours but it is not available after breakfast timings.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent staff, clean hotel, centrally located! There are many amenities around the Hyatt to compensate for anything the hotel may lack in the way of extra restaurants, bars, etc. I would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: While staying at this hotel my son and I were bit on our hands and fingers in the room. Not sure what bit us but it was very itchy. Staff were great and nice hotel except for being bit. Not sure if we would stay there again because of this but location, breakfast and staff were great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Centrally located to prime attractions and accessible to the subway, this quiet hotel is situated in a lovely midtown neighborhood surrounded by appealing shops and restaurants. I have recently stayed at several high end Hyatt hotels and I actually thought the service at this Hyatt Place were the nicest most thoughtful Hyatt staff. They were happy to make suggestions and accommodate preferences. I highly recommend this Hyatt Place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is our first time staying at this hotel and we are very happy we stayed here! The location is close to everything, walking distance to the stores for shopping, sightseeing and Times Square. The hotel staff is very friendly and professional. Rooms are very nice and clean. I look forward to coming back in July for a visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
