review_body: I was in New York for my business and I can confirm that it is the right place to stay. Not so big, fantastic staff always helping you for everything. The breakfast, a continental one, is really good and you got a great choice. The room are nice and well cleaned.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is clean and staff is friendly. Do not pay extra for the Empire State Building view, it is not worth it. My view was obstructed by a ridiculously dirty window. The room is a lot smaller than other Hyatt Places and the cost is a lot more. After you factor in all the high taxes your room price becomes astronomical and is not worth the money. For the money you could find a much nicer hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for 8 nights at the beginning of December. We were on vacation, and it was our first time visiting New York. The hotel is situated in an ideal place to visit all the must see places. Around the corner from Macy's. A short walk to Bryant park and the public library. And little bit further to the Chrysler building, and grand central. Broadway and the rockerfella centre 10 minutes walk. Empire States Builidng not far (as you can see from our view from our room). The subway is again, round the corner.Pubs and restaurants on the same street. Mcgettigans good pub and atmosphere. The keg across the road also good. And a lovely Mexican across the road as well. (Don't think it had been opened long.)The room was nice, larger than expected, and the view totally fantastic, we were on the 16th floor, and seeing the ESB from the large windows, just said NEW YORK.. Breakfast was ok for free, mainly had the fresh fruit. The coffee was very good.The staff were efficient, and friendly.Hope to return to New York in the future, and would look into staying at the hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Empire State right out my window. Great breakfast. No one explained how to connect to the free wifi had to ask staff. Very clean and fast elevator. Room very clean and great decor. While waiting lobby bathroom out of oder for two days. I'll be back great service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel location is excellent. We were assigned a handicap room but we werent handicap and they didnt changed it only if we pay and extra $200 a night. Matress was uneven probably because it was a handicap room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Check in was easy and took only a moment, and the staff was very friendly. The room was very clean and well prepared. There was a tiny bit of street noise, but not more than any other place in NYC. Check out was effortless and overall the stay was very nice and economical for a room downtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My partner and I stayed here for a quick 4 night stay just to catch the sights that New York has to offer. The staff were very friendly and the hotel itself was very clean and modern. The room was a good size and very clean with free wifi. Located in Midtown you are ideally situated to get to most of the transport links and attractions in New York, what sold it for me was when we first entered the room and opened the curtains you had the Empire State Building towering above you one block away. It was also my partners Birthday and friends of ours had organised a bottle of champagne to be sent to the room on our arrival which the hotel sorted out without any problem. Directly across the road is an Irish bar which do lovely food and on the corner of the block is a nice Resturant. Just a short walk down the block is Macy's and lots of other shops. I would recommend this hotel as a base if you are sightseeing. If your a smoker there is no smoking anywhere in or on the property and you will be moved out on to the pavement if you smoke on the large outdoor space directly outside the main entrance but that's a small price to pay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was extremely clean and comfortable, and much more spacious than expected for a NYC hotel room. The best part of it was the view of the Empire state through a huge window right next to the queen sized bed. This alone was worth the price! In general, the hotel staff were also very helpful and courteous. One night I forgot my handbag in the lobby (busy texting!) and by the time I got up to my floor, realized and came back down, they had noticed and already secured it. Pretty sure this is not an everyday occurrence in Manhattan. The breakfast buffet was also decent and surprisingly presented much more than the generic bacon-sausage-eggs-hash-browns offerings.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a room on the 14th floor, at the backside, we could see a glimp of the Empire state building! The room was larger then expected an it was quite at night, so you can get some good and needed rest, which is good, because the hotel is in midtown (Korea Town), on stumbling distance from the biggest Macy's I ever have seen and only a 10 minute walk to the Madison Square Garden, were you can see a game of the Knicks, which is a must for all non US visitors, it's nothing like we have in Europe. Time Square is also on walking distance. Basically the hotel is your recovery place, after all the shopping, watch games, going out.The showers are good and hot!The only comment I have is the wait for the elevators, and it gets crowded for breakfast, but the hotel advises you times when it is not so busy. For you short shopping / Site seeing trips to NYC and if you do not want to pay too much for a comfy bed I would recommend the Hyatt Place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It is a nice hotel and we had a nice room. There are just a few areas that need tightening up. Our room wasn't as clean as it might have been. Not dirty, but surfaces coated with dust etc. One day we didn't get a room clean, and when I asked about this at reception instead of an apology I was offered the maintenance man who could take out the trash only. Eventually they located someone who stopped by and did a rush clean. Another day the young lady on reception had a bit of an attitude when I was asking to pay my bill. Other than these small things there really isn't much wrong with the Hyatt. The breakfast room is not big enough, and if you're not down early you will be lining up or going somewhere else for breakfast. Maybe they should look at the 1st floor or basement as a possible solution to this. The hotel is simply too big for the current breakfast room to handle. On the plus side we slept well in a comfortable bed and had amazing views of the Empire State Building. (see picture - room 2201) Hotel position very central. Walking distance to Times Square, Macys, Empire State. Nice little deli next door if you wanted to take something up to the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We flew in on an early flight so reached the hotel way before check in time and were given a room with two-double beds right away at no extra cost (we had a booked a room with 1 king). Location is great, hotel is very clean and the breakfast included in the room rate was great as well! Best part was that the price was amazing for NYC! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this hotel and I highly recommend it for anyone who is looking for a modestly priced hotel in New York City. The size of the room is very small but the layout has been designed so as to make it very functional and comfortable. All of the staff I came into contact with were extremely friendly and helpful, providing any assistance needed. The free breakfast is a wonderful perk. Being located on 36th street, the hotel is very quiet and tranquil but at this same time it is only a few minutes walk from the center of town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is very nice for the price. We got such a great room on such a high floor. The room was very clean and was perfect, the view from the window was incredible, we can see the whole Empire State from our room very beautiful. We loved that they have a little menu that is 24/7 so whenever you want they will make a meal for you. The only thing I would change is the hours of breakfast but that's not a big deal. We would definitely recommend this hotel if your not trying to spend too much money but are looking for something nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a fantastic 5 nights stay at the Hyatt Place. The location is superb, within a few minutes walking distance of 5th Avenue, Macy's Store, Times Square and all of the major attractions in midtown. The rooms and hotel amenities are fantastic, modern and completely spotless - the complementary breakfast was also excellent! Every member of staff tha we encountered were friendly and provided exceptional customer service - this is a really well-run hotel.Although we have stayed in a number of nearby hotels in NYC in recent years, we will definitely return to the Hyatt Place for our future stays.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent hotel in a great location at a wonderful price. staff was welcoming and accommodating to anything we needed during our stay. We had a wonderful time this last week. We will absolutely be back in the very near future!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Superb location. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was basic but more than adequate. It was clean and tidy. Breakfast was good with some better days than others but never bad and filled us well for the day ahead. I would go to this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I arrived here on 5th January for 5nights for my 30th Birthday. Upon arrival we were greeted and checked in within minutes. We had a king accessible room and was 3 of us was very spacious and clean and tidy, only downfall was from nose from neighbouring block. The breakfast was adequate and started the day off well. Location was brilliant was walking distance to most places if not close to a bus stop. Staff very helpful and friendly. I did book through British airways as a package with flights. I would def return to this hotel as the location is spot on.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were more than happy here and the hotel was in a fantastic location. We were given a room with a view of the Empire State Building and when we woke up on the first morning to that view and also snow, I was very emotional.The room was big enough for us 5 as we were hardly in it. It was extremely clean. The breakfast was ok but did get a bit boring after a few days of the same food.I was given gluten free toast which i had for breakfast and then kept some for lunch on the go.I would recommend the hotel if you want a good location and won't be using the room for much more than sleeping.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a great experience with the hotel. Very nice staff, and super helpful. Not a frequent traveler to NYC so staff helped us figure out a few things and did with a smile. Clean rooms and super cozy

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room itself was very nice, with a view of the Empire State Building. The bathroom however was my biggest issue. Urine stain on the toilet and urine still in the toilet from previous guests. Made us question whether it was cleaned. It was nice to have a mini fridge in the room, it would've been better if it actually worked and our food didn't go bad though!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good hotel in a very good location. Value for money and breakfast every day was a bonus and plenty of choice. The staff were so helpful and even let us switch rooms half way through our visit so we could have a view of the Empire State Building. Perfect hotel for what we needed and really added to our amazing trip in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was clean, beautiful view, very convenient balcony, customer service was superb, couldn't have been happier with the location on New Year's Eve, FANTASTIC Deli next door, spacious bathroom, fast & quiet elevators. I would definitely recommend to friends and family

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall, good value and a very centrally located hotel. Staff were very friendly. Beware of crowded lines at breakfast during the last hour as breakfast finishes at 9 am on weekdays. Should really consider extending breakfast another 1/2 hour for those on vacation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here in december 2016 hotel was so nice staff are so helpful nothing to much trouble. Breakfast was great lots to choose from. Every was amazing would definatley stay again roll on 2018 A ******

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Simple and basic hotel, comfortable and quite spacious room with sufficient quality of breakfast and cleaning. The added value was the position, litterally a few steps from the heart of New York. The area also offers a variety of services, including bars, restaurants, banks and shops.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location is great. Staff are happy to help and care. Can't say enough about the staff. Top notch professional caring team! Rooms are as pictured on the website. Clean, comfortable, modern, quiet, updated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, the rooms are noise controlled which feels like heaven after a tiring day. Highly recommended. The staff really makes things special here. We have an small incident and Jennifer follow through days after we stayed until solved. Thanks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights at the Hyatt Plaza. It's not fancy but we got a pretty good breakfast and free Wi-Fi so felt that this hotel was a steal. It's got cafes and restaurants right outside and is pretty easy walk to the Times square area. If you want to go the Museum mile or Central park, you'd have to use the subway. All in all, we really liked this hotel and the very friendly and helpful staff (thanks for the notepads for my kids & the breakfast staff were very nice as well). Would be happy to stay here again. Only downside, the king room did not have bathtubs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent and comfortable accommodation. Hotel was quiet and clean. Great overall value for New York. Staff was pleasant and courteous. Centrally located and accessible to all modes of transportation. I would highly recommend for families or business travel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A wonderful place to be, this is the only location I care to stay the location is near all of the local artractions, the ease to walking and the subway...you must visit to enjoy. Thanks for a beautiful time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is not a fancy or luxurious hotel, but gets the job done in a clean and efficient way. I stayed for business and was in and out. The bed was comfortable, room was on the large side, and 36th street is relatively quiet at night (especially on a higher floor). The free breakfast was fine for a grab and go and it was nice to be able to easily get a tea or coffee. (It's mostly egg sandwiches, bagels, cereal and oatmeal). I would stay again if my usual spots were booked or too expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed this hotel and its location on our first NYC trip. It had family-friendly rooms to sleep 6. The staff was extremely helpful and kind. We couldn't have asked anything more from a hotel for our family. We will definitely return. We appreciated that we could book a car to the airport at the front dest, at a very reasonable price (wish we'd known that before we booked a bogus company from the airport).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booked 4 rooms for 2 nights for 14 ladies. We were charged for a 5th room. The hotel can't seem to figure it out. Thank goodness for American Express. Multiple calls to the hotel has not produced results. The hotel cannot find the transaction even though they were given the transaction numbers. You would think resolving an issue for a client spending a couple of thousand dollars would be a priority.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here during Christmas and New Year holidays. The best place of this hotel is location. It's at the center of subway connection so you can go almost anywhere in Manhattan. Macy's store is very close. Times Square is short walk. I loved location even though it's a bit crowded with lots of tourists. Hotel is good, similar to Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express even though they try to create better breakfast by having semi-open kitchen serving freshly cooked omelette or french toast. During holidays, breakfast area is too jammed. They have no quick snack bags or hot coffee at the lobby like Hampton Inn.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was clean and had a sofa which is rare for NYC. It was a great location, close to shopping and short walk to time square, Madison Square Garden, Rockefeller Center. Complementary breakfast was the what is expected at a Hyatt Place along with the free wifi in guest's room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location was perfect! Not too far of a walk from Grand Central, Broadway, and right around the corner from Macy's. A staff member at the front desk gave us directions on how to use the subway and we successfully made it to the Twin Tower Memorial (and back).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A great place to stay where the staff are very friendly and is situated not far from herald square. When I come back to New York this is where I would like to stay again. The complimentary breakfast does get busy after 9am,get up earlier!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 4nights for the Christmas. Great location close to the Timesquare and subway. Room is small but clean, we cannot get wifi most of the time in the room. but the signal is strong at the lobby. long waiting for the elavator in the morning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our family of six stayed at the hotel over Xmas. We chose Hyatt Place as it was one of few places that could accomodate our family in one room....We checked in smoothly and were given the card to our room. When we opened the door we were a little dumbfounded...even though the hotel states 6 in a queen room, there was no way that it was going to work for us.The room had 2 queen beds and a pullout sofa bed which had about half a metre to spare before it hit the 2 queens and zero space for anyone to walk along the side of the sofa bed. Not only was it extremely tight sleeping wise, there was NO room for our six suitcases....and I mean NO room. After about one hour sorting with reception and them coming to see the room with suitcases piled on the beds, they agreed there was no room and posed a safety hazard.Eventually, and thankfully, the solution was to room us in an accessible room. The room was a really good size and we all fitted well.The breakfast each morning was laid out well and a good variety. It does get very busy however and during that peak, lacks seating.All in all we received good service from the staff, breakfast started the day off well and we found the hotel to be in a convenient location (an easy 2-10 min walk to Macy's, Penn Station, Times Square, Bryant Park)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great place to say in mid-town. Rooms are not large but manageable. Close to a lot of places like Macy's, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc... I'd stay there again. The free breakfast is just OK....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: From start to finish a great experience; allowed early check in on a bad travel day; great location;caring staff...good value with free breakfast...great service at less tha half the cost of the Langham around the corner

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great place to stay while in NYC. The middle of everything. Wonderful value for your money. Free breakfast was a bonus. The room was big and clean for NYC. Staff welcoming and helpful. Looking forward to our return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great stay, loved everything about the hotel, great price and very convenient location. Asked for high floor, and was given it. Floor to ceiling windows made it even better. Customer service was great as well, and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here from Friday 9th December for four nights with my mother. Upon check in, the staff didn't appear very interested in their guests. However, as the days went on, other staff were courteous and helpful. Upon check up, I paid cash. And thought nothing more if it. The problems started when I got back home; my debit card was declined as I tried to use it to finish off my Xmas shopping and grocery shopping and pay bills. It appeared the hotel "held" my card for the full duration of my stay. I called the hotel and the staff were not at all helpful or concerned that I had no access to MY money. The girl said it would take 3 to 5 business days to transfer back to my account. Day five is now here and I still can't access the money. Christmas week, bills to pay etc and I'm left emptied handed because of Hyatt Place Hotel inadequacies. Waiting for a response!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staying at this hyatt was our first time but not our last. The location is excellent within walking distance to many attractions. We loved how it was off the main roads and tucked in so it allowed for privacy and tranquility. Staff super friendly, rooms were spacious, super clean, beds and linens wonderful! Excellent quality for the price and the best part is waking up to being able to go down for breakfast without having to pay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After reading some of the reviews I wasn't sure what this hotel would be like. But I needn't have worried it was absolutely faultless. The room was great with wonderful views of the Empire State Building, very clean, comfy beds, lovely bathroom. The breakfast was wonderful, with plenty to choose from every day even for a fussy vegetarian like me. The staff couldn't do enough for us during our stay, so helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. When we asked for more milk, coffee etc,, within a few minutes someone would bring them to our room, very impressive. I've had to wait much, much, longer in a higher star hotel and sometimes even been forgotten. I would highly recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again any time. Well done Hyatt Place

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very impressed with the hotel including the great room with incredible view, fabulous breakfast that was included every morning and the location. The staff were very helpful and caring. We will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Absolutely great place to stay when you are in NYC as this hotel is so close to many great tourist stops. The rooms are great, the breakfast is satisfying and the hotels staff are very personable and absolutely wonderful. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I came to NYC with 2 friends and we were able to stay in this centrally located hotel with a great view. I work for a Hyatt Place in Florida so I was able to get a really good rate. We asked for a room with a great view and were pleasantly put on the 25th floor with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building. Our whole stay was very good, housekeeping was great every day and the staff is friendly (one gentleman in particular was a big help, I forget his name but it starts with an S and he is very tall). There was a good variety of food for breakfast, and their breakfast sandwiches are really good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Comfortable hotel in great location! Room was fairly large (particularly in comparison to others in NYC). Hotel was close to many of the local attractions with a subway within two blocks. Because of the location there was a great deal of traffic noises which could disturb a light sleeper. That seems to be the case with most hotels in NYC! We always want comfortable beds and seating in room as well as good showers. Hotel excelled in all of these areas. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was my first stay at a Hyatt Place and boy was I pleasantly surprised. For a hotel in this category in NYC, the room size, including the bathroom area were exceptionally large. The staff was well-trained, pleasant and helpful. On my scale,all this rates a 5 out of 5.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We booked our stay at this hotel in January (For end of Nov for a week) and in March I contacted customer services asking if it was possible to be given a room on one of the higher levels with a good view out the window. My response was quick and I was kindly told me my request has been added to my reservation. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were given a room on the 5th floor. We explained we had contacted CS in March but they knew nothing about it and the 5th was the highest floor they could offer but if we came back down in the morning once some people had checked out, we may get something better.Our first night, at the front of the hotel was a very noisy, sleepless one but thankfully we ended up with a nice quiet room on 24th floor with a fantastic view of the empire state building out of our window - huge thank you to Tamon for sorting that for us! (We think that was his name!) The holiday wouldn't have been the same if we hadn't been moved so we really did appreciate it.I'd like to add here, this wouldn't stop me from staying again but I do feel that customer services shouldn't say something has been added to my reservation if it hasn't - or if it had then it should be made clearer for the hotel to actually see it.The room was nice and modern, bed and pillows were very comfortable, nice big TV, free wifi and the power shower was fantastic.Breakfast was a mix of hot and cold, our first few days we really enjoyed it (the egg and bacon muffins, yummy!) but the last couple of days not so much (not keen on those sausages and I'm afraid! and there was less variety of fruit).. But it's free which many of the other hotels don't offer so can't complain. They had English breakfast tea which was really good to see. The lift was slow when busy but we also noticed it would get stuck in one place a lot - don't know if this was the cleaners keeping it there or someone messing about but it got frustrating.Hotel is in a fantastic location, plenty of shops, restaurants etc within walking distance. Bryant Park, Macys and Times Square all very close (highly recommend Bubba Gump!). We even walked down to the Brooklyn bridge and into Brooklyn one day! There is so much to see on the way to everything, you don't realise how far you're walking.. Our phones tracked that we walked over 50 miles that week!Hotel booked us a taxi back to the airport, was told it was a fixed price ($62) and included everything.. I asked if this included the toll etc and she said 'yes, everything' but the driver wanted more once we got there. Thankfully we hadn't spent up and were too tired to argue. It was a really nice car though - not a yellow cab.I didn't realise until we got home that Hyatt have hotels around the world; would I stay here again? I wouldn't return to New York (it was a fantastic holiday but we done everything we wanted to) but I would stay with Hyatt again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is always full regardless of the time of the year. Had to wait for three hours at 10 am after a red eye flight from SFO before I could check in. Hyatt Place's rooms at other properties in Chicago and CA have larger rooms with a couch and seating area, table, chair and larger bathrooms. However, this is Manhattan - the rooms are much smaller - more focus on functional aspects of the room - less on the aesthetics. The room though was one of the smallest I have stayed in. Small tiny closet. If you have too much luggage, it may be an issue. Otherwise, the room comfort and value for money considering the absolutely brilliant location is unbeatable. If you are looking to enjoy New York and are seeking a comfortable stay without a huge hole in your pocket, this is it. If money is limit and you are looking for fine dining and an uber luxurious stay, look at the Hyatt Andaz instead.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great value for location. The Hyatt Place is on a side street from Herald Sq. and Macy's Easy access to subway entrances, not too far from Penn Station. Room faced street, a bit of noise but not obtrusive. All staff members are helpful and pleasant. Go to the complimentary breakfast early or face a big crowd later.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was clean. The room was on the street side close to the ground floor so it had the associated background noise one would come to expect when being in a big city, No complaints though, we slept through the noise. Location was excellent for our needs. Right in the middle of Manhattan at the base of the Empire State Building. (a block away) The staff was accommodating, they did nothing to make the stay extraordinary, but was enough. Breakfast was typical American breakfast fare. Bad coffee, eggs, sausage and cereals. All in all, I would stay again if the price is right (as it was the first time)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hotel was very clean and the staff was always friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. The free hot breakfast was a huge bonus. Location was central to access many of NYC's top destinations. Would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After checking into a horrible hotel down the road, we found this Hyatt.. the Hyatt was clean, rooms where nice and modern, and the staff was friendly and inviting.. it's in a good location we an easy walk to some of the sights

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast food was adequate. Location was good with ten minute walk to Times Square and the Empire State Building was two blocks away as was Macy's. Central Park would be a good thirty minute walk and the Rockerfellar Centre twenty minutes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We've visited NYC before and stayed at the Wellington. In comparison, the Hyatt Place was more modern but I preferred the location of the Wellington. The rooms were clean and the beds were nice. Breakfast was ok...only eggs and sausage as hot options on the weekend. The service of the cleaning staff was good but the reception staff were vague and lacked interest. On arrival they said one of my cards had been declined, so swiped another - turns out they took a reserve payment on both cards. No one was able or willing to try and fix this which limited my spending whilst in the city. Also a wake up call wasn't processed as requested. Overall the stay was fine but I'd recommend the Wellington over the Hyatt Place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Arrived here at 2pm and got checked in right away. Reception staff was very friendly and helpful. Requested a twin room and the request was accepted and we even got a room with a view of the Empire State Building which was lovely at night. Rooms were a good size ours had 2 double bed and a sofa. we had an issue with our tv and they sent a mainenance man straight up to fix it. Bathrooms were spacious with a good shower as well. Continental breakfast was included and was great to have that in the morning before heading out. the choice of food was good as well but it got quite busy the later you went down. The location was great as well tube stations close by and right next to Bryant park as well. Times square was a 5/10 min walk. I would definatly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Always a great location and facility with great staff! Great quality, great staff, great location being convenient to subways, theatre district, Times Square, restaurants, Bryant Park and Herald Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I loved the hotel. We are going to stay there again when we return to NYC next year. Rooms, service, food were all excellent. Thanks!! The location was also perfect. Just down the street from Macy's and Herald's Square. Easy to get to other main attractions like Time's Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt place with my aunts and 2 cousins. I admit I was a little apprehensive about sharing a room with four other ladies. I need not have worried. 2queensize beds for the relatives and I slept on the super comfy sofabed. The staff gave us a warm welcome,were very helpful and on hand the whole time. I woke very early on the first morning and was really pleased to find complimentary coffee available,which I enjoyed in the relaxing lobby. Breakfast was excellent,a good array of items and each day a different hot option. I really enjoyed my sta y and my first trip to New York was fantastic. I definitely plan to return to the Hyatt Place with my husband,I know he would love it too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Pros: Convenient location easy walk to bus and train stations. Excellent customer service. Got to the hotel before 10:am and a room was ready for us. However because the room was on a lower floor, we asked for a higher floor to avoid street noise. It would not be ready until later, so they stored our luggage. (They also held it after we checked out). Our room ended up having a fantastic view of the Empire State building. The desk was very accommodating. We came in later one afternoon and wanted to buy some bottled water, (at $4. a bottle), they gave it to us instead. Room was size was adequate, considering it was in NY. Our king bed was comfortable, the room was quiet and at the end of the hallway. Only 8 rooms on a floor. Bathroom was small but clean and updated. Breakfast had usual continental fare, 2 kinds of scrambled eggs (plain and one with red peppers, spinach and cheese) and fresh fruit. Cons: Small crowded lobby that does not encourage sitting, (suppose that is good for security). 1 bathroom in the lobby, and not on a "pretty street".  Good value for the money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have been to this Hyatt the first week of December for the past 4-5 years. We love staying here. The room is clean and plenty big for just 2 of us. The bed is quite comfortable. We also enjoy the convenience of having breakfast there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a fab hotel. Our room was at the front of the building and whilst a tad noisy, was a great size, immaculately clean and very comfortable. It was ideally situated for all the local attractions. 5th Avenue, Madison Square Gardens, Macys, Empire State, etc etc. Would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights the hotel and staff are amazing nothing is to much trouble staff will help with directions and print them off for you . Also helped when my phone would not log in to there wifi . Rooms are large and the bed is very comfortable room was cleaned everyday .Breakfast is included hot and cold choices really good and sets you up for the day Hotel is central to everything . They also booked us a car to go back to the airport Can't wait to return next year wouldn't stay anywhere else

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you're looking for the best spot to do a walking tour of nyc..look no further.Stayed in one room with my family of six.A bit tight, but it worked.Would give 5 stars, but breakfast was kind of lame.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel, clean & tidy which is what is needed in New York when not much time is spent in your room. Breakfast was a good start to the day, but most of all the location could not be any better with great surrounding restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Went on our honeymoon, booked over 5mths in advance, ended up in grotty front room that so needs updating, dirty tiles in bathroom, grout worn away,with builders opposite who woke us every morning at 6am! food awful and plastic cutlery and dishes was unexpected for the price we paid!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have been here with my daughter since 1st December and we check out today.The hotel is lovely. Our room has a huge king size bed which is so comfortable and a partial view of Empire State Building.Choices at breakfast are delicious. Always hot and cold foods to choose from.Staff are so helpful giving directions and printing them off for you.I wanted a particular present for my 12 year old son and they even searched the computer for that and I got it in Macy's.You are about 10 mins away from Bryant Park. 15 minutes to Rockerfellar Centre. And about 20 minutes to Times Square.Penn Station is near and we used that to get down town.I will definitely use this hotel if I come back to NYC and I would definitely recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is situated in Mid- town New York and within a fifteen minute walk to Times Square and thirty five minute walk to Central Park. Empire State Building is two blocks away and Macy's one block. We bought a three day New York pass expecting to get priority on queues, just be careful - at the 911 Memorial Museum we got into a priority lane and got our admission tickets only to be told we had to join another queue that took us another hour to gain access. Do your research before purchase.Breakfast is complimentary with a good selection of food to set you up for the day. Rooms are an adequate size but the bathroom floor was not very clean with hair left on it.Staff friendly enough and some good eating places within easy reach.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I found this hotel to be extraordinarily attractive, convenient, comfortable, and accommodating in every respect. It provided us with a large room with every appointment that one could wish for including a sleeper sofa in addition to two beds and a refrigerator. The staff was exemplary in its friendliness, efficiency, and desire to help in any way possible. I can only give this hotel my highest recommendation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed 2 nights at the Hyatt. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. The breakfast has good choices, is tasty and of course seating can be a challenge because it gets really full. And during the breakfast rush, the elevators are full and take forever. My room was clean, however it was a bit small. The closet was narrow. Minimal amenities, there was no body lotion or shower gel. I didn't like that there were no curtains. The hotel is ideally located for the parade, which passes right on the corner. It was not a bad for a short stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location to Madison Square Gardens! Macy's, Times Square...food food food! Close to many Subway Lines. Within walking distance of 5th Avenue shopping. Nice brisk walk up to Central Park. Too close to The Empire State Building! Don't forget to check out Bryant Park for some unique shopping at the Market Stalls, also incredible food Stalls as well!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Recently stayed 11 nights at Hyatt Place, the location was perfect. Room on the 20th floor offered a great view of ESB, with 2 double beds and a sofa bed for the 3 of us,and street noise was very minimal. Bathroom offered a bath/shower combination. Housekeeping were very efficient, always our room was made up early. Breakfast offered a good selection, we never had to queue or wait as we went around 7.30am. Only had a couple of times where we had to wait more than a few minutes for a lift. My mother, daughter and I really enjoyed our stay, the value for money is excellent, and we would recommend and stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I asked for a quiet room on a high floor when I arrived, and they upgraded me to a delightful room with view looking south. It was spacious, clean, attractively furnished and well lit. Bathroom was good, too, although I think Hyatt can do better than MADE IN CHINA toiletries--personally, given all of the health scares and scandals in China, I'd never use a Chinese made toiletry on my skin. But the room was charming, and the best was when I returned from dinner and went to close the blinds. Standing by the window, I had a view of the Empire State Building at night that took my breathe away. Just spectacular. Staff were friendly, efficient and helpful, too. Will definitely make this my NYC go-to hotel, especially since room rates were remarkably reasonable and location is so good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We arrived at the hotel after a long journey from London at around 1330, the weather was poor but the check-in was quick and easy.The room was good for the 4 people (2 adults and 2 children) as it had 2 double beds and a sofa bed, although not much space left once the sofa bed was down. Disappointingly as we were on the 8th floor the view was only of a wall of the adjacent building. The location is very close to the Empire State building in one direction and Times Square in the other, a short walk to many bars and restaurants. We found this locations as a base for site seeing very good.Some issues were the breakfast room is small and a large queue can form, also returning to the room from breakfast is difficult due to capacity of the 2 lifts being relatively small for the number of floors in the hotel. On the day of departure we waited 10 minutes for a lift to take us to reception. The hotel uses a local taxi company but it seemed that they do not have many taxis as we were quoted a 45 minute wait for a cab to the airport on departure, we ended up hailing one in the street,Overall a good hotel for a family stay at a good price. For our return in February we will however be staying at the Hilton and requested a higher floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have gone to NY many times and thought we would try this Hyatt. Very small rooms, very noisy, could hear all the street noises from the 12th floor...didn't even use the shower bc it looked gross. No valet parking as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were in NYC for Thanksgiving and booked Hyatt Place on a whim. Turns out the hotel was around the corner from the parade route. Small rooms but friendly staff and very clean. Great breakfast. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and went to visit his sister who was very ill and we stood in the city for 2 days at the Hyatt Place on 52 W 36th street. Our room was not ready till around 6 PM so we went out to eat after a long travel day. when we returned to the hotel Mabely was very professional and brought out our stored luggage and we went to shower and rest.The shower head was broken and only dripped water out and we were desperate for a good shower...I called Mabely and she quickly sent up Franny who replaced the shower head and also fixed the television which was not getting any reception. After our maintenance scenario we kicked back and got up early to start our day. The hotel was packed so we had a quick coffee and off we went. When we returned Mabely was not in yet to thank her for quickly handling our room issues. We did get to see her later that evening to thank her in front of one of her fellow workers. Though I wanted to share this experience from 11/18/2016-11/20/2016 with the hotel management so they can realize the talent who provides diamond class service to diamond members. Sincerely, Rose Lee & Joseph Di Capua

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Checked in yesterday. Gallery host yawned openly when we approached her. Wifi was difficult to connect and you need to connect on a daily basis. Today, my room wasn't serviced. Gallery host was very skeptical when I told her I did not have the DND sign on. I shudder to think what is going to happen for the next 13 days I'm here. Small room plus terrible service. Really regret booking this place. Extremely disappointing for a Hyatt. Don't waste your time. Stay in the Holiday Inn Express next door.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is near everything in Midtown Manhattan as it is on 36th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue. Friendly staff and luggage room. Helped us with luggage needs on checkout day. The breakfast room is great. Very modern and great choices of food and coffee, tea, etc. This is a great value for NYC in that it is included with your nightly room cost. Clean rooms. Stayed here for two nights and would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in November 2016. Very convenient location in Midtown Manhattan. But more important, the staff here is wonderful. The rooms are very clean and the facilities are very nice. Highly recommend this hotel if you're going to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was so clean, neat and the location near Herald Square and the subway was fantastic. The breakfast was a value alone for NY and the area is so accessible. Our king room was huge with a couch and massive TV. The shower and pressure was amazing. Honestly my go to is now Hyatt, they are pretty consistent everywhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is what makes this hotel a contender. It's not very far from a lot tourist attractions. The service was okay. There was a snafu with booking but that can be attributed to the website. The covers didn't smell very good and there was no tub in the room. Overall the location was pretty good, the rooms were clean, the free breakfast was awesome, and the value wasn't that bad.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have just returned from a 5 night stay and couldn't fault the hotel. It's located close to lots of attractions and if you couldn't reach it by foot there is a subway station at the bottom of the road. Would stay again if we come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This updated hotel offers a great location, clean room, helpful staff, and a good breakfast. Rooms are not big, but have everything you need. I truly enjoyed this hotel. Workout room could use a tune-up (machines weren't working) but still nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've checked out 18 days ago. Still trying to resolve the issue with the credit card funds held by the hotel. Eight days ago I wrote feedback and received an answer that they will contact me in 2-3 business days - nothing! 20 mins ago called directly the hotel - after waiting about 10 mins and trying different extensions (answering machine is their strong side) the operator who answered me could not assist me and told that he is redirects me to manager - after redirecting the call I've reached the answering machine. The funds are being held and after you check out no service available. Stay away from this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good overall hotel , convenient location , and very friendly staff. Breakfast menu offered plenty of choice. Nice to have fresh towels every day. Beds very comfortable. No negative comments to make.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is a fantastic hotel located in the heart of Midtown right behind the Empire State Building and an easy 5 minute walk to Times Square and Broadway. Overall everything about our stay was excellent. After taking an overnight flight across the country we arrived in New York early in the morning and were able to check straight into our room (which was an absolute blessing considering I had 3 tired young children who wanted to freshen up before a big day exploring the city). The room itself was a really comfortable size and easily accommodated the 5 of us. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best we had on our 4 week stay in the US. The staff were also overly helpful and friendly, even providing me with assistance to locate a launderette that was open late one evening. I would hapily stay at this hotel again next time I visit New York and would highly recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The great service began at check in as William was very engaging and friendly. I was offered an upgrade, city view which delivered a great view of the Empire State Building. The hotel is located very close to a subway stop, restaurants. The property is close enough to Times Square but far enough away. I had the King Room with Sofa (no sleeper sofa) by NY standards the room was somewhat large. I didn't feel cramped as i would at many other NY properties. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location walking distance Madison Ave, Madison Square Garden & Empire STATE byilding. Delicious free breakfast with eggs, fruit and several options. Highly recommended will stay here again. Best value

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent rooms, almost all with very good views of the city. The hotel seems new, and is in very good condition. Very good breakfast, excellent choices and very tasty. The staff is amazing, very professional and so nice. I will always stay here when I'm looking for a hotel in midtown Manhattan!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here during the NYC Marathon along with many other runners. We had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed the interactions with all the other runners and foreign visitors in the common living area, dining room, and elevators. We arrived at the hotel extremely early due to our red-eye flight from California. We took the A-train from JFK/Howard Beach and got off at Penn Station. Our room was not available yet since it was sold out, but the host at checkin was extremely welcoming and offered to hold our bags and invited us to join them for breakfast! After breakfast, we started to explore the City.Location:The hotel is conveniently located. Easy walking distance to Time Square, Empire State Building, Penn Station, Bryant Park, Grand Central, and Broadway. The expo for the NYC Marathon took place at the Javits Center which is just a 1-mile walk along 36th.Hotel:The hotel is clean and includes breakfast. Keep in mind the breakfast hours. We noticed a few late comers surprised to see breakfast ended at 9:00am on weekdays. The dining area is awkward and can be difficult to navigate through when crowded. There are 2 elevators that can get claustrophobic and move at a snail's pace during high traffic breakfast time. A fitness room is also available in the basement.Room:Comfortable size considering you're in New York. Bed was extremely comfortable. We were offered a high level room which had some view of the skyline. I've heard there are some with views of the Empire State building but those are more highly requested. You will hear a lot of NYC noises and sirens at night, but that will be true with any place you stay in the area.Conclusion:Next time we come back to NYC, we will definitely consider staying here again. It has an ideal location, comfort, and an exceptional staff. The front desk is always smiling and welcomes us every time we walk through the doors.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff were pleasant . Room was nice ans spacious . The breakfast selection needs some help not much choicea and the fruit was mush. The buffet on the corner of 5th looked amazimg is recommend to eat there if staying here

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had 11 people staying in five rooms for five days and were delighted with the quality of service, the cleanliness of the rooms, the sunny attitude of the staff, and the overall atmosphere throughout the hotel. The location is excellent for access to Uptown, Downtown, and Brooklyn. There are many good restaurants within a block or two. Breakfast was good for the price. Other guests were friendly. Children enjoyed it. Everyone from the general manager to the maintenance man went out of their way to be helpful and follow through on promises promptly and efficiently. We will stay here the next time we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We went for a 3 day weekend vacation. The location was great and the hotel was fairly clean. But we had problems with the service. We originally booked a double for 4 adults and we got a king size with a sofa. We asked to change it but they said they didn't have any. After 10 of arguing they said that they had one with two beds but they had to charge us $250 a night. We finally gave up and went to sleep on the couch. Early in the morning, after the second night, we discovered that we got bitten by bedbugs! Immediately we pack our bags and run out of that hotel. We did not have a place to go, but on my phone at a coffee shop, I got a nice hotel for $150 to stay our last day in NY. But the damage it was done, we were itchy for several days. It was horrible!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a great hotel for my overnight stay. Very clean rooms with friendly staff and reasonable rates for NYC. The breakfast was great quality with ready made items as well as prepared items. It was in walking distance of Penn Station

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As always GREAT stay. LOVE this hotel and the people. LOVE the Hyatt experience! Staff make you feel very welcome and look after you. Rooms are large with the extra sofa for additional space. Breakfast improvements were welcomed-more choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a great stay at the Hyatt Place Midtown/South! Was located close to Time Square, Broadway, the subway, shopping, etc. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and as always, the bed was extremely comfortable. As with most NYC rooms, it wasn't huge however it was big enough. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location, the hotel is very clean and modern, the free breakfast was nice too. The staff were excellent from the time we got there to time we left.I would defiantly recommend this hotel and i would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was great and the staff super friendly and helpful. There are several restaurants for lunch and dinner within walking distance. The rooms were clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was an added plus, although it was a bit crowded if you didn't get there early. I would stay here again, for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Amazing location for walking, shopping, sightseeing or taking public transport. Had Empire State Building outside our room window every day. Good room cleaning staff. Efficient front desk with plenty of help for us. Cheap food next door and usual quality food every where.Sometimes breakfast was packed up 30 minutes early, but when asked they came back out with some food as we wanted to keep eating after waking up late.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place great location for getting around NYC. Staff were very friendly & helpful throughout stay from check in to check out rooms were clean beds were comfy & overall better than we expected. Breakfast was buffet style & while good choice hot food was more warm than hot but overall was fine. Hotel accommodated luggage on day of check out until we were ready to leave for airport would definitely recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was unusually large for the city with a sofa, fridge, and desk. We also enjoyed a very large picture window with a view, also atypical in the city. The free breakfast is always a plus but the service is where the hotel really separates itself. The staff really goes the extra mile to make guests feel welcome and comfortable. Thanks for a great visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here with my partner and 4 children last month. Initially, I was pleased that we had found a room to accommodate 6! However, on arrival, the room was just too small and led to having to jump over things, as well as small injuries from the fold down sofa bed. The sofa bed hadn't been made up, and it took 3 requests, and one night of being very cold for us to get any extra blankets - and blankets are all we got!I was disappointed with housekeeping, as we were there for 7 nights, and the room wasn't cleaned/dusted properly in that time. I could run my fingers through the dust on the tables. The bath also wasn't cleaned in that time. We also came back to our room one evening to find the door open.The breakfast also appeared to be something that doesn't usually happen in NY but unfortunately, it wasn't very nice, and we stopped going after the 3rd day.On the positive side - the location is great, and we had an amazing view of the Empire State Building from our room. We stayed on the 18th floor, and had no noise from outside at all. Room sizes ok if not using the sofa bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Found out about this little boutique hotel and spent a memorable night! We were able to us our Hyatt Gold Points and just put in for a little fee to complete the transaction. It was in a terrific location, walking distance from Penn Station. Upon a smooth check in we walked to everything. The Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center, caught the Christmas holiday show at Radio City and even got over to Birdland, the jazz club over on the west side. Since it was a Monday night, all Broadway shows were closed and all the talent was there for an open mic night. Enjoyed it all!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This modern hotel is tucked on a cross street in mid-town Manhattan, not large but well-designed with rooms that are quite spacious, new bathrooms, all the amenities you might need. Desk staff - couldn't have been nicer, more helpful, friendlier - helped with everything from taxis to the nearest drugstore. The only slight disappointment was breakfast, which was quite mediocre - although the coffee was good.Excellent location, and reasonable rates.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Ideal location and good hotelJust remember there is tax added to each night you stay and this was not included in our original price - this cost us a further £650 for a 8 night stay Would return again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The first positive thing about this hotel is its location and that is all positive that I could explore during my stay in June 2016 in New York City.The hotel though very well placed in the heart of New York's vibrant 36th Street and being stone throwing distance from major attractions, lacks guest engagement and proper travel and concierge desks.The house keeping is rude and even if there was an extension for us with the check-out time,they had no co ordination, and we faced an awkward situation as they tried to open our room while we were inside.This was completely unacceptable if I am to believe of the brand value that Hyatt attracts globally.The morning breakfast area was chaotic and dirty with people all around grabbing and running for food.The sitting place was also not well managed.Last not the least on our departure date, we didn't get any help from the hotel to get us a private car or taxi to JFK and we had to run across the street to grab one.The front desk could have been more customer friendly and may have been involved into a high level customer engagement.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for 6 nights in the hyatt and the hotel was really in a good location just steps from the subway, shops and restaurants. Room was spacious and clean, quiet and bed was really comfortable. I just didn't like the breakfast at all, typical american food with powder egg, frozen hotcakes and waffles. Good to have cereal, fruit and excellent coffee, maybe use real plates and glasses because the use of plastic supplies is awful for the environment at that rate. Overall a really good experience in NY at an affordable price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very clean and well managed hotel in Midtown. Free breakfast is a plus and well done. Front desk was friendly and helpful, Provided very good map of Manhattan. For quiet ask for a room in the back. We had room 2204 which had a view of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well placed, easy to get to from Penn Station so no difficulty in getting to and from the airport. Moderate size lobby though not very comfy. Although it was after 4pm when we arrived many rooms hadn't been serviced and the lobby was quite full of people waiting for rooms. This did affect us on 2 occasions when we returned to the hotel late afternoon, after 5.30 and our room had not been serviced. Not good when you want to rest and freshen up before dinner. We requested a quiet room but ours on the 9th floor did get noise from the building work opposite early in the morning. Room was very comfy however, good size with all the amenities we needed. Check in staff were ok but nothing special but breakfast staff were great and worked very hard. Congratulations on providing gluten free bread!! Very slow elevator. Overall thought hotel a little expensive for what it was, but I have to remember it is New York. I may be biased too as we had just arrived from Washington and the Park Hyatt there would take some beating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good job! Comfortable rooms and very friendly staff. 2 blocks from Empire State Building and 1 block from subway. Breakfast was good! Staff was very helpful when asking questions about subways and directions. Overall great experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In New York for business I looked for a hotel to combine work and pleasure. The location of the hotel is perfect! I was impressed the most by the quality of the bed. I cannot recall sleeping in a hotel on such a comfy mattress. The room was big. Having breakfast from styrofoam plates is not what I expected and would seriously advise to change

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff very friendly, comfortable bed. Hotel needs some up keeping. Refrigerator made noice all night long. The street noise kept me up and we were on the 21st floor breakfast was not as good as past visits

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a great place to stay for NYC. The location is spot on as Empire State Building is a couple of blocks away and just a quick walk to Times Square. The room is comfortable with a sofa to relax on, super fast wifi and tea and coffee making facilities. There is heating control and air con which is good and the bed is really comfy. Bathroom had a walk in shower with toiletries and towels changed everyday. The rooms were cleaned every day. Free breakfast was spot on with a good variety of food and drink. No queues when we were there and easily found a seat. You just need to be patient. Front desk staff were extremely helpful and approachable. Oh and the two lifts in the hotel served us well. We were on the 16th floor and we never had to wait too long for one. Finally along with the lovely staff I found the other guests from around the world and of all ages friendly which made the hotel feel like a safe environment to stay in for our break. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is the second time I've selected the Hyatt Place Midtown. It's the perfect location to get to/from all the hot spots in NYC! Easy walk to the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, the Theater District, Times Square, and Penn Station/Madison Square Garden. To get to Battery Park or the 9/11 Memorial I recommend the Big Bus. The Big Bus allows you to hop on/hop off at several stops you might not have checked out otherwise. The hotel is clean and also includes a nice breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All of the staff, especially Andrea were exceptional!! She was very helpful in helping us to know where to go and what to do. Very friendly and a pleasure to deal with. Also, we had checked into our room and discovered that the bathroom ceiling was leaking and maintenance was there immediately to put us in another room. Such great service!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Manhattan Hyatt place on 36th street was THE PERFECT place to stay. You are near several subway stations and within walking distance of many attractions. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were very good also. The skillet breakfast sandwiches were warm and good. Some days the sausages and eggs were room temperature and not very edible. However, overall a fantastic place to stay for first time visitors to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just returned from staying at the hotel , room large spacious with fantastic view of Empire State Building ! Our room was on 18th floor , family of four , room more than met our needs , large comfy beds , rooms cleaned daily .Complimentary breakfast was great and variety of hot and cold options available , free wifi throughout which kids were happy about !! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful at reception but must mention that all staff we came across from start to end of day were friendly in all areas of hotel . Location is spot on for access to all main attractions and subway is close by , which is very easy to use , can't wait to return and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a central base for exploring New York with added bonus of excellent hotel staff

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you want to be in a good location for tourist hot spots, this is a good choice. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Empire State building and really close to the subway. The rooms are a good size for NYC and ours was completely silent at night. The only reason I'm not giving this hotel a 5 star review is due to the breakfast situation. Yes, they warn you about queues for the breakfast so you can avoid them - but the issue I had was not simply with the quality of the breakfast, but the fact that it is served on non-recyclable plastic covered paper plates, which are then thrown out. In my opinion, if you are going to put up a sign in the bathroom saying that you are an eco-friendly hotel, so please reuse towels (which I'll happily do), please use plates and a dishwasher for the hundreds you serve every morning. I understand many of you reading this will think this is a minor point, but I think companies such as the Hyatt need to be leaders in this area, and I was disappointed to see the hypocrisy at work here.Nevertheless, I would recommend this hotel for its location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I really liked this hotel. Great and extremely friendly Staff, Great location. My room was spacious and very clean! Loved being able to pop downstairs for a very nice complementary breakfast (that was very yummy) and free wifi was a plus! I will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: One of the few places in New York we could get two Queen beds instead of two full. We were able to walk easily to Macy's and Times Square. We had an upper floor with a view of the Empire State Building which was just two blocks away. Very cool. Staff there seemed to really care whether or not we were enjoying our stay and even sent cupcakes to our room when we mentioned we were there to celebrate my mother's birthday. Rooms are small but that is typical in NYC. Hot breakfast included scrambled eggs, pancakes, fruit and yogurt. Would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is the 2nd yr in a row that we stayed at the Hyatt Place for New York Comic Con. We love the cleanliness of the room, the great free full breakfast, and the ease of checking in with our Hyatt points. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is basic but clean with lovely sized rooms. We were on the 14th floor but could still hear the music from the bar over the road, not too much of a disturbance for us as we were exhausted every night so slept like a log anyway. Having only 2 lifts in the hotel creates big queues and waits on a morning, breakfast is ok with a choice of fruit, toast, scrambled eggs but we chose to eat out a couple of times instead. Location is great, literally a couple of minutes walk from Macy's and not much further to Times Square. It's on a busy street with several nice bars and restaurants, would highly recommend Keens which is almost next door, you have to book as it's very popular. Would give Trade in the opposite direction a miss!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great place to stay near Time Square. This was our second time to stay here, and we would gladly stay here again. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to New York. Very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location in midtown Manhattan. Wonderful Hyatt beds! Front desk staff customer- service- oriented and helpful in assisting with directions and subway use. Free breakfasts had a lovely selection of hot and cold items. Incredible views of Empire state building and observation deck on 26th floor with views of city on three sides.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: An excellent value. Great service. Quiet rooms. Free breakfast is a nice feature. Food quality is so/so, but it's free! I would highly recommend this hotel to someone looking for good value in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Upon arrival booking cancelled as credit card had expired since booking. We're given a room with the same facilities we originally wanted. 25th floor with Empire State Building views amazing. Staff very helpful and friendly at all times. Ideally located to all facilities, attractions, shops and tubes. Hotel clean and tidy and facilities very good. Hot and cold eat as much as you want breakfast. Had a thoroughly enjoyable stay and could not fault anything. It's a shame we had rain and low cloud that affected our views from the top of the buildings. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff were so welcoming at the hotel. I was very late down for breakfast one morning (after our daughter's wedding!) but the young man in the breakfast area went out of his way to make coffee, toast bagels and obtain a bowl of fruit for us. The hotel was exceptionally clean throughout. Rooms are a good size for New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Couldn't have asked for a better hotel. The location was perfect, 5 minutes from Macy's, 10 minutes from Times Square, it was very central. The room had a fabulous view of the Empire State Building and the bed was so comfy! Breakfast was an added bonus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall it was good except the sheets had stain on it. Other than that the hotel was not bad. The location wasn't too bad either. The bathroom was clean which is a big plus. Front desk was very friendly and courteous

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I will stay here again. Great location, very clean and looks new. Free breakfast was delicious. Room was spacious, AC quiet and cool. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Easy walk to herald square, perfect location between 5th and 6th.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Every time I stay at this Hyatt Place I have an incredible experience. The bed is comfortable and the room has a lot of space for NYC. The service is great and everyone makes sure that you're comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is located close to many sights in Manhattan. The breakfast was very good. The room was small and not up to the usual Hyatt Place standards. Our room did not get cleaned and we had to ask them to clean it so we could have fresh bath cloths and have the garbage emptied. They offer a travel service to the airport or other places but it is expensive. You can find your own transportation for less. Oh and if you use travelers checks....they do not cash them and did not know of any place that would cash them!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good quality of everything. I recommend it for your visit. We were six people in one room. Rooms are not spacious, so if you want to spend more time in the room, pay extra for space. Great breakfast and very nice staff. Great service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were put on a 4th floor location facing the street. When I inquired about the occupancy they said we have a lot of room. Maids were friendly, room was clean and efficient. Front desk was hit and miss some helpful some oblivious. Asked for them to call a cab for a 5 AM departure and they declined. Breakfast included but we walked next door because the buffet at the hotel was abysmal.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Convenient to Madison Square Garden, The Empire State Building, Macy's and more. Staff was friendly and helpful. Even though we arrived ahead of the official check in time, instead of just storing our luggage, we checked right in and within minutes were in our room. Our room was clean and quiet. Loved the breakfast!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I judge a hotel primarily on room and staff. From check-in to check-out, I had a great experience. Andrea who checked me in was efficient, gracious and incredibly polite and helpful giving me a great room with an early check-in on my phone call as I was walking to the hotel from Penn Station. She even offered me a non-alcoholic beverage. I also was offered a late check out which allowed me to make my 1 pm tour of the 911 Tribute Center and still get a shower in before I left on a 5 hour bus ride back to DC. In fact, I literally entered the hotel at 259 pm after my tour where Michael renewed my entry card in the event it expired before I got to the room. He also provide good nightlife directions the night before. The room was clean, spacious (for NYC) and I had a great view. The hotel is perfectly located. In short, Hyatt Place knows how to treat its Platinum guests. Would gladly stay there again and recommend to friends and family!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed in hotel for 5 nights... Is in a good location for getting around the city. Rooms and hotel are okay, probably needs a Wee update but nothing wrong with it. Free breakfast... Always good. Staff were helpful and very welcoming.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I really like this place and this is a follow up review as I had a chance to visit again this past week. The staff has always been great and incredibly helpful. Housekeeping is very good, the room, for a hotel of this type in Manhattan, is of a decent size - and every room seems to have a couch, which I have found is not necessarily the case is many NY hotels. The only potential downside would be if one of the two elevators should be out of service, which sometimes happens - but I have to give them credit for quick repair and an ability to manage that situation if it occurs (which it did.) Breakfast is sufficient and they are good about posting times to avoid lines. I would definitely stay here again - and the location for public transportation can't be beat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt is in a good location, close to Times Square. We were able to check in early on arrival which was great. The double room was quite spacious and well decorated. Breakfast was ok, but ridiculously served on plastic plates and cutlery. For me that doesn't make sense at all, especially as it doesn't seem to get recycled. And it's not very nice to eat from. So next time I'd probably skip the breakfast and go to a nice restaurant in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great value for the $$. Location is hard to beat and the staff are fantastic. The rooms were clean, quiet and the beds are very comfy. My only (tiny) comment is that the breakfast is a little repetitive. I would absolutely stay here again and I will definitely recommend to friends and family

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms are very clean and the hotel staff is friendly. The location is close to the main attractions and shopping area. Breakfast is included which eliminates a need for morning hassle and finding the spot to eat as soon as you get up. I would highly recommend this hotel to all visitors to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed in this hotel recently, and found it to be a gem in the heart of mid-town.
