From the very start with the welcome of the entire staff, in particular Andrea went above and beyond what we expected. Great service, friendly and welcoming staff. We're Looking forward to our next visit to NYC and will be back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located near Herald Square where you can take a lot of subway trains to get you where you want to go fast... walking from the hotel to Times Square is no big deal either. Very good beds, clean bathroom, friendly staff, breakfast is good and tastefull Would recommend !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As a tired tourist traveling across the country via train, I look forward to settling down and putting my feet up in a hotel room. This particular hotel exceeded my expectations when it came to the relaxing environment. My room (which was surprisingly small) had ran outstanding view, and the assortment of hot beverages found in the room was a pleasant surprise for a coffee/hot tea aficionado such as myself. I slept soundly in the pleasantly soft bed, and the HD tv kept my interest through a long night. The staff here was especially courteous, and were friendly and helpful through the night. The continental breakfast satisfied my cravings with delightful French toast, and it was nice to have a coffee shop downstairs, even if the drinks were overpriced and took awhile for the employees to make. I left my hotel room for a five hour tour, and when I returned around 4:00 PM, I made a rather unsettling discovery. The maids hadn't even even touched my room. The garbage was still there, as were the wet towels and unmade bed. Seeing as I paid a hefty sum of money to stay here, it disturbs me that the maids didn't even think about giving my room a quick tidying up. In all, this was a good experience, though the carelessness of the cleaning staff underwhelms me greatly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Front desk staff had noses in computers and never greeted guests as they arrived or departed. Seemed to forget that without guests there would be no hotel. Breakfast room was a disaster: crowded, unsupervised, chaos. Rooms were small but nice enough, quiet for NYC, nice beds.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The check in was he fastest ever and my room was ready early so we got to go right up. The location is great and room was bigger then I expected for NYC. Free full breakfast buffet was a nice bonus. Parking close to hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was our 4th stay at Hyatt Place and we were very disappointed to experience a decline in service obviously due to cost-cutting measures by Hyatt. There was less food selection, utensils (plastic), poor seating and not enough staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is well located but not luxurious. The lobby is simple and very nice, as are the rooms. Staff is helpful and courtious. It comes with a very well appointed breakfast bar--lots of choices of both hot and cold foods--in a spacious breakfast room. About 6 blocks from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent two nights at this Hyatt Place property and couldn't be more pleased. The rooms were clean and relatively large by NYC standards. They also include the little extras that you don't normally find in a NYC hotel- free breakfast, coffee/tea in the room and a fridge. The location is so very convenient. However, the best part of this hotel is the outstanding staff. Everyone went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect. The manager, William, and the entire front desk staff were exceptional. We had a small billing problem which was corrected quickly and pleasantly. I cannot see ever staying anywhere else when in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: we stayed at this hotel for 9 days. Its literally a few blocks away from the empire stae building.The hotel staff gave us a room with an amazing view of the empire state building. We are a family of 6, 2 adults 4 kids. The room size wasnt bad. Two double beds and a very big sofa bed. The room was cleaned every day by the housekeeper.The breaskfast was good for my children each day ranging from bagels, to scrambled eggs, cereal, fruit etc.Though they did ran out of english tea on the 3rd day of our stay!Round the corner was macy which was fab for me. Theres a lot of restaurants nearby and you wont say you cant find anything to eat in the early hours as there is a mc d nearby. But there are plenty of other options than mc d!!!The station is nearby too so its a plus to stay here.Car park was expensive in new york i can stay and the hotel has a car park 3 building on your right.overall i can stay our 9 day stay was superb.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The front desk personnel were very courteous and helpful. The room was essentially typical on NY...small and limited. However, the small space was modern and clean. The location was fabulous...midway btwn Times Square and Madison Square Garden. I am a New Yorker, and I know how midtown traffic can be...so it was a pleasure to be close to the Lincoln Tunnel...straight shot to the NJ Turnpike. Breakfast was ok...oatmeal, eggs, toast, cereal, frenchtoast and limited fresh fruit. Thought there would be a waffle maker, but no. Parking is just a few doors and within a short walk. Overall I liked it and would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Idea location for sightseeing or work-you're near the subways and trains and even airports-you can easily connect from the Long Island railroad to the Air Train. Hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful. Rooms are not huge but not cramped. Unless there is an event going on in the city, rates are usually extremely reasonable-especially considering a full breakfast is included. There is even a small gym so no excuse to miss out on your workout.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location in Manhattan.. Front desk service was superb in meeting my needs during my stay. The complementary breakfast was extra ordinary.. would stay again at the same location next year. Never thought my Hyatt Gold Passport membership would value so much during my stay at this Hyatt Place location..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was perfect. I normally stay at the grand central station location but this one was amazing also and it provided free breakfast! Hotel was clean and staff was great! I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is in a great location near enough for Times Square walking distance but far enough away from the mayhem. Comfortable bed, good shower, safe, hair dryer with tea and coffee making. Breakfast had plenty of choice. Staff friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We wanted to stay in the city and this Hyatt turned out to be the best. From their location to the check in, everything ran smoothly and we were happy with our choice. I highly recommend it. The room was spacious, bright and airy, bed extremely comfortable and I wouldn't mind returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Like the Best Western, Holiday Inn Express beside it, the Hyatt Place Midtown South is a simple and functional hotel, good for a moderate budget NYC trip. The location is pretty good, and close to Union Square and Koreatown. Breakfast is included, though not many choices, but a good selection of hot and cold items considering that price of room comes with it. There is also Starbucks coffee. Room wise, pretty good size for NYC standard. The bed is comfortable and room has a view of parts of NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Located on a block with many other chain hotels, and plenty of free parking in the street the weekend we were there. Great location but not much else to recommend it. Room just OK, free breakfast not inspiring....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel, well located and equipped. We had a quiet family room with ESB view :), our preferences were taken into account. Complementary breakfast is good (even though a lot of people in the peak hour) and service is excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was on the smaller side and that was a good thing. Located close to Penn Station. Great complimentary food Skillet service to guests. The hotel stay was wonderful. The rooms and the view were awesome. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friend staying in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location (better than Times Square which is just too busy!). Perfectly located for subway station and several attractions in walking distance - Empire State is two minutes away and 34th street shops & Macy's in your doorstep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A hotel which doesn't burn a hole in your pocket and is within walking distance of many favourites including Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue, Grand Central, Madison Square Garden etc. W34th street subway (and Penn) are close by to help get around as well. I chose a high view room with a view of the Empire State Building. Free wifi throughout. Staff are lovely and very helpful. Nice Irish pub over the road where you can view some international sporting events on TV. I didn't go to the buffet breakfast often, but I appreciated it was there if I wanted it. Airport shuttle dropped off and picked up at the door. Definitely will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well designed rooms, large comfortable beds, good lighting and a great shower. Last minute rate was very competitive. Staff extremely friendly and helpful on arrival. Well thought out concept. Breakfast buffet is fine, stops at 9.00am.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We loved everything about this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fantastic. Something for everyone. Even the coffee was good which is rare in most hotels of this class. Room was clean and comfortable. Location was perfect. Close to the subway, Times Square, fifth avenue and so much more. Would stay again for sure. Parking was pricey but that's New York for you. Oddly enough we had only booked on Thursday and we extended our trip and stayed another night and got a lower room rate for the second night which was a Friday. Not sure why they couldn't adjust my rate for the first night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good price and great location. Don't expect luxury but the rooms are average, clean and comfortable. The breakfast isn't delicious but was included a sensible. Great place to use as a base and see New York! I don't think I would stay here again as something a bit more fancy would be nice but it serves a purpose for those on a budget.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We love to stay at a hyatt hotel, and this one was also a great place to stay in NYC. The room is fine, clean and modern. It is close to to midttown. It's nice to have breakfast at the hotel. The staff was friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were very happy with our quiet room. Our King Bed was very comfortable. Location was very close to Macy's and a movie theatre which we walked to. Right next door to the hotel is a NY deli and more. Everything we needed was in walking distance. The staff were excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is in a great central locations. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows so there will be at least some view; some rooms have Empire State Building views. Rooms are in good condition, excellent and very welcoming staff, and a really good (free) breakfast. Overall fantastic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location. Lovely staff. Clean. Comfortable bed and pillows. Affordable price. I highly recommend this review and will dfinitely come back. Good breakfast. The location is fantastic. Close to main attractions and subways.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hyatt is clean, offers a wonderful included breakfast, and treats its visitors with courtesy and personal attention. It is a top value in the Big Apple. Dolce, one of the front desk hostesses is especially wonderful. She made us feel like we were at home and gave us very special attention. Dolce is a terrific lady! P.S. Spectacular views of the Empire State Building, really spectacular!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located on 36th Street within a few blocks of Penn Station. The room was small and minimalist, but clean. The hotel offered free wifi, but had troubles connecting. The hotel only had 2 elevators servicing 20+ floors. The staff was all very pleasant and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a large family group so the flexibility of the 2 Queen Beds + double sofa bed allowing up to six to sleep in one room was great for a NYC crash pad. The folks at Check-in were also accommodating with an easy 1 hr early Check-in and storage of suitcases, etc. The room had a view of the Empire State building (despite not paying for a ESB-view room at $130 extra).Negatives: Missed breakfast which finished at 9am on weekdays - fairly early. Parking was an eye-watering $40 a day (with the discount) and the cushions (pillows) smelt awful. I'd like to say this was an exception but with 7 pillows in the room all smelling like mould - this severely impacted the quality of our sleep. The blackout blind was also broken - meaning we woke up periodically from 5am onwards despite a late night. Bathroom also had a leak from the water feed into the cistern.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice property, easy check in and they let us in an hour early. Good breakfast with lots of options. Super location, near subways, restaurants and shops. Vibe of the area is good for all folks. Intl. flavor. Room blackout drapes are perfect. Rooms on corner w/king are very comfortable. Note they only have 2 elevators which happen often in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you frequent Hyatt Place locations often, you will feel very at home here. They run a very nice hotel here that is a Hyatt Place through and through- but located in the city. Rates are very competitive, I imagine they want to sell rooms not keep rates high during low occupancy. So yes you may even get a great deal for Manhattan. I will gladly return, but yup, lots of choices in NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel. Definitely upscale for a Hyatt Place. The view was amazing, the Empire State Building was so close it felt like you could reach out and touch it.   The staff was very attentive. The only downside was that the workout facilities were closed while I was there, but they provided access to the gym at their sister facility (Hyatt Herald Square) which was only one block away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very pleasant and helpful staff. Check in promptly and get a bottle of water for free. Checkout was also very quick, they arranged for transport, provided advice about activities. Great breakfast. Would strongly recomend and return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: hyatt on 36th street between 5th and 6th is a good deal, plus a good deal more! excellent value for the location. hotel is just over three years old and our room still looked brand new. 25th floor view of high rises to the north is constantly changing with new construction in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was our 3rd trip as a family. This hotel was perfect. Very close to major attractions and all major subway lines. Also close to Penn station for EWR connections. The best part was the breakfast which was very good both in terms of options and quality. The price was also very reasonable for a 2 queen bed. The room was a bit compact but the beds were big enough to fit 5 of us and the bathrooms were well maintained.I would definitely pick this hotel for future visits.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My experience with New York City Hyatt Midtown/South is always something I look forward to when I visit NYC 2 to 3 times a month. They recognize me by name upon check-in, which process is always quick and efficient. My Gold Passport membership affords me a high floor room which is almost always ready for my early arrivals. The room is always clean and fresh. The staff is very attentive to any needs, from the receptionist to the housekeeping staff to the staff in the restaurant where the complimentary breakfast is served daily. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We decided to stay in NYC for our anniversary and act like a tourist for a change. We live in NJ. Anyway, one of the gentlemen on staff gave a great walking tour of mid-town from Herald Square to Madison Square Garden. We learned some great historical information about NYC and we have lived in NYC/NJ for the past 14 years. Anyway, the gym is nice, the location is a great proximity to Times Square. The breakfast was ok but the best part was we had the best view of the NYC skyline. It was a great way to spend our anniversary.
user_location: Highland Park, New Jersey, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had five in our party and got two Queen beds and a sofa sleeper. Nice accommodations for a party of five in midtown Manhattan that didn't break the bank. They offer a free breakfast which is okay, nothing to write home about, or on Trip Advisor, but it saved us some money eating out. Our room also came with a small fridge/freezer which was nice to put drinks in after a long day of sightseeing. Parking is very close and you do get a small discount on the parking for staying at the hotel. The only major issue I had with parking was it's a one and done type thing. The parking was based on 24-hour and we parked on a Tuesday night and wanted to use the car on Friday, but were told if we pull out that ends our stay. To get back in the clock starts all over. We wanted to put some luggage in the car and do some sightseeing but were also told if they pull the car up its out of the garage AND we couldn't go to our car to drop anything off. Hyatt should have provided us some indication of this, as along with the Queen beds, and the breakfast, we selected this hotel based on the website that stated "Parking Available".

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Visited with family (kids14,12,9). Location is perfect - close to Macy's, Times Square and subway (closest station is 34th herald square) etc. Room small as you'd expect but enough for five, v clean and amazing view to Empire State Building (we were on16th floor). Only criticism is breakfast was a bit of a scrum - it fills a gap but don't expect amazing food or a sense of tranquility. Worth considering for your trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved staying at this hotel. Comfortable, classy room on a very quiet floor. Awesome bathroom and fantastic bed/couch. I also liked the window shades. Quiet central air conditioning (no noisy wall units like other hotels in NYC!). I enjoyed the breakfast, particularly the juice choices and the vegetarian egg sandwich. The granola and cranberries were also tasty. Very helpful and accommodating staff. The neighborhood is pretty hectic, but its in the middle of everything, so it's easy to get around the whole city. I personally prefer quieter and more beautiful neighborhoods, but if you are stuck in midtown, this is a great bet. There are also complimentary walking tours offered some mornings, such a cool perk!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It is a good place and the location is great. Close to transport, Macy's, Madison Square Garden, etc. The room are quiet and you don't feel the noise of the other guest, I was in the 11th floor and I listen sometimes the rubbish truck so if you can book a higher level it could be nice. The staff very nice and speak English and Spanish....so my mum didn't need my help there. The only negative point....the eggs they use in the breakfast are box eggs which is very unusual for me so I skipped eggs for those days. I will book that place for my next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for two nights in the heat wave of August 2016, and gratefully, the AC was nice and cold. We were on a high floor facing away from the street, which made it quiet. In walking distance to Times Square and a plethora of restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It was very nice. The room was spacious and comfortable. The linens were very nice and I slept well. Room was very quiet . The staff was very friendly. I went for a trade show so I did not spend much time in the hotel. The breakfast was nice, good coffee helped start the day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Both my stays here have been business shared with a bit of free time. I had friends or family join me and the first time it was just after my birthday-I was welcomed at the Front Desk with Birthday greetings! Nice surprise! We had a room with an amazing view of the Empire State building in all its splendour and enjoyed the hotel with all its assets! This latest stay was a saving grace from a terrible experience with another hotel. The manager, William, made every effort to accommodate us so that we could come and stay and be taken care of. This hotel is perfect for the Fashion District business; shopping after hours; dining and a short distance away from shows. Staff are ALWAYS EXCELLENT. Rooms are airy and full of light. GREAT breakfast too! AND they have a little hidden bar which Tamon is there to serve you at!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room we booked was pretty big for New York. We had comfy beds and also a fairly big bathroom. The view was towards the back but we were able to see the top of the Empire State Building which was lit up some of the nights. The breakfast is okay, enough to get you started but not too fancy. The breakfast room is always packed around 9 a.m., so go before that. This hotel has great service. The staff is very friendly and helpful. One day was our birthday and we were surprised by the front desk staff with a plate of appetizers and wine.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: RECOMMENDED GOOD CHOICE: Week in NYC, this was our 3rd hotel and the best of all yet. Near Penn Station, easy access to major subways up or downtown. 36th St relatively quiet with a number of similar looking hotels (all mostly new). We previously stayed at the Executive Hotel Le Soleil New York next door (which I have a poor review to). Contrast since both hotels have similar floor layout.Check-in was super fast and friendly staff. Our King Room was on 23th floor (floors only have 8 rooms each). Stunning view (see pic) with floor to ceiling windows. Very bright. Very large for NYC standard. Plenty of room for 2 people and include a couch. Windows relatively soundproof (this area of town has lots of construction). Bedding comfortable, plenty of lighting, desk area workable (not large but enough and well designed). Bathroom was large walk-in shower and in good repair. AC worked well and was quiet and not drafty. Internet speed (free) was excellent. Business center had super fast printer and easy to quickly print out boarding passes.Breakfast was included, nothing special, there are plenty of places to wander to in less than a block, but on a cold or rainy day a nice touch.Overall, very positive hotel and I would look to re-book here on a future stay. Hyatt knows how to run hotel properties and it shows.Note: 26th floor has open terrace (no food service), but nice view of Empire State Building. Please don't ruin this treat view by being a bad guest making noise or being a stupid tourist (otherwise the hotel will lock the doors).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for the Independence Day holiday weekend and had an incredible time! This is one of the few hotels in NY that has rooms which can fit a family of 6 people, but does not cost an arm and a leg. The room was a bit worn, but very clean. We all loved the breakfast everyday and the staff throuhout the hotel was fantastic (housekeeping, front desk, breakfast, EVERYONE!). Even before we arrived the staff was welcoming us which made the city less intimidating. The hotel was great and opened the roof for the 4th of July fireworks which was a great bonus since it was a bit rainy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I would not recommend staying here. For $500 plus this was small old and the view was terrible. . I would believe most hotels in there area are the same.. Very small land uncomfortable. Met a couple from Switzerland and they agreed they would never come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location and great staff, but it's a dirty, tired hotel. The staff was great overall and tried hard. However, the rooms, hallways and bathrooms are dingy and dirty and the bathroom smelled like mold or mildew or something. Will not likely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My Wife and I stayed here for 3 nights, everything we expected, staff were a bit robotic but maybe that is what they are trained to do. Rooms were clean and turned over to very high standards. Location is fantastic so close to everything. We will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I love to travel to new places and it is my job to handle the lodging and logistics. New York City has too many choices. But I got very lucky when I picked the Hyatt Place in Midtown. They made sure our trip was a success. And the location is perfect for Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Thank you Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved my stay at the Hyatt Place, as always! The staff were Super Nice and Quick. The hotel was very clean and well maintained throughout. My room was AWESOME with the best bed and pillows the Hyatt is known for. Easy access to internet! What more could you ask for? Awesome night!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is a perfect hotel in all aspects. The location is amazing. It is walking distance to a lot of sight-seeing places in Manhattan. Also close to bus and subway stations. Lot of places to eat nearby.The room is clean and spacious. It is well arranged and has all basic requirements. Choose a higher floor room for lower noise and better views. The bed is comfy and the sofa is a big plus. The fridge was a bit noisy. The LED is huge! I enjoyed watching all my sightseeing pics on the LED by connecting my pendrive. Breakfast is delicious and filling. It is changed everyday. It has hot and fresh items too, apart from the regular bread, fruits, cereals, coffee and juices. Their donuts and croissants were freshly baked and yummy! The earlier one goes the less crowded it is in the breakfast area..The wifi is good and reliable. There is nice connectivity all over the hotel. The common space outside the hotel is also good to hangout. It would have been great to have a open space on the terrace as well to enjoy the views of NY. Overall, Hyatt turned out to be the perfect hotel! I would definitely go back to Hyatt on my next visit to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location to immerse in all NY has to offer: Museums, Broadway, Brooklyn, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street and more. Hotel is conveniently located near subway stations and places to eat all day & night. I combined a business trip with a family vacation and everything worked out perfectly. Room is small for a family of 4, doable and fun.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square. It is also a short walk from Penn Station. Nearby are many eating places offering a variety of cuisines at different price levels. Macy's and other shops were nearby.The staff were friendly and helpful. We arrived before the check-in time at 3 pm. They kept our bags while we explored the area. The room we had on the 10th floor was a corner room and was spacious. It had a pullout sofa bed. The room was clean and pleasant. The bathroom had a shower stall with a shower curtain. However, using the shower resulted in the jet of water splashing onto the floor of the already small bathroom. Having a glass door would have helped.Breakfast was complimentary and was adequate. It is advisable to go down earlier as they don't seem to replenish the food closer to the end of their serving time. There are only two elevators and they are very busy during this time resulting in long waits.Wifi was complimentary but the password changed each day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've been at hyatt for 22 nights, quite some time. Fortunately, I felt like home. The room was very good, clean .... However the cleaning ladies are not that good. They've changed glasses...Breakfast is good, nothing luxurious but it does its job, very crowded though.Staff is great and very helpful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place NY Midtown South is located near shopping, transportation (subways, Penn Station), restaurants, theater, and bars. Our room was a generous size s compared to most NYC hotels in and above this price range, and wi-fi and breakfast were included. The staff was helpful, nice, and professional. Great value. I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location was perfect and close to everywhere we wanted to go. Easy access to subway, clean rooms with a great view. We were only there for one night and for the price this is a really great place to stay. Will definitely stay again though I did have some concerns. There was no lotion in the room and we called down twice and were told both times that someone would be up.. never happened. I went to make a cup of coffee machine was really gross.. I mean things floating when I poured water in. Needless to say.. did not use it. They should check the in room coffee machines. Also one of the elevators was not working which was an inconvenience but not really their fault. All in all, I would stay again...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent hotel! Easiest check in and check out I ever had at a hotel. Room was ready when we got there. Clean, comfortable, great room and view for NYC. Manager reached out to me days before arrival to see if I had any questions or needs. Will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful location with an easy walk to Times Square, and even easier to the world famous Macy's and a very versatile Subway station.The rooms were clean and well-appointed. Bed was a very comfortable King in a good sized room!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a very nice hotel. It had more square footage than a lot of other hotels I viewed. I liked that it had a fridge in the room for drinks. The hotel staff (Andrea) was very helpful in recommending where to eat, traffic, transpiration, etc. I would def stay there again. There is also several bars & restaurants very close.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was greatly impressed by the unblocked view of the Empire State Building from my 23rd floor room window and the hotel offers a very hearty daily breakfast. Near to train station which is just round corner.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent 6 days at the Hyatt Place Midtown and it was great. The staff was great (Kamesha was amazing, the room was clean and the breakfast was great. Thanks you for an awesome stay. At the end of the day it was great to know we had a nice place to relax. Location was great to get to everything. We would highly recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Right in midtown Manhattan near transportation, shopping , restaurants, and theater district. The room was big by NYC standards and the staff was very professional and helpful. And breakfast and WIFI were included! Hard to beat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Although rooms are not huge the employees treat you in a fantastic way. They're warm and helpful. You definitely feel at home. Breakfast is good (nothing special to report). Went there mostly on winter and its location makes it perfect for a first time in NY. Is not expensive but it could be cheaper.
user_location: San Nicolas de los Arroyos, Argentina

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Clean, Affordable, Convenient. Great hot breakfast (if you get there early) that included juice & coffee. Friendly, professional staff Great view of the Empire State Building. Everything within walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at several Hyatt Place over the years. I'm usually a Marriott guy but decided to try this spot because of the location. Great choice! From the moment I arrived the Gallery Host was super nice and helpful. I expected a smallish room but was surprised at the roominess. Great flatscreen and a nice couch to relax. Excellent king bed with the best hotel pillows ever. Bathroom was modern and clean. The free breakfast was great both days and boy can that save you some cash in NYC! I will return for sure and highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: very cold and unwelcoming staff, unhelpful most of the time. we stayed there for one night in a double bed with sofa, the overall room condition is good but I did not feel comfortable interacting with staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed a few nights. Basic Hyatt Place. Staff was very friendly, was very accommodating for delivery food. I skipped the breakfast so can't comment.Hotel was clean, bed comfortable. Only complaint is the elevators were often slow or backed up.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I and another couple were going to New York for a few days and I was the one to find a hotel. We've stayed in Hyatt Places before and always found them to be very good and they included breakfast and wifi which is a plus in New York. Our friends had a car and the hotel offers parking at a garage on the same block which is cheap by New York standards. You have to leave your car in the garage but who needs one there. The rooms aren't that big but they are nicely laid out and we had enough room to lay out two big suitcases on the floor. I have stayed in smaller rooms in the city for more money. The location was great for us. It's in walking distance of the theaters, stores, restaurants and many sightseeing opportunities. The free breakfast was good but the first morning there were so many people eating breakfast at the same time that the lines stretched into the lobby. The hotel was perfect for this short visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very convenient area with plenty to do around the hotel and easy access to many of the well known spots. Staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Hotel lobby was always cleaned and well kept. The rooms were very nice and not those tiny rooms you usually get in New York. Very spacious

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice rooms with nice furniture, very clean. Excellent staff. Nice breakfast! This location is convenient to Times Square, Broadway shows, Empire State Building, and lots of restaurants. Pricing is very good for this city!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good, modern hotel, with very practical rooms and perfect service. Very convenient place to stay at if you need to be midtown New York and fancy Hyatt chain and its perks. Nothing fancy nor exciting but very practical indeed to enjoy the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: What stands out at this place are the staff members who work at the front desk. They have bent over backwards to make me feel welcome and to look out for me. They work in a cramped space but are never anything but enthusiastic and happy. I have been shown great concern on two occasions when I am sure I looked like I barely managed to drag myself into the lobby. On top of that, the rooms are very comfortable and just the right size to feel cozy but not boxed in. The room air is spot on whether it is a/c or heat. The bathrooms are commodious and I like the walk-in shower stalls with the adjustable shower heads. I also love that WiFi and breakfast are included. My only quibble with service is that breakfast is understaffed, which ends up meaning food and utensil items run out. The breakfast area is a madhouse thanks to the clientele. The only other problem is the room rates are only worthwhile if I book short notice or get some other kind of discount. The regular advance rate is about 40 percent more than my budget.
user_location: East Greenbush, New York, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everything from the location, staff, amenities to the rooms were great! Highly recommend this hotel. The staff bent over backwards to welcome us, answer questions, point us in the right direction and anticipate our every need. Could not get a better location. Close to everything. If you have a car, parking is easy and affordable in the garage virtually next door. Room was keep very clean. Great room servicing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location: right next to Times Square, Macy's, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, NY Public Library, Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden... Etc. if you want to see the city and don't mind being right in the thick of it, this hotel is for you.Services: good sized room, comfortable bed, clean and modern feel.Breakfast: yes, you get breakfast! So you can't complain... But you could say there is some room for improvement there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location minutes away from everything you might want to enjoy in NY City. Nice price to value received, especially in NY. Staff was extremely warm, welcoming, friendly, helpful and went above and beyond to make my families stay enjoyable. Breakfast was tasty and satisfying. Parking was accessible and affordable for NY City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We found the staff to be wonderful - professional, helpful and caring. The room was recently updated and perfectly situated in midtown - not too close to the Times Square, but still convenient to the subway and Penn Station. Room was large and well-appointed. Breakfast was decent and the price of the room was great. BUT, there was lots of construction going on - street being worked on and 2 high-rises being built across the street. Noise not a problem until 7am (presumably, loud construction can start early in the morning). Bring earplugs!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room smelt a little musty and the breakfast options were not all that great. More fruit should be available. But the location was great lots of place to eat or relax and watch sports if your into sports.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I selected this hotel for my family trip and was looking for a room that would have accomodated 4 adults and a child. Based on the reviews, I booked here. The room was not at all what was advertised. Super small and not like what I have seen in other Hyatt Place locations. However, the price was reasonable and the location really good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great little hotel, rooms clean and moden. Breakfast available and very good. Staff friendly and approachable. Would stay here again. Empire State Building around the corner. Easy walk to Times Square but not sure why you would bother.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was very nice. The staff was very helpful. It was close to subway transportation. The breakfast was amazing and free. It was in walking distance of many attraction we wanted to see and experience while in New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed 1 night and therefore its ok. At arrival it was fully booked and I got only a room on 2nd floor towards the street. Pretty noisy at night.Room with Kingbed was not spacious but ok. Good bed high Comfort. Bath small with a shower which is great as I don't like to shower in a BT,Gym is small but in good condition. Be early (I was at 5am) or it might be crowded.Breakfast was good except srambled eggs. Guess they were made of powder not fresh eggs.Fresh fruits, juice, baggles, Joghurt all what you want.Friendly stuff but a high floor is recommended.I think Price was too high for what you get. But its season and they were sold out...I would choose a different hotel next time in town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel provided everything we were looking for. Location was great. Rooms were clean. Service was exceptional. Surrounding pubs were quaint. We felt very safe at this location. I will be staying here the next time we visit the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed overnight for a mini-vacation. Hotel is in a great mid-town location near major NYC attractions and has easy access to subway lines. Discounted parking next door was a plus. Staff could not have been friendlier.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Having 2 queens and a sleeper sofa was great, allowing our adult children to each have their own bed. There was a little problem with getting the room we had reserved so thanks to Andrea for going above and beyond to help us with that! Rooms were very comfortable and having breakfast every morning was a definite plus. Within walking distance to most attractions and the subway. Would recommend to others!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Exellent Hotel !!!fantastic location, Right in the center. Midtown Manhattan near Empire State Building.Courteous and efficient staff.Large spacious room. Pleasant Lobby. Nice breakfast. free wifi.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Business trip to New York City and first time at this particular Hyatt Place. Looking at the hotel from the street, not much to it, just like most hotels in New York. They just squeeze another 26 story hotel among all the other buildings. You cannot even see the hotel if you stand at the end of the street. The front lobby, not much to it. Front desk person… she should have been doing the dishes in the back or emptying the trash cans. I am not kidding you, this person only words to me were “id and credit card”. Nothing else. Good thing she wrote the room number on the key card envelope. Where do they find these people anyway???? Oh well…. The room, on the 25th floor was great. Excellent view of the Empire State building from our room. Room was large (by New York standards), even had a couch, coffee and refrigerator. Things I have given up completely from New York hotels.The hotel does not have pool, but it does have a gym. They also have a free breakfast, not cooked to order, but they do have hot items. The food is average. Being New York, expect large crowds at breakfast time. So pack your patience or take your breakfast to go.There is a bar, kind of… you must go to the front desk and ask someone to get you a drink… really, not kidding. The Best Western right next door has a small bar with a bartender. We actually went there for drinks. Much nicer and relaxed.The best part about this hotel is its location. 15 minute walk to the Flatiron building, 15 minute walk to Times Square, and it is right next to Macy’s so lots of shopping to be done. And of course, right next door to the Empire State Building.I have stayed at a few New York hotels (see my Yotel review for where NOT to stay) and this is a nice, decent hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Really a terrific place to stay in NYC. Very close to subway stops, Penn Station, and only 6 blocks from Times Square. Great shopping and food within walking distance. Staff at hotel was professional, friendly and very helpful. WiFi was great, room was pleasant. We enjoyed our stay very much.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A modern hotel, close to center, close to herald square and shops. There is a good concierge service and valet parking. Breakfast is included in price. We had a double bed room which was comfortable . Room equipped with flat screen tv and fridge, mini bar. Cleaning of the room was good on a daily basis. Mattress and pillows were confy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very convenient location, easy accessibility and easy to get to Penn station. Make sure you get your free bottle water and ask for a room away from 36th ave. People on the whole were friendly, this is our second stay at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and two teenagers stayed here for 4 nights. Perfect location, good size room which was cleaned well everyday. All staff were very friendly and most helpful and polite. Nothing was too much trouble. Decent breakfast with a good choice every day and lovely coffee!For a noisy city, we found the hotel very quiet and we slept like babies in big comfy beds. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: we cannot find negatives to say about Hyatt Place.We were travelling on my points to NYC and I would have expected some kind of recognition. No minuspoints, it just struck me, but I would have expected another greeting.Room was OK (every room in NYC is small, don't get your hopes up in this price range), shower OK, airconditioning OK. The large windows (ceiling to bottom) took a little getting used to.We found the breakfast to be excellent, despite what other guests had to say about it. The only thing that surprised me is that there was no one looking after the cleanliness of the breakfast room. Sometimes cleaning a table with a wet towel would keep the room fresh and welcoming.One con.Smokers are not allowed to smoke on the terrace in front of the hotel.But when Hyatt would decide, that exiting the hotel, the (1)left table is for smokers and the right tables are for non smokers, that would give everyone a choice.This is somewhat discriminating towards smokers, and since over 30% of the world population smokes, this would be a solution that also nn smokers could live with.@ mr William: I emailed you before we arrived (May 21st) about contracts but no reply.....?????

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Two adults and four children on vacation in Manhattan can be a challenge but the Hyatt fit the bill. The suite was smaller but that was expected considering where we were. (My brother who lives in NY commented on how big it was!) Otherwise the hotel was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The staff was helpful and friendly. Location good. Free morning breakfast always a huge plus in our book and this one was yummy with a decent selection.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If all Hyatt Place hotels are as good as this one, I'll be seeking them out for future trips. This one in particular was a dream experience. It scored top marks for cleanliness, BIG rooms (a rare thing in New York City), amenities, and pleasant, professional staff. I admit I didn't expect much from the free breakfast, but wow, was I wrong! There were plenty of choices, and even hot dishes including two kinds of scrambled eggs, sausages, oatmeal, and waffles. As a frequent traveler, I know that buffet scrambled eggs are usually nothing special, but the ones here at Hyatt Place were as good as if they'd been ordered a la carte. I took special notice of how well designed the bathroom was. Plenty of towels, and careful attention to details like a grab-bar in the shower that had a textured hand-hold rather than just being a slick metal tube. Taking care of travelers' comfort is wonderful but taking care of travelers' safety is phenomenal. Great location too, close to subways, buses, restaurants, and just about anything you could want. We look forward to a return visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Husband surprised me for my birthday!!! Stayed 2 days at the Hyatt Place Midtown during memorial day weekend. Located off 7th ave and Broadway West 36th Street. It is in walking distance from Penn Station and 5-6 blocks away from Times Sq. The room and breakfast was plenty. When visiting times square and in the mood for bbq. Try Dallas BBQ. Bang for your buck and delicious too! Had the combo. Sirloin steak, baby back ribs, cornbread, bake potato and shrimp for $19.99 and its worth it. Looking forward to visiting Dallas BBQ and staying at the Hyatt Place Midtown on our next visit to NYC hopefully soon and in the near future.Lastly, please do the NYC tours. Very informative. We took the Gray line city tours in which was a bargain bc you get to do all tours uptown, downtown, Brooklyn and plus a ferry ride to the statue of liberty $54.00 pp. Normally the price would be $136.00 pp. Note: to tour NYC. Go to times Square where you will find lots of tour guides selling tickets.Overall, we had a nice time. Until next review. Enjoy your stay if ever visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For a Hyatt Group, this hotel is definitely under achieved. I am not sure what else is good about this hotel other than the most basic: Good location & clean. Everything else is really standard. The pillow was really bad, and the Air Conditioning was not working well enough.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is conveniently located near the subways and bus routes. The staff is very friendly and willing to help answer any questions that you might have. There is a complimentary breakfast which is not the usual continental type that you find at most hotels. Our room was quiet and had all the ammenties that we needed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We got an early morning check-in after an overnight flight from Vancouver. We were then invited to have breakfast, which we appreciated. Three hours later I developed food poisoning which I cannot conclusively say resulted from the hotel. But I observed some food handling practices that would not normally be acceptable. The breakfast buffet is not varied which is not ideal when staying for six nights. Apart from these issues, the hotel is clean, rooms are large and look new. Staff is very friendly and efficient. Location is excellent, close to subways and no more than a 15 minute stroll to Time Square. Despite the food, I recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown South overnight on a Saturday. The price was very reasonable for the location and the hotel was in excellent shape. The check-in, housekeeping, breakfast area and check-out employees were all super friendly and sought to be helpful in any way possible. The room was a bit smaller than other Hyatt Place properties where we have stayed, but this is to be expected in Mod-Town Manhattan.We have several events in the area coming up over the next 6 - 8 months and will be saying here for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was on a business trip, so cost of the stay is out of the equation ;)Hyatt Place is a nice hotel in the midtown of Manhattan / New York city. Room was good enough for 1 or 2 to stay. It had a comfortable couch which was nice to seat and watch TV / movies. Bed for comfy and large. Washroom was clean and room was made everyday with fresh consumablesBest part of the hotel is their staff. All are very knowledgable and helpful. No major issues while staying except for 1 day, I need to change the room due to A/C duct failure and it was done in swift with a complimentary drink ;)Hotel is close by to Times Square (20 mins walk) and it's 2 blocks away from Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a red-eye flight, but had reserved for the night before so we would have a room on arrival. We were given a different room than what we had reserved, but the very pleasant person at the desk, Dulce, said she would get us the correct room that noon. She got us a nice room higher up on the backside of the building. From other reviews, the backside of the building is quieter so you don't hear the horns and trucks. It was right. The Hyatt doesn't short-cut on provisions such as providing real Kleenex and Cottenelle (sp?) toilet paper. The staff is friendly and rooms, and bathrooms were clean. It is in a good location for getting to Times Square, Empire State building, Grand Central, and subways.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We read a lot of comments about this hotel.Our appreciations based on our experience of 7 nigths is the following:The room had enough space for 5 (2 adults - 15, 13 and 9). Of course we open the 3rd bed only when necessary. The breakfast place is that small has some people described. Of course at 9h20 a lot of persons are arriving, while everybody knows the service stops at 9h30. We never had problems, even if one day we were not on the same table. The people on restaurant and at the reception were very frendly, while the hotel was crawded. The situation is perfect to visit Manathan walking, and the view of the Empire State build was a good surprise, as we didn't pay more for that. Not noisy. Room service was correct too.In fact we only can recommand this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good hotel for a weekend trip where your hotel is only for sleeping. Bedroom is small, but full-window wall makes space seem more airy. Good view from 24th floor. Included breakfast was substantial with scrambled eggs with or without spinach was hot entre, but hot oatmeal, cereals, and different bread and muffin choices available. Staff very pleasant and ready to provide directions or help. We had wanted to drop off our bags but they allowed us to check in early (11:30-ish), so that was much appreciated as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location made it easy to walk to a lot subway and shopping. Many restaurant nearby. Staff was very accommodating with knowledge of New York sights.. Nice hot breakfast every morning. Room was clean and comfortable. Easy check in and out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great spot to stay, close to almost everything some of the staff are more than helpful and others don't even greet you as you walk in.We asked a girl at front desk to ring and book our transfers but she said you can do that? Thought it was all part of the service.Would stay here again .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Have spent many nights in recent years. Well equipped rooms with excellent beds, friendly and service oriented staff. Low external noise to be NYC. Good views from rooms at the top. The only minus is the breakfast that should improve defying the limited kitchen spaces.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've been in many Hyatt Place properties U.S and international and this one was as always great! What I really love about this concept is that you really feel like home away from home, the service was awesome, one of my favorite breakfasts, the rooms concept is as always amazing and clean and the location is very convenience in midtown NYC. I definitely will be back for the usual December trip. Special mention to William Heitmann who was awesome with me and my family, world class service!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Amazing location - right in the middle of the city and always felt safe (subways to everything very close by and plenty of restaurants and bars right outside the door). Friendly staff, nice, quiet and clean rooms (great big showers)...would definitely return. The little deli next door was absolutely delicious!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff was extremely friendly and the breakfast options were fresh and plentiful. Rooms were quite large for NYC and the staff was extremely welcoming. Was here for business but can definitely see myself returning for both work and pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was a great find. We had a cozy corner room with an excellent view of the Empire State Building. Everything you need in a NYC Stay. Nearby garage, complimentary breakfast, walk to local attractions. Friendly staff and very clean rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The view of the Empire State Building was remarkable! The room was small yet included a desk, refrigerator, safe, storage, and nice bathroom. The free breakfast was well above average- yummy! The front desk staff were always helpful and the location was within walking distance to everything. We were very happy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed here on numerous occasions while visiting on business. The hotel has been consistently clean and comfortable, and the staff friendly. The beds and pillows are great. The hotel is walking distance fto most places in Midtown. About 15 minute walk to Times Square, 5 minutes to Bryant Park, 2 minutes to Herald Square, 10 minutes to Penn Station, 15 minutes to Grand Central, Breakfast buffet is included in price. Some rooms have nice views of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I selected this hotel because it took the lowest number of points for a "free" room in a Hyatt establishment in New York City. While not luxurious, it was a very nice. For a Manhattan hotel, the room was good-sized and the bathroom perfectly adequate. Also, my room on the eighth floor was remarkably quiet even though it faced the street. There is a "fitness center," but it is really very small. They have a free breakfast which has a wide variety of juices, cereals, eggs, sausages etc. The staff were uniformly friendly and very helpful. Both the check-in and check out were quick. The hotel is centrally located within easy walking distance to the subways, Penn Central Station, the Broadway theater district, the Empire State Bldg., etc. The only negative is that there are only two elevators which during peak hours may cause a little delay. All-in-all, I would definitely book here again even if I had to use actually money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just back from a three-night stay in NYC and the Hyatt Place. Here's the quick summary and yes, I'd stay here again!Pros:- Quiet room (2Q and sofabed) on 16th floor and faced Empire State Building (great to see majestic building and what colour at night)- Clean room, but needed to make calls to the Front Desk on consecutive nights for the sofa bed linens (prompt service though)- Location is fantastic in the Herald Square area for shopping; also enough distance from the chaos of Times Square but close enough to walk to- Free hot breakfast which is a rarity in midtown NYC- Water pressure, refrigerator and room temperature were all adequately functioning for a nice, comfortable stay- Fast check-in and our room was ready for us upon arriving at Noon.- New Chick-fil-A and Shake Shack in the immediate area -- what more do you need!Cons:- Like many reviewers have noted, the elevators can be painfully slow especially in the morning rush hours for the free hot breakfast- Slight mix-up with car service to airport; luckily I confirmed a day ahead since they had forgotten to make arrangements- Room rate has gone up significantly since the first time I stayed here back in the summer -- even with Costco discount- Bath towels were worn and not the very plush, if that matters to you- Toiletries were sparse, but not a big dealIf you want a moderately-priced midtown hotel that's clean, has three beds (2Q/sofa) and free hot breakfast with a great location to shopping and food, this is the only choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nicely apportioned room, the free breakfast is very adequate, around the block to subway stop, bus close by too. Restaurants close by, price was very comparable but depends on time your going to New York. The staff here is very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel location is excellent. Walked with family from Penn Station and was able to check in right when we got in. I did not expect this as it was 10:30 in the morning. Wonderful location to seeing all the sights. Walkable to most of the main things we wanted to see including Times Square. Right around corner from Herald Square and several Subway stops. As far as the Room goes.. Excellent. I have stayed in New York and usually had very small rooms. This particular room was plenty of room for our family of 5. With two teens and a 9 year old thats impressive. We had two double beds and a pull out sofa. We had an excellent view of the Empire State Building right out our window. Beds were very comfortable and could not believe how little sound we heard. You would think we were the only ones on that floor of the hotel and at the 25th floor could hear absolutely nothing from the streets below. Staff was excellent and everyone we encountered was so nice. Asked for an extra blanket and had it in minutes. Breakfast was nice. You are not going in for a 5 star breakfast food, but the selection and amount of food offered was a really nice way to start the day with the 5 of us. Will be planning on staying at this property again next time we visit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel. It’s a fantastic central location, especially if you don’t mind walking – only 10 minutes to the theater district and right around the corner to the Empire State Building. Overall our room was very nice. It was a decent size, especially for Manhattan. The bed was nice and the bathroom was good sized with good amenities. The Wi-Fi was strong and reliable. There was complimentary breakfast in the morning, but it was often over crowded with the food picked over. We mostly went out for breakfast. There are only two elevators for this tall hotel and there would sometimes be waits in order to use them. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and the staff and would gladly return in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is a great value, the hotel is in a great location, and the staff couldn't be friendlier. It is convenient to all tourist attractions, and if in NYC for business, close to multiple subway and train lines

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown for 6 days as a family of 4. We had booked a room with a view of the Empire State Building and were not disappointed as it was right opposite our room. The room had two Queen beds and a sofa bed and of adequate size for us all considering we were not in it much. The hotel is only 5 minutes walk from Times Square with loads of restaurants and excellent shopping so would definitely recommend the location. Breakfast is included and although not cooked to order, was plentiful and of good quality and sufficient to start the day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed two nights. Was given a King accessible room corner room. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Only issue was the accessible room. Shower didn't have any borders so the entire bathroom floor was flooded after a shower. I understand the reason it was made that way for someone with walking issues - but it was a pain in cleaning up the water! Free breakfast buffet was adequate - but nothing special. The great thing about this hotel is the staff. What nice young ladies! Very helpful and could not have been nicer!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice nice Place back in March of 2014. I should have wrote a long time ago.....Sorry I just spent two days at the Roosevelt Hotel April 7th and 8th. This place was nicer,newer, and offered a great FREE breakfast back then. Just as convenient to the subway system and a little longer walk to Times Square but defiantly doable. I would go back and pick this place over the Roosevelt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In New York with family. Had such a good time. Good beds, quiet, fabulous breakfast. Front desk workers were so helpful in planning our outings. Super location-walkable to many sites and close to subway connections. Can't wait to come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice place to stay pre-cruise that was leaving from the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal . Walking distance to Times Square as well as Penn Station and Grand Central Terminal and subway stations. Free continental breakfast was okay. Staff was very friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As we celebrated our best friends soon to be wedding. We are night owls so our front desk person was a man named Shandel. We were lucky! He was so. Sweet, FUNNY! And accommodating and made our stay extra fun! All staff were excellent; I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms at this Hyatt Place were large with good amenities, especially for NYC. The staff was the Best, very accommodating, knowledgeable about the area, and professional. They also have some need items available for their guests who have forgotten them, like shower caps, toothpaste etc. Excellent location to shopping, dining and landmark location, ie Empire State Building and Macy's. This is where I will be staying for now on when I visit,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed with my family at this hotel and we enjoyed every minutes of our vacation in New York. The room was quiet and clean and large enough to accommodate the 4 of us without any problem .The best part is the location of the hotel just few minutes from Time Square making everything easy!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our room was a good size, clean and comfortable. The hotel is located close to major tourist attractions, and is reasonably priced. However the level of street noise is absolutely dire. We were only there two nights and had busy days so it wasn't a big deal, but the noise did keep waking us up. The breakfast room is too cramped for the number of people using it, which makes it incredibly chaotic and tables weren't being cleared very quickly which meant sitting surrounded by other people's trash. Overall, this hotel is fine if you're on a budget and just need somewhere to shower and crash in a central location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great place to stay. Great location, great rooms, great breakfast AND great rates! We were in the city for a girls weekend and to see the show "Beautiful". We were able to check in early with no problem and have a very nice dinner before the show. The front desk staff helped us with finding a restaurant. We stayed over a Friday night and upon check-out on Saturday (12:00 Noon), we were able to leave our bags and do some sight-seeing. We came back around 3:00 in the afternoon and they had our bags ready for us within 5 minutes. Great service, with a smile on their faces. Hope they keep their rates reasonable because I will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel usually offers a good value and is within walking distance of many of New York's major tourist sites. I have stayed here before and will continue to do so based on this value, as well as the staff's general friendliness/helpfulness. The rooms are small (like most in New York) but very efficient so I did not feel cramped. I have only stayed there on business before, but I did see some families. I will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We recently stayed 4 nights at this hotel. The location was great. We had a fantastic view of the Empire State building from our room. We had requested an upper floor and it was very quiet. The room was clean and plenty of space for the 4 of us. Breakfast was good but very crowded toward the end of the time. Go early for the best experience.The hotel staff was so helpful and very friendly. A great experience all around!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is located in the heart of Herald Square right by the famous Macy's and lots of shopping! Easy access to subway and getting up or downtown. The room was very large and we had a view of the Empire state building. Our room had a sleeper sofa and the beds were really comfy. The shower was annoying because there was no door, just a curtain, so the bathroom floor was soaked. As for the free breakfast, it was okay. Nothing to write home about, but a fine option if you don't want to go out. Overall, great budget option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The price for this hotel was amazing to stay in Manhatten blocks from Times Sqaure! The staff was wonderful. When we arrived they did not have any more double rooms and upgraded us with two rooms next to each other. This was a fantastic surprise as we were on a family vacation and had been sharing a room with the kids for the last 5 nights in DC. It is a very busy lobby but everyone is so nice that it didnt really matter. The rooms are beautiful ... though the beds are stiff. I would recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was comfortable with a huge window and a nice view. Breakfast was simple, but good and helped me start the day. Bed was comfy, ar conditioner (heater) was quiet, and the bathroom was clean and good. Front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Would definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was clean and the room was very spacious and provided a great view of the Empire State Building. The location was great....just a short walk to Times Square. The complimentary breakfast was very good. It was a great stay and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: New York is generally great for customer service and this hotel excels. Friendly and helpful staff make you feel happy to be there. Personal but not intrusive. Fresh cookies in our room every day for the kids a very nice touch. Also good value for a smart very well located hotel. Fantastic place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Although check in was a bit of hassle, front office assisted well. I do wish that the front office would be friendlier especially to guests who are concern with security issues of the credit card.The room was amazing and clean. The view especially was great for the reasonable price with the convenient location. The housekeeper was Spanish and tried her best to communicate and clean the room very well. I also love the peanut butter cookies that was available near the front desk. Breakfast was also good. Would love to come back again. review base on stay from oct 6 to oct 10

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I spent 4 nights here back in February and we were very satisfied and happy with our choice. Having stayed at many so called 4-star hotels in NYC in the past where you pay top dollar for a very old property with mediocre rooms and service people endlessly asking for tips, it was nice to come to a brand new modern property like this one.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and unlike the rest of New York definitely not looking to dress you down for tips which was a huge welcome. The rooms were clean, and decently sized for NYC, with extremely reliable and fast wifi and a decent included breakfast buffet. The location was of course unbeatable as it was right in Midtown, a short 10 minute walk from Times Square with none of the noise and crowds.Unfortunately for us, there was construction going on across the street during our stay. Nothing like waking up to jackhammers at 8am every day. As well, if you arrive a bit late to breakfast it was hard to find a seat as they could not clean fast enough to keep up. Finally with only 3 slow elevators, it was always a long wait to go up and down.Still even with all of the negatives, the hotel did everything it does extremely well, and along with the extremely reasonable price, I would not hesitate to stay here the next time I am in New York City. It would also be a great hotel for business travellers as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I went to NY with my in laws and we took only one double bed room with pull out couch. We were 5 adults and we actually were perfectly comfortable with the room. The staff was super nice and helped us with all our tourist questions. Gave us great advice and the breakfast buffet is perfect for fussy eaters! You walk out and boom right in the action of time square! I'm certainly going to remember this hotel for future trips!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good location, condition during breakfast terrible (dirty tables, ran out of dishes, not enough tables to sit etc. etc) Recommend you eat breakfast outside the Hotel. Rooms are ok sofa and rug need cleaning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a family vacation and chose Hyatt Place because we were familiar with other of their facilities, it included breakfast, and the price was reasonable. Our room was clean and inviting. the desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff were great and the hotel room was fabulous and clean. Only issue I had is that my room key stopped working which is a pain when you are near the top of the hotel. Breakfast was good, variety of items available.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for four night here. The staff was especially helpful in answering all of our questions. They always greeted us when we walked in if they were not helping a customer. The hotel was very clean and as quite as could be considering New York City is not a quite city. The hallways were always quite and we could not hear neighbors to the side or upstairs or down stairs. Room was always cleaned so as not to inconvenience us. Location was very good to see the sites and get onto the subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed three nights with my young son for a short trip from DC. I can say that I have made the perfect choice. The hotel staff at the front were welcoming and also helpful to everyone giving directions to various places. There was a subway station close to the hotel which takes you to major places, and a safe & short walk to the Empire State Building where we went at night to see the beautiful skyscrapers. The room we first had did not have the exact view we wanted, but they kindly offered to switch the next day as a room was available. Both rooms were very quiet. My son also made friends of his age who was visiting from another country. It was a great experience. The hotel is very clean&modern but unlike the big hotels I never had to wait in long line to talk to the front desk. I was running out of time to catch my bus to DC and the lady at the front desk rushed to get our suitcase from storage, so that we could leave right away. I recommend this hotel to families who are wishing to have a memorable trip to NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I love this hotel.it's super comfy.Loved our room,very spacious for NYC and clean.what I like even better was the location in the middle,very convenient if you want to go uptown or downtown. The lobby and staff were great.I'd stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is within a short walk of Macy's/Herald Square/Madison Square Garden and 34th Street/Penn Station. My room on level 22 looked straight out to the Empire State Building which lit up at night enticed me to leave the blinds up all night. The room rate was modest for Manhattan and included a complimentary breakfast. The room was not large but had a king size bed, a TV unit and a sofa along the full size window. The bathroom was small but serviceable with a shower, sink and toilet. Complimentary shampoo, conditioner and soap provided. Ironing board, safe and mini bar fridge were all appreciated. The room and bathroom was very clean although the towels were not as plush as you'd expect from a Hyatt. The coffee maker and the Twinnings English breakfast teabags were appreciated. There is no room service but you can order from a limited menu and pick it up from the lobby. However within less than 200m there are a range of pubs, cafes and even a McDonalds. I ordered a town car from reception to JFK which was $68 a lot cheaper than from more expensive uptown hotels. I organised a late check out and they offered to store my luggage too. The service was very good and friendly. It was great for a night or two in the city, a quick shop at Macy's and access to the subway station which has ACE, NQR, DFMand the PATH lines and regional trains from Penn Station. Only two elevators so can be a bit slow.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We recently had a great stay at the Hyatt Place - Midtown. We were referred by a friend and it was a great referral. Very convenient location. Clean and spacious room. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We had shopped the price and it was very competitive with other hotels. We had a great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
