review_body: Excellent experience and would stay again in a heartbeat. Very clean comfortable room. Excellent location withing easy walking distance of shops, grocery stores, restaurants, and subway. Fridge in the room. Comfy bed and quite spacious by NY standards. Excellent, excellent wonderful staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great hotel "to be in the middle." Loved the location with the subway right around the corner. The staff was excellent. So friendly! Breakfast was nice and I liked their hot selections that changed daily. Room was small but functional. Very overpriced......but that is NY. Reasonably clean but the carpet had dirty spots. Extra sofa bed in the double queen was a nice surprise. The downside was that the room was very noisy with a constant rattling fan in the bathroom and a fridge that was very loud. In all fairness I didn't ask for this to be remedied and I'm guessing they would have changed my room. There are only two elevators and they are slow. On the upside we were given early check in and that was very much appreciated after we arrived on the red eye flight. The hotel arranged transportation to the airport for us in a nice SUV that was less expensive than the two cabs to accommodate my family that we took to get there. Overall very pleased with this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We both agreed this was one of the best locations we've stayed in Manhattan. Rooms are clean & have refrigerators & sofas. Worse Hyatt Place breakfast ever though. Not only is the hot food bad, there is very little room to move around to get food , once gotten, nearly impossible to find a seat. We always book a place with breakfast so we can eat before we venture out. Only thing edible was the basics like cereal & toast. I've never been picky about coffee, but found theirs was not good at all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was initially impressed... evening check-in went off without a hitch (rather rare for NYC, I've been bumped to other hotels numerous times despite having a confirmed reservation). Room was well appointed...almost new even...and very clean. Breakfast was a pretty good spread for NYC free hotel breakfasts. There were multiple hot dishes to choose from and a good selection of fruit and breads. Today was the slipup. We left our room this morning at 11:30am. The housekeeper was cleaning the room next door, so I even took the time to catch her and tell her we were in the room next door and were leaving for the day, and that she could get in to clean whenever she wanted. I guess she didn't want to. Got back at 7pm and the room was just as we'd left it. Needless to say I wasn't happy. Still amazes me that management at some hotels don't have a system for followup checks on housekeeping to make sure rooms are cleaned by the end of the day if there was no DND sign out. We still have two more days here. Will update this review to see how they recover from this one. But as for now we're completely exhausted and can't relax in our room as we're waiting (45 minutes so far) for someone from housekeeping to come clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I reviewed this hotel in April, 2014 and I absolutely fell in love with the place. It is still clean, modern, well situated and convenient. What has changed is the staff and I MEAN CHANGED!!! The former staff was so friendly, accommodating, helpful, and so interested in the guests' concerns, comforts, and needs. Update October, 2015 and the staff now is not friendly, helpful, or accommodating. They are negligent, lax, and neglectful of their duties and their guests. The maintenance people are super speedy, friendly and efficient and the staff responses to requests for towels, bedding, and other amenities is very good. Luisa, our housekeeper, was amazing. What has changed are the greetings when entering and leaving, the smiling faces of the front desk, and the night staff. Most of them do not even look up when you arrive or depart or even try to know who you are. These people need a lot of training about how to treat their guests and execute their jobs properly. They are in the service industry. Raul was the only person I found helpful and friendly. Rich is still there but was on vacation until 2 days before I left after staying there 2 weeks. He gave me a big hello as he remembered me from 18 months ago!My departure from the hotel was an abomination. I had 3 bags that I put on the elevator and arrived at the lobby. I am 71 yrs old, have a cane, and am arthritic. As i struggled to get my bags out of the elevator, members of the staff were mulling about doing nothing but talking to each other and NOT ONE PERSON came to help me. As I was getting out the second bag from the elevator, the door closed and I shot up to the 20th floor, A very nice gentleman entered and he offered to help me. When we arrived in the lobby, HE helped me out the elevator. No staff member came to help me out the door. My limo driver was waiting outside and the gentleman from the elevator helped me to the door. The gal at the front desk looked up at me and suggested I use the regular door rather than the revolving doors as it would be "easier" for me to get my bags to the curb!!!!!!! Hello? She couldn't call upon one of the staff doing nothing??? Raul and Rich were not on duty yet. I was absolutely fuming at this lack of professionalism. I was at a hotel, for heaven's sake! That kind of assistance should be automatic. After spending $5,500+ at this hotel for such negligent service, I was enraged at this inattentive behavior of the front desk and EVERY staff member mulling about at 7:30 AM. I really should give this hotel 2 stars but it is clean and modern. They should really get their act together. I will be calling the manager about this incident and let he/she know how disappointed I am. 'Will I stay here again? I would have to think about that very carefully when i return to NYC in April/May.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Despite of the convenience location, I was impressed by their service. Especially the guy named Raul was very helpful finding me cabs and places. I'll choose this hotel again if I come to New York next time, and I hope to see him being their helping more people as the way he helped me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Used to paying $300+ a night when I come to NYC, I was hesitant to book one at $199/night -- but I decided to put faith in the Hyatt name. Not only did the Hyatt meet my expectations, they exceed them! The staff was over-the-top helpful and friendly -- Raul is our new BFF :-) -- and the rooms were super clean. Everyone made us feel welcome and feel that we mattered. Will be coming back to the city in a few weeks and will be staying here for sure. Thank you for everything you all did to make this a memorable trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Best stay ever!! Best service!!! Dolce, and the whole crew in the lobby -- they were so friendly!! They let me check in super early and I did not even expect it. The rooms were very nice Fresh and GO down the street has great sandwiches and salads.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've had many, many stays with Hyatt brands but this was certainly the worst experience. I was tempted to check out as soon as I arrived; however, the price was cheaper compared to other options. The decor was very simple and did not meet my contemporary expectations but I figured I'd survive for 4 nights. I think it's sad when my own master bathroom is bigger than the room. The location was great - close to Empire State Building, shopping and subway. All in all very economical but did not have a wow factor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We got a double queen size bed room with view to the Empire State building which was great. The room also had a queen size sleeper sofa bed which let the five people in my family (two adults three tenn kids) sleep really well. The room was not very new, but clean just like most business hotels are. Four stars out of four super friendly and helpful staff. The missing star is because the Skillet (R) breakfast was just a little bit too fatty. It doesn't have to be kale or quinoa but a little bit more healthy breakfast options would be great. (Egg white sandwich? Turkey bacon?)Overall, I recommend this if you're visiting New York with your family. It's right in the middle of everything. Very close to Penn station and multiple subway metro lines.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was located on 36th St in NYC. This was the heart of the city. Due to an overbooking at another Hyatt site the Staff asked if we would mind staying at the above Hotel. When we arrived they tried everything in their power to make us feel welcome. While in Aruba we also love staying at the Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: comfortable, good location to sights, friendly staff, room was large enough, cable TV, clean rooms, short walk to heart of the city, used my points for this stay, quiet place to rest after a hard day shopping

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: the hotel no good and do not care about their guests The only advantage to him when you log on be friendly.I have got the problem of water in the bathroom and I told them so water rash to repair take a long time and when asked for the delay was the excuse that they have a maintenance worker only one, Because of that we're late to go out and delayed the timing of my travel.I will not book in the hotels of this company

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel...clean...convenient, great location...nice front desk folks....not familiar enough with city they live in, could use a concierge...I would definitely stay again...loved New York...the breakfast was always fresh and hot got behind a little from time to time but still good...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel at least 8 nights a month for more than a year. For the regular business traveler, this is a good, solid hotel that is fairly new. The desk, housekeeping and maintenance staff are friendly and focused on customer service. HOWEVER, if you are traveling with your family, or if you plan to book a room using Hyatt points, you should be aware that the king + sofabed rooms, which are all you can book with points, are all handicap rooms. These rooms have roll-in showers with no curb, and the showerhead points directly towards the curtain rather than the wall. The result is when you take a shower the entire bathroom floor gets flooded with water. On one occasion I even had the water from the shower seep through the wall and wet the carpets next to the bed.In addition, the management at this hotel is not very focused on customer service, and if you have an issue, they are not willing to work with you to resolve the situation. In July I booked a room for business at the end of one week and the beginning of the following week, and then reserved a room with points over the weekend so my daughter could come up and spend the weekend with me. When I checked in, I asked to have the same room through the entire stay. I was told that the weekend room booked with points had to be a king + sofabed room because that's all you can book with points. I told them I didn't want a handicapped room. Of course, since I stayed there all the time, the person at the desk accommodated me and booked me in a room with two double beds for the entire stay, but told me I would need to come and have new keys made on Friday because it was in the system as separate reservations due to booking the weekend room with points. When I went down to get new keys made on Friday, I was told that I had to move rooms, apparently because the manager had removed the hold on the room for my weekend stay. After some back and forth conversation that had the desk clerk running to the office 5 or 6 times to talk to the manager on duty, the manager finally came out to talk to me personally. He was quite rude and dismissive, but finally told me he would see what he could do. I told him I had 30 minutes until I needed to leave to catch the train to the airport, and he assured me he would have an answer to me before I needed to leave. I did not hear from him, so I had to go back to the desk, where I was told the manager wasn't available, but they couldn't accommodate me and I needed to move rooms. This caused me to miss the train, which left my daughter waiting alone at Newark Airport. I sent a note to Hyatt corporate explaining the situation and asking for an apology - not because they couldn't accommodate me, but because the manager was rude and didn't do as he promised and get back to me so I could make my train. I received a reply stating that the hotel manager would contact me directly. It's been three months, and I have not heard anything from Hyatt even though I have inquired about a response since then.I will not stay in this hotel again. It's a shame, too, because it's a pretty good hotel. Still, if the manager isn't interested in good customer service, I'm not interesting in staying there. If, after all of this, you still want to stay here, I have some advice:- do not book a king + sofabed room unless you are handicapped- ask for a higher floor, because the street noise can be very loud- ask for a room at the back, which means you will have a view of the Empire State Building- the wait for the elevator is long, particularly in the morning when everyone is heading down to breakfast. Take the stairs- they have a good breakfast that's included in the room rate. It includes hot food- ask at the desk about places to eat. They sometimes have coupons.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Midtown South Hyatt Place is conveniently located for entertainment, sightseeing, and dining. It's close to Bryant Park, among other sites, so it's probably also very convenient for business travelers. We enjoyed a clean room that was relatively well insulated of the New York City urban noise. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place New York Midtown South is in a great location. There are lots of restaurants and entertainment establishments within walking distance of the hotel. The subway station is also within walking distance as well as other tourists' sites such as Time Square, Empire State Building, the New York Public Library, and Bryant Park, among others.My room was very nice. The room was neatly decorated. The bed was comfortable. There was a love seat in it and also a refrigerator, microwave and a safe. My room did not have a bathtub, only a shower, which was big enough for two people to fit in.The wifi was free in the room and the lobby. Breakfast is free too. There is a cocktail bar lounge and coffee and pastries. The hotel also has a fitness center. The staff were very friendly and the check in and check out was quick and easy. As a woman traveling solo, I felt very safe at this hotel. I would definitely stay here again. I highly recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is very nice, clean, and comfortable. The staff is amazing!!! Words will not do justice. We where there for my daughter's birthday on 10/10/15 and checked on on 10/11. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was pleasurable and that our needs where met. The Hyatt corporation should give everyone that worked that weekend a bonus. The hotel room was comfortable and clean. We had a room that slept 6 (4 adults and 2 children) and we fit comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good stay at the Hyatt Place,stayed twice on our trip over toArizona.The rooms are of a good size very clean and comfortable bed,breakfast was hot and plentiful.Staff are very polite and helpful situated in a good location for Macy store and Empire State Building.Would recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is our favorite brand of Hotel and this one lived up to the expectations. The hotel is in a great location for visiting most major Mid Town attractions like the Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Empire State Building. The staff was awesome and the hotel is in great shape.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A nice Hyatt in southern mid-town. Clean rooms, breakfast served every morning, and friendly service. Easy walk to Times and Herald Squares, the theatre district, Radio City, and Rockefeller Plaza with the subway station nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: great hotel - clean, modern and convenient to plays and restaurants. sky lounge is nice, but very expensive! great weekend birthday getaway. would definitely recommend and would absolutely stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel has an excellent position in the middle of Manhattan. The personnel is very pleasant and one feels very welcome in the hotel. Rooms are clean and tidy. A breakfast is rather poor. The food selection is very limited.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I booked this hotel for a one night weekend girls' trip to NYC. We needed a larger room since there were 5 of us as we preferred to stay in one room/suite rather than separate rooms. The room with 2 queen sized beds and a roll out couch was sufficient for our group. We were largely using the room as a place to freshen up and sleep and didn't spend much time at the hotel. The location was fantastic for exploring and the hotel staff was very helpful. The hotel itself was clean and we utilized a nearby parking garage for one night at a price that is considered reasonable for NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was fine for a Manhattan location. Breakfast bar was barely acceptable. Expect much more from Hyatt. Bellman for- got to load wife's bag to airport resulting in an additional charge. Very disappointing.. Well see if Hotel addresses mistake.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I had a really good stay at this hotel. I learned from a very helpful man (from the engineering staff) that the hotel was a little short staffed and that everyone was doing what they could to help out. I honestly would not have known, had he not told me. I liked that fact that he was so honest and praise him for being so flexible. This is what customer service is all about; making a choice to be of assistance, even though it isn't your "job." Even a man who was assisting in the breakfast area said, "Have a good day" to me when I was leaving. I'm impressed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I didn't choose this hotel, but I couldn't have made a better selection myself! Of course, the location is superb. But the staff at the front desk are even better. Friendly. Knowledgeable. Helpful. Nothing was a problem - even extending our check-out by an hour so we could shower, change and pack before heading to the airport. Will stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel and it won't be the last. The location can't be beat, the staff are incredibly friendly and the rooms are reasonable and well cared for. Can't find fault with anything they do.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here for 4 days. The room is big, good enough for 4 of us. And thelocation is great, easy to reach many visiting spots. But there are some drawbacks, there are only 2 elevators, so it always need to wait for a long time for the elevator. And the breakfastis free, but don't have many choices. And the staff didn't give us enough towels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place staff were professional, polite and attentive! I booked a double bed room and even though I didn't have much of a view, there was space! The beds were very comfortable and breakfast, with so many choices, was fantastic! Times Square, the theater district, shopping, tour bus stops, trains & more, all within walking distance of the Hyatt Place! I will stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice stay at the Hyatt Place! We liked the location and the complimentary breakfast. The bed was very comfortable. Room size was average. It's a very close walk to the Empire State Building and Macys-Herald Square. Penn Station (subway) seemed like a 5-6 minute walk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Main concerned was breakfast, it's always late in serving. We stayed 3 days & 2 nights and that's basically our main complained. In the future, make sure that breakfast is serve on time. Some guest have an early schedule to catch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for 2 weeks during the Papal visit, the UN General Assembly so it was a little chaotic. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Changed my room to one with a lovely city view and arranged a very late check out to accomodate my late flight back to europe. Closet space is very small for a 2 week trip but i managed. There is a free hot breakfast buffet each morning which is a very nice touch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is convenient to Penn Station and the rooms are good size. BUT...the price went up by $500--yes, that's right--between my stay in mid September and last week. Okay, so the Pope was there and the UN, but that is PRICE GOUGING.Also, no paper delivered to my room either day, even after I complained and am Gold Passport

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The price was competitive compared to the others hotels closed by, and the facilities and room were in top condition. Safe neighborhood, nice view, friendly and attentive employees. Would definitely consider it for a next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Few blocks walk from grand central. Couple blocks to subway. And Macy's. Very friendly and helpful staff. Had to clarify subway directions- walked away with info needed and suggestions for 2 Resturant/bars to stop for our girls out weekend. Clean room comfortable beds. Good sized bathroom. Being in NYC and saying there was room for 4 women in a room says a lot. Loved having the sofa bed for more sleep space. Heard very little hallway noise. The breakfast had something for everyone. Staff there to restock as needed very polite. Just would suggest looking around as the utensils and plates are stored near the food but hidden above where you would normally look. Upon checking out the staff assisted us with grabbing a taxi to train station- had to go to the corner little way from the hotel. Very nice to have such service- and we weren't platinum customers or anything, the staff was just very nice and very hard working. With smiles!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was in NYC for business and shared a room with a colleague. For staying in NYC the rooms are bigger than average which was nice. Location is great, especially since I had meeting through out the entire city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for two nights. The front desk staff was unfailingly helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our room. Although the decor is a simple "functional modern" style, it was roomy for New York and we really loved having a sofa and ottoman to stretch out. Good size bathroom as well. I was disappointed by the quality of the towels: at $396.00 a night (before taxes), I'd expect something a tad more fluffy. The included breakfast, served in a somewhat unappealing room off the lobby, had a good variety of choices.The location is excellent. A short walk to Times Square, Grand Central Station and the New York Public Library.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for one night mid week. Enjoyed the easy walk to Manhattan sites. Breakfast included - good selection to getting you fueled up for a busy day of sightseeing. Many options for eating nearby!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very pleased with the standard of this hotel which was great value for the location. The staff were very friendly; on one particularly hot afternoon we arrived back at the hotel and were greeted into the cool lobby by one of the receptionists with "Welcome Home" which was just lovely. We had a couple of minor maintenance issues during our stay and both were sorted out in minutes with a visit from the on site repairs staff. The breakfast was great with a varied selection including hot choices and real plates and cutlery - not always on offer from other hotels in this area in our experience! This hotel will be on my list for future stays in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have a family of 5 and stayed in room 2403 for 3 nights. Our room faced the Empire state building, which the kids loved at night with the lights. The room was clean and good operating order. There were complaints on this website about the size of the room (especially with the sofa bed pulled out), the customer service and elevators. We had no such issues. In fact the front desk staff were the best we had had versus other hotel experiences. The am breakfast is decent especially for younger kids. There are lots of reasonably priced options nearby like pure food next door.The big plus is the location - 2 blocks from herald sq subway -- and four blocks from time square. All in all, this is is a good option for your family stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Close to Time Square, nice room, people at reception very nice. Close to Metro. Close to Bryant Park, great location.We were at a high floor and we got a nice view.Breakfast room was crowded and its carpet not so clean. ( It could improve if they do not use carpet in the breakfast area)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed in two nights midweek in September at this small hotel. The central location in Midtown is fantastic as it is walking distance to everything (Penn Station, Grand Central Terminal, Times Square, Bryant Park, etc.) The hotel has a complementary breakfast which was adequate if one didn't want to venture out. The neighborhood appears to be up and coming and there were a couple of healthful eateries nearby. The staff, from the front desk (especially Dulce) to the hotel engineer (who one evening kindly doubled as the bartender), were exceptionally nice. The room was smallish (it is Manhattan) but was clean, quiet and comfortable. My room faced 36th Street (there was hardly any road noise) and had a view of the old Pam Am (now Met Life) building. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Average room, reasonably priced, good location, free wifi. Didn't read the check-in time and it was a long wait before I could check into the room - not ideal after 24 hour flights. Coffee bar downstairs which we didn't use.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was spacious and well-appointed (extra large flat screen TV, full-size sofa). The staff went out of its way to be helpful. Minor housekeeping problems but they were very minor. Good location: three blocks from Penn Station, near several subway lines and the Fifth Avenue bus. Relatively (for New York City) quiet at night without being deserted.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was clean and centrally located. The service was excellent, and Jasmine Vizuete at the front desk was outstanding. She was extremely helpful, courteous and knowledgable. The breakfast was very good. The elevators were quite slow at times, but that was our only complaint. We'll definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: first time stopped at Hyatt the hotel was excellent the staff where great the rooms where excellent the complimentary breakfast was great the staff could not do enough for you will say at this hotel next time in new York

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staid in a lot off places in New-York and at this moment the Hotel is BEST PRICE versus Quality. , Very friendly staff , nice rooms and a super T Super Breakfast.Every morning different food to discover an taste.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As a native New Yorker, I would recommend this hotel as good value and a reasonable option for its proximity to the subway, bus, PATH and Penn Station. Outstanding front desk and bellman support. Clean rooms with comfortable beds. Free breakfast - not a lot of hot or cold options, but still better than having to pay for breakfast on your own, right?! Since our room faced the street, we were subjected to more outside noise than expected... city construction with jackhammers and all are beyond the hotel's control. You're in the city that never sleeps after all.Our only drawback would be that this 26-floor property only has two elevators. During peak hours, it was common to wait an average of five minutes to get on an elevator. If you're on a lower floor, I suppose you can just take the stairs. We were on the 19th floor so this was not an option for us.Anyway, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely consider staying here again. I appreciate the other tips to ask for a room facing the ESB. Might be quieter as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We did have a great room with King size bed.Their included kitchen skillet hot breakfast is a great way for starting your day on foot. Conveniently located, around the corner of 5th Avenue and only 10 minutes walking from Time Square.We both were very pleased with this location and comfy quiet room on the 18th floor.Mariette's Back to Basics

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I never thought that I would ever give a one-star rating to any hotel from the Hyatt family but yes, it is true...! Only because the windows in our room were so dirty that you could barely see through! Hyatt should be ashamed!! Other than that the hotel was fine but certainly not worth the price we paid (500 USD per night). For sure there are hotels in this area which are cheaper and certainly not worse (two are just next door). I will not stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: this is our 3rd stay here and the location and room are fine, but the free breakfast gets worse each stay. The selection of hot food is not great and they tend to run out of food/beverage with not enough staff to replenish in a timely manner.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As I'm sure many travelers do, I spent a lot of time researching lodging options in NYC for 2 nights in August. I was fortunate to have found this Hyatt Place as it met all of our needs. We arrived in late morning, several hours before the official check-in time. The front desk attendant offered to upgrade my family of three to a room with an Empire State Building view. Our luggage was stored for us and upon our return later in the afternoon, all we had to do was ask for our keys and head to our room. The room was very clean and well appointed. However, what we did not realize was that the rooms with the ESB view do NOT have a sleeper sofa. They just have a regular sofa. Of course, the front desk attendant should have known this, but by the time we discovered that the sofa did not fold out into a bed, we had unpacked and basically taken over the room. We decided to stay in the room and enjoy the view (as opposed to repacking and moving rooms). The room was extremely quiet and the layout of the hotel kept the hallway noise down. The breakfast room was very busy each morning, but the staff did a great job of keeping the items stocked. I agree with other reviewers that the offerings could include more items like yogurt and fresh fruit. However, the breakfast is included in your room rate and definitely helps keep the budget in check. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The property has a small outside patio area which is a nice spot to have a drink and relax. The hotel's location is very central to many NYC attractions and subway lines. We would definitely stay at this property again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I travel to NYC about twice a year and typically don't expect a friendly experience. This property broke that tradition and I truly appreciated it. They were very friendly upon check in and every time they interacted with them. It also has a great centralized location in Mid Town. I'll look this property up next time I am in town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is located very conveniently in Midtown Manhattan, near to Macy's Herald Square. Front Desk & Bell-captain people are friendly & helpful. Room is small for 3 people but still comfortable. The only drawback is they only have 2 lifts to serve for those many rooms. Overall, our stays have been very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We came for the long Labor Day weekend, both check in and check out were quick and easy. The location is great for walking to our Broadway show, Times Square, and Rock Center. Easy access to the subway for our trips outside walking distance. The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was busy of course but the staff did a great job of cleaning up the area and refilling food items. Staff was helpful and friendly, we have no complaints, would most definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for 5 days/4 nights on business. Every staff member I met was exceedingly polite and friendly, and delivered on whatever was promised. The room was good sized and kept very clean. Plenty of plugs for charging. No real food options in-house but this is as expected for the brand. Very good location in being able to access many subway lines nearby, though not a lot of good food options other than being three doors away from Keens. Very happy to have stayed here and will consider it again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff was very friendly, welcoming, and professional. Location is excellent - a short walk to Times Square. The hotel itself is very clean and pleasant. The room is a good size for NYC, and the bathroom is nice with good bath products. Nothing really stood out, and the water pressure could have been better in the shower. But we did like the glass shower and the vanity. A/C was good but loud. Bed was comfortable.The one big disappointment here was the breakfast. We were informed it was a full breakfast, but we felt the selection was poor, especially for gluten free patrons. There were sandwiches, some bacon, and fruit. We didn't see any greek yogurt, and there were no eggs of any kind. We decided to stay here because of the breakfast, and it certainly didn't meet our expectations. Instead we gave up the free breakfast for take away down the street. Check out was quick, and the hotel provided car service to JFK.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed our stay. The rooms were spacious (by New York standards gigantic) and well decorated as was the total hotel. The breakfast was quite good though limited, but with adequate choices. Since I am gluten free, I was pleased by the glutten free cereal options. The staff was most pleasant and helpful. The hotel was very well maintaned. Location was great with easy acess to Times Square and Chelsa areas. Parking was expensive, but cheaper than most other parking options. The lobbu was small, but attractive

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a nice place to stay. Not fancy But very nice. The hotel is very close to all of the action. If you have a car the parking rate was very reasonable.Staff was friendly and check-in was fast. Room was nice and bed was soft.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Booking a hotel online in NYC without a personal referral was kind of a scary thing. We didn't know what to expect from our room or the facility as a whole. Ultimately it was a fantastic experience. The Midtown location suited us fine-close to shopping, attractions and the metro. For NYC our room was spacious with a mini fridge, couch, desk and nice TV. The bed/linens were fine, a safe in the room, clean, nice bathroom, great water pressure, A/C worked great during a very hot/humid NYC visit. The staff was knowledgeable and very friendly. The food that is available onsite is nothing fancy but the prices were great and everything we had to eat satisfied! The free breakfast certainly did the job in getting us started each day with a full belly! After exhausting days it was nice to come "home" to a hotel we were very happy with!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: lovely very clean, quiet room for family of 5, a little cramped until sofa bed put back up but otherwise would recommend ++++++, breakfast included and great location, round corner from Macy's and subway

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I typically stay at Hyatt Place for business and decided to try it out for my recent vacation. The staff is the nicest, most personable staff I have encountered. They were welcoming, helpful and extremely friendly - from the front desk staff to the breakfast nook staff to the housekeeping staff.I appreciate Hyatt Place because they have free wi-fi and breakfast, all at a reasonable price.This location is in a great spot...walking distance to Times Square, 2 blocks from the Empire State Building, 3 blocks from Penn Station...so easy to get where you need to go from here.I will definitely be staying here again when I'm in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room 2502. Empire State Bldg view - I can only give an average rating because of two critical elements: 1.) there was very little closet space and 2.) the bathroom was tiny. Not sure who Hyatt is trying to appeal to here. If the target traveler is a single business person who only needs closet space for 3 shirts and one suit and isn't sharing a bathroom - he/she probably gives an excellent rating. But if the target travelers are middle-aged couples with disposable income and any sense of style who are coming to NYC on vacation, this hotel is missing the mark. My wife and I couldn't even begin to hang the clothes needed for even a long weekend. And the one-sink one-mirror bathroom is crazy. My suggestion? Why (oh why) is there a full-length couch in that room? Was I supposed to host a cocktail party in there? Or lie back on it and watch football or HBO when I am in NYC? What were they thinking? Remove the couch and put in 1. a vanity (with a mirror - for her) and 2.) an armoire for evening clothes and they create a room that grown-ups can actually use and enjoy. Even the business person wouldn't miss that useless couch - that's what the beds are for! The staff was great, the breakfast was outstanding, the location was perfect - I would like to rank this hotel as very good or excellent - but I can't!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location to walk to all main sites, shopping etc. hotel clean, staff friendly. Room had A/C which was very welcome, breakfast buffet very good. And although we were 6 in one room there were no complaints from the children. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: smaller hotel, no noisy corridors late at night. Central to everything in midtown. Felt very secure. The staff were always friendly and helpful with all of our questions. Room was awesome, perfect for our needs and the shower was 'to die for'!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I thought the hotel was really nice; staff were friendly and provided a bottle of water at check-in, the room was small, but well appointed, WiFi and TV were good. One downside was the lack of a bath towel and the room phone not working, which caused an extra trip to the front desk. The other downside was the garbage piled up on the sidewalk completely around the building. Not the hotels fault, true, but it was a sour smell while walking around piles of garbage bags, then being awoken in the middle of the night by the garbage truck, not the best experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location for tourist- walking distance to Times Square, walking distance to Empire State Building, and walking distance to tour bus stops. Staff was always helpful, kind and friendly. It was nice to have breakfast on site before we headed out for a day of sightseeing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place, is a charming intimate property. Great amenities for the business traveler or a leisure visit. Location is Great, close to shopping, endless restaurants and midtown attractions. Very Clean property with a professional, knowledgeable, and friendly staff. I will definitely be returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was advertised as a room that sleeps up to 6 persons but it was still small for 2 persons! We were a family of 5. In the room, there were 2 twin beds that barely fitted 2 persons in each and when we opened the sofa bed there was no space to walk in the room! I will not comment on space for luggage for my family of 5!! Service was poor, since I asked for a set of towels and a blanket for the 5th person and it took them 2 days to deliver them!! Breakfast was interesting but was lacking on savoury food items (eggs, cheese etc). Elevators were very slow to accomodate the number of clients it had in the 24-storey building! The price was extremely high for the services and the room that it provided. however, the location was excellent for sight seeing and a waliking distance to many interesting sites (Empire State, Times Square, 5th Ave)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is one block from Macy's where we did a lot of shopping. It was easy to run back to our room and drop our bags rather than have to carry them around the city. The rooms were clean. We were upgraded to an upper floor with a fantastic front row view of the Empire State Building all lit up at might! The hotel has free breakfast which was great! The only con was the elevator is very slow. The staff were very friendly and accommodating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A perfectly average hotel in a good location. Room size OK, just, for two but small given we needed to use the sofabed. inadequate hanging facilities for clothes whether for two people or, as we were, three. Comfortable beds, good shower. Breakfast adequate with a single hot food option but, as others have said, the dining room is too small for peak periods and there are inadequate staff to clean tables, and refresh cutlery and crockery which keep running out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It is on a fairly dreary block and not the most ideal location for Midtown. But then again you are paying perhaps 1/4 of what they get at the Lanham just up the street on the corner of Fifth Avenue. This is a fairly new conversion of a dreary old apartment or office building. The rooms are sparkling clean and fitted out with appropriate amenities for a budget to mid-range property. It has about as much character as an airport lounge, but if you ask for a room in the back it will be quiet enough with the "white noise of the HVAC system drowning out any traffic noise. There are only a handful of rooms on each floor, and with 28 or so floors and 2 elevators you are introduced to the typical Manhattan past time of waiting for elevators.A good firm king bed, a large flat screen television, a sofa, frigobar, desk and chair, good lighting and forgettable art work, all you need for a generic and acceptable brief stay. The tiny closet and the efficient but austere bathroom with fairly thin towels are not conducive to a lengthy sojourn. Two layers of light deadening shades keep the sunlight out and hide the very dusty windows. Too bad we are breathing that stuff in Midtown.I suspect they see this price point segment in competition with Hampton Inn and Courtyard, and frankly I think Hilton and Marriott do a better job in this sector. Still, the Hyatt staff are friendly; the included breakfast (steam table hot items and good Starbucks coffee and juice) will do; wifi, printing and nearly 24 hour food service are valued perks.Would I stay here again? Perhaps. There are plenty of hotels, and many of them new, in this price range. Location and loyalty programs will probably influence your choice.On the night and morning of our stay, the hotel was packed with mostly foreign tourists and their families, a wholesome and bargain seeking bunch. It is a decent property and not too far away from my old neighborhood, Murray Hill. Worth considering if you are a practical sort and trying to save some bucks for yourself or the bean counters.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed here last week. I was really expecting great service and hassle free stay. No. It did not happen. Check in should be before 3 pm but when we arrive at 3:30 pm our room was not ready. They told us to come back in 15 minutes. We walked around for 30 minutes, came back and it was still not ready. We waited in the lounge for another 45 minutes and they finally told us that the laundry truck was late and it would take another hour for linens to arrive and our rooms would be ready them. Yes, we eventually got our rooms but late and waited a long time.We went to the bar to get drinks while waiting because they told us to. There was no bartender. Only people who were waiting for their rooms looking unhappy.The breakfast was a mess. Very long lines with dirty tables because only one person was cleaning the room. They had positioned the toaster right in the middle of the breakfast line and no one was moving until their bagel got toasted. Long wait and they knew this would happen and staff saw it all along.I received a customer satisfaction survey to complete via email three days after our stay, filled it out immediately and described our stay. No one has gotten back to me or even acknowledge our stay at this Hyatt site. I event gave them my phone number to call me back or email me to discuss our experience.Overall, do not stay here. Not cheap and certainly not worth the price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We are a group of friends who live in NYC and decided to check in for the weekend. Everything was fine. Clean, comfortable, centrally located in midtown UNTIL we were all in the room... The room is LOCKED and suddenly someone uses their key goes in looks at us excuses themselves and leaves!?!?! Seriously? How did they get in? It was NOT an hotel employee! When we looked out in the hallway the person had rushed out !! I immediately call the front desk to complain and ask for an explanation and the ONLY thing they could say is that they would change our keys? And asked me if the room was locked? L-O-L!!!! Helllooooo???? Why would a stranger have access to our room from the start?!! And yes OBVIOUSLY it was locked!!!! We had an event that night and we did not leave afraid someone could come in and steal our things!!! Ridiculous! Most ridiculous thing Ive lived in any hotel in NyC!!!! Do not recommend! So disappointed, my dinner/event plans were ruined.... I was afraid to leave the crappy room thinking they would rob me!!! Thank you Hyatt! Wonderful!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful customer service, great people working hard to make your stay a pleasant one. Visited for business purposes but stayed a few extra days to enjoy the city with my family. Hyatt Place did not disappoint.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Thiis property is truly a gem. I have stayed at many different properties in NYC and I find myself drawn back to this property. It is centrally located but far enough away from the hustle/bustle to get a good nights rest. The staff is exceptional and always greets you with a smile. They go above and beyond to make sure your stay is a comfortable one. The rooms are clean and updated. The hot breakfast is a plus i.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for two nights on a business trip. The staff were extremely polite and helpful, especially at the front desk. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The view of the Empire State Building was amazing. The service was excellent. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The rooms are pretty small which is expected in New York, I guess. The location was PERFECT just a couple of blocks away from all the action. The breakfast was good. Once the food ran out, they replaced it right away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is in a GREAT location, right in midtown. Easy to get to, and just two blocks from the Herald Square subway station. Pay a bit extra for the room with a view, it won't disappoint! Beware, you're pretty close to touristy destinations (Empire State Building, Times Square), so that will either be a plus or a negative for you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Midtown for one night on a recent business trip to NYC. The hotel is nice and in a good midtown location. Rooms are clean (newer hotel) and modern. The elevators are a bit slow but that is to be expected in a Manhattan hotel. The TV in my room didn't work. I tried calling the front desk but after no one answered (over 5 minutes of ringing), I just gave up. I had dinner plans and need to meet some coworkers. When I was checking out the next morning, I mentioned it to the front desk manager, Tiffany. She asked me if I told anyone about the issue and I told her I tried calling but no one answered (I told her it was around 5pm). She said that is a very busy time at the front desk and that I should have tried calling when they weren't busy with people checking in. Her tone and body language was upsetting considering I was just trying to let her know that the TV was broke (and that she should have someone fix it before the next guest arrives). She then went on to tell me that it was my fault for not having the TV fixed and that I should have done something about it earlier. I stay at hotels a lot (Gold Passport Diamond) and have never been treated so rudely. A nice hotel but the management needs a bit more training. When I'm traveling for business, I don't have time to spend my entire night trying to fix a TV or packing up my luggage to move to another room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel and very friendly staff and front desk, I stayed with my family for six days and we enjoyed the hospitality, generosity and much more from suck kind staff.For sure the location is perfect and so close to many and various city activities Perfect hotel considering it is a 3 stars hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is great here. Very walkable to desirable locations. I stayed here for one night on business and had a pleasant experience. The rooms are on the smaller side, but more than I needed. Upon check-in I was greeted with an ice cold bottle of water (it's the little things!). My room was very clean and the bed--VERY comfortable. Bathroom was clean and shower was very nice and spacious. There was a fridge in the room that came in handy and I was offered free wifi (might have been due to staying for business). I didn't have any problems at night with loud guests or thin walls. They slipped my receipt under the door before I left the next day so I didn't even have to check out! Very pleasant stay and I would recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is my third stay at this hotel; location, price and service generally excellent; highly recommended for a midtown Manhattan stay. Did have some problems this trip (only) with lkate night food service, but that was satisfactorily dealt with.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nothing negative to say. The hotel is in midtown a short walk from several major subway lines, Bryant Park, Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller plaza, and more. The hotel itself is what you'd expect from a Hyatt a place. The included breakfast was fine. Wifi speed was good. Rooms were clean. It's not staying at the plaza, but for the price, is a very good option in midtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed at a number of NYC hotels in this hotel category and this one is my new favorite. VERY friendly staff, well-appointed, spotless and spacious room and clean bath. All good.And the free breakfast (very unusual for NYC) was excellent. I am currently in a healthy eating mode and there were plenty of choices including a tasty omelette, fresh fruit salad, sliced grapefruit, yogurt, and oatmeal with many topping choices. My only complaint is that I can hear the street noise and nearby construction even though I'm on the 19th floor. The sliding windows don't provide adequate sound insulation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at a few different Hyatt properties while visiting NYC and this property has it all. Even though it is only rated 3 stars it stands out clearly. The rooms are clean and ample for what should be expected in the City. The overall experience with all staff is outstanding. They are very personable, friendly and willing to go the extra distance to accommodate within their means. This hotel is close to everything; subway, eateries, bars and Empire State building. You also get the perk of a hot breakfast which is included in your stay. This is definitely my choice of stay in the City. Hats off to a wonderful staff that makes you want to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room was very comfortable, clean, and quiet, and provided an excellent refuge while in NYC. The location was perfect in the Mid-Town area. The hotel staff was very attentive. I will look to stay here when I return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were able to check in early, room was ready, staff was professional and very friendly. Also helped with subway info and provided maps. Free breakfast was buffet style and quite tasty. Fresh home-made French Toast served one morning along with several other options. The next day, the main meal was different which was nice. I would highly recommend this place to anyone staying for leisure or business. I will look to stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place after having to move out of a hotel in Murray Hill due to the full occupancy. I paid a very high price on Agoda in Australian dollars for one of the smallest hotels I've ever had nevertheless the hotel was better than expected. Service was very good from the front desk team despite the small but very busy lobby. As the room was small there was very space to put a suitcase but the room was relatively quiet considering the location near Broadway & 5th Av on 36th.Location was ideal in mid town as I wanted to be close to Madison Square Garden for a concert.I agree with what others have said about breakfast - it's a bit like a madhouse in the morning and the food is basic.Next door at the Best Western has a reasonable happy hour and a small rear outdoor deck.All things considered it was a good hotel but not worth the price I had to pay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This quaint hotel, may be in between 5th & 6th streets, but is bigger inside than it is outside; also, has wonderful rooms, good elevators & fantastic staff. It's near Broadway & Times Square, & right behind the hotel, the Empire State Building

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Convenient location near Herald Square, subways, Empire State Building, and not too far from the Theater District. Room was comfortable and well appointed. No tub, just a shower. Breakfast could be improved.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown for a Yankees game with my wife and daughter. The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. A girl named Dulce greeted us with a smile and was very accommodating as we arrived early. The bellman, Rich, was also very helpful and informative. Our room had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Convenient midtown location with an easy walk to the subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My stay at the Hyatt was very enjoyable. I got an excellent deal via HotelTonight and the hotel did not disappoint. The room was clean. The bathroom was clean. The front desk was courteous and welcoming. Everything went smoothly. The price was so good for NYC. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quick and easy place to stay in nyc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms are much smaller than you expect from a Hyatt Place, but that is nornal for NYC. They are nice, new and clean. The staff was excellent. I would totally stay here again. The breakfast was good, too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times when we go into the city. The location is great, rooms are clean with good views of the city. I needed a flat iron for my hair for a night out with my husband and forgot mine at home. The awesome front desk staff had one to loan out at this hotel. Great service! We stayed here for our anniversary and it was not too far from the theather district area where we went to see a show.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is clean modern and located one block from 34st/herald square subway station. Times Square, Empire State Building radio city all within walking distance. Room is very well designed not big but very functional. All rooms have a view. We only got a room with city view meaning looking at north direction with met life building. When questioned the staff said that's all there is and it's an excuse. So ask for Empire State Building view directly when checking in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We chose this hotel for an overnight stay in New York City because of its location and were very pleased when we were greeted in such a friendly way by each person who works there--beginning with Leslie who checked us in at the front desk. As we left the desk to go to our room, we were given bottled water which was much appreciated on a very warm summer day. The room was spacious in New York hotel terms, clean and inviting with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the street. The bed was very comfortable with lovely sheets. The air-conditioning was thankfully working well. Breakfast in the morning (which was included--rare for a City hotel) provided lots of healthy choices--oatmeal, eggs & sausage, cereals, fruit & yogurt and Starbucks coffee. Dana was working in the breakfast galley and was especially friendly and helpful--working hard to keep the place tidy and doing it with a warm smile. Marlinne was at the front desk when we checked out and was friendly and helpful--marking for us on the map how best to get to the 9/11 Memorial Museum. One recommendation--ask for a room off the street as New York is truly the "city that never sleeps!"

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It's a basic but modern hotel. Right off 5 th avenue on 36 th street. Staff at reception friendly, a simple food bar and a very reasonable store next door with beverages and snacks. The bathrooms modern and clean, and the rooms contemporary. Ask for a high floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stay at this hotel most times I'm in NYC. It's in great shape -- clean and well maintained. The rooms are perfect for a business trip -- functional desk, space to spread out, and comfy bed. Plus, the staff is always helpful. If you need a midtown hotel, this is a great option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Visited NYC and needed a place to crash for a night so booked this property. I like Hyatt Place's because the rooms are spacious and for NYC, the room was huge. The hotel is in a good location and easily accessible to public transit and local attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I traveled with my family of five: 3 girls (8,9,12). We reserved a room that will accomodate us, but it wasn't available when we got however, the staff honored our rate and gave us adjacent rooms which was better. The staff is friendly, helpful and the location is great since you are farther from the Times Square area. The breakfast is nice, Herald Square is right there and the subway very close. Good for families and reasonable price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Adequate rooms...small but clean. Front desk friendly. Elevator service was terrible. 25 floors all rooms booked serviced by 2 very slow elevators. Breakfast variety lacking and very limited seating for number of guests. Get to breakfast early if you stay on weekend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had another great stay at the Hyatt mid town. Elevators very slow in the morning. Had to wait 7 minutEs to leave 26 floor. Other than that it was a great stay.,close to subway. Nice breakfast quiet rooms

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is on west 36th, right near my favorite steak house Keens so it's well located. It's fairly new, clean and offers free breakfast. It's usually the lowest priced Hyatt in the city, so I stay here a lot. It's a bit like living in your old college dorm furnished by Ikea, but it works for a cheap and cheerful. The elevators can be brutally slow in the morning when you are trying to get to work,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: wasnt satisfied with the staff. There was one guy that was awesome. The ladies at the front were rude, impolite, and didn't care about us at all. The bed was nice- good sleep. The front desk didnt help us with directions or anything. super disappointing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here in November after flying into New York from San Juan , for a 2 night stay , prior heading back to UK , it is a perfect location for everything you need to do touristy, the staff were great , and so friendly , with lots of local info of where to head, the room was spotless , and much better than anticipated, breakfast was a great ,help your self Buffett ,which set us up for the day , free wifi and computer access to check in at airport and even print off , they even organised taxi back to JFK, which turned out cheaper than what I arranged getting there . Free storage for your cases if your flight is later, yes there are only two lifts , but we didn't let it stress us out , we would happily stay again , if ever in New York .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was my second time staying here. I saw it on the listings and had to stay here again! It's a great little hotel right in the middle of everything..few blocks from Times Square, few blocks from the Empire State Building. I asked for a view and the woman checking us in said they had none left, however she can put us higher, so when we walked into our room and saw the view we were still thrilled! Free breakfast is a nice touch and yummy. Love this place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Friendly staff. Good location. Walking distance to most attractions, shopping, shows, etc. Elevators slow. Best to get lower floor room to take stairs. Breakfast was very good and there was a variety of items to choose.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Such a great location and hotel. The staff is amazing and the rooms are perfect. Book this place. You will not regret a thing. Close to all and the rooms are like little studios. Parking can be tuff but your in midtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel offers 2 queen beds in addition to a pullout sofa. The room, by NYC standards, was also quite large. It is not the "typical" Hyatt Place layout, but we had enough room for a family of 5, with three teenagers. Breakfast was fairly good and the staff was helpful and friendly. We were able to check in a little early and were given a room with a great view of the Empire State Building. Location was excellent. Easy walk to Times Square and the Theater District. Empire State Building is just a few blocks away. There is also a subway station just one block away on 35th that is a great option to get downtown to see the 9/11 Memorial and Statue of Liberty. Finally, the rate we got was very reasonable for NYC hotel. Would recommend this hotel for families visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Not the cheapest hotel, but good price compared with similar hotels, free wi-fi and breakfast was a good deal because some other hotels charge for them. I will consider this one as future options if I come back to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We love the location and cleanliness of this hotel. it is low key and the staff is friendly and helpful. My husband and I enjoyed the breakfast buffet provided every morning as it helps us to get out quickly. It saves us a lot of time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel offers an excellent location close to all New York has to offer. Breakfast should be improved but overall I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Front desk staff are terrific and always happy to help.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My office is in midtown Manhattan (39 & 6th) so this location was perfect. It was an ideal hotel to "sleep" in for me, but that was about it. The rate, for a hotel in Manhattan was pretty good so I would for sure stay here again. This hotel was "no frills" but when you are just sleeping there, thats all you need.The staff was good and I had zero problems. Thanks everyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Have traveled here twice in the past 13 months. Love the location, helpful staff and tasty breakfasts. Last year we came with our four children and it was perfect. This year was only a mom and dad trip so we got a room facing the Empire State building on the 21st floor. This property has 26 floors.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had two adults and three kids in one room. The room was spacious enough and the beds were very comfortable. The rooms were clean and very quiet. The staff was very helpful and gave good advice about how to get around the city. The free breakfast was excellent and plentiful. We chose the Hyatt Place for its convenient location (we walked from Grand Central Station easily), queen sized beds and free breakfast and we were extremely pleased with the quality of the room, food and service. We recommend it highly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for a quick jaunt into the city with the kiddos. Had a nice weekend away and the hotel was in a decent location to see many things. Small room, but clean. Had a room on the Main Street which was a little loud even though we were on a high floor. Breakfast was nice, but get there early so they don't run out of things like pancakes. Overall decent stay, nothing spectacular but it wasn't lacking. Valet was quick and bell hops were very attentive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location of this Hyatt was perfect for us. We were in the city to see a play and to do a bit of shopping and such. I felt the hotel was located centrally for all the places I would be seeing. The staff is friendly!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent a great weekend in New York with the Hyatt Place in mid town Manhattan as our landing spot. Our room was on the 23rd floor and we had an awesome view of the Empire State Building. Ask for that! The only negative was that the elevators can be ridiculously slow and they only have two. But breakfast was amazing and free! Unfortunately, we found a very stale donut in a very greasy bag in the top drawer of the dresser.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is great, close to Time Square, MSG, theaters, shopping and lots of great restaurants and bars.We lived in a king bed room, which is clean but the room size is small. All the essential things are available in the room though.The breakfast is great, but the dining room is crowded and often has a line.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for four nights at the end of June/early July. I won't repeat all the great comments about the nice free breakfast and staff since it's all true. Here's a quick summary of my stay:Pros:- can sleep 5 (2Q and sofabed) but not much room after that- empty fridge in room for water bottles and drinks- free wifi though connection dropped often after first night- free breakfast- great location- great staff- Costco members deal giving me 10% offCons:- Breakfast and elevators very busy after 8am- Only one bathroom in breakfast area- Arrived on Pride Parade Day; 5th Ave closed so had to detour around- More ice machines available would be niceOverall, I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After staying one night in an absurd boutique hotel that was totally not worth the price, my boyfriends and I moved to the Hyatt for night two of our NY weekend. It was WONDERFUL. The room was a good size worth plenty of space to move about, very clean, and had plenty of outlets and space in the fridge for food and drink. The staff was courteous and the hotel is really conveniently located, easily walkable to Times Square, the Highline, and Fifth Ave. shops. And best of all, it was so reasonably priced. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Keeping in mind that this is a budget hotel, it is in midtown NYC, near a subway station at 34th St. Besides a good location (also, it's close to Macy's and plenty of other shopping sites) they provide a nice guest breakfast. The staff, especially Marlene at the front desk and Rick, a valet, bellman, and part concierge are a pleasure to deal with. The reasonable (for NYC) price assures that the place will always be buzzing with guests, so there are occasional waits for an elevator. We would not hesitate to visit this location again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is close to Penn Station, there is free breakfast in the morning before you start your day (decent egg sandwiches and waffles) -- though you need to get there early to avoid the crowd, nice view of the Empire State Building, and they allow 5 in a room (though you need to ask for extra linens).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Easy subway access; located between 5th & 6th Avenues in a nice neighborhood, away from the Times Square madness. The hotel offered free breakfast to guest, and the food was not only excellent, but selection was good each day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very disappointing--the only good thing about this hotel is the location. The hotel should be an embarrassment for the Hyatt chain. It needs a major renovation--lobby, elevators, room decor. The breakfast is the worst I have seen in any hotel-- the quality of the food and service were terrible

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For our first visit to NYC, we stayed at the Hyatt. It was a nice hotel, squeezed in among construction and small businesses. Our room was on the 19th floor, but we could still hear the street noise. If you sleep light, take ear plugs. Our room was nice and clean, we enjoyed the large comfortable bed and couch. The window looked out over the city and had two blinds options - allowing in a little bit of light but protecting your privacy, or completely shutting out the light. The hotel is just down the road from the Empire State Building and not too far from Times Square. We chose this hotel due to the location. The hotel recommends that you park in the Meyers Parking Garage, just down the road from them, and then validate with the hotel before you leave. This garage was a lot more expensive than the others we saw around the city. Validating only saved $1.40 off the normal rates, so if you are ok with walking a bit more, check out the other parking garage options nearby. The free breakfast was great, each day the options included fresh fruit, cereal, bagels/donuts, and hot food items like pancakes and breakfast sandwiches.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great central base for visiting New York. The Empire State, Times Square and Macey's are all within walking distance. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy, my only comments would be that the external windows were very dirty. Breakfast was adequate for our needs with hot and cold food, juice and coffee.Our room was on the 9th floor facing the road which did have some road noise but our overall stay was very enjoyable and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Clean quiet room with comfortable bed. Great breakfast with great variety included in the stay at the hotel. It was a great find in NYC at a great price! Monique at the front desk was very helpful in getting copies made of documents I needed while staying there. We accidentally left our laptop charger in the room. Housekeeping recovered it and were very quick to accommodate and help us to get it returned. Great experience and very helpful staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I usually stay at the Grand Hyatt because it's closer to the office, however I have been increasingly disappointed by that location so I decided to try this hotel out. First, the location is very handy. I did not have time to do much sightseeing, however the location is very close to a couple of subway stations and it's easy to get around. The room I stayed in was excellent -- very clean with nice furnishings. I was even given a room with a pretty decent view as well. I ate breakfast here twice and was pleased. The fresh fruit was perfect for me and I enjoyed the hot selections as well. I ate dinner here twice as well and was very pleased with the food. Even more important, all of the staff I encountered were pleasant, helpful, and just a joy to interact with. I'll definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here in June 2015 and had a nice stay. The rooms were clean and we had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was also very quiet and we slept well. One area for improvement would be the friendliness of the front desk staff upon check-in. Maybe it's a NYC thing but they seemed a bit brusque. I've seen friendlier service at other locations. But all in all, we had a good stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For $379 a night ($439 including tax), I got a small room with a comfortable bed but non-working TV. Next AM, waited nearly fifteen minutes for elevator before walking eight floors with my bags to check out. Never again. Shame on Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good central location, friendly helpful staff and reasonable value. The room was of a good size and comfortably furnished. The only downside was that although breakfast was included in the room rate, the choice for a hot breakfast was quite limited and we probably would have been better off eating breakfast elsewhere. That said, we would certainly choose this hotel again for any future visits. Also, because of our Hyatt Club membership, we were allowed a 2pm checkout which suited our departure arrangements perfectly. The concierge also arranged a car service to the NJ airport for $USD80, flat rate. Given the issues of taxis/limos crossing state lines we felt this was reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Not sure the rate because we traveled for business, staff at desk was very friendly. We were able to get cabs and see quite a bit from the central location. the bed was comfortable and view was great from floor 19, the empire state building literally right outside the window. Breakfast was included and it was decent. Coffee was good. The bathroom was nice with a clean and updated shower. I would stay again if we needed to be in that area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I searched high and low for a hotel in Manhattan with two queen-size beds and a sofa sleeper for a family of 5 - this hotel has it! It also comes with a hot cooked breakfast; a must for a family traveling with 3 kids in NYC. The room was not big, but it was comfortable and we all had the space we needed to sleep. One tip: bring an outlet strip for charging devices, as there were not many outlets in the room. We were on the sixth floor facing the side and had virtually no street noise. The front desk staff was extremely helpful with subway directions and restaurant suggestions, and had a baggage hold service which we used our last day there. They also leave dishes out and accessible, as well as a microwave, so if you bring back leftovers, you can warm them in the kitchen-area microwave on real plates. I would have enjoyed having coffee and tea service left out all the time, but there is a small coffee maker in the room. We found the black-out shades helpful, and were also glad we were only on the sixth floor as one of the elevators was not working one day, causing a real headache in this 26-floor property. The location is excellent - just a block or so from Macy's, and not far from Bryant Park and the Empire State Building. It's not spacious or cheap, but if you need to sleep and feed five in Manhattan, this place does the trick nicely.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
