The ice machines were only provided on three floors. And the elevators were VERY slow.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Disappointment, not worth spending money on this hotel. bad service, no lotion. I was not happy & request Hyatt pay back. Requested 3 rooms on a floor because we had 2 old people with us during the trip. No luck & mercy

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: OMG what great value for money . This hotel is so well place to see the sights of New York . It's a stone throw for Time Square and all the attractions. The hotel room was well appointed with comfortable beds and even a sofa in the room. The bathroom had a huge shower room and was spotless . The staff were very friendly and helpful and went out of there way to help . I visited over the busy New Year period and even though the hotel was busy it was a pleasure to stay in. If I had to make a negative comment about the hotel I would say the lifts for a multi story building were very slow .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel set in the perfect location, great friendly staff. If you stay in a higher level room you don't hear the street noise as much.The room I stayed in the last time wasn't as good as others I have used. But I will stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was our 2nd time staying there and will stay again. Staff was great very friendly and informative. Breakfast was good. Location is excellent close to many attractions Time Square, Empire State building and Macy's. Transportation is nearby Bus and subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were charged an "Upgrade Fee" for changing rooms even though we were not told that we would be until checkout. Staff then became rude and annoyed that I would even ask a question. There is not enough space in this hotel. Rooms are tiny & lobby is tiny. Two elevators cannot satisfy the demand - waited over 10 minutes several times when trying to go downstairs from the 17th floor. Room keys (both) stopped working on 3 different occasions in 3 days - not a big deal, just rather annoying when being forced to wait for the elevators AGAIN to keep going up and down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My expectations were not high when I arrived at the modest entrance on a crowded street. At check in, the service was superb, accommodating a request to be in a room near that of family. The room was large, spotless and comfortably furnished with sofa,fridge, desk and excellent lighting. It was also quiet. The breakfast buffet that was included in the price of the room exceeded many of those that cost $22 or more in other hotels that I frequent. Although, this is not in the center of Manhattan, it is near a subway that gets you there and within an easy walk of Penn Station. Hotel staff know the area and are helpful with directions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellent location, excellent hotel, excellent staff. Very comfortable. Great location for Broadway and Times Square (about five blocks away), but not in the center of all the crowds! Breakfast has a wide selection of freshly made items. Coffee was good & strong. Business center easily accessible and easy to use. Several excellent restaurants within a four block radius. Two blocks from historic Macy's and Herald Square; easy access to IRT and IND subway lines; taxis abound and easy to get on 7th Ave going uptown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location: perfect!Great location, in the middle of the city. Walking distance to a number if places, so you don't have to be wasting money on Taxi's!..Times Square - 5-7 minsByrant Park/Public Library - 3-5 minsCentral Park - 30 minsEmpire State Building - 5 minsSubway stations (34th & Pennsylvania are the closest) both approx 5-10 min walkWorld Trade Center - 1 hour(All times are approx based on how long it took us)Staff: one rude, the rest "okay"When we arrived we was welcomed by a receptionist who was not very friendly at all! We booked with a travel agency and booked for the night before we arrived as we arrived at 7am in the morning and did not want to wait around in the lobby until 3pm (when check in is available). We was not informed by the agency to contact the hotel to let them know we wasn't arriving until the next day. When we checked in, because we were booked for the day before we had been put down as a "no show". The receptionist was very rude in the way she spoke to us, basically telling us it was our fault, we should have known to call the hotel and tell them and that "we were lucky" there was another room available otherwise we wouldn't have a room! We had been travelling for over 12 hours, so this was something we didn't really need first thing in the morning! Especially in the way we were told!!Other than that the other staff were okay. Some cheerful and happy to help and some not very. Not one of them wished us a merry Christmas on Christmas Day. In general, we were disappointed with the staff!Rooms: AverageBasic rooms. Large king bed. Sofa bed. Large shower. Fridge. Coffee machine. TV. NO VIEW if at the front! COLD! Crap windows that constantly lets a draft in! Very noisy (not double glazing so can hear the noise on the street). Freezing - had to have heating on 90% of the time!Cleanliness: PoorWe stayed for 10 nights and our room got hoovered once! That was about 2 days before we left. The window seal was covered in dust. The headboard and side tables too!Maids came in each day to "freshen" the room, but never was it dusted! There was never any quilt cover on the bed, just a duvet and a sheet! This is something I've never heard of before! So unhygienic, as you don't know how often the duvets are washed. The flat sheet had a hole in, the fitted sheet was always wrinkled and one day when they changed the sheets they put a dirty sheet on with marks on! Our room didn't get cleaned for 2 days. We assumed the first day that maybe it was because it was a Sunday. But when we returned Monday evening and our room still hadn't been cleaned we went down to ask. Reception didn't know why it hadn't been clean and sent someone up as we were heading out!Breakfast: don't even botherNo matter what time there is a ridiculous queue for breakfast. The area to sit is too small for the amount of guests. Twice when we actually bothered to go down, we had to take food up to our room as there was no space downstairs. Poor choice of selection! Went down on Xmas day thinking maybe it would be different and there were: sausages, scrambled egg and vegetarian scrambled egg. That was is for hot food! Then you had some fruit or cereals and some porridge which I thought I'd have since I didn't want the hot food and I soon have up on that... It was so thick you couldn't even move the ladle! Other: poor2 elevators for the whole hotel. 26 floors and approx 6 rooms on each floor = the worlds slowest elevators and you wasting your time waiting for them! Really was ridiculous. Highly disappointed with the hotel overall. Would NOT recommend to anyone and would suggest to stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel location is really good - close to Penn Station/Madison Square Garden and the Empire State, for example, and not far from the subway. The room is comfortable, clean and large. Staff is also friendly. Free breakfast is good, but go early and avoid the crowd.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown South for 13 nights. After staying at several different hotels in previous visits to NYC, we felt this was by far the best room we have had. It was large by NY standards, with a sofa and large ottoman, as well as a mini fridge. We also enjoyed the floor to ceiling picture windows. In fact, because we arrived a few days before Christmas and were planning to be there for almost two weeks, we went across the street to Duane Reade and bought a small (4 1/2 ft) pre-lit Christmas tree for $22 and put it up in front of the windows. Looked great and made the room festive for the holidays! There is a large seating area downstairs next to the "kitchen" where they serve a free breakfast. The food is mediocre at best and the line is sometimes long. We only ate there about 4 days. The wait for the elevators can also be very lengthy. Those are the two biggest negatives we encountered, and the only reason I rated it as very good instead of excellent. We were on the fifth floor and our view was of 36th St., but I believe some of the upper floors have excellent views of the city (especially with those big windows). There was quite a bit of street noise, so the upper floors would probably have less of that as well. Free wi-fi was a plus for us, and fairly uncommon in NYC. The location is great, with easy access to subways at 35th and 6th Ave. and at Herald Square. Easy walk to Times Square, Chelsea, Murray Hill. There are numerous places to eat within two or three blocks. Our favorite was Pronto Pizza at 36th and Broadway. Recommend it highly (but don't choose it based on the free breakfast).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Solid hotel. Room size ok for nyc. Not a super sized hotel which was nice. Great view on the 24th floor. I could see 30 Roc tower. Higher floor wasn't too noisy even though there was a metal plate on 36th Street that trucks ran over. I left happy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was with my first experince with Hyatt Place and it was surprisingly good. I stayed there for 4 nights during Christmas. The check-in staff was friendly - they knew that I had a long flight and offered me the room straight away upon my arrival at around noon time.My room was on the 20th floor - simple yet modernly furnished with a typical Hyatt setting. It was clean and comfortable. I felt indeed like being at home. One thing to note is that there was a fridge in the room but it was empty. If you would like some snacks and quick drinks, you'd better stock something up from the local stores nearby. For those who are staying on a higher floor, please be warned that you may need to wait for a long time for elevator during morning rush hours. There are also two in the hotel and often it may stop in every single floor.Location is the key reason why so many people picked this hotel. It's situated on the 36th street between 5th and 6th Avenue. Times Square is literally around the corner and The Empire States Building is also walking distance within 3 blocks. All the key sights around mid-town are all accessible easily without taking any transportation.The hotel also offers free wifi all around the premise. In the morning, there is a complimentary breakfast at the Gallery Kitchen on the ground floor for all guests. I was pretty impressed by the variety of seletions ranging from oatmeals, cereals, fresh fruits, pastries, juices, coffee and even some hot items like pancakes, sandwiches, eggs, etc. This was definitely a great deal. My only suggestion is that the hotel can extend the breakfast hours to 10am on a weekday as well.I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want something more extra than Holiday Inn Express and Best Western Premier. The consistency of Hyatt experience does make a difference. I will return to this hotel on my next visit to the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed at a number of Hyatt hotels in NYC (Andaz 5th Ave, Andaz Wall Street, and the Grand Hyatt) and the Hyatt Place is my favorite. The location can't be beat. It's about a block away from the BDFM and NRQ subway lines, which take you to most places that you would like to go. It is also within walking distance to Penn Station (if you're arriving via Amtrak or one of those DC to NYC buses) which makes things convenient. In general, the Midtown/Herald Square location serves as a great base if you're visiting NYC for pleasure. Location aside, the hotel staff are helpful and the room is modern, clean, and big for NYC standard (e.g. You can put your luggage down and still be able to walk around the room). The Hyatt place, Grand Hyatt, and Andaz 5th Ave are all within 5-10 minutes walking distance apart, but the Hyatt place is usually substantially cheaper that the other two and with a better location. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is well-located, comfortable and clean. It is priced well below comparable and not as good hotels in the mid-town area. The staff is friendly, and a bellman--Rich-- serves as a great source of help and information. Want to know where to get a threat bagel? Ask Rich. A good hamburger? Ask Rich. Car service? Ask Rich. One tip. They charge $30 extra for a room with a view of the Empire State Building. Save your money. It is so close that you can't see it all from the rooms. There is a much better view from nearby Herald Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice hotel with great customer service, room was small but had everything we needed; great location but lots of construction going on which made it a little bit inconvenient especially with all the traffic. I would return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After searching for deals online I traded in credit card points for hotel points and was rewarded handsomely. We went up the Saturday after Christmas and even though our room wasn't ready we dropped our luggage and were ready to explore. Unfortunately the only reason this isn't an excellent review is that our room was still not ready at check in time and we took a room on a lower floor. The elevators are slow at peak times, but that is to be expected. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was surprisingly large for how small the hotel is. Will definitely recommend and return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: There is 2 elevator for 26 floor and one is always broken or they are using for cleaning service, You have to wait least 15 min to go to your room. TV paid channels not working, we called 3 times to front desk and they said they are sending somebody and nobody came. Key cards stops working periodically and you have to go to front desk to reactivate it. We waited over 1 hr to check in. Checkin in time was 3:00 pm and we walked in our room in 4:15 pm.Breakfast line goes in to the looby. Foods runs out and they don't feel it up.Good thing for this hotel is it is very close to everywhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Pleasant staff. Always helpful. Hotel is newer so excellent heating and A/C. Fast elevator for NY. Breakfast good. Rooms are decent size for NY city. My room faced inward so the most quiet room I've had in the city. Excellent easy location for Macy's, Empire St Bldg and Penn Station. Comfortable beds and bedding.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The web site is not accurate very very small lobby and room No service of any type after breakfast-no one works in coffee area or bar area- front desk workers try to wear all hats- stayed 5 nights could not get late check out- Very disappointed for a hyatt owned property Would have thought you were in a very small rural town motel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: its very important that the hotel is near all the rigth places.the crew is very welcoming and help alotthe rooms are very nice but DONT TAKE ROOM TO THE STREET SIDE !!!!!!the breakfast is nice in the american way. if you didn't like it there and resurants near by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our recent stay at the Hyatt Midtown during the Christmas holiday was made even more exceptional because of the super fantastic staff in the hotel. Very professional and courteous staff who remembered your name, and small things about your trip to support your time with them. Really good time with the Hyatt staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This Hyatt is in the middle of all the action in midtown NYC. The staff is extremely accommodating. Breakfast is great but be sure to get there early to avoid the crowds. The price is quite a value as compared to other NYC midtown hotels. I don't know of any other to offer breakfast included in the room charge. Not great for romance, but excellent for business and families.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Place New York Midtown South in October, 2014 for a long weekend (Canadian Thanksgiving). The hotel is exactly what we had hoped for - spotless, modern and comfortable rooms, convenient location, very friendly and competent staff, and great value for the money. The only thing I didn't like is that the fridge in the room was so loud I had to unplug it to sleep. This would have been an issue for me had I needed the fridge. I couldn't sleep with it running even with ear plugs in. Our room was small, but very comfortable, with a couch and coffee table and a great view. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast which is included, but I have so many food allergies and sensitivities that I could only eat the fruit. My husband loved the breakfast though. The elevator can be very busy and slow during the morning breakfast rush so give yourself lots of time in the morning. There isn't much at the breakfast if you can't eat gluten or dairy (like me), but there is a fabulous smoothie place a few doors down from the hotel called Pulp Juice (it's at 16 W 36th St and basically a counter off the street so look hard or you'll walk right by it) which makes the most AMAZING smoothies with fresh fruits and veggies. I could live off their smoothies! There is also a great casual restaurant directly beside the hotel called Pure and Fresh which has the most delicious assortment of freshly made food. They make custom salads which are to die for. My husband and I ate dinner there every day. They were also very accommodating of my food sensitivities. This hotel was great. The staff were super sweet. The location was great too. It's on a quiet street in a busy area which made for a comfortable sleep. It's close to Macy's and the Empire State building and so central it's easy to get anywhere. It's great for couples and families. There were business travellers there too, but I can't comment on amenities for business travellers. I would stay here again and recommend it for a great affordable place to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great experience at the 36th Street Hyatt. Accommodating staff that went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and welcomed. Walking distance to Bryant Park, Port Authority, Penn Station, Rockefellar Plaza, Macys, etc. Great place to stay for access to holiday store decorations!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here because I got a great deal on priceline. A good midtown option. It's like every Hyatt Place I have ever stayed at but the rooms are a little smaller and the building is much taller-- so it is predictable and comfortable and good for things like wifi and customer service. Nothing sensational but all in all a really good business hotel with a great location for transportation options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here in November 2014 visiting New York on a short trip. The hotel is centrally located round the corner from the Empire State Building, Macy's and close to Madison Square Garden and approx 10mins walk to Times Square. The hotel is in a line up of three hotels pretty much next door to each other. Check in was fast and efficient. After reading previous reviews I asked for a room on a high floor at the back. I got a room on the 16th floor not quite so high but still a great view of the Empire State Building. I was glad I had a room at the back as the front facing rooms overlook an Irish Pub which was pretty noisy at night. My room was clean and a decent size, some previous reviewers thought the rooms small but for me it was a really good size I've stayed in places where you can just about walk round the bed and with little or no storage. It was also a bonus having a sofa in the room. There is so much to see and do in NYC there's not much time for sleeping anyway!Breakfast was included in my deal and there was a great selection on offer. During the week they serve egg white sandwiches I thought I'd have one at the weekend and found they only serve them weekdays! :( I still enjoyed the breakfast each morning but go early if you can. On my first day I didn't go down until 9.15am and it was a scene of chaos people trying to find a seat and some ended up eating their breakfast standing up. On the weekend I went down at 7am and virtually had the place to myself.I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Place Midtown South and highly recommend a stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We met old friends for a fun week in NYC at Christmas time. We were not disappointed, largely due to the location and the high level of service from all the members of the staff. The breakfasts were always well stocked and varied - every thing was first class. The breakfast area was a generous size so there was not an issue to find a place, especially for our party of four.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Comfortable, clean, new hotel. Our room was fine for the two of us. Breakfast included was good and we enjoyed the free happy hour on Friday. Desk people were very friendly and helpful. Good midtown locations and very close to subways.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: i really like this hotel!that my 3rd time i stayed there.. its a great place* easy to come and go (close subway)* walking distance to everywhere* good breakfast* free wifi* nice stuff - helped me every time* they don't charge extra for packages that arrive (online shopping!!)the only bad think i can think about.. is the slow elevator..ill defiantly come again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was booked for three nights at the Hyatt Herald Square, and after a long flight from CA, arrived and they notified me that the hotel was overbooked for the night. Book directly thru Hyatt.com, and was a platinum member thru gold passport, but i digress. They offered me and my family (five year old in tow) a cab ride an relocation the the Hyatt Place Midtown on 36th st.Boy am I glad that the Hyatt Herald Square was overbooked. This was a fabulous hotel in a fabulous location. Service: Was greeted with the most respect when we arrived from Cab the other Hyatt arranged for us. Was given a cold bottle of water and assigned a room quickly. Within five minutes from arriving in our room we received a knock with a treat of cupcakes for my daughter as thank you for staying with them at the hotel. Nice touch, my daughter loved them!Throughout the stay we were always greeted nicely, in the hallway or lobby, even the people at breakfast were very accommodating to getting additional food, or clearing plates. I always say, good service is when you don't notice anything is wrong, and the staff at the Hyatt Place never did anything wrong.Room: Hotel is either fairly new, or fairly remodeled, as everything was clean and updated. Most floors only have about 8-10 rooms per floor, so hallways were always quite and clear. We had a room on the 19th floor with a unobstructed view of the Empire State Building, which was awesome. We had the two queen bed room which for NY was very large, and for any other location was on the small to average size. Quietest hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC.Breakfast: if you have stayed at a Hyatt Place before the food is as expected. All the breads, pastry, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, oatmeal that is common. Daily hot foods rotate with some good breakfast sandwiches, eggs, sausage, and pancakes, french toast all rotated throughout our stay. This is not a five star breakfast, but its a fresh hearty, filling meal to start your day or sightseeing or business meetings in NYC.Location: by far the best asset is the location of the hotel. Block and a half north of subways. Four and half blocks south of bryant park, times square. Easily walking distance to empire state building, Macy's on 34th, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, 5th ave. We don't walk much at home, but my five year old had no issue as the location was so perfectly placed.So an overbooked situation at the Hyatt Herald Square turned out to be a big benefit for us as the stay at the Hyatt Place Midtown was a much better hotel and location, and service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you read some of the other reviews, you will find that this hotel offers a solid value albeit more of a Holiday Inn Express experience (which is located next door) than the feel of a Hyatt. Breakfast is very nice. If you travel to Spain, the quality of the room is determined by the quality of the bathroom. The beds and bathrooms are exceptional for this size room and price in NYC. Unfortunately, there is an Iris Pub diagonal across the street and it is very loud. So here is the tip. Rooms 5,6,7 and 8 face 36th Street and the Pub, so if you are not above the 20th floor, it will be loud. Rooms 1,2,3 & 4 face the back and may offer a better choice. Otherwise, choose a different hotel. The Holiday Inn Express next door is directly across the street from the Iris Pub. Enjoy your trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is in a great Midtown location and the beakfast is a nice bonus. My room was on the 10th floor and was the quietest NYC hotel room I have ever stayed in. It's walking distance to Bryant Park, Rockefeller Plaza, shopping and Highline park. There are also nearby subway stops within 2 blocks

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room is pretty small. It does not provide bath robe, cotton bud, slipper, tooth brush etc. However, the manner of the staff is good. It provides a place for you to sleep but don't expect too much service. The location of the hotel is very convenient. Considering of paying only USD199 per night and breakfast is included, I still give 4 stars.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Getting here was a fluke. Really.I booked and paid Hotwire for a 3 star midtown hotel and was advised a room was reserved for me at the Four Points on West 25th.After a 7 hour train ride from Charlottesville, VA, lugging my suitcase from the train to the taxi stand outside Penn Station and then waiting 40 mins in freezing weather for a cab, I finally arrived at 00:20 at the Four Points, tired, hungry and frustrated, only to be told “sorry, looks like we overbooked the hotel”."You are kidding me, mate" I thought.The front desk officer, Jason, soon after arranged for me to be accommodated at the Hyatt Place, but it took 20 mins for a cab to be hailed down for me. And waiting in the bitter cold at 25th & 6th Avenue is something I don’t want to repeat!At 1:00am I arrived at the Hyatt Place with a letter from the Four Points to bill them for my stay. That however didn’t stop the front desk chap from whispering to me that my credit card was declined. Three times in my one night stay I had to clarify just who is paying. After all, the Four Points already banked my payment.The HP's room is not large but well put together. Modern, comfortable and clean. Features include a couch, king size bed, closet, safe, refrigerator, coffee maker (note: I found the part where water is to be poured to be dirty and needed a clean, which I did and then enjoyed a fine cup o’ joe), a desk, plenty of drawer space, good lighting and a modern bathroom.Brilliant location if you want to be in Midtown. Five minute walk from Macy’s. I lie. It’s UNDER 5 mins. And quiet. The hotel is in a small street and while close to Penn Station and Herald Sq., but you wouldn't know it from the tranquility of the hotel.This time I traveled without a mobile device and found the three desktop computers in the lobby to be very useful.The b/fast was great: eggs, cereals, fruits, breads, yogurt and pastries. Thank you Mr Four Points for introducing me to the HP! If you honoured my reservation with your hotel I would never have found this wonderfully located, quiet, nicely put together hotel. Oh and THANK YOU (not) SO MUCH for calling me ahead of my arrival telling me YOU ARE SOLD OUT so that I wouldn't waste time, money and energy getting to your hotel. Only to besent to the HP! After all, the HP is only a short walk from Penn Station. On a scale of 1-10, customer service at the Four Points is MINUS ONE.I liked my time, room and food at the HP and already suggested the HP to my folks when they visit Manhattan in March.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I booked through a travel website, having never stayed at a Hyatt Place before. The hotel was spotless. My bed was very comfortable, the bathrooms are a nice size and the couch is a bonus. Lots of plugs and well-lit room. VERY friendly, helpful staff

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place Midtown South is very well located on 36th Street between 5th and 6th. Convenient to Madison Square Garden and not too far from Times Square. Rooms are small but clean and good AC system. I would consider staying there again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel was very clean, updated, and the rooms were spacious. Ours had a pull out couch that one of the children slept in. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location was great. Breakfast was pretty good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel, staff, food, room, location...excellent! It was a very busy time in the City, but everyone was friendly, cordial, kind. There are a number of boutique hotels in the area, but this is really pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: the rooms were spacious and well appointed, the staff was lovely, the location could not be beat and where can you get a free breakfast anymore in Manhattan!? I highly recommend this hotel for a business or personal stay in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location --an easy walk from Penn Station and midtown sights, great value including free breakfast, cheerful, welcoming staff and very friendly clientele all made our stay a pleasurable one. The hotel is a half block from the bustle of Fifth Avenue, but on a relatively quiet side street; our room on the 24th floor had a view of the MetLife Building (formerly PanAm) while other guests looked out on the Empire State Building --all in all, we would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location and typically Hyatt Place. Great rooms, very basic services. The staff was great and friendly.Ask for a high level, south facing room for a great view of the empire state building.Told us that most of rooms are Hyatt Gold Passport, booked on points.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The price was also very reasonable considering the quality and the service provided by the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in a hotel that has great access to and from Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Enjoyed our stay here. First time back to New York since we relocated from there so know the city well. Property is one of the many sliver hotels that have popped up here on the mid-blocks of Midtown/Midtown South over the past few years. Service was the stand-out item with front desk and housekeeping staff very friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable. No real issues that we had other than towels being a bit worn.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotels in NYC are terribly expensive but the Hyatt Place was reasonable. The location was great: 7 blocks to Radio City Music Hall, just around the corner form the Empire State Building, a couple of blocks from Macy's and Times Square. It was a 15 min. walk from the Amtrak station. For other locations we hopped the subway. Rooms were all newly renovated and I would love to have one of their beds - great sleep! Staff was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. Only downside is construction and trash pickup noise, but that is just NYC - not a problem limited to this hotel. I will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very clean service was awesome. Great breakfast to start off the day. Also received a couple of drink coupons one evening when we got off of the elevator. Nice deli next door. Great location. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Perfect location. Friendly, helpful staff. Especially Dana. Walked to end of street to see the Thanksgiving Day parade. Also walking distance to Radio City for the Rockettes. Great trip. Room overlooking the city with fridge and very comfy bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall the hotel was nice, rooms were tiny but manageable considering it had 2 queen beds and a sofa pullout. The location was EXCELLENT and had a great view of Empire State Building. We paid the extra for the upper floor and view which was helpful considering it was Thanksgiving week and very noisy at the street level. Upper floors are worth the view and the peace and quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family enjoyed our Thanksgiving week in New York. The hotel was very nice and fit the four of us well with 2 double beds and a pullout couch. It was very clean and the staff very friendly. But who wants to only read about the good things. If I had to pick things that could improve, the elevators were always busy and slow moving and the breakfast area was packed with people and they struggled a bit to keep food out. I consider those things very minor and would recommend the hotel to friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It's not hard to find a hotel in New York City -- the only issues are specific location and price. Even location is not a big problem, so it all comes down to how much you are willing to spend -- and what you get for what you spend.My Wife and I have stayed in several different hotels around the City, and have pretty much run the spectrum on price. This time in New York, we spent four days in the City, and wanted to be close to 5th Avenue to see all the amazing Christmas decorations. We also wanted to be between 35th and 40th Street because of a few commitments we had in the area -- and we found the prefect place. Not fancy, not an especially large room, certainly no serious luxury services. But still the perfect place if what you want is a specific location, clean with more than ample space, at a price that doesn't break the bank around the holiday season.So, given its location just off 5th Avenue, on W. 36th Street, there is the Hyatt Place Hotel. What makes it something special you might wonder? The Hotel is just a few years old, and is Hyatt's entry into the fewer amenities, lower price hotel category, but, at the same time, maintains the quality that Hyatt is known for -- and Hyatt has done it here. We found our room on the 20th floor to be perfectly laid out, and what it lacked in square footage, it made up for in quality space utilization -- not to mention a 42 inch flat screen TV. The room itself had a couch, king size bed, small closet, safe, refrigerator, coffee maker, a desk, plenty of drawer space, ample lighting, black-out shades,free Wi-FI, and an ample free breakfast (only wish they served NY style bagels). The room was spotless, with sheets and towels changed on request (the Green option). The Wall Street Journal was delivered on weekdays, and there were three monitors in the Lobby for Boarding Passes, etc. So what else is there? Service. The Front Desk people were well trained in terms of eye contact and the use of your name -- and were friendly and very accommodating. There was always someone in the Lobby to help with any questions, and even help with luggage and calling for Car Service. I asked for a slightly later checkout -- no problem.Oh yes, one other thing -- the air conditioning/heating system. More often than not, many NY hotels are in older buildings that have been renovated a few times. Many of these hotels are in the real "Luxe" category, but still have window air conditioners/heaters. We've stayed in several, and found that they are usually very noisy, and regardless of black-out shades, make comfortable sleeping a serious challenge. In one instance, we were in a really upper scale hotel and asked that the air conditioning unit be changed out because it had clearly had seen better times and was very noisy. "Sure" was the answer, "but I can't guarantee it would be any less noisy as the replacement unit would be of the same vintage as the one in your room," In any case, since this Hyatt Place is so new, they have absolutely noiseless central air conditioning/heating -- leading to the best nights sleep you could possibly have outside of your own home.Next time we are going to the "Big Apple", the Hyatt Place Hotel on W. 36th Street will be our address.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is an excellent choice when visiting the city. My wife and I had a king bed with a great view of the city. We were able to check in early which allowed us to rest before we ventured out. It is just a short walk to Macy's, Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Inn is a very good hotel and totally recommended for those who go to NY. It is just 3 blocks away for the Empire State, 5 minutes walking from the Times Square, 15 minutes walking from the Central Park (5th and 59th). You have the Penn Station 2 minutes away.The rooms are beatiful and big. Some of them have very nice view. The breakfast is very good and with lot of things to eat. Staff is very gently too. You have computers if you want to use and wifi is free (and works perfectly).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall all ammenities were very good and the service was good. The room was clean and up to expectations. It was very busy and very difficult to get into the dining area and get breakfast. The staff was trying to keep up, but that looked like a challenge. Overall everything was very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was my first visit to a Hyatt Place. This trip I was on a budget, so I cashed in my Hyatt points and stayed here. The location is a good one: particularly convenient to theatre district and restaurants. The room, although small and really not sized for two people, is well laid out with everything a single occupant needs, including a coffee maker, sofa and desk. The room was extraordinarily quiet despite all the kids staying here, and I was very pleased about that given I am a light sleeper.The attitude of the hotel staff members I encountered was excellent. A very warm and friendly welcome greeted me on upon my arrival. When I discovered there was no caffeinated coffee in my room, someone came up with a full bag of very good coffee as well several filters and suggested I improvise, given that the regular room-sized coffee packets were not available, which was very helpful. The maid service was excellent as well. Also, the folks who serviced the breakfast room were very nice.The negatives (and not strong ones) are that the hot (and cold) breakfast, which is quite good and generous, is served buffet style in a large room off the lobby, and it gets very crowded at times. Also, the hotel has only two elevators, and the waits can be long in the morning.In summary, I think this is a good mid-priced option in Manhattan, and provides a lot of value for your hotel dollar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were extremely satisfied with our stay at the Hyatt Place in NYC. The location was great....only 2 blocks from Herald Sq, Macy's, Empire State Bldg and a subway station....the latter made the rest of NYC within easy access. Room (2308) was a King with view and was very clean and contemporary. Staff was superb, esp the Mgr, Charmain and also Anthony at front desk. The only drawback was slowness of the elevators, as using stairs was not an option (23rd floor!). Other than that, it was a great hotel. They even obliged my request to change the rate that I booked the room for months earlier ($199/night) to what was available online at my time of check in ($134). All I had to do was call Hyatt's Central Reservation and they honored the less expensive rate - this saved me $65/night!! I was thrilled and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were told that we could get pillow and comforter that was not down and that was not the case. There are only 2 elevators for 24 floors and so you have to wait and the worst is if you stay on the street side there is construction on the street and every time a car goes over the street there is noise and so if you are a light sleeper, forget about it.....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Hyatt and would recommend it to anyone visiting!! Request to stay on a higher level if you want the noise to be completely eliminated. We were on the 6th floor and could hear some trucks in the am. The room was extremely neat and modern.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is ideally located for various attractions in New York. Excellent breakfast was included in the cost which saved having to look for somewhere to eat each morning. The staff were extremely helpful, bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. The only downside was that we sometimes had quite a wait for the lifts.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I can't review the Hotel since they cancelled my reservation but I can tell you the Hyatt policies and customer service at this hotel are horrible. I arrived at this hotel at 9pm to find out they cancelled my room and did not have any rooms available. The credit card company had issued me a new card since I made the reservation and I didn't think about notifying them since I was bringing the new card with me. The hotel said they tried charging my card at 8pm and when it didn't work they cancelled the room. I recieved an email at 8pm that night but since I was in transit did not see the email. The reservation had a 48 hour cancellation notice so if they were going to charge the credit card ahead of time why didn't they do it then and I could of given them the new number. The manger of the hotel told me she didn't have to do anything to help me out and I belong to the Hyatt loyalty program and this is how they treat their members. It is very frustrating to arrive at a hotel with a garanteed reservation and not have a room and the hotel doesn't want to help. Very disappointed in Hyatt's policy to cancel and the customer service at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I got tired of my prior hotel and decided I needed to make a change. The other hotel was in...well the area wasn't ideal for me. anyways, I got here and the folks at the front desk were so courteous and friendly. The location is right in midtown on the back side of Herald Square right on 36th between 5th and 6th ave. They offer free breakfast which is a nice touch if you're a business traveler but beware this is also a heavy tourist hotel - not a business hotel. That may/may not be a bad thing but it is something one should be aware of. There are no lounge areas that are 'quiet'. The rooms are adequate and are in good condition. The lower rooms provide no view whatsoever but that may be beneficial because....there are two elevators and they..take...FOREVER. Seriously, if you have to be somewhere plan to be at the elevator a good 10 minutes prior so you aren't late. Also, the gym is very, very small and in the basement but if you're the only one in there it is adequate. If there is more than one person in the gym then you're in trouble. Other than that this place is a good hotel with a great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The only one good thing about this Hyatt is location - 100 steps from subway, 200 steps from Macy's and close to Broadway, Madison, 5th Avenue, Empire and Rockfeller Plaza.On the dark side you have: tiny lobby, tyny room, small bathroom, no place to open and store your suitcase.Breakfast is warm but terrible, and the eating place by itself don't provoke appetite - cramped, weared out, dark. We spent 1 night here and moved to a neighbour building to Courtyard Marriott Herald Square (entrance is from W.35th Street). If you see the same prices for this 2 hotels - don't hesitate and choose Courtyard.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place Midtown does not disappoint! This hotel is a great property on West 36th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues and a block from Herald Square. The hotel has 26 floors with 8 rooms per floor. The rooms on the back side of the hotel have views of the Empire State Building. The Rooms are gorgeous and are quite large for the New York City hotel market but common for the Hyatt Place brand. You will find large bathrooms, some with walk-in showers only. Safes, coffee makers, and mini-refrigerators are also located in the rooms. Some rooms have floor to ceiling windows. I stayed in room 2407, a king room with a sofa (non-pullout .bed). I was quite pleased,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place on W 36th st, provides great accommodation for the a competitive price . This comfortable space is at a very convenient location, close to transportation with easy access to downtown financial district for the business traveller.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is great but other than that, the hotel is average. Rooms are NOT big - especially if you're traveling with 2 teenagers. The lobby is unremarkable. Closet tiny. No counter space in bathroom. We were stuffing our luggage under the sink, on top of side tables and desk in order to have room to move about. The buffet is meager. For this kind of money, we expected more.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just 3 nights at the Hyatt Place near Macy's Herald Square during this frigid week exceeded my modest expectations for comfort, amenities, service, price, and location. Our well-appointed room (2407) was much larger than many standard double rooms in Manhattan in this hotel category. One appreciates the ample quiet space up high after being outside with throngs of tourists, workers, and busy streets and sometimes overwhelming auto traffic and noise. Kudos to reliable and talented maid service. Included hot/cold breakfast buffet and coffee bar was much appreciated, featuring tasty brealfast egg muffins and assorted breakfast staples. Plenty of everything just kept flowing from the tireless staff. Clean, fresh-tasting, with CNN and free newspapers, and worth always waking up early for. WiFi signal is strong and allows HD video streaming in rooms. Huge TV in room has numerous A-V connections, but we didn't use them. Just watched regular cable channels which were somewhat deficient, a minor issue. However, more significantly, few to no yellow taxis drive by the hotel, and hotel staff appointed to assist failed to secure a taxi for us. Hotel has negotiated high flat rates with car service(s), so since we preferred a regular taxi to "save" money, we were on our own. In cold weather (temps under 40), flagging down taxis is a challenge, as everyone wants to drive instead of walk. There are surprisingly some very good restaurants right nearby, such as 5 Boro Burger and Szechuan Gourmet. Plus Macy's is a must-see, and don't forget about its restaurants and food bars inside. That subway station is central, so be sure to use it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location,very clean ,breakfast great,helpful staff from the off.They were always ready to help you with any questions you had about the area and things.Even at check in,they asked me if I required a late check out.Also there was a great bar opposite.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stay at Grand Hyatt or Hyatt Place all the time. The Hyatt Place on W36th st in Manhattan is wonderful. The accommodations are excellent as is the staff. Stay there yourself sometime and you'll see what we mean!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is everything you need for a trip to the Big Apple. Modern, comfortable, with a room big enough for a king bed AND a sofa, it's close to sites like Times Square, Macys, and the Empire State Building. Hyatt Place hotels have a business focus, but this one was just fine for a leisure visit. The hotel includes all the details that often cost extra in NY, like breakfast (tasty smoked gouda breakfast sandwiches!) and wireless internet. They also hosted a Friday evening cocktail party, with hors d'oeuvres and 2 complimentary drinks! The staff were friendly and accommodating. I'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Special thanks to Mr. Kevin Spina for handling of rate check-in discrepancy and handling of complex federal/state tax exemption forms while traveling on federal business. Excellent attention to detail and superb customer serving atmosphere. This hotel will be my first choice when returning to NYC. Excellent location in mid-town area. Elevators a bit slow, so add a few minutes when departing your room. Back side of hotel faces into another building. Not a pretty picture, so you may have to keep your shades down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All the positives are true: Good sized room, nice bathroom (a little short on the counter space) and everything generally in good condition. There are fridge, coffee maker, and free fast wifi. Really good free breakfast. Hot and cold food, and fresh fruits and yogurt. And very friendly staff. The fitness room is also better than the average for a limited service hotel. The only thing that didn’t work is the Printme service in the lobby. I could never output my docs. The negatives may affect your visit: the elevator waits are long if the hotel is full. And the room cleaning is somewhat hit or miss. But they’re probably not paid enough so just tip them a few dollars and they’ll do a better job. And there may be street noise depending on the night you stay and how low your room is.If the pricing stays where it is, I will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After a birthday weekend in NYC, I can't say enough about our stay at the Hyatt Place. I love the brand, but this was my first time staying with HP in NYC. The room was understandably smaller than the standard HP suite, but larger than a typical NYC room. We really enjoyed the full size couch and the view of the Empire State Building.We enjoyed easy access to Macy's (2 shorts blocks) and a nice walk to Times Square (6 blocks).What was particularly impressive was the customer service. Christian, the bellman, took care of our every need at checkout by providing bag storage and having a terrific car service ready for us hours later when we returned and needed to get to the airport asap.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a fan of Hyatt Place hotels and this one did not disappoint. The room was spacious by New York standards. Very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I used the computer in the lobby and had trouble printing a document, and they let me come to the front desk and print from there. The breakfast was very good, though it ended by 9:00 on the weekday. The hotel's parking rate down the street was reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First off, want to thank Dana at the front desk as well as the doormen and bellhop that helped us out the weekend we stayed at the end of October. Truly provided sincere care in their services.Requests that were made for our room were met (crib, floor, check-in, etc.).Room itself was very clean and provided enough room for our family of 3.Breakfast buffet was always plentiful. Expect it to be busy any time you go.Location was perfect. You are walking distance to any of the major attractions in the city.Parking garage is very close by. Also able to find free street parking on the weekend in this area.Overall, GREAT experience. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had two rooms for family of eight. Disppointed to not have adjoining as requested. But clean and comfortable. Hotel seemed safe and secure. Were able to get around the city well from that location. Lobby furniture needs cleaning/updating. Included breakfast was very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First the positives: This hotel is centrally located to everything midtown, has the typically nice Hyatt feel, and the staff are generally friendly and helpful.The negatives? We found evidence in our room of the maids not doing a thorough clean after guests leave- socks and assorted items just under the edge of the couch- we thought we'd dropped our own items), housekeeping (in our room/floor) spoke no English and was unable to fulfill the most basic request for a clean glass in our room, they cleaned the showers with their shoes on. I've never seen housekeeping do this- they are supposed to put down a paper mat or something...I don't want my bare feet standing where your street shoes have been...especially in NYC.Overall, a good place to stay. yes, the elevators are slow- two elevators for 26 floors is insufficient, but there is no option to put in any more. the rooms are small, but typical NYC size. No view from our room (1607) except to the office building across the street, and there was a fair amount of street noise- but to be fair, this IS NYC, and there is street noise everywhere!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Probably one of the best experiences I've had in NYC within the budget I'm allotted for business travel. I actually wished I were staying longer! All staff were friendly, courteous, prompt in response. The room was wonderful --- comfortable, extremely clean. The amenities offered are terrific. Wifi is part of the package! I stayed on a high floor, and had no problem at all with elevator waits.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is in a good and safe location, convenient with public transportation from airport to hotel. Also walking distance to many visitor attractions including Korean town with many restaurants that open 24 hours. The room is clean and comfortable. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great staff, clean, comfortable rooms, wonderful location. Great business hotel. Highly recommend to business travelers. Walking distance from Penn Station; near 42nd Street, Broadway and Bryant Park.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well appointed hotel with great attitude and customer service. They knew my name and were very helpful. The breakfast was much better than the usual hotel free breakfast fare. This is a great location that is near Grand Central and of course Macy's. This hotel was not only a great hotel, it was a great value. I'll go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a great new option for us when we head to NYC. It is conviently located in south midtown at 36th and 6th. It is right near the famous Keens Steakhouse. It is typical for Hyatt Place and having said that you know what you are getting which is ALWAYS great. Hyatt as a whole is amazing!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Yes the rooms were spacious (2 queens & a sofa!), and clean and the breakfast buffet was excellent BUT it was the extremely nice workers that made this Hyatt a perfect stay in NYC!. Michelle at the front desk was so sweet and friendly and made check in go flawlessly. Rich, the bellman, who checked our bags was happy to give us perfect directions to the subway, and Jim Burns who was sure to tell us to pick up a newspaper and take an apple smiled the entire time he chatted with us. Plus the hotel is located close enough to walk to from NY Penn Station and is centrally located. I'd stay back here in a NY minute!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 3 nights at the hotel. It was ideally placed for Times Square, Broadway and all the tourist sights, it's well as the Subway. The staff couldn't be more helpful. The icing on the cake was that we had the Empire State Building right outside our window on 24th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great staff- Rich, Dulce, Kevin, Dana and Maurine were terrific. Very helpful and gracious. Hotel noise from out side was very loud which is sleep prohibitive. Bring ear plugs. Elevators are also a bit slow. Consider staying on 3 rd floor or below. The view is of another building face so no need to be on top floors. Close to shopping for beads and sight seeing of 42nd ave, Ave of America's and the Empire State building. Note that unlike most Hyatt places the rooms only have a mini refrigerator and single coffee maker

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had two rooms in NYC for 4 days in September 2014. The location is nicely in the center of Manhattan. It is just east of Madison Square Garden and south of 42nd Street with easy access to southbound subways to Financial District, Status of Liberty and 9/11 Memorial. There is a nice bar called the Keg Room across the street to watch a game and have a beer. The room was larger than previous NYC hotel rooms and was very clean. The views are either of the Empire State Building or of Bryant Park (Radiator Building) and the lights of Times Square. Both views were excellent. I would definitely ask for a high room if possible. The staff was very attentive and nice. They had the NYC attitude but went out of their way to be helpful. We were surprised we got a continental breakfast. It was the typical pastry, egg, sausage patty, cereal, toast presentation. It was very nice not to have to spend money on breakfast and to be able to eat so quickly to get the most out of our day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for four nights on our first trip to New York. The hotel was welcoming and comfortable. The room was spotless and whilst not huge was fine for five of us. Breakfast was busy, but there was plenty of everything. The location means you can come back and flop after a long day sightseeing, but a short stroll takes you to the middle of Times Square or 5th Avenue in the evenings.And if you are lucky you can see the Empire State Building while lying in bed!We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would like to return before too long!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: hyatt mid-town rocks. I WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN nice, clean. comfortable, easy to find close to everything, subway close, easy to walk to stuff... Time Square, Empire State Bldg, the High-line, Broadway nice staff, friendly, informed and willing to help good restaurants and bars right around the corner

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I got this on Hotwire for one night and it was great - clean, friendly, fast check-in, great beds and bed linen and breakfast and wifi included in the price. It's also close to Macy's, Broadway etc. Highly recommended. Rooms are small like most NYC hotels but large comfy bed, couch etc. If you are going to be spending time in room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel looks brand new and is centrally located within walking distance to Macy's, the empire state building and time square. Rooms are very small and there is no space to place a normal size suitcase. The front desk offered us a limousine service to JFK for 62$ (including taxes and tolls), but when we got to the airport, the driver added 8$ for tolls to the bill (including a 12$ tip).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: if you want to stay close to the Madisson square garden or whereabouts at a reasonable price, this is the place. the hotel is very business like and comfortable but nothing luxurious at all. service is average and parking nearby is expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very glad we found this hotel - the emphasis is on functionality, not luxury, so if you merely need a 'home base' while visiting NYC to simply sleep, keep your stuff, and save a couple of bucks, this is a good choice. In the same 'family' as Holiday Inn Express or other "no-frills" hotels, but it's a Hyatt, so it's slightly nicer. A big plus is that breakfast buffet is included; saves you from searching for a breakfast locale every morning and spending too much money. That said, the breakfast buffet can be a bit hectic and overcrowded, and staff can't always keep up with re-filling items in a timely manner. But there's a Starbucks and deli next door if you want some variety. Like I said - if you want a luxury hotel, go elsewhere. Other great thing is location - very close to Macy's and 34th Street subway lines; took us less than 30 minutes to get to Williamsburg. The room size is tight; don't plan to do much more than sleep and use the bathroom.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First time stating in Manhattan. The Hyatt Midtown was a totally pleasurable experience. stayed on the 18th floor and the room was quite large by the New York standards. It was also very clean and modern? We had an excellent view from large windows overlooking the city. The staff was the most courteous and friendly that I have met in a long time. The hot morning breakfast was complementary and offered a wide variety of choices. We would stay here again and would recommend it to anybody.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had enjoyed our stay when we stayed before. This stay was just as good. Will stay again in the future. The location is good, the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very kind and friendly..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All in all, an excellent hotel. Attentive staff, clean, modern, comfortable bed, effectve AC, and most importantly, double shades to block out the perpetual street brightness. Close to Penn Station and within walking distance of major attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for two nights. There was a short wait at check in for a room, but we were there before 3pm. Parking was very close and we went there first. Our room was comfortable and perhaps slightly larger than is typical in this range in NYC. The bathroom was large and everything was spotless. The bed was comfortable, but not so much so that we would go back for that.Breakfast was adequate but the dining area was very crowded.However many guests saw people waiting and rushed their eating so others could follow. I can't fault the hotel here. A big surprise for me was the freshly squeezed orange juice.Overall we were happy in this hotel and while I'd prefer to stay a little further south towards Chelsea, we may well stay here again.The hotel is just a short couple of blocks south of Bryant Park, one of our favorite places in midtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you can get this hotel at a good price, stay here! It is several blocks from central park, but a pleasant walk. We stayed here on points for two nights. They provide free breakfast (and free apples). This is a block or two from the Empire State Building. Great location for that! The rooms are pretty basic, but the service at the front desk is impressive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Excellant location near Times square, port authority bus terminal, Penn Station, Hertz car collection point, Grand Central, restaurants, Macy's, 5th Avenue, practical, good transportation available to airport at reasonable price

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We traveled with 3 small children and 3 adults. The moment we arrived at the hotel foyer (Even before the door) the front door staff shouted "A familyeee" and ushered us to the front desk where we were checked in fast and smoothly. We new we are in safe hands. We were very impressed with the way they accepted us. The room, breakfast, staff and their service was world class. We were delighted, thank you Hyatt Place 36th street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were greeted with smiles...the Internet inour room was perfect for my business meetings...the room was huge! The breakfast was Hyatt Place's standard reliable breakfast of hot breakfast sandwiches, cereal, sweets, fruit, juice, bagels & coffee. It really just feels like home away from home.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Tucked in between a few other major hotels, this is a gem. Rooms were spacious, breakfast was outstanding (free) Attentive staff to boot. This is a major find. Near Amtrac and Long Island Railroad station and a stones throw from Macys.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Born and raised in NYC and now living down south, I travel back often to visit, check out a show, or for business. I've stayed at hotels in Times Square, East Side, and lower Manhattan. This Hyatt was a pleasant surprise and afforded me a wonderful stay. After being warmly greeted when I checked in, I entered my room to find a spacious area (for NYC), and large flat screen TV, coffee maker, clean and comfortable bed, and I nice sitting area. When I asked the front desk if there was an ice machine on my floor, she said no, mentioned where they were located, but proceeded to get me ice and save me the trouble. Great location close to Macy's and a few blocks south of the hustle of Times Square. Breakfast was impressive, similar to what you might get at a Hampton Inn. Hot eggs, pancakes, meat, pastries, cereal, and Starbucks Coffee. I will definitely look them up first when I return. Also got a very reasonable rate using my AAA membership.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Convenient NYC location near Herald square. We walked to our broadway show, times square and central park. Hotel was very clean. Nice breakfast provided daily. Rooms are small vs other Hyatt Place Hotels, but it is NYC. Overall, would recommend and price is right for NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a girls trip to New York. There were five of us going and we wanted to be able to stay in one room that would accommodate the five of us. Hyatt Place Midtown South provided us with a spacious, clean, and comfortable place to stay. The free breakfast was very good. The staff was very kind and helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. The rooms were nicely furnished and decent sized (considering that most NYC hotel rooms are really small), the staff was friendly and helpful and everything was clean. The location is very good, near Penn Station and Times Square and many of the bus and subway lines. It is also very centrally located for walking in any direction. We are going to be back in the city in March and already have our reservations to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location of this hotel is wonderful. Super friendly staff. Very clean rooms. The breakfast served had a great variety of food that is sure to please everyone and it was very good. You will not be disappointed if you stay at this hotel. The only negative would be that there are only two elevators so if one is truly impatient and/or you can't walk up or down stairs it might be a problem. However, the wait is not very long five minutes at most.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location! Forget about being too close to Times Square (it sucks there, and too noisy) This area is way better. Very Clean, nice bed & new furniture. Free wi-fi Small rooms but it was expected. Maybe prices should be a bit lower because of that. The staff was very friendly and knew who we were when we checked in and gave us a nicer room with a great view because we were on our anniversary.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice and clean but very noisy Fridge, AC (prefer it hot than noisy) so had to turn both off and weak insulation from street noise (even in t17th floor). It was hard to sleep! Otherwise the location is excellent and the service is very good

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for two nights. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was a decent size (considering the location), and was clean. The hotel itself is in a great location for tourists or non-tourist. Very close to Penn, Times Square, and good local bars. Was also able to get the military rate! I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you plan is to be a tourist in New York, the best thing about this hotel is the location. You are in Midtown and therefore half way to all the main sites and areas you are likely to visit. All the major subway lines are close-by and you can walk to Times Square, Central Park and shop to your hearts content in nearby major department stores and several major brand outlets like Zara's, Gap, Uniqlo & Forever 21 etc are all together on 34th Street. My teenage daughters loved it. The rooms while not large are very clean and if you are lucky or simply reserve one you can have a great view of the Empire State. The free breakfast while not overly inspiring has a fair range. The staff are all friendly and attentive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Most staff members were very pleasant with the exception of one who was quite condescending (clearly this woman does not like her job). The hotel, located on 36th between 5th & 6th, is new and attractive yet the rest of the street is dirty and feels creepy at night. The breakfast is continental which is code for stale bread, bruised fruit and barely there eggs. With only two elevators servicing the building, expect delays. Hyatt shouldn't even put there name on this place. It's a cheap Holiday Inn, nothing more.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place Midtown is a hidden gem in Manhattan!!! Not only are the rooms larger than normal compared to other similarly priced Manhattan hotels, but the staff makes you feel like family!!! From Dana, the night manager who wrote down all his favorite restaurants for us, to Kamesha's beautiful smile and disposition, to Marlinne's great sense of humor, these wonderful people made us feel so special! Even the gentleman who arranged a car service for us to the airport saved us the inconvenience!! You were wonderful as well, and I'm sorry I've forgotten your name!!!The location is so central to all landmarks and subways - and the little hotel bar was inviting to close the night with a glass of wine! We couldn't have asked for more, but it's this great group of people that makes me want to return to HMS - and I will be back!!!Thank you!!!!Judy RodriguesCan't wait to

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The only advantage of this hotel is the Location. .but not worth the money spend. ..you pay may be $50-75 more per room and stay in a much high end place. ..There is no restaurant. .only breakfast is served. .not even the complimentary drinking water. ..Even the toiletries are not promptly replenished. ..you need to ask for it..Yeah there are better options nearby. ..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location for shopping and sightseeing - free breakfast and ample access to other food places for lunch/dinner. Rooms a good size for New York though ask for high floors to ensure light and views - though trade off is wait for lift. Staff helpful and always acknowledge guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel great - centrallly located to all the sights of New York - very clean, good breakfast and extremely helpful and friendly staff. Would recommend to all family and friends. Look forward to going back soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For 5 time in New York,first time this hotel,very friendly,Nice staff,easy with everything,breakfast very good,invites for happy hour,walking distance to Macy's and Times squere,next time I take this hotel again,hope they keeping the service high.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: For a last minute reservation, this hotel ranks well above the rest! They have exceptional staff who help with anything you need. The rooms were so comfty, clean, and stylish. The breakfast was amazing, with a huge selection of choices. I have seldom experiences such stellar customer service as I did at this location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everything was perfect: the room, the staff, the food. But for me the most wonderful was the view. I reserved a room with a view of the Empire State Building and I was delighted. (I had seen that an earlier visitor had been disappointed not to have the reserved view.) My room was on the 25th floor; it was quiet, the weather was clear with a blue sky and the view from my picture window was fascinating during both the day and at night. (I realize that he hotel can't take credit for the blue sky...) I was able to get breakfast in time for my 6:30 am departure, and on the weekends, the breakfast was available until 10 am. The hotel provided reading copies of _U.S. A. Today_ and _The Wall Street Journal_. The WiFi worked beautifully. Although I didn't take advantage of the offer, I could have had documents sent to a printer downstairs. There were enough outlets to re-charge multiple devices at once. I had only short waits for the elevator, even with the 25th floor room. I wish the rest of my life was as carefree.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Place over Christmas and we had a great time. We arrived really early in the morning, around 10am and the front desk had no problem getting us checked in and our room was actually ready. The room was a little small, but you're in freakin NYC, you're not spending much of your time in your room. The room was great though, my wife liked the fact they had Twinings tea in the room... The location was perfect, close to Times Square, Broadway, Herald Square, subway's etc... Free breakfast was great. Staff was very friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had two room for 6 days, all kept clean daily, one of the twin rooms was a little cramped as you could only get out of the beds one side, but didn't spend much time in the room as to much sightseeing to do. Staff couldn't help enough, Breakfast was good and free beers one evening during the week was a nice touch. Would highly recommend this especially for a three star.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a great stay here. Convenient location in Midtown. Our room had a great view of the Empire State Building which was only a block or two away. Easy access to subway lines and walking distance to many of attractions in NYC. Great breakfast in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you plan on staying in the room for anything other than sleeping, you'd be shock on the extremely tight space. They also needed more clerk to help process check ins. There was a bit of delay in check in due to 1 person handling thus while also taking phone calls.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is just about the perfect NYC hotel option: great location, very nice accommodations, friendly people running it! The entire operation is first-class, starting with a cheerful, what-can-I-do-to-make-your-stay better attitude as you enter the small but modern entrance. For a NYC hotel, the rooms are relatively spacious, everything is clean and up to date, it is amazingly quiet with NO room-to-room or hallway noise, and the morning breakfast, at least on Sunday, is amazing! The price-point seemed initially high, but that's NYC, and on reflection it was actually a "bargain" as it was a perfect "place" for a weekend of Broadway and baseball in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just arrived here at The Hyatt Place Midtown South NYC and am very pleased . I have stayed in many hotels ~ of all price ranges ~ and chose to book this due to it being the best price for a hotel in the city considering the Jewish Holiday . The room is quite big for a NYC room ( don't misunderstand .. It is not BIG .. It's big for NYC standard rooms ) and the rear facing rooms have a spectacular view of the Empire State Building . Clean room, Free breakfast and free wifi .. It's a GREAT deal for NYC! Don't be apprehensive about this one ~ just book it and I think you will surely agree! Happy travels !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A great night away for my husband and I. Staff accommodating, room small but didn't feel it. Everything was Clean and fresh. The bathroom was modern and worked well. It is easy walking distance to many NYC attractions. Breakfast was nice and offered to us when we checked in at 8am, a pleasant surprise.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It was my best friend's birthday and we wanted to stay in the city to celebrate, so Ifound this hotel that was way cheaper than what some of the hotels were offering and I'm glad we stayed here! It was only for one night but it was great. The beds were comfy the rooms also come with a sofa bed I can't complain about the bathroom. Expect to get an studio size room, it's not very big but it was great for us. It's located a couple blocks away from times square and not far from a train station! They also offer free Wi-Fi and hot breakfast buffet. The buffet could have been better but you can find any diner near you.
