I recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be walking distance from everything. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel will be on my radar again. The rooms were clean and the staff was very pleasant. I have stayed an many establishments in NYC and the Hyatt Place will be on the top of the score card. It is centrally located which makes navigation a breeze. The rooms were a nice size considering for NYC. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable. This hotel is located close enough to walk everywhere but far enough away for a good nights sleep. Many little eateries and bars close by that are reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were leaving for Europe and decided to stop in NYC a day earlier. Found this hotel on Hotels.com. Can't say enough nice things room was fine and clean, bed comfortable, breakfast excellent including hot items, staff Very friendly and helpful, location was centrally located in Manhattan. All this at a very reasonable price. My only concern in sharing this gem is that next time we need a place to stay in NY, they won't have a place for us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We travelled by train from Boston, arrived into Penn Station, this hotel was only 2 blocks away, so ideal. The location was great, walking distance to Times Square. The Empire State Building is just behind the hotel so if you get one of the rooms at the back you are in for a treat. Bryant Park is very close by and we enjoyed sitting in the park watching the world go by. We were on the top floor, 26th which meant the view was stunning and the room was quieter. We chose this hotel as reviews say staying in Times Square is very noisy, if you want a little less noise then this hotel is ideal.Breakfast was included, a good selection of teas and coffees, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, pastures, bread, muffins. Each day here were different hot items too, egg patty with spinach on a roll or bacon not a roll, cinnamon toast too. Previous reviews have said the rooms were small, whilst not huge, they were more than adequate, a king size bed, very comfortable, a 42 inch tv, a desk and an additional seat, tea making facilities and free wifi too made this an ideal hotel for a city break.I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stay in many 3-5 star hotels and this hotel was great. I had just stayed in a horror location in Long Island city after 5-6 weeks in the Intercontinental Barclay NYC. I checked out of the Long Island city hotel after one night and came to the Hyatt Place. Staff were friendly and very courteous. Every time you come back to the hotel during the day they say" welcome back", they go that extra mile to assist and nothing is a problem. The room was great will a nice long lounge up against the window and bed was firm and very comfortable.It's a great location between 5th and 6th in midtown, near Penn station, near great shopping (5th Ave south and North and also 34th st) and thankfully 12 blocks away from our temporary offices in Flatiron. And if you want low cost shopping, then Kmart is next to Penn station a couple of blocks away.Again the staff were great and courteous, hotel amenities modern and funky (stylish).Ps: great Irish / American pub across road that does a great Shepard's pie and cold Guinness

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff is wonderful and most helpful, caring. Rooms are extremely clean and comfortable. the morning breakfast had a variety of items to choose from and the coffee is excellent. The location has easy access to the subway and theatre district. You feel safe when walking out the front door and the streets are clean. You can't beat the comfortable bed with high quality sheets.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I planned a two days stop on NYC en route to Connecticut. We arrived late at night (around 11pm) and were received with a great smile and our room was ready for us. Breakfast and free wifi added to make our stay a comfortable and happy one. Stayed on the 22nd floor facing the front street, had no issues with noise. The room was comfortable enough, modern decoration, very clean. Courteous employees. Close enough to the tourist attractions but not in the middle of the craziness. Would stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place is a rather new hotel of which one can see Empire State Building from the Windows (at least on the side we were placed). We were 5 in total to share the room (the whole family) and enjoyed it a lot. The location is great, one can walk to Central Park but also all the main shopping streets are near & theater district not too far. Nice service, nice breakfast, clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was a last minute booking and a friend recommended the Hyatt Place Midtown. It located only a couple blocks from Times Square, Macy's and other 'gotta go to' places. The price was very fare, the staff very friendly and helpful. As with most hotels the room was not large but very adequate and comfortable. I will stay there again for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had an amazing time at the Hyatt Place Midtown South, W 36th St. It's a great location and the customer service is excellent! Greeted daily by employees, Dana at the front desk extremely friendly and accommodating as well as the rest of the staff members. Complimentary breakfast offered daily....will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very well run, simple, clean and comfortable. Good beds and linens. We chose a king room with a sofa and desk. Good, attentive staff. Ample full breakfast. Large dining room. No other meals except for breakfast, but we had a refrig in the room. *Not enough elevators to serve the population.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Very conveniently located. Enjoyed the daily complimentary breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful. The only issue was the noise from the street at night but the problem was solved after being moved to a room on a higher floor. Would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms are spacious, clean and functional. The only issue I had was very limited options for vegans in the am skillet, as only bread was available. Some creativity is needed here as it is indeed not difficult to include one or two additional vegan options. Elevator wait time can also be a bit frustrating when the occupancy is high.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Some of staff were not kind enough but it may be due to New York. At arrival a room was not ready and at departure instruction to a cab that was reserved was not done though the cab had been waiting. But there was a very friendly staff actually.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a quick, easy walk from Penn Station so the train connections can't be beat. While it lacks the knock your socks off marble lobby of the classic NYC hotels, the rooms are larger and the bathroom is first class. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel is a good choice for business travelers and couples going for a NYC weekend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We only stayed for one night here but it was a great deal! (got it on points, ha). It was obviously a big turn day because the front desk was looking a bit stressed and the bellman was overflowing with checked bags for people who checked out in the morning but hadn't left yet. My game plan was to be the nicest guest the staff would encounter that day and I think it paid off. I was totally easy going, thankful, complimentary, etc. etc. As a result, I was able to get one of the first rooms which was cleaned and I got to check in early while many other people had to wait. The room was one of the bigger ones, and the view was great. So that's the trick, fellow travelers, don't yell at people.Also, the location is good because its pretty close to time square. There is parking at a good rate a couple buildings down which the hotel validates. There is basically no front drive so make sure you are a light/easy packer so you can just go park and walk your bags back to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I visited NYC for a Yankee game from 22-24 August. This hotel stood out because of the free breakfast; which is difficult to find in Manhattan. The rooms were very nice and Maria Suarez did an especially good job of providing customer service during breakfast service.I strongly recommend staying here. The staff were professional and courteous. I will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Located int he heart of midtown Manhattan, this hotel managed to keep its AAA price under $200./night. It is clean, nice linens and towels. We had a king room with a sofa. Very comfortable. Having a hotel that is walking distance to many sites is a plus!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We like to frequent this chain. Comfortable,clean rooms. Nice included breakfast. Free wifi. The rooms at this location are smaller than at others. It is in a good location if you are arriving or departing Penn Station. Easy walk to Empire State building, shopping, Times Sq./Broadway shows and other midtown locations. Easy access to subway lines for the rest of NYC. Friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I surprised my wife for her birthday with a trip to NYC with over night reservations at the Hyatt Place. The hotel has very courteous and professional hotel staff and rooms are very clean and modern. Close enough to time square to walk there in a few minutes, but away from all of the crowds, noise, and traffic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is about as perfect as it gets for a business hotel in Manhattan. Central location, extremely comfortable bed, fine shower, ample space for 1, free fast wifi, hot breakfast. The a/c unit was whisper quiet, and overall, this was probably the quietest hotel I've ever stayed at in Manhattan. I could hear voices outside the door very faintly, but since each floor only had 8(?) rooms, there was never a lot of commotion. Road noise, even construction next door, from my 20th floor room was also very, very muted, if still audible. The only thing I would ask for if I were staying here with someone else is a larger closet. My king room's closet could only really fit clothes for 1 person, especially if the trip is longer than a few days.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel and room were very clean. During a heat wave it was nice to have a room with an ice cold AC and it also had a lovely view of the NYC skyline. Staff were very kind, rooms were very quiet. Location is also a plus (couple of blocks from ESB).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here with my Mum and sister for 6 nights. We chose this hotel for it position and we were not disappointed. We were given room 2002 with the window facing the Empire State Building which for me being my first time in New York was fantastic. I loved seeing it before I went to sleep and again when I woke up each day. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate and had some variety. There was noise at night but there is always noise in New York.They had 3 computers available for use in the lobby hooked up to a printer so we could book tickets for shows and print them out. There was also good free wifi in the room. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is spotless and the staff were extremely helpful, pilot and friendly. Rooms are a good size and the bed was really comfortable. Situated only a 10 minute walk from Times Square this hotel is in a great location for many attractions that have central departure points. Macey's is a few minutes walk away and there are numerous subway stations if you want to experience the NY subway! The are lots of bars and restaurants close by, and it's a nice safe area to walk about.The only slight downside is there are only 2 elevators, so best to avoid the breakfast time rush. There is fast FREE wifi everywhere in the hotel and there was plenty of choice of hot and cold breakfast options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The breakfast is terrific, rooms are clean and comfy, the location probably the best in it's pricerange and the staff is supercute and helpfull, hands down for you guys! When I return to NYC I'll defenitley stay att Hyatt Place again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I tend to stay in 5+ stars hotel but now I found an affordable option in Midtown Manhattan. We had 2 rooms side by side and our view was to the street. The rooms were clean, adequate, new and great location. The only thing I don't like about this hotel is their elevators, it takes forever. Love that we always feel safe to walk the streets even in the middle of the night. Free breakfast was a bonus, they have different warm food everyday along with the staples for continental breakfast. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a decent place to stay and not need the full service hotel amenities, this is the place for you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It is a nice place near Times Square.We had an excellent stay for three days at the Hyatt place.We would definitely stay again there.Cozy little rooms.Nice breakfast.Thank you for the hospitality!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We went to New York on a busy long weekend and we planed our trip just couple of hours before leaving. The only place we could find to accommodate 5 persons in a room was Hyatt place. Hotel is located in a great place. 5 minutes walk to empire state, 15 minutes to times square. The breakfast honestly is not that good so next time I prefer to go out and have breakfast. Staff are polite and hotel is very cleaning. Parking is just 4 building down the street for $40.00 a day. The only disappointing part beside breakfast was elevator. We were at 5th floor and never could use elevator from 5th floor in 3 days of our stay. You have to wait 20-30 minutes for elevator and finally use stair cases. Now think that you are on higher floor and every time you are going out you have to wait at least 20 minutes if you are lucky or use elevator.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place Midtown is my go-to place when I visit NYC. The location is excellent...on a quiet side street near Herald Square. I hate the crowds in Times Square so this is slightly less "zoo-ey." You can walk to 34th st for shopping or jump on the subway on the corner. I have stayed here about 5 or 6 times.The hotel is modern and clean. The rooms are a bit small, but comfortable. Love the bed. There is a small couch in the room as well. Bathroom is nice. Room was quiet. No complaints at all.Typically the rates here are a lot better than you might get in NYC...so there is a lot of bang for your buck. Wifi is free and works well. There is a breakfast area off the lobby with free breakfast in the morning. The worst thing about the hotel is the elevators. There are only 2 of them. The hotel is tall and skinny, so usually the wait is longer than normal. When one of the elevators goes down (frequently), it is even worse.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was centrally located. It wasn't right in the craziness of Time Square but just a short walk away. There were restaurants, Starbucks, pharmacy's and even the famous Macy's nearby. It was easy to walk or get a cab at any time of day. The staff was very welcoming to our group of 10 and even offered to take pics for us. No NY attitude here. The rooms, while not fancy, were clean, well appointed and spacious. We even had a view of the Empire State Building, if you got close to the window and looked up. :) I would recommend this hotel especially for large groups. We easily fit 5 people can could have fit 6 thanks to the pull out sofa.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The best choice for a mid rate stay in NYC. We could have chosen something more expensive and saved a block or 2 of walking but this place was worth its weight in gold. It's location was very convenient and safe. The room was very clean and up to date. The hotel serves a breakfast (included in all room rates)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location was great. Room was on the smaller size but worked just fine for us. My only complaints were that the elevators were extremely slow, and the chain kept falling off inside the toilet tank (we did not report though). Great location, nice views, helpful staff!! The breakfast that is included was quite nice as well (go early though, it gets crowded). Would stay there again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed from Thurs-Sun in March - perfect location. Cheaper, larger and cleaner than rooms near time square and was a short walk. Central to everything we wanted in New York (Time Square, Broadway, Madison Square Gardens). Staff was friendly and helpful - had a small issue with safe in room and it was fixed very fast. The free breakfast in the mornings was amazing - great food and selection! Can't wait for our next trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice Hotel with good staff. I stayed with my wife for five days, the stay was very good. The staff was very courteous and had made our stay very comfortable. The breakfast and the service were really good. I may like to stay at the same hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everything positive! Great location, great hotel, great staff and very clean. Very friendly and accommodating to us. Much better comp breakfast than your average comp breakfast at other hotels. We stay at quite a few Hyatt Places and this location has been the best of those we have stayed in. We stayed on floor 24 with an excellent view of the Empire State ... Beautiful at night. Some have complained about the elevators...we were there for 4 days and never had a problem! Thanks to Rich who stored our luggage upon arrival and before departure. He was able to help us with directions if the front desk personnel were busy. This location was very convenient to Times Square, Herald Square and Macys, & Madison Square Garden.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am VERY picky with hotels, and I booked a room a month before our arrival in NYC. I was a bit stressed out, cause it's non-refundable, and what if the room does not meet my expectations? Guess what- it did! I loved the place, it's small but just about right- rooms are clean. Room service was amazing. I always look forward coming back every night after a very long day of doing touristy stuff. I requested for extra towels, it was granted. Hotel is 5-7 minute walk from Time Square/Empire State/Shopping centres, and about a 5-minute walk from a Subway station. Staff are awesome. Make sure that if you're taking a cab form the hotel to the airport, you book it with the staff so it is a flat rate. Over-all, very pleased with our stay. And will definitely book at this hotel again if we come back to visit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just spent a week at this property and for the cost was great! The staff were very friendly and happy to help anywhere they could. The hotel is clean, well kept but most importantly is in a great location. The subway station is a 2min walk away. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location and superb customer service made my stay very pleasant during a weekend getaway with my family. We were a party of 5 (2 adults / 3 children) and we all got the best of NYC thanks to choosing the Hyatt Place Midtown

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My Family was in New York on the week of the 18 of August. WE were staying at this Hotel the Hyatt Place in New York Midtown South. What can I say!!! This was the most Incredible, Excellent and very economical. We have traveled to a lot places and stayed in different hotels, but this one was one of my favorite. Why??? Because the service, Cleanliness, always with a beautiful smile. The rooms are beautiful and the Free breakfast was great as well. The best part of it all it really central of Times square. My family and I had a very enjoyable stay and would DEFINITELY GO BACK to this Hotel!!! Thank so very much for all your great services and your hospitality!!! Thank youKind RegardsDina Liakakos & Family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room, bathroom and lobby were nice, up to date and well furnished; bed was comfortable, location good, great accommodation for a moderate price for NYC. Closet too small for two persons however and with luggage the room was cramped.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I like Hyatt Place in general and this hotel lived up to my expectations.  Rooms were good. They are not as large as the standard hyatt place ( which are very generous rooms) but are roomy by New York standards. I like having the extra sofa. The fridge is always a nice amenity. There is a microwave in the bar area and you could heat up leftovers if you wanted. Bathroom is nice. Beds comfortable. No one yet has a good pillow, but theirs are fine. We had a view out to the Empire State Building and that was cool, but I don't think I would pay extra. You have to duck down even on the lower floors to see the top. Breakfast is fine, if crowded toward the end. Wifi worked fine. Location is great. We were on the 10th floor and noise was not an issue. Very close to tourist locations but not right in the middle of the mayhem. 1 block from subway. Easy to get uptown or downtown. Neighborhood is busy without the charm of lower manhattan but lots of restaurants and stores nearby. Staff was great. Friendly and accommodating. We are honors members and I don't know if they treated us differently, but they had a great attitude. They were, "yes, that is no problem at all people."We will definitely go back there when in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Firstly, ignore the current photo on the hotel's Tripadvisor page (of a low lying, white building). It looks nothing like that! That photo is of another hotel and is therefore very misleading. The NYC Hyatt Midtown South Is a tall narrow building structurally sandwiched between two other tall, narrow buildings.The location itself is fantastic! Turn right out of the hotel and 30 seconds later you're on 5th Avenue. For my needs and interests, the location was perfect - 5 stars versus the 4.1 stars I 'd give the Distrikt Hotel, where I also stayed during this trip!Be aware, however: there is major construction going on next to the hotel. Not the building immediately adjoining it but the building next to that. And boy, is it loud - and nor does it look like a short-term project!! Ensure you ask for a quiet room in advance of your arrival if that's a concern for you. It was for me, but thankfully my room (#1204) at the back of the hotel meant I wasn't particularly disturbed by it by during my three night stay. Obviously there was normal city traffic noise, and a bit of background drilling/banging - but you'd fully expect that in NYC. However, the price I paid for asking for a quiet was a 'view' facing straight into another building. The fact the outside of my window was so dirty was an aid in terms of providing a bit of privacy(!), but whenever I was in my room I also needed to pull down the blind, which meant restricting the daylight a little.I booked a studio room with sofa. It was tiny. Having just checked out of the spacious room at the Distrikt, I really felt it.... I found it too small really.... I definitely wouldn't book that category room again for what was originally* priced at US 279/night inclusive of breakfast + taxes. The bed was large and comfortable though. And I was really pleased to see a very good sized, empty fridge which was greatly appreciated: so many hotels - including the Distrikt - pack out their fridges with products leaving zero room for anything you may want to buy and keep cold! Of course, you can often just remove the hotel products if you want, but it they're operating a drawer configuration, every time you remove something it clocks up as "consumed" on your account! Thankfully no such issues at the Hyatt Midtown South and with the blistering summer heat I was pleased to be able to buy big bottles of water and coke and keep them cold in my room.There's no kettle in the room and none available to borrow. There's a small (one cup at a time) coffee machine in the room which Front Desk told me I can get hot water from - but clearly the water generated from it stinks/tastes of coffee and I loathe coffee, so that was no use to me! Reception were very happy to fill up cups for me from the kitchen but I felt really bad asking them to do it for me, and would have preferred being able to do it myself....Other reviewers have mentioned the slow lifts.... It really wasn't an issue for me though; I was on the 10th floor and I used the situation as a good opportunity to get a big fitter and use the stairs! :-)Breakfast was a very welcome, complimentary inclusion and really adequate considering this is only what I'd say is a 3 star hotel (in the same bracket for me as a Holiday Inn Express, Ibis, that sort of thing). The dining room itself is very plain and functional.... But the staff were very sweet and pleasant, which I appreciated. In truth, I'm used to expansive, 'all-singing, all-dancing' Asian hotel buffets which of course this isn't, but for for what it is, I was pleasantly surprised: plenty of different cereals to choose from; big jugs of cold fruit juices and milk (low-fat, soya and full-fat); fresh fruit; a small selection of tasty pastries; and at least two hot breakfast muffin options (eg cheese and spinach, and bacon and cheese) on the hot plate section. I got there at 7 am each day when it was fairly quiet. It gets really crowded and akin to a full-on "bun fight" later!! I saw people grabbing loads of stuff to take back to their rooms.... * Overall: if I had paid the original price of US 279/night I'd have felt very niggled. Although the location is fab, the bedroom was just too small and the orientation of my room was poor (albeit avoiding the construction site!). However I was given an adjusted price US 200/night, which was the going rate on their website the day I checked in. That made it a better proposition....

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: About two and a half weeks before our trip I made hotel reservations. It is really hard finding a room for 2 adults and 3 kids ages 10, 15, and 17. This place was great as everyone had a bed. The 2 girls shared and the boy had the sofa pull out bed. Our bed was very comfortable. As this being New York, the rooms are slightly smaller than the usual Hyatt Place rooms. As long as you can get the kids to stay organized with their suitcases, there is enough room. We were on the 17th floor and our room was quiet. Since this hotel was full, the wait for the elevator was a little long at times. The free breakfast was better than other places that offer free breakfast and there were many options. Since the weather was perfect it was great to take a glass of wine and sit out front at one of the tables. This location is not as close to Penn Station as the map indicates. I would recommend a cab ride.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great staff. Comfortable rooms. Room was surprisingly quiet for NYC. I would return to this hotel. It was easy to get to transportation, near both Penn Station and 15 minute walk from Port Authority. I flew into Newark and took a bus to PA and they allowed me an early check-in which I appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place was a nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Had great service for everything we needed. The breakfast was great, many options and all tasted good. My only complaint is that the room was small. I guess that's normal for NYC. :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent 4 nights for a business trip and would definitely return next year! The lobby was comfortable and the free breakfast was very good. Staff was always welcoming and helpful! The location is great, a few blocks from Penn Station (took the train in from NJ) and easy to get around the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I normally travel to NYC for business and stay at a number of different hotels depending on where I am working in the city. I have never stayed at a HYATT hotel brand before. I expected a higher quality and level of service than what I experienced. I would compare it to a Holiday Inn or Hampton Inn. Very budget and basic, un-attentive staff, poor quality room and food.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Visiting NYC with family and unwilling to spend for a 4 or 5 star hotel. Hyatt Place offers clean, comfortable rooms that are decent sized. For a 3-star hotel, this property is very good especially when considering the location, staff and modern facility.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location , staff was realy friendly very helpful went out of there way to say hello is everything ok ,well run Hotel, stay there.Cl;oes to Macys,subway one block away safe at late hours,great Irish pub across the street, and they always have great green apples in the loby!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I pulled up in crazy traffic. Raul one the staff members came out and told me to park right out front. He set the stage for a great trip. The hotel is small but has everything you could possibly want. It is not far from Times Square, Broadway and the Empire State Building. The rooms are clean and they have a nice fitness center. They also offer complimentary breakfast. Their staff is the best. Raul always went out of his way to make sure our stay was pleasant. We were having a problem with our room keys and Lorraine stepped in to make sure the problem was resolved.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff made us feel welcome!!!!! The front desk employees were so helpful when we needed some insightful New York insider information. Olivia with housekeeping was awesome. Love the beds and spacious walk in showers. Free internet was a nice amenity. Thank you!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Me and my wife recently stayed at the Hyatt for four nights during a long weekend in New York. We found the hotel to be well located, the room looked great and was spacious and the staff was fiendly. I would love to stay at the Hyatt Place hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at this hotel because we needed something to accommodate 5 people (which is hard to find in NYC). It was also extremely beneficial that they had a continental breakfast each morning! The hotel was very clean and the staff were helpful with directions and other needs (extra towels, etc). The breakfast was perfect too. The Empire State building was literally outside our window!! Plus, it's a short few blocks to Times Square, Broadway and subway stations. Really, the location is ideal if you want to be in "NYC". You may pay extra for this hotel but it's definitely worth it if you want to avoid extra subway or bus rides.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Beautiful Hyatt quality room with safe, iron, great A/C, fast free internet, good in room coffee and a comfortable bed. By NY standards, plenty of space in the room. Very nice bath as well. Clean, modern, efficient and helpful staff, yet reasonably priced. Has everything you need and nothing more. Central location if you don't mind walking a few blocks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Small but brilliant. Modern interiors, nice view, great location, reasonable prices and service level compared to Plaza or Waldroff Astoria. West 36th street is maybe not the cleanest and impressive location but the hotel itself is just perfect for business or leisure stay if you prefer small modern hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was nice and size was good for a NYC hotel room. Elevator service was awful and we ended up taking the stairs most of the time. Excellent air conditioner in the room. Wi-Fi was good. Location is good as this is close to everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: we had a night in NY paid in this hotel....and at the time of arriving at 1;00 am after 12 hrs of flights and transportation and when the only thing that matter is getting a good rest to wake up early to get back to more transportation at penn station....and there was no room available..........before in the afternoon we called the hotel to say we where checking in late.we think you are unprofessional....the only job you had... and you got it wrong.....and if it wasn't enough....the person at the hotel lobby was of no help at all......and sent my daughter to a much much cheaper hotel....and not close to penn station....... and keep her at the lobby for more than 30 minutes waiting for I don't know what type of cab. and didn;t even bother to explain the taxi which hotel they had to drive my daughter....and she did't know even the name of the hotel she had to go after..........we thought Hyatt was a serious company...now we know better. not even 30 days ago we spent more than 6000 dls in andaz......we will think twice now before booking in any of your hotels around the world.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: i have stayed at hyatt hotels and hyatt place properties in many US states over last decade. Spent 3 nites here this week. This hyatt place is a liitle different: (1) employees are terrifically trained --- not a knock on hyatt's elsewhere but just stood out here (2) big breakfasts (3) 25 story hotel with two elevators. This was an issue one evening when one elevator quit working. Good stay as per the norm at Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I were celebrating our 6th wedding anniversary and we decided to spend the weekend in the city. We've stayed at the Hyatt Mystic Place and we loved it so we decided to give this hotel a try. It was reasonable priced for a hotel in Manhattan. We arrived at the hotel before check in and it was no problem our room was ready . The front desk was very friendly and he told us everything about the hotel and if we needed anything just ask. The hotel is not far from Mass Transit, it's in a great location. Lots of restaurants and stores in the vicinity. Our room was clean and it was an okay size. The breakfast was ok as well. Overall the hotel was clean, had free wifi as well as a business center. They had a pool and fitness center. We had a great time and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was nice and clean, staff tried to be very accommodating. Hotel was sold out and very, very busy. We tried to check in early but was told no rooms were available. They held on to our bags but we had to store in the hallway because storage room was filled. Did not feel very safe doing that so we hung out in lobby until we were able to check in. Room was clean, breakfast was just OK, it was so busy it was hard to get through the line. I would go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 1 week. It is a shame that Hyatt lent its name to this location. Customer service was poor and the hotel was ill maintained. The poor customer service wasn't a surprise as the receptionist also doubled as the cook and cleaner in the restaurant. House cleaning was horrendous as we had to request for towels in the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago. We arrived around 12 noon and they checked us right in. Staff we friendly and helpful give us good ideas on where to go. Two elevators so we didn't have to wait long to get to our room on the 19th floor.Room was very clean with a small couch for added comfort. Room had small fridge, desk and good wifi. We had a view of the Empire State Building which is about two blocks. Subway station is just around the corner and easy to get uptown or downtown.Hotel also has a hot breakfast, but go early because room gets crowded. We paid around $160 and we thought it was a good price for NYC. This isn't a fancy upscale hotel, but it was good for the 5 nights we stayed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for one night with my daughter while visiting colleges near the city. The rooms were nice and updated, view was great- we looked out to the Empire State Building, the breakfast was crowded but had good variety. The location was perfect to go exploring the city, lots to do near by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed three nights, four guests in the room. Very clean room. Disappointed we were short on wash cloths and one of the elevators was out one of the days, which created longer than expected waits. Breakfasts, which were included in our room cost, were convenient. The cost of the room was very high considering the amenities offered; however, parking and the Subway were near the hotel and I recommend using the subway to travel--forget the CityPass and Hop on Hop off bus, which I considered a huge waste of my money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Got a great price for the weekend on hotels.com, shame it wasn't available all week as I would have been happy to cancel my other hotel - plans changed and were in the city longer than expected.About 10 minutes walk with luggage from the Port Authority, 2 mins form Macy's, Empire State etc. Despite being on the 9th floor and a relatively quiet side street, Monday morning (and Saturday night) were noisy, but ear plugs are available - very thoughtful!Breakfast was very good for the price - a couple of hot dishes and breads, cereals etc. Not sure if we were supposed to clear our own tables- very little evidence of any staff & some tables were piled up. Long line on Sunday though. Room was clean and a good size for NYC, with a sofa - wifi was slow, couldn't get on at all on my iphone. Deli/salad bar next door was good for lunch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Meh, was clean and a decent location. tons of garbage on the street when you sit outside. was just ok. it was very clean and the door man and older gentleman was teriffic. breakfast was good, but finishes at 9 so my teens missed every one. we did get to bring stuff up the them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stay twice in the same July 2014, as pre and post hotel, before and after US East Coast Tour. I can not change my opinion for its prime location, near to many tourist attraction, macy's :), Empire State building itself.. etc.Room is simple and spacious enough, bed is fabulous. The Hyatt touch.Book a limo from hotel people to JFK. Mind please make sure once again the fix fare. Seems the price list listed in hotel lobby is no longer valid. It is not a big different, but not accurate.I remember, wi fi here is just like I am in the office or at home. There is No painful re-insert username and password. Love it.Insya Allah, I will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We booked our stay here on line. I personally called the day of our check in and made sure our room was booked and informed them that I will be using a different credit card than the one I had put on record. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that our room was sold out because the credit card didn't go through. After clarifying that I had called in anticipation of this and that the hotel should have made note of this, it took the receptionists a couple of hours to find us another room in another hotel. Much appreciated, of course but such a mishap should not have happened in the first place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've tried a number of mid-priced hotels in NYC and this is my new favorite. I usually take the train and Penn Station is maybe a 15 minute walk, also about the same distance to Broadway and Times Square. The room was also the most comfortable of hotels in this class. A nice modern look, un-fussy but nicer artwork than other hotels. And the sofa was particularly nice as usually the only place to sit in many of these hotels is the bed. The bathroom also had a clean, modern look. The free, hot breakfast was a big plus as usually hotels in this class offer only stale pastries if anything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for two days with my 14 yr old niece. Hotel is located right by the Empire State Building, up the street from macys, and around the corner from the subway. The hotel staff members are very helpful and knowledgeable about the subway and area. This hotel is in walking distance to rockafellla center and Central Park and Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: When I made the reservation, I didn't realize that I would be around the corner from the Empire State Building, and Herald Square. I am so glad that I chose this hotel. I will be back again. I have visited NY many times, but this is, by far, the best place that I've ever stayed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Ck in-smooth, all in order, Lauren explained all and provide great customer service. The vibe in lobby seamed hectic though.Ck-out no problems but we did not get our summary under the door last night.Room comfortable, good decor, good condition, Bed - best mattress I've slept on want one for my house. Bath - good condition, modern, clean. Hot water, good pressure Breakfast - scrambled eggs, sausage, frenchtoast, pastries, juice very good breakfast - get there early though as the line is long an hour before it closes.Cons - elevators are slow on the way down in the morning due to stopping at every floor. We took the stairs down from floor 16 as it was quicker. No I'm not an athlete.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We are currently staying at the Hyatt Place here in New York (Aug 2-7). So far it has NOT been up to my previous Hyatt experiences. In fact, it rates very much below any average quality hotel I have stayed. First, somehow my reservations were wrong. My family of 4 were put in a room with 1 king bed only when we reserved a room with a sleeper sofa. In addition, the cost for the room was an astounding $450/night. Ridiculous. Front office personnel was not very helpful except for Dana and Rich (bellman). No one really seems to enjoy working there, no one smiles or greets you as a Hyatt Platinum member even though i have spent many nights gathering points for this "once in a lifetime" visit to New York. We had 2 free nights and OVERPAID for the other 3. Had I known about the quality of service at this Hyatt, I would have spent my free night points at another location! In addition, just got back from a long day of sight seeing (3:30 PM) and our room was not cleaned yet! Front desk response was "they are not finished cleaning yet". That was it, no sorry. I know this is New York, but this is Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here for the first time in June 2014. The hotel is clean, convenient, in a safe area within easy walking distance to Macy's, Bryant Park, and the Empire State Building. Subway access in any direction and Times Square also an easy walk. Breakfast included with room along with free wi-fi makes it a bargain in the city! The staff members were friendly, efficient and accommodating....the only complaints I have are that the computer was down when we checked in making it a long and more complicated than necessary process for the staff and...there was no linen ordered on the 3rd day, so we didn't get fresh towels at all that day! ( with 4 women that is not a good plan!). I think the staff did the best they could with the situation and the problem lies with the administrators who seemed to do little to remedy either situation! They certainly weren't visible and they should have been! Shame on them....they don't deserve the great staff they have!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stressing breakfast with lack of seating and the buffet area very underdimensioned worst case was 15 minutes waiting in line - not a good start to the day - especially not for the children. Staff at check in not very smiling and informative. Shower was making the complet bathroom wet. Cleaning lady was nice and very efficient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a very pleasant property that is centrally located and with very helpful staff. Rooms were very good size and beds very comfortable. Bathroom was immaculate. We have stayed here before and will certainly be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location of this hotel was key as we drove in and out of the city. The hotel is not far at all from the Lincoln Tunnel and New Jersey. We arrived, it was easy to use the public secure parking a couple buildings down. The room was smaller than another Hyatt Place we had previously stayed, but we had a great view of the Empire State Building and the wonderful staff made up for the smaller suite. The staff was wonderful in giving directions and advise. They were also helpful with our son's food allergy concerns at breakfast. I do believe the customer service was the best I have experienced at any comparable location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I typically stay here when on business for 1 or 2 nights if the price is lower then one of the Marriott's. If there is no price difference I stay at Marriott mainly because of the elevators mentioned below  Rooms are nice and clean. Very good location in midtown withing walking distance of 34st (Macys) and times square. My only complaint is there are only 2 elevators and you can be waiting up to 10 minutes during busy time. Was there one visit when one elevator was out for 1/2 day which was inconvenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a nice stay, 10th floor, noise not an issue at all, actually over slept the entire time there. Good size shower and comfortable room. The blackout shade was a nice and walls very thick NO sound from other rooms. Overall a very good hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family was very impressed with this hotel. Great location. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was clean and spacious. Got a great price with our AAA discount. We did not have any of the issues mentioned in other reviews. Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: took the room with 2 double beds with sofa. Unlike what the site states, they are actually double beds and NOT queen beds. In addition, the service was not what would you expect for the price tag, the way the reception treats your requests, the many times that we had to call for additional towels and clean mugs, the smelly and noisy room, the packed elevator, and the most annoying is the free breakfast...until 9am. Be sure to show up early to have a seat! No thank you, I will go elsewhere...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Arrived late and went out for a bite & then back to room & sleep. We were surprised when we got up to shower & there was no hot water & the plumbing was so messed up that to take a cold shower you had to turn on sink faucet. We weren't expecting the camping experience in midtown. A low price doesn't necessarily mean a good deal. Buyer beware!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location...great view of the Empire State Building...close to subway...staff very helpful! The room was just the right amount of space for 2. Very clean. The staff was great on showing us what subway to take.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is well located and offers excellent service for a reasonable price. Room was comfortable and beds were excellent. Air conditioning is quiet compared with many older hotels which have noisy units. Bathroom was modern and clean. Breakfast included many healthful choices and was a real bonus. We had a great stay and would return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Not only is this hotel in a perfect location at such an affordable price, the staff were all so friendly and the room was just what you need for a stay in New York. The complimentary breakfast was impressive. Great place. Will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We checked in early. Our room wasn't ready we came back at 3 and waited an hour for our room. The room is smallish and clean but not horrible. The bad part is waiting for the elevator forever. Not enough towels only given 3. Had to call for more. The TV didn't work right away and the internet is free but slow and kicks you off frequently. I have stayed at other Midtown hotels before and this one is very inconvenient to the subway. The second day my room key stopped working and after the elevator finally came to take us up to the room I then had to wait forever for it to bring me back down again to get my key fixed. Probably won't stay here again. Other places in the area that are better for the same price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a bit new to Hyatt chain. Familiar with Park Hyatt, Grand Hyatt, Hyatt Regency. This Hyatt Place is very centrally located. Not fancy, but everything is carefully thought. The room is big enough for Manhattan. The comfort of sofa bed, bed itself, huge large TV with sophisticated pay TV. Room has only shower cabin. Internet is fine, connected anywhere in the hotel, without any painful re-login to connect to wi-fi.Love the place and comfort quality of the room. Good to be lazy sometimes. Wish the window is sound proof. Perhaps this is the only mishap.We will be back in the future, Insya Allah.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: stayed in February, 2014 (sorry for late review); arrived early evening for one night stay before overseas trip; was warmly received; assisted with bags, given complimentary bottle of water AND room overlooking Empire State Building! room VERY clean, new, with all amenities; ordered dinner at the bar and had breakfast (included) in the restaurant; Doorman Raoul actually ran to the end of the block to hail me a taxi in the morning so that I would not be late to arrive at the airport. I travel frequently and have stayed in New York at least once per year for 20 years and the hotel and service were outstanding. For the price, it was almost unheard of! Thanks so much to the staff! I highly recommend this hotel and will be returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well managed property in the middle of everything New York! Very easy access to the Subway system, and ample parking arranged with a garage very close by. Cross-town traffic does tend to make it difficult to drive to the property, especially in the afternoon rush. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Breakfast is very good to excellent. Staff are true superstars! Extremely attentive, professional, and knowledgeable - they truly make this property a winner. Lots of restaurants very close by. Front desk / 'Lobby' area leaves a bit to be desired, but the staff more than makes up for it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nothing special here. Fairly typical NYC chain hotel. Clean. Smallish. Breakfast needs work. Crowded area to sit and food is akin to airline food. When checking in, staff were dealing with guest who had been booked into wrong room... or some such nonsense. Took two staff some time to fix.... we waited to check in while they futzed with the computer and blamed the previous night's front desk staff for errors. Can't really complain too much since stay was on points, but just confirms my loyalty to marriott. Location is good. jerusalem deli across the street is great alternative for breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is a basic hotel with limited amenities. The best feature of the hotel is the location. It is very close to Broadway, Times Square and Herald Square. The staff was friendly but seemed distracted at times. I was surprised to find the dining/ bar area was not open until late in the afternoon. The rooms were relatively large and the bathrooms were well stocked. Overall, the Hyatt Place is a modest facility with a great location.Tip. Ask for a room facing the street or you may be peering into the window of the building next door.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was clean, convinent to Penn Station and theatre district. Staff was friendly and very attentive. I will definetly stay there again! I was there with friends and there was plenty of space for 5 of us in the room. Extra towels were provided with a smile!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent two glorious evenings here, to enjoy the forth of July weekend. We could not have chosen a better place to celebrate. The staff was extremely helpful, and professional. I would strongly recommend this gem of a hotel to any and all of my friends. The location is also a plus, with it being walking distance from Penn Station. I for one can't wait for my next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Room was clean. ..updated and large enough to work in.Free WiFi and free breakfast.Street didn't offer much and was filled because of construction but great staff and for the money I paid 209 ut was just fine. Could use a better evening bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice place to stay in midtown. Comfy rooms right sized and free Wall St. Journal, USA Today AND breakfast. Staff is professional and helpful. Close to subway, shopping and Broadway. There is no fine dining nearby but there is Korea Town with its iconoclastic barbecues.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was very accommodating to us as we asked for several special requests. We got into our room very early - circa 11 am after a race in Central Park, so the showers were very welcomed! The breakfast buffet was very nice, especially the scrambled eggs with tomatoes and cheese. Only complaint was long elevator waits.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Friendly and helpful staff. Free internet, free delicious breakfast, gym is ok, rooms ok, reasonably priced. Not a luxury hotel, but as comfortable and convenient as you could ask for. 200 hundred extra characters required by STOOOPID TripAdvisor

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here last December just after Christmas and had a nice time, but found hard it had to like it. My husband booked a bigger room as my sister was also with us.The staff was disoriented and really slow with the check in process. It took almost an hour! We drove from DC so we really tired and just wanted to relax. Considering we reached after noon, check in should have been a breeze. They gave us a handicapped room and the room was spacious.The room was clean with modern decor. It was all good, until I stepped in the shower and realized the position of the shower head was such that it would not only flood the bathroom but also the room! Really strange experience. It took half an hour for room service to provide us with towels to soak the water and then another 2 hours for the maintenance guy to arrive to figure our problem. The staff was extremely slow but they tried their best to help. My husband booked through his points and since we were disappointed with the whole thing they gave us a night free.The location is amazing, always buzzing with tourists and its walking distance to all the hotspots, shopping, restaurants etc. We ate breakfast in the hotel and enjoyed the selection at the buffet - nothing special the usual bread, muffins, oatmeal, juices, fruits for us vegetarians. There can be a wait line for breakfast as well as the elevators. As mentioned above we drove and weren't planning to use it during our stay. We found a cheaper alternative to the hotel parking opposite the hotel, best way to find options is by using google maps.Might come back to stay in a standard room mainly for the location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Positives: Location, location, location; just a block from Empire State Building on one side, and Macy's on the other. We took a red eye flight and arrived way before 3:00 pm check in, the staff was accomodating none the less...THANK YOU!. Appreciated that WiFi was not an extra $12/day thank you. The breakfast skillets were quite phenomenal! Not the typical "free breakfast" of bad coffee, stale bun, and juice. But rather a real, hearty, hot breakfast...definately a plus! Negatives: The elevators. There are only two of them, and they are slow. by the time it gets to your floor, it's probrably full. Stairs are ok...unless you have luggage and you're on the 18th floor. The rooms are quite small.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at this midtown location for the second time. Rooms have been clean and its a great location. That is all I really want and this hotel provides it. Staff is friendly, no issues. Our earlier stay had a great view of the Empire State Building, this time we were not as lucky. Bathroom was clean too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We decided to spend our Anniversary in New York City. We took the train and the hotel was just a few blocks from Penn Station. The room was very nice. We had a great night's sleep. The complimentary breakfast was also very good. The room included a refrigerator and safe (which we appreciated). We would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great little hotel with a very convenient location conveniently located between 5th and 6th Ave on 36th St only a few blocks form Penn Station many good restaurants right around the corner great breakfast at hotel along with USA today only 2 elevators

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for 5 d tays in April 2014 with our 2 year old son. We were given a room in the last top floor and the view was just incredible! The staff was the most helpful we have seen in years!! Muchas gracias Dulce!!! The location is perfect just beside Herald Square, close to the metro and to the Empire State Building. We really liked the fact that there is a microwave available at the restaurant downstairs that you can use anytime. The breakfast is delicious!! you have everything there! and they change the eggs every day.The only negative thing is that still being in the top floor (26th I think or 23rd) you can still hear the noise of the cars the whole time. I think it is because there is no double-glazing in the windows. But apart from that everything was great, very good value for money. If we come back we will definitely come here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: One of several boutique hotels on this street, and one of the few reasonable (in NYC dollars) hotels to fit 5 adults/teens. Two comfy queen beds and a sofa in a small room is a tight fit, but in NYC, tight fits are the norm. Newish and clean, with an airy lobby and a dining area. The free breakfasts have long lines as you approach the 9 am cutoff, and the food is OK at best, lots of bready things. We only ate there twice in a week. But’s in New York: lots of places to eat including a better than average Fresh and Natural deli next door. Plus the Keg Room right across the street was a family favorite.The Herald Square subway is right around the corner, so you are in the heart of city, but happily out of Times Square (it's a subway stop away).25 floors (we don’t count the non-existent 13th floor), means if you get high up on the south side, you get a tremendous view of the Empire State Building. And the windows open slightly for fresh air versus constant air conditioning. There are 2 fast elevators, but wait time around busy breakfast times can be long. Good maid service, solid & free WiFi, and a friendly staff. Minor quibbles about lack of power outlets and noise from the elevators.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is small but very nice....we loved our room - very contemporary and clean! Nice breakfast buffet that is free, however, the line gets very long, and the dining area is very small. There is only one elevator, so the breakfast backup caused a huge delay in getting downstairs. Otherwise, the staff was very friendly and the hotel was within close walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for a long weekend. Will stay here every trip to NY. Location is convenient to shopping, subway lines, Times Square, and TKTS. Rooms are large by NY standards with a separate couch and sitting area. Decor was much more upscale than expected.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff at this hotel have made our stay incredible. Kevin at the front desk was amazing and helped us get a room as soon as we got there, which was around 9:30am ( most hotels make you wait until 3 to check in). Kevin also made sure I had a tub, which was an added bonus. I will always choose this hotel in the future because the prices are great, it's very clean, the larger rooms are very spacious, the staff is great... Especially Kevin, and the location is perfect! I love this place and look forward to my next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: PRO: Very friendly staff. Great location. Walking distance to time square and empire state building. CON: Only one elevator. Be prepared to wait during peak hours or use the stairs which is an excellent form of exercise that I would recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First time staying in New York City. We had a party of 5, so it was hard to find a room that slept 5 that was not so expensive. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. Room had (2) queens and a sofa bed. The room may have been a bit on the small side, but we did not feel cramped. Beds were very comfortable. Large screen TV and fridge in the room. There is a microwave in the lounge to use. The hotel is within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. Times Square, Broadway. Rockafeller Center, Port Authority.Breakfast was a step above the normal continental breakfast we get. Nice breakfast sandwiches and french toast along with all the other normal items.I would not hesitate to stay here again when going to city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I'd like to start by saying the staff is exceptional at this property. We are a family of six (6) and this room fit use well and cozy :) I must admit that this is our first stay in NYC so this room seems small to us but from what I've read this is good sized (esp for the location and price). We love the location. It ended up being much closer to key locations and attractions like The Empire State Building, Time Square, Broadway and Shopping. We also bought unlimited 7 days Metro Passes and every location was a quick train or bus ride away. I have to agree with earlier comments about the morning elevator situation. It's very difficult to take the elevator in the mornings. With the crush of people checking in and out along with the staff having to use the same elevator it makes sense that there's a long wait. Luckily we are on the 5th floor so we just took the stairs in the AM. Ok that brings me to breakfast. We sometimes just slept in so late we missed it but as it nears 9am there is a crush of people in the dinning area and yes food does run out but they quickly restock even when it's close to 9am. There were these two people who has the arduous task of taking care of the buffet areas and they hustled. There was a young Spanish girl and guy and anything I asked about or for they always had a smile and a quick turn around. I do feel they need more hands on deck for breakfast since the great staff is being overwhelmed by poor design and layout of the dining area. One plus was that we were free to take our food outside to eat or even to our room. The food was pretty good and they had many choices. There is a microwave in the dinning area that can be used throughout the day which came in handy for reheating leftovers. Parking sucks but we are in NYC so that's to be expected. We drove here from Florida in our SUV and just note the base is $35 but for an SUV it's $45 per day (ouch since we're here for 7 days). All in all the rooms are clean and beds are comfortable which are my personal top two needs...I would certainly recommend this hotel. Lovely hotel with a great location. Pleas note that I'm really not a fussy or high maintenance travel/person. For the price point this property is very good. I read some other reviews and if you want to be picky etc than you may need to up your price point.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were travelling with a family of 5 with 3 kids and booked a room with 2 queens and a sofa. After reading some tripadvisor reviews highlighting how small the rooms were and how slow was the elevator, we took the plunge and went for it because of the location. Yes, some of what was written is true, however, it was minor compared to the convenience this hotel offered. My kids loved the view of the Empire State Building from our room. It was excellent that someone shared on tripadvisor that you should ask for it at check in and we did. Don't be put off by some of the negative comments. My family enjoyed our stay and we would go back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The room and location in NYC are to die for. Such a fantastic room size and quality. The downside however is that the hotel is mismanaged. With no other customers in line we still had to wait almost 5 minutes to be acknowledged of our existence beyond a "wait" from the service rep. When we were finally acknowledged we were told the cleaning crew was running slow and that we wouldn't get our high level room anytime in the near future, and that we would still have to wait past the official check in time to get our room. I've stayed in motels that have had better customer service. To top it all off the breakfast served you guessed it...rotten eggs. When we notified the manager they brought out yet another plate of the eggs. Nothing starts your morning out right like tasting sulfuric rotten eggs and watching ten other families spit out the eggs at first bite. Disgusting service and disgusting food. But stellar rooms and location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is one of those narrow new hotels in the 30s. The hallways too are exceptionally narrow. The cleaning cart was left outside my room the entire 24 visit I was there. I had to make quite an effort to squeeze by it between my many nyc appointments. The cleaning lady considered her own space and hung out in the room across from my room. I complained and was assured management would call it never happened.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were very happy with the two nights we spent here. Breakfast was included and it was one of the best hotel buffets I’ve had. Nothing gourmet, but they provide a variety of fresh offerings. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The midtown location is generally convenient, though it is a few blocks between subway stops. The room showed a little wear but was comfortable. Bathroom was roomy and clean. Free wi-fi worked well. All in all, a good deal for the very expensive midtown Manhattan area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for three nights in a double room with a pull-out sofa bed for the four of us. The room was spacious for New York. We had a small refrigerator. The beds were very comfortable; although, there were two very nice pillows and one cheapo on each bed, a little odd. The front desk staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet was nice -- freshly made breakfast sandwiches, fruit, cereal, etc. Very crowded at 9 a.m., so earlier is better. Other reviewers mentioned the elevator situation. Since we stayed on the 6th floor, we could easily take the stairs if the elevators (two of them) took too long. We didn't have the nice view of an upper floor room, but we also didn't have to deal with long waits for the elevator. (Another guest mentioned that housekeeping kept the elevator on a floor for an extended amount of time -- not sure if this is true or not.) We paid around $250/night, which we felt was very reasonable for the location -- walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Penn Station, etc. We would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a small hotel but with decent standards and at a great location in Midtown NYC. Definitely a great value for the price, in NYC terms. The rooms are rather small but very modern and clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the hotel has a nice breakfast with large selection of meals. If you need a simple and affordable place to stay at while being close to everything in NYC, this is a great choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is our fourth stay at a Hyatt Place this summer. Our previous experiences have been fantastic. The entire staff of this Hyatt Place need to visit their colleagues in Nashville. They know how to do it right. We were in Nashville during CMA, the hotel was at capacity, and still the hotel was well staffed, very friendly and efficient. Not so in NYC. The complementary breakfast in Hyatt Place is typically fantastic. The breakfast here is a nightmare. There is a consistent line of 10-30 people. They need to re-do the buffet so it is not a single line (again see how Nashville does it). Breakfast ends here at 9:00 a.m. Every other Hyatt Place had more generous hours. Every morning we have been at breakfast around 8:00 a.m. (an hour before they are scheduled to close) and they are already out of yogurt, oatmeal, cereal and most of the coffee dispensers are empty. I ask if they are bringing out more food and the response is that once it's gone, it's gone. I guess that's too bad for the 100 plus people I see come in after us. They are terribly understaffed. There are 2-3 people working when there should be at least 6. People can not find places to sit and there is not staff assisting with bussing tables so they can turn over more quickly. If you are a family, plan to sit on the floor or go back to your room if you want to sit together. The other major complaint is the elevator. It takes at least 5-7 minutes to get an elevator and, again, if you're a family, once the elevator arrives, it is full of people and can not accommodate your party. We have begun taking the steps 15 floors because it is quicker. The rooms are nice and work well for a family. I am trying to think of more positive feedback but nothing is coming to me. Hopefully our Hyatt Place stay in Boston will be more in line with our previous experiences.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place Midtown, New York was a great place to stay. It was close to everything, our room was clean, and the breakfast was good. The staff were friendly and accommodating. We had a quiet side so we slept well. Will definitely return to Hyatt Place in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is very well located just a block from Herald Square and the amazing city block sized Macy's. Easy walk to Empire State Building, lots of shopping, good restaurants and even a short walk to Times Square (or one subway stop if you don't feel like walking). The hotel has a very modest entrance but it is clean, well-managed and has a very well-trained and considerate staff. All in all it was a very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice to have a couch and a king sized bed, was a little cramped, but not bad for nyc. Got a nice high floor room, with a view. Was able able to check in a bit early after arriving at 11:00am, left my phone number with the front desk, and they called me when a room was available.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms is large enough, but the bed was very uncomfortable. The carpet was dirty and the A/C unit was adequate, but louder and needed to have more fan when asleep to cool the sleeping area.Overall a solid stay, close to Bryant Park and good breakfast. I would try not to stay the next time I'm in NYC if possible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent a few nights here in mid-June -- first time at a Hyatt Place, so not sure how it compares to others of this brand. Our room was fresh and pleasant, and roomy enough for NYC. It also seemed well-priced compared to other midtown hotels for the same dates. We were on a high floor, and did not experience street noise. We received very good and friendly service from all staff we encountered. The front desk even made every effort to help us with an early check-in. Only drawbacks were that the breakfast space was mobbed and a little uncomfortable, and current construction a few doors down on 36th Street was a bit unattractive and made navigating the street a little difficult.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Place Midtown. It was convenient to all New York attractions and staff was wonderful. James was great in assisting us with transfer set-up and answering all of our questions about recommendations. The proximity to Macy's is incredible, so if you are looking for somewhere to stay during Thanksgiving, this IS the place. Loved that we could put 5 ladies into 1 room without any issues. So, if you have a larger family definitely consider staying here. Free Breakfast was included every morning and wish we had known this the first day. We went next door to get breakfast instead b/c there was no signage letting us know about this perk. Wonderful Hotel in the Midtown Area and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We asked for Empire State Building side. Request was ignored. We asked for additional towels. Request was made at front desk and was ignored. Request was made by calling desk and was again ignored. Third request was made again at front desk. Someone eventually came with one towel even though the request was for 3. Same problem on second night. Room was not cleaned between nights. Used cups were not replaced. Trash was not taken. The bathroom light was burned out. I could go on but it is just more of the same.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: somehow they had me checked in for 3 nights instead of 2 nights, at check out they charged me for the third night anyway EVEN THOUGH the front desk clerk who checked me in said she made the mistake for having me in for 3 nights - manager said I still have to pay, I had a great experience and soured beyond repair at check out - basically I tipped the hotel $300

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel hyatt place is conveniently located a few blocks from shopping area (the 34) and a few more down brodway, is close to the station and its lobby is very good, the attention of the staff first, highly recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The service in the hotel was great, I was staying in New York on my own for my 18th birthday and the staff were very helpful and kind. They had my mums email adders from previous enquires made about the hotel prices etc, and when I arrived at the hotel they emailed my mum to let her know that I had arrived ok. I had left my adapter in another state and the hotel lent me one and were available to help with anything needed such as recommending places to eat and finding transport. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My daughter and I went on a mother daughter vacation and couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. The Hyatt Place was a few blocks walk from everywhere. Time square you turn one direction, Shopping another, the subway that ran most trains a block away, the Empire State Building, yes, we were a five to ten minute walk from anything.  Our plane was 3 or 4 hours late, of course, and we came in around midnight. The front desk got checked us in quickly, our room was clean, ready, and wonderful. We stayed on the second floor. Yes, you could hear some traffic occasionally, but it never bothered us or our sleep. We used both the stairs and elevator. I can only think of one time we gave up on the elevator in the seven nights we stayed there.  The staff was awesome and helpful. Every time we asked for directions, recommendations, or advice it was given. Dana, Rich, and a man who wore the suit, I think he was a manager, were extremely helpful. EVERY recommendation given to us from the different staff members was great! They could give walking directions, what subway train to take to get where we wanted to go, restaurants , and even ideas of things to do.  The Hyatt Place has earned my business and I will look for them in other places I go!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt, arrived early and while waiting on the room to be ready, we enjoyed the best apples. The hotel had several computers right off the lounge for visitors to use. The room was a little small for 6, but it worked. Enjoyed the view of the Empire State building in it's night time, lighted glory! Friendly employees, great continental breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
