review_body: We stayed last week and loved it. Four of us (2 adults & 2 teenagers) fit perfectly and didn't need to have two rooms. Very clean and comfortable. The staff was attentive and considerate (Rich was especially helpful when Obama's detail basically blocked our entire street and we couldn't really get out easily!). Very good locations for food, attractions and NYC life. We could see the Empire State Building out our window and what a wonderful view to have for a week.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is great. Right near subway stops and the Empire State Building. The staff was outstanding. From the moment we entered the lobby till we left, the staff was friendly and very accommodating. And the rooms were very clean! What else can you ask for with visiting NYC. Highly recommend this hotel when traveling to NYC either on business or family trip. When traveling with children, the hotel offers breakfast in the morning. What a great way to start the day in the city. Then

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in June 2014. We had a room on the 21st floor with a view of the Empire State Building. We are pretty heavy sleepers so didn't have trouble with noise (and we were fairly high up). I heard some faint street noise when I woke up a couple times - but fell right back to sleep. We were a little concerned about the elevator due to reading prior reviews but didn't have any problems. Maybe waited about 5 minutes one morning around breakfast time - otherwise no waits beyond a few minutes, if that. Room was clean and large by NYC standards - there was a small couch, desk with chair and small refrigerator besides the king bed and dresser. Breakfast had a good variety - some hot items as well as the normal cold items you would expect. Breakfast room was busy - if you have a family - it may be hard to sit together at certain times, however for 2 people - we could always squeeze in somewhere - even at the bar! There are some computers available in the lobby to use to print out boarding passes. The location is absolutely ideal - you can walk to the Times Square area, Macy's is right across the street and one of the busiest (several lines) Subway stations (34th street/Herald Square) is a block and a half away. (use the 35th street NE exit to be closest to the hotel). There are also some good places to eat right around the hotel including a great sandwich/pasta bar/salad bar place next door that is open until 11:30 pm. Will use this hotel again on our next trip to NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: $218 a night in the heart of NYC. Great room, great bath, friendly staff. Probably shouldn't even write this since everyone will want to stay here. The hotel is small--as most NYC hotels are--but the rooms don't feel small. Loved the blackout blinds. Great idea. Walk to everything. Great restaurant across the street--The Keg. Amazingly good food for a pub/bar. Oh and parking is just $35 a day, which isn't cheap but it's NYC cheap!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I recently stayede at this hotel. The rooms are new,very comftabl, extremely cleanand quit.The staff are super freindly and very helpul. in this opportunity I would like to say special thanks to Dula for giving us the best service - thank you so much.it is a great locaticon for stay in NYC will return Shalom Charles Cohen

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In early June, my daughter's Girl Scout Troop stayed here on a weekend "Get Away." Dana, Lauren, Dulce, Luis and Melissa were instrumental in making the stay unforgettable. They were extremely patient with us as we had pre-teen girls in our troop. The location is very convenient to everything in addition to the early morning breakfast, speedy elevators, clean rooms and hot showers. I would definitely staff here again. Thanks for the excellent customer service and living up to the great reviews. Looking forward to staying here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place while on business in June. The rooms are spacious and clean and entire staff is friendly and accommodating. From the moment we pulled up out front, Rich was eager to assist us with not only our luggage, but absolutely anything we needed from arrival to departure and all with such a warm, sincere smile. I would definitely recommend the Hyatt Place NY Midtown South!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very good and convenient hotel well located and the staff is very helpful too. I would recommend it highly for business visits and for families. Rooms are quiet and hotel is conveniently located in mid town NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A relative small hotel with great location for business Great service comfortable rooms Staff is very friendly and accommodating It was a bad snow storm out and One staffer ran to the corner of main ave to get me a cab so I would not have to trudge thru snow

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My daughter's Girl Scout troops and us moms stayed at The Hyatt Place South this past weekend, and it was the perfect stay! Dana Brown, Lauren, Dulce, Luis, and Melissa are the best staff ever! They took great care of us. The location is perfect as we walked everywhere we needed to go to from the hotel. This is definitely my new hotel sty spot in the city!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, for a long "girls weekend," to meet friends who live in NYC. The last time I was in NYC, I stayed at Eventi. The Hyatt Place was clean, modern and still fairly new. The staff at the front desk were super friendly and helpful. I made use of the gym in the mornings. The location was perfect for me, as I could easily walk to the big Macy's or go to my shows on Broadway. My only small negative, was the fact that I could hear more street noise in my room. I found that the soundproofing at Eventi was better. Possibly, choose a higher floor to reduce the noise level. My flight left VERY early in the morning. The bell hop was so kind that he walked with me and my luggage about a block, so that I could catch a cab, on one of the main streets. Great service and with the comp breakfast, it was worth the money. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff was very helpful. Breakfast bar was good and varied; although could have healthier food choices. Room was clean and very quiet. Hotel is in a great location of the city and is easily accessible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Definitely one of my favorite hotels to stay in when visiting New York. The location was fantastic and made traveling easy. If you want to take part in the breakfast provided, make sure to get there early. Seating is limited.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Only 2 lifts - insufficient for the number of guests. No service lift, so cleaning staff etc used them for work purposes. Children allowed to use the hotel computers without restriction, spending ages playing games when adults wanted to use them. Staff thought this was acceptable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: There wasn't a single thing I didn't enjoy about Hyatt Place. The location was Great (close enough to the madness of the city without being right in it), the room was just lovely (spacious, plush & clean, the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, the bathroom huge and impeccable wireless internet. Nothing but good things to say. I stayed here twice in a two week period & loved both stays. The staff were particularly friendly & helpful (especially Dana who remembered even my name when I came for my 2nd visit) Highly recommend a stay here whether your visiting for business or pleasure, family or couple or single :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is a great location. Easy access to subway @ Herald Square and of course Macy's!! Perfect for a shopping holiday with friends. Once I arrived at the airport, I realized that I didn't have my passport; thought I had left it on the couch. I called the hotel and Maria and staff looked all over my room for me. I was ready to jump in a cab and go back and Marie recommended they check first and that they would be able to send someone/cab with the passport to me. Fortunately, when I friend was digging in her purse to find her passport, she also had mine! My lucky day!! I waited on the line to let the staff know which was great because apparently, they were turning the room upside down for me. I can't believe how helpful the staff were. Would definately stay there again and I have been to New York five times and stayed in some really great hotels! This was one of them :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel has a great staff and great location in Midtown. We were at a wedding in Manhattan and the hotel location allowed us see the sights as well as be centrally located for all the wedding events. It's a Hyatt place, so the hotel was great if you didn't plan on staying at the hotel the whole time

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have been there for two nights. It was really pleasant !! The location is great.The staff were very helpful specially front office man (Dana). That guy was really Cheerful and made my stay very easy and happy. Breakfast was so cool and there was lots of varieties. Everything was great! Thanks all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Don't let the name Hyatt make you think this is one of there signature hotel. this is not, in fact it bears more of a resemblance to a Holiday Inn, but that said for the location and price I doubt you would do better. I have to say that whilst the lobby was of a more basic design the rooms were extremely well appointed, of a good size with a king size bed and comfy full size sofa , huge TV and very good in room movie and TV selection. The cleanliness was excellent, but the closet was ridiculously small , and if deigned better a nice comfy chair and bigger closet would have worked much better. My WiFi was excellent but my friend could only get it in his room if he were jammed up against the door, The Free breakfast ( unusual for NYC) is a bit of a bun fight , probably because they stop it at 9 am which is too early. The only other criticism, is that there are only two elevators, and it seems the staff have no service lift, so i waited up to 8 minutes to go from the 12th Floor to the lobby. I would definately go back as the location was first class and overall it is great value for money !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here 3 nights in May 2014. We arrived at 1.30 and were able to check in straight away which was great. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The room was a good size, had a full comfy Hyatt king bed, decent sized TV and reasonable sized bath room. Unlike some of the New York hotels you see on here, where they have chipped paint work, or have been decorated but you can see not very well, this Hyatt Place is new and clean and and the design is modern. Also, the bathroom had fairly good lighting, which can often be a bugbear of mine. The breakfast was fine, nothing special, but good enough considering it's included in the price. The breakfast room is not the biggest, so getting there earlier rather than later is advisable. We were on the 11th floor at the back and could just see the empire state building out of the window. We didn't have any traffic noise, but the dozens of airconditioning units outside are pretty noisy. Also what proved to be a bit noisy was our in-room fridge, although we had a rather large bottle of water in there. There are only 2 lifts in the building covering 26 floors (not even a service lift), so around breakfast time it can take a while for the lift to come. We walked down twice. Location-wise it's great - we walked as far north as 91st in upper east and as far south as Soho. It's very close to the Empire State, Macy's, Times Square, Madison Sq. Garden and NY Public Library/Bryant Park.In this price range, it is highly recommendable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt Place was awesome. We had a few bumps in the road (to be expected), but the staff of the hotel was very helpful and VERY accommodating. Anything I needed they were there to assist me. The room was very nice and clean. The breakfast in the mornings was delicious. One of the best breakfast choices I have seen at a hotel in a long time. I have no complaints about this hotel. Thank you, Hyatt, for your contribution in making our trip to NYC comfortable and enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had to rush to NYC for a last minute decision to attend a nearby conference. Hotel of choice was booked and my search ended up with nearby Hyatt Place. Upon arrival the hotel front and lobby were simple, but immediately was surprised at the professionalism and engagement of the lobby personnel which is on par with hotels that are 2x the cost.Room was comfortable, clean, updated bathroom. Very pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We just returned from a stay with our two daughters and had a wonderful time. I spoke with Samantha at check-in and explained that it was our girls' first time to New York and she gave us a room with a wonderful view of the city. It was amazing. She definitely added to our trip. The rooms were surprisingly quiet - I had great sleep. The breakfast was typical of hyatt house and there were no other amenities really. But the location was great, super close to subways and Midtown is a convenient place to be to see all parts of the city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I like the Hyatt Place product; I have stayed in several in different parts of the US. This Hyatt Place is new-built, less than 2 years old. Location is excellent for midtown South; close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's. But in my opinion, the downsides outweigh the upside of location.1. Only 2 elevators: I frequently waited over 5 minutes for an elevator to arrive. In the morning 'rush hour' the elevator that finally came was often full and I needed to wait even longer!2 The breakfast is sub-par compared to other Hyatt Place offerings. Except for cereal, the food was overcooked or had been left out too long and was soggy. 3. The WIFI was non-existent except on the ground floor. I had to use my own cellular WIFI to connect my devices.4. THE NOISE: Even though the windows are double-paned the noise from 36th Street was tremendous. I was on the 8th floor and pulled both drapes. I could hear lots of street traffic all night. I concluded that the building insulation must be non-existent.The staff is very nice and courteous, but they could do nothing to alleviate my concerns. I won't be coming back here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: They were so friendly and called me by my name. I loved how nice everyone was. Complimentary breakfasts are important for us and this one at the Hyatt was one of the best we have seen in a while. We were impressed. Even the apples were wrapped in plastic wrap and the bakery items tasted like they were just made. Yum!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Outstanding staff, Arturo and Eunice at the front desk were most kind, and extremely helpful. However, this hotel had issues which the staff can not directly control. Worn, faded linens, noise. Extremely small rooms, even for New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Enjoyed a great stay at this new (1.5 years old) Hyatt Place hotel. On 36th St between 5th and 6th Aves it is very convenient to the subway at 6th Ave, that runs on the east side of NYC, and Penn Station, which runs everywhere. The hotel is mere blocks from Empire State Bldg, Macy's, NY Public Library, Lord & Taylor, and Bryant Park. The king room was quite comfortable, breakfast each day was good, and hotel staff was courteous and helpful. Our only complaints, which are pretty minor, were the long wait for an elevator almost every time we left the hotel, and the very slow wi-fi. Will definitely stay at this property again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at Hyatt Place Hotels in other cities and have been very satisfied. Despite the fact that the room was small, as they usually are in NYC, the room was clean, modern, and comfortable. The staff was extremely gracious and eager to please. The location of the hotel was great and my wife and I were able to easily able to access the subway, hail a taxi, or walk to our desired destinations. The breakfast buffet was presentable, had a nice selection, and the hot food was hot and the cold items were cold. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and I would not hesitate to recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here 2 nights on a business trip. Loved the location as it is close to pretty much everything. Penn Station, Time square, Empire State Building, etc. Room was super clean and the bed was very comfy. Room rate was very reasonable, included free wi-fi and free breakfast. One thing about the breakfast is that it's simple (basic so don't expect too much but will get you going) but their coffee was great. They don't use Starbucks but a different brand. I really enjoyed the coffee.Staff was super friendly. I really enjoyed nice little chit chat. Recognized my Diamond status and thanked me for it (some Hyatt properties don't even mention your status). I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Here's a summary:Pros: friendly staff, clean room, comfy bed, a small couch in the room, coffee maker and a small fridge in the room. Reasonable rate (keep in mind that you are in NYC). Great location (walking distance to pretty much everything) Free wi-fi (very fast) and free breakfast (good coffee). A really nice bar across the street with a great selection of draft beers, they have over 50 diff beers on the draft. Korea Town is only a block away so if you like Korean food, this would be a perfect hotel.Cons: water pressure in bathroom was pretty low. OK for a shower but don't expect a massage. 2 or 3 trucks were honking at each other 3 in the morning which woke me up (not the hotel's fault) so ask for a room on higher floor.I'll definitely come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Thank you i really satisfied about my stay in NYC ….. Very good !!! 5 High star !!! I can recommend for my friends and colleague , very good for business and pleasure ! very good location , all near and walking distance , just lovely ……

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Everything in this hotel worked for me. I expecially liked the location which allowed us to easily walk to Empire State Bldg, Hell's Kitchen, Times Sq, and grey line bus. Staff was very nice and room was comfortable with very good shades on window. Breakfast was delicious.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I just want to say that although this place filled up fast and was quite busy during our stay, we had such exceptional housekeeping staff. I had lost my diamond and 24k gold nose ring which was a family heirloom. I left a message in the room for the housekeeping staff to look for it along with a description of it, in addition to letting the hotel lobby folks know. I left my number and prayed that they would find it and be honest about it. THEY WERE! A wonderful woman, the cleaning lady for the 15th floor, named Evelia, located my nose ring and called me and was even willing to send it out in the mail to return it to me. Thank You so much Evalia, God Bless you! Additionally, I commend Maria Suarez, who manages the housekeeping staff! What an excellent job, of keeping these women honest and full of integrity. Needless to say Maria was able to overnight me my jewelry back the very next day. I received the package today in a cute little blue box with a bow, and was thrilled to bits to have that piece of jewelry back on my person. Thank you so much to Maria, Evalia and the Hyatt Place, for hiring such quality employees. You guys a great and I will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff and Concierge were wonderful and friendly. Very helpful to have the flexibility in check in time. Storing our luggage so we could go to the 911 Memorial was wonderful as well. The breakfast Buffet was fabulous and a real help!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I cannot find anything to complain about regarding this hotel. Clean, new, modern, good location, decent price, free internet, free business center, free breakfast, good customer service. You should definitely give it a try.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have spent 4 nights in this hotel with the whole family and found it very good. Having stayed in 21st floor in the room facing Empire State Building we had beautiful view during the nights (well, if you ignore not so nice NYC rooftops).Some tips:1) staying on the high floor gives you nice views, but fetching an elevator in the morning can take you 5-10 minutes - sometimes it is easier to take the stairs.2) there is a parking garage available at the same street some 200ft from the hotel - hotel itself does not offer parking, so drop off your luggage and park your car there.3) breakfast room can get pretty crowded, so be there early. Getting there too late might result you want get everything...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very friendly staff. Clean, simple and modern. We where provides a handicap accessible room. I suppose it's a bigger room and that was a plus but the shower was in a weird position. The whole bathroom filled with water. However it's was a great all around experience. The breakfast is included in the rate and it's not the boring continental type of breakfast. They serve scrambled eggs or egg sandwiches, pancakes or french toast, fruits, assortment of breads an cereals, oatmeal and juices. They also have a pretty good coffee and tea. Breakfast gets crowded 1 hr before ending. Free wifi is offered and it has very good and strong signal. I consider the location of the hotel perfect. It's near shops at 34 St and of a subway station at 35 St. It's much less crowded than Times Square but very safe. Preferred it to shopping in Times Square. Only about two blocks from the Amtrak Penn Station.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel was oer $700 for a standard room. Small, noisy and not very comfortable. I had noisiy neighbors and to top it off, there was no hot water in the morning to take a shower. TO compensate Hyatt offered me bonus points in my account, but no discount at all. Very disappointed and I will not stay at the hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was definitely one of the best hotels regarding service; location and comfort we stayed in in a long time. The hotel is very convenient to Times Square; and all the shopping areas and subways one could need. Enough cannot be said about the staff (thanks Thomas; Raul; Luis; Tammy). The staff customer service and genuine caring for their guests could go up against any 5-star property, and would win. This Hyatt Place was far superior than some full-service hotels we've visited (including Hyatt). The room was spacious; super comfortable beds; and the elevators were fast - longest wait was about four minutes. Well-appointed room with a full-size sofa (and we had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building - thanks again Thomas/Luis). The hotel is kept very clean by a caring staff. This is a real gem located in the heart of Manhattan. The breakfast area was well appointed as well. The hotel is fantastic and the service outstanding. Will certainly return and highly recommend. You simply cannot go wrong with this fantastic property. There are also numerous great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location....Easy to get around the city from here. Nice size room especially for New York. Fridge was handy and free breakfast made it easy to get an early start during our short sight-seeing trip. Short walk to theaters and subway. Super comfortable bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: do you want to be waken up in the middle of the night for no reason and have to climb to the 22nd floor? If so. check in at Hyatt Place. No water, but noise instead. Bad Internet connection is a bonus. Not enough? How about the noise? You got it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great service, location, amenities and convenience. Highly recommended. Competitive price. Super comfortable. I have stayed in Hyatt Places before, so I had an idea what this would be like. It's now one of my favorite hospitality brands because they have taken the best design and technology of the higher end experiences and made it more affordable and workable. Bravo, again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel check-in staff could not get computer to work, had to move on to another check-in person. No answer on multiple calls to front desk and operator. Had no hot water so had to take cold shower in the morning. No notification from hotel staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is very nice. It's very well located, good shops/stores and subway stations around, no more than 10 minutes by foot to times square and excellent staff. I Didi many purchases by internet to be delivered at hotel and all of them were delivgered to me, even prior my arrival date.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My partner and I loved our stay at Hyatt Place New York Midtown South in March 2014. We booked online for 3 nights through Westjet Vacations as part of a package; no hassles and excellent value.Hyatt Place's location was perfect for what we wanted. Situated in the heart of midtown, we were able to walk to everything - Times Square, Empire State Building and many more. It's also very easy to catch a subway or taxi in this area too.We loved the consistently super-friendly service at Hyatt. Everytime we walked in the door it was like being welcomed back into our own home. Smiles always make people feel good and staff were very helpful; able to give us a map and directions when needed.The included breakfast was excellent value. It was a fantastic way to start each day with a great range of fresh food, coffee and newspapers - perfect to fuel up with before a long day. Super-friendly breakfast staff also helped get each morning off to a good start!We used the business centre multiple times and found it really modern, clean, efficient and didn't have to wait to use it. This would no doubt be excellent for business professionals staying at the Hyatt.Our room was bigger than I expected for New York standards and was always clean, receiving regular clean sheets and efficient room service. I hear the tap water in rooms is drinkable with nothing wrong, despite its cloudy consistency. We opted to buy bottled water during our stay though, which was easily purchased from one of the many nearby convenience stores. Our bed was incredibly comfy!Our room faced W36th Street and it took us a while to get accustomed to the street noise at night. It is New York though, so we expected this somewhat. The loud banging of nearby room doors did actually rattle our heads a little sometimes which was a bit unexpected. The waiting time to catch the elevators was a bit tedious as mentioned in other reviews. We didn't have a tight schedule opposed to business people, but I can imagine this annoying some.We would definitely recommend Hyatt Place Midtown South to anyone staying in New York. An excellent hotel with excellent service and only minor hiccups. I look forward to our next stay at Hyatt Place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Good solid hotel in mid-town. Price is good, but you can have the same experience in many other hotels. Nothing to write home about. Good service, okay fitness center. Rooms are VERY basic with standard equipment, and not very clean. The location is very good, close to Broadway, Penn station and many attractions. Actually, I walked to most places hardly using any public transportation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a a Platinum Hyatt Member, and this is my second visit to this hotel. The stay was good in general, but was so disappointed afterwards.When i left the hotel, at the airport, i discovered that i forgot my sweater & scarf in my hotel room. Called the hotel, the phone operator couldn't locate the person responsible (Maria was her name), and asked me to call again. I called in the morning, and the reception told me that she (Maria) did not arrive yet. Called again later, he said to leave my phone number and she'll call back. Called the day after complaining that she never called back, he promised he'll personally follow up with her.Of course, Maria did not respond despite my several phone calls for 3-4 days.Luckily enough, i was connecting via NY and i decided to drop by the hotel in person. The guys at the reception were sympathetic with me and tried contacting Maria on the radio. After waiting for 10 mins in the lobby, she responded back that she has no sweater or scarf in the lost & found registered under my room number and that she was busy in a meeting and couldn't see me!!For God's sake, some respect!... the polite guy on the reception (Thomas) respectfully apologised to me for this agonising encounter and promised me he'll have her call me when her meeting was over. Obviously, this did not happen till now.Regardless of where my belongings are, i have never witnessed such disrespectful behaviour of a Hyatt staff before. I'm very disappointed, but hopefully i'll get a response for this post. Else, i will need to escalate further...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I found the hotel to be grossly overpriced for sketchy accommodations. Is this really a Hyatt or a cheap impersonator? Apparently, my >$600/nite was a bargain because the guy behind me was quoted >$800/nite. But many much classier hotels centrally located in Manhattan at 1/2 the price. The Staff were very good but overall a ripoff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in April, celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. Knowing we wouldn't be spending much time in the room, we didn't want to pay a fortune. We chose this hotel based on the price, location, square footage (which was larger than other comparably priced hotels in the area.) Our room was very good-sized by New York standards, and it was set up efficiently. We had a (VERY comfortable) king bed, sofa, desk, large TV and huge window. The bathroom was nice but no counter space by the sink.... a lot of my toiletries ended up on the desk. Thomas at the front desk was very helpful, and when I told him we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, he offered us 2 free beverages and a room on a high floor for a better view (but it was still was not good - on the other side of the building, we could have seen the Empire State Building but we looked over buildings and water tanks!) The complimentary skillet breakfast and Starbucks coffee were a huge bonus. The housekeeping staff did a great job each day, and the front desk and bell staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. The only downside was that there are only 2 elevators, and during peak hours they were crowded and slow.But the best thing about this hotel is the location. It's close to several subway stops that will take you north or south; walking distance to Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Central Park. It's just off 5th Avenue, but we weren't bothered by any street noise during the night.Overall, this hotel is a great value - ideal for our needs. We recommended it to relatives who will be visiting the city later this month.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My daughter and I spent two nights at this great hotel. From the first minute we stepped in, we felt at home! Dana from the front desk was amazing. He personally made sure that we were settled in answered all of our questions. He gave us great recommendations for restaurants and things to do. The room was small, but standard for NYC. It was clean and fresh. The breakfast was nice, nothing over the top, but just what we needed to start our day. The location is great! You can walk to so many of the local attractions including Times Square, the Theater District, 5th Avenue Shopping, Empire State Building, the Subway, and Madison Square Garden. Everything was extremely clean and the beds were comfy. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I brought my two kids (12 & 15) to the city. The hotel is very clean. The staff is friendly. The room was spacious for the 3 people. The breakfast was great! I felt very safe here. Just around the corner is a subway station. When returning I'll stay here again. Great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here for business because I had a meeting in mid-town and also downtown. It was convenient for both. The room was good, staff nice, and the breakfast quite good and you can walk from Penn Station. It is close to shopping and lots of transportation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location of the hotel is very good. (very near Times Square, subway, Empire State Building, nice restaurants)The rooms are small (as usual in New York) we were with a family (6 persons at one room) and it was ok. The buffet in the morning is good but could be open a little bit longer. (it was open untill 9)Staff was friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice affordable place to stay. Noisy if you face the street. Low water pressure in the shower. Great location if you like all the touristy, Times Square stuff. Within walking distance of a lot of mainstay attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Would recommend this hotel, location great, friendly staff, room clean and quiet, and great breakfast to start your day! Provided good recommendations for restaurants within walking distance from hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place is an excellent location to stay if you are working in the city. There are restaurants close by, and the staff make you feel at home. The rooms are comfortable and quiet, and the morning breakfast buffet offers a wide choice of food. Overall a very good experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Value for the money was high, secured a promotional rate and was very satisfied with the hotel room's look - larger than the bigger hotels and very well kept. Front desk staff best I've ever encountered, had answers to all questions, always helpful. Breakfast was fine for a complimentary breakfast. Under a 10 minute walk to Time Square and just around the corner from Herald Square. Subways right around corner -easy to navigate - beautiful view of Empire State Building from some rooms - quiet at night!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Place on 36th and 5th for two nights. The place was conveniently located and extremely clean. My one issue, which is not a deal killer, is that there are only two elevators, including for housekeeping. The hotel appeared to be sold out and frequently there was a wait to get on the elevators. Other than that, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was decent and included.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice midprice hotel that looked fairly new. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was spotless, modern and had multiple, easily accessible outlets. They also had free wifi and wireless printing to the business center printers. The room was smaller than many American city rooms, but larger than most European rooms. In all the rooms, there was a nice sofa and large footstool/table for relaxing and eating, and a mini fridge. Breakfast was included and was ample. You could also take it back to your room. Location felt safe and was convenient to many small take out food places. Easy walk 2 block to the Herald Square subway connections.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A spiffy modern hotel with friendly helpful staff near both east and west villages. I did recommend to management some improvements in the lighting but overall I enjoyed my stay here verymuch. I think the hotel would be a good base to explore the NYC nekighborhoos south of midtown

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed in a 2Q+Sofa Bed room, with a view of the ESB. It was tight when the SB was pulled out, but otherwise perfect. The entire staff was VERY accomodating, nice and helpful. Perfect location for our visit, which was a long weekend vacation. We were able to walk to the subway and to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel has everything: great location, great prices and great facilities. The breakfast was really good (small hotel buffet) and the staff really friendly and efficient. Overall, this is my new New York hotel for all my stays.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As first time visitors to New York City, we were very satisfied with the Hyatt Place. Prime location, clean hotel, great hot breakfast. Transportation to the airport was arranged in a few minutes. Staff was friendly and hardworking.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My daughter left an expensive item in the room, housekeeping returned it to me. the staff was super friendly and helpful. This Hotel's location is perfect for city exploring on foot and by subway. Breakfast was way above standard free hotel breakfasts. Starbucks in lobby very convenient for caffeine fix!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was perfect for us. Traveling with a total of 3 and the room was plenty spacious and very clean. The staff was very friendly on all shifts. The location was close to Times Square and very close to Macy's. We saw a show so it was a perfect spot

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is fairly new and in a great location for our needs. Close to Times Square and Theater District. Rooms are clean but on the small side, however the size of the rooms are standard for NYC. Don't let my last comment deter you. Staff was great and helpful. I appreciated Raul's help at the front desk with some transportation issues. Nice guy and very willing to help. The value you get 8th hard to beat plus it includes a decent breakfast to get you going in the morning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is not far away from the Madison square garden. the entrance is lovely & also the lobby. there are free (but very slow) online computers in the lobby. Clean & colorful entrance & front desk. The staff is helpful & nice. my room was on the 17th floor.The view is to the street & the buildings across the street = meaning there is no view. The glass window was dirty.There is a horrible noise from the construction site down the street!!!! horrible drilling noise & the window is not sound proof. Terrible in the morning hours if you want to sleep late.The room seemed to be very clean, nice & neat. There was a sofa, desk & big cable TV. Clean bathroom. The breakfast was complimentary included & we went 30 min before closing time. They couldn't handle the amount of guests (providing clean silverware fast enough) & there was a long line to the food all the way to the lobby,They have a room to lock your luggage after you check out & before you check in which is great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is better than most that I have stayed at in NYC. It's probably due to the fact that it's newer and run by a chain that I trust. The staff also seemed friendly. Only negative was the elevator and that the room next door was smoking (though not allowed) and I woke up at 2am with smoke coming in my room - couldn't stand it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well midtown location is great, close to many places, I know to find a big room in NY is hard but this hotel sells they can accommodate 6 people in a room... Well photos in site and expedia shows they can, reality is different... My room was awful, clean but not enough room not even for four and they offered for six? Was not a suite but a normal room with a sofa almost above the other beds... Breakfast with no variety, no options, always the same. Elevator crowded and housekeeping service not efficient, they never made the sofa! Mmm mixed feelings about this hotel because service is slow but good)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel, excellent location. Amazing staff especially Raoul, literally from the minute we walked in to the one we left he was like our personal city guide explaining the best routes, places etc, extremely helpful! He was a pleasant introduction to nyc hospitality. Minor quibbles could be elevator call times as most city hotels and the mini fridge made buzzing noises the first night since we had no use for it we just unplugged it. Free breakfast and wifi, great location a couple mins walk from Macy's herald square and metro stations, plentiful food and grocery places nearby. Hotel can org cab for leaving to JFK. Overall good bang for the bucks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Rooms nice and spacious for NYC ( some overlook Empire State ). Very central. Lobby cramped. Breakfast good. Free Wi fi. good overall deal for NYC.Good for families and tourists and ok for business too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Although this is not a luxury hotel, they made you feel like a queen. The staff could not be more friendly or helpful no matter what was requested of them. I must say this was the most pleasant hotel stay that I have had in quite some time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved this hotel. Within walking distance to Penn Station, Times Square, Macys etc. Free breakfast and many of the rooms sleep five people. The rooms are big for New York standards. Great for families!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our great experience at the Hyatt place started with Dulce who checked us in. She graciously told us that while our room was ready, if we wanted to wait we could have a room with a nicer view of the empire state building. She was fabulous! The room was very nice and comfortable, though neither of us were happy with the pillows, but that is really nit-picking. As others have said this is an excellent location, with many attractions within easy walking distance and the subways are close. It was just about half the price of what I was going to pay at the Marriott. And Discount parking- 35.00 a night to park (24 hours) is cheap in NYC. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here a couple times for business. You really can't argue with the location; though the street it's on isn't the swankiest place I've ever set foot, you can get virtually anywhere in Manhattan in 15-20 minutes as the hotel is conveniently a three-minute walk to Herald Square station, where several subway lines intersect. Rooms are very serviceable, and borderline "nice"; they feel new and clean, and have nice couches for lounging. They're equipped with fridges, which is a huge plus. I understand the higher floors have nice views; I was on 9 so was looking across the street into an office building. I didn't find the street too noisy, unless someone got out of a cab and then the horns would start blaring (welcome to New York). Also, I got a Wall Street Journal delivered to my room each morning, which was a nice touch. Internet was a bit slow, but free. Breakfast was very good, with hot sandwiches, cottage cheese, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal etc. And the breakfast staff work really hard to keep the place clean and stocked, which I appreciated.Front desk service is a bit raw: this is where you remember that no, this ain't the Plaza, it's the Place. Somewhat unpoised staff are expected at a limited-service hotel; it just hurts when you're paying $350 a night to have to try as hard as I did to get a smile out of anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location is perfect - close to the subway and walking distance to Times Square, Empire State, etc. It is so nice to return to a quiet hotel at the end of a busy, noisy day. The room was very clean & perfectly quiet, and the staff were friendly. Will definitely stay here again, for a girls' trip or with family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel suited us perfectly - great location - walkable or easy access to subway. Rooms were a bit smaller than expected but we were only returning at the end of each day to sleep. Breakfast buffet was very busy but turnaround was quite quick - food was adequate for free buffet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is well located, staff are very friendly and helpful and the facilities are well kept. The room was more spacious than I expected. Lower floors are a bit noisy if that is an issue for you. All in all I was very pleased.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Conveniently located to transportation and shopping (Macy's just 2 short blocks away). Good value, terrific staff. Be aware that hotel is very busy, only 2 agents at desk, prepare to wait to check-in/out and for elevators ( only 2 serving 24 floors of rooms).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Clean, good value and a nice location just off of Herald Square. Walk to transit and close to Time Square without the tourist crush. Only downside is that with no freight elevator, the cleaning staff doing their logistics can make a long elevator wait. Had multiple 10 minute waits in 2 days we were there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were very satisfied with our recent experience at the Hyatt Midtown. IT was conveniently located and the hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The assortment for breakfast was exceptional. The room was spacious for New York and with black-out shades, sleeping was exceptionally quiet. Quality of coffee and tea service made this a wonderful respite in New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: great locations, nice clean rooms, terrific view from higher floors. perfect midtown location with everything within walking distance. one of the better midtown hotels we have stayed in. the breakfast is also good and simple and sufficient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: this is a nice, clean, modern hotel just built abt 2 yrs ago. the location is fabulous--near buses, subways, Macy's, times sq, Broadway, and terrific restos and shops. the staff here is so friendly and helpful. the manager is a doll. everyone is concerned abt the comfort of your stay and your satisfaction. surprisingly quiet also even though right in the middle of midtown. everyone remembers you and is cheery and friendly. anything that needs to be fixed or done is done expeditiously by Luciano. Lorianne, the manager is terrific and helpful and Rich, the bellman, is wonderful and helpful. computers and printer readily available in lobby. breakfast is ok but ends early. the one complaint i have is the TV--flat screen and large but the cable was always going in and out and i rarely saw a whole program w/o the signal stopping. really a pain. they should address that ASAP. i would definitely stay here again and will in October when i return to my hometown. i love NY and New Yorkers and they get such a bad rap that they do not deserve.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Although there are not a lot of bells and whistles like a full service hotel; this hotel has everything you need!! The decor of the room was pleasing along with the staff. The size of the rooms are typical New York size. I would definitely reccomend for business and pleasure!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Hotel was a lovely clean Hotel, good location. Beds were very comfy, the only negative comment I have to make was the noise from out side, sirens and refuse collectors. Food was good, could of done to be a bit different each morning. Staff were very knowledgeable and Helpful. Wifi was brilliant through out the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After several weeks of traveling from the UK to the states, my final destination was New York City I am glad I had choose this hotel. This has been my first time staying at a Hyatt and absolutely loved it. The king size bed were very comfy and room very clean, decent size room for new york city, I stayed in room 2302 , I believe the person that cleaned my room left a nice note with her/his name which I could not remember. For breakfast it seems as if it gets really busy right after 9am as my coworker and I then planned to wake up earlier to avoid the crowd of persons. The staff at the reception were always in a good mood every time when I would leave and arrive back to the hotel in which I very much appreciated. Upon my departure there was one gentleman in which I did not get his name, tall handsome Persian young man that was changing currency, maybe the manager but he was so pleasant in assisting other guests in the lobby that was waiting and offered to assist me with my bags. Overall great staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After traveling around Chicago, Boston, and Washington, we traveled to New York and spent 7 nights in the City that never sleeps. The first two nights were at the "Hilton Garden Inn New York - Chelsea" hotel, and the last five were at the "Hyatt Place New York Midtown South". My partner and I loved our stay at Hyatt Place.Location is great (Macy's is just around the corner, as well as many other great places to visit, shop and eat). Service is perfect! From the very first moment, they've all made us feel we were at home (specially one lady who wears glasses and works in the evenings). Every time I went downstairs to ask for a cup, fork or knife, they answered back very nicely.We were given a well-sized room on floor #14. The view was lovely, we could clearly see the Empire State Building.I loved the breakfast they serve. The only bad thing is that in ends at 9 AM, so we had to get up earlier than expected; anyway, it was so tasty and so varied that we didn't hesitate much when the alarm went on. I would definitely stay again at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our check in went fine. Nice person. The room was on the 23rd floor and was a nice room. Small but compact and neat. The shade got stuck and could not get fixed. The room had a little refrig and even had a couch. The bed was a little hard. Bathrrom was nice with large shower and was clean. When we left to go to a restaurant and show, we asked where to catch a cab, since it was raining.. They suggested to go to the nearest avenue. They did not offer to call or get a cab. The breakfast was good but was crowded. There was scrambled egg, sausage, pancakes and the usual other thing. Some things ran out before they could replace them. I called to ask how to check out and they said the only alternative was to come to the desk. No over the phone or tv type checkout.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: It was a nice hotel in the perfect location, the staff was friendly and our room was just right for us, clean. Will definitely go back with the right pricing and recommend it as a great location for shopping and site seeing NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were only guests of the hotel for one night and they managed to make a huge impression in a very short period of time. From the moment we checked in we were greeted by the über friendly front desk staff and bellman. Upon hearing that we were celebrating my son's 13th birthday that day the front desk clerk (Lauren, I think! I'm sorry if that's wrong!) presented him with cupcakes! We had a lovely room with such a great view of the Empire State Building that we never closed the shade so we could enjoy it for the one night we were in NYC! Although the room was not huge (it is manhattan after all...I expected that) it was very nicely decorated and the location was perfect for us I really have to commend the amazing staff at the hotel which made our stay so memorable. A great choice!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place for one night on a recent business trip. The hotel was conveniently located not far from Penn Station and close to the Empire State Building and Bryant Park. The room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. The decor was updated and stylish. This hotel serves breakfast with your room stay and it was a very nice spread of foods, with hot and cold options, fruit, and cereals. Coffee, tea, and drinks were available throughout the day. This was a nice value and not an amenity that you find at many Manhattan hotels. The staff were extra helpful and friendly, from the front desk, to the bell hop, to the woman working the breakfast area (who brought out some almonds for my oatmeal) when I asked. What made this hotel extra special for me was actually what happened after I left. I accidentally left a very special book behind in my room when I checked out. It has great sentimental value for me and I was heart broken when I got home and noticed it was missing. I spoke with Maria Suarez at the hotel and she was a real darling. She checked the lost and found immediately for me and thankfully they had my book! Maria handled my request expeditiously and FedExed my book to my home address. This degree of care and concern was noteworthy at this hotel and I would highly recommend it to all travelers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed in NY many a time, and hotel fairs pretty well. For the price, I was pleased. The breakfast each a.m. (included) was great albeit, the eggs were the kind from a carton and the buffet was not always fresh and hot. The staff was friendly (Lauren was super nice!) and the room size for NY standards was decent. We stayed on the 18th floor and had a pretty nice view of the New York sky-line. The bed was not as comfortable as I might have liked, but certainly seemed clean and I am a clean freak. Bathroom and shower was great! Lots of water pressure and hot water. The fridge was great for sodas etc. The street was still pretty loud with nearby bars (not bad if you are up for partying) and the location pretty convenient to most everything including some great shopping at Macy's! Again, don't look for peace and quite at this location - construction, honking horns, and again people on the street where fairly loud even though we were on the 18th floor- but that is typical of NY city. Lobby and lobby bathroom were not clean- perhaps my biggest complaint but how much would you really be in those locations anyway?! So all in all, not a bad choice for the price. I read reviews like crazy because don't forget, the consumer is king!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Very nice room, excellent service very good value AARP discount was very good. I would recommend this hotel without reservation very good location the breakfast was very good staff very friendly. Room design and bed was very comfortable. Great views from 24th floor It made the trip memorable

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: From the moment we entered everyone was polite and helpful. They gave us a subway map and explained the exact route to get to the Museum of Natural History. Everyone always greeted us when coming and going. The breakfast was fantastic, loved the southwestern eggs and fresh fruit. One night it was raining and we found a great restaurant right across the street(The Keg Room) The subway was so close it made everything so easy, plus time square was an easy walk. The hotel was clean and shower was nice and roomy with nice pressure.The number one reason I am writing a 5 star review was that I let my guard down and left a drawer full of my belongings in the hotel. I didn't realize it until we were halfway home. It included my nintendo 3DS and a $150 pair of White House Black Market shoes. All of my friends told me I would never see my stuff again, but they were wrong. I called and spoke with Maria Suarez the manager in charge of housekeeping. She was wonderful!!! She found my items and called me right away. I sent her my credit card information, but when I checked my statement they did not bill me. All my items arrived safe and sound. My things could have easily been taken, but they were so honest and helpful. I was a mess when I thought I lost everything, but Maria stayed calmed and listened every time I called and added another item that was left in that drawer. We would definitely stay here next time visiting New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great Location, have now stayed here twice and both time it has been exceptional. very clean rooms, though some noise from slamming doors does come into the rooms, which is too bad otherwise really great. busy on weekends but great value for the money spent and great location, right around the corner from Herald Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Place hotel on West 36th Street in New York City. It was a great experience. The room was big for a manhattan hotel room, the staff was exceptionally friendly and the breakfast that was included with the room was convenient. I will definitely go back there with my family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I were here for 7 nights. The room was well set up and comfortable. We had a great view looking south to the Empire State Building. Staff were consistently helpful and pleasant. Breakfasts were an added bonus and started our days well.We used the subway to get around and one line had an entrance 2 blocks away. The area around the hotel had a variety of restaurants to choose from and there was a drug store nearby. We are not shoppers, nor were we interested in the theaters on Broadway, but if you are it is conveniently located.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of midtown Manhattan, amazing customer services from staff member, very clean rooms in general. We are very happy to stay there and looking forward to coming back in the near future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Midtown New York City is a hotel that I would definitely return . The staff was very helpful, professional and friendly. We were a party of 5 ranging in age from 17 to 88, needless to say interests were diverse! The bonus was the parking garage that was less than a block away .

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Loved the room, it was clean and comfortable. Loved the staff, couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful. We were in LOVE with the location. And the breakfast was perfect. So I HATE to put this out there but there is a new hotel being built right next door and I'm quite sure they are working on it 24/7! I'm NOT KIDDING.. We were in 1006 and we Literally didn't sleep for 3 days!! My daughter and I kept checking (at like 4am -mind you) to see if our windows were open somewhere.. It was AWFUL! So disappointing...I know that Hyatt has nothing to do with the hotel being built next door but maybe there are certain rooms that they just should not book right no while this is going on!?

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place was fresh, bright and new. Location near subways and sights was excellent. The staff was friendly, prompt and accomodating with all requests. Breakfast buffet was a huge plus. Will definitely recommend and would stay there again. Rooms not large but we had room for 2 adults/2 kids in a king with sofabed (king seemed smallish)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hotel is located in the center of Manhattan. Easy to get anywhere in the city. Rooms are not very huge though very comfortable and clean. Housekeeping was excellent! A porter boy - Raul – was helpful and did his best with some recommendations and directions in town. In general stuff is friendly. Nice breakfast, good variety of meals. Some rooms have an Empire State Building view. It is really fascinating. There are only 2 elevators in the hotel (for 26 floors) so in the morning going up and down will take some time but it was not such a big deal. One of the best steakhouses in NY are 2 buildings to the left from the hotel, good Irish pub is just in front of the hotel. Don’t expect any luxury. It is a good deal is you travel on business or stay for few days.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had the best room on the 25th floor, overlooking the city and the empire State building. Room was spotless and in great condition. Employees, esp. Raoul and Thomas, were extremely helpful and friendly. We were in a good location for walking and bus and the best breakfast ever. Highly recommend this Hyatt and didn't break the bank either.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for Oscar night. First time to New York. Walking distance to all the Midtown Manhattan spots... Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Grand Central, etc. Top floor room at a great price. We will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here on March 9 & 10 and had a wonderful experience. The only complaint I have is with the car service that was called by one of the employees to take us to the airport. We left our baggage at the hotel since we had a flight later in the day and the gentleman that took our luggage ask how we were getting to the airport. When we told him we were taking a taxi, he said "Oh no, let me call you a car service, you'll be much more comfortable and it's not that much more expensive." He told us the car would be no more than $50 to LGA. We had paid $35 for the taxi when we arrived from the airport so we figured for $15 more, why not go ahead and get the car. When we arrived at the airport, the driver told us it would be $60. When we questioned why we were quoted no more that $50, he said that it was because he had gone through the tunnel and paid a toll. The taxi also went through the tunnel and charged us a toll. I felt this was very shady. I don't know if the Hyatt employee is aware that the driver he called is doing this, but if he is, he should be made to get an honest quote to guest before he encourages them to let him call them a car service. Other than this, our stay was very enjoyable and I found the staff, location, rooms, and comfort of beds to be perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Place for 12 nights with my boyfriend in march. We had a great stay, no problems at all. The room were spacious enough, we had a great view towards EST and the room is actually really quiet if you don't open the window ;) Breakfast was ok, I would prefer more cheese, sausage etc to put on bread. Might be an european thing, I'm seldom in the mood for jam and toast in the morning. And the signature roll gets boring after so many mornings. I digress, our stay was indeed great. The hotel is located in the middle of everything, with great shopping and walking distance to almost everything else.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Midtown South on March 7th and 8th, 2014. Overall a great hotel to stay at. The hotel is only a year old so it is in great condition. The rooms and bathrooms are on the small side but look good and are very clean. The breakfast is amazing! I suggest you get there early as the dining area gets crowded around 9:00am. The staff was very polite and helpful. I recommend you get a room on the higher floors facing the Empire State Building in order to have a better view.The hotel is in a great location. a block away from Macy's and about a 10-15 minute walk to the theatre district and times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel was fabulous! Dulce, Raul, Dana and Adela were great! They made us feel like we were part of their families from the moment we got out of our cab. One room had a view of the city and the other had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was quiet which is impressive for Manhattan. The hotel is close to the subway which took us just about everywhere we wanted to go. It was important to my stepfather that our hotel have free wifi and free breakfast. We got both for an amazing AAA special. The breakfast was very tasty and had a large seating area. Beds were comfy and room was spacious enough for the child and I.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My friend and I stayed at the Hyatt Place at 52 West 36th Street this past weekend. We were in NYC for a girls weekend including a Chelsea Handler concert at Madison Square Garden. From the moment I pulled up, I felt well cared for. Raul greeted me, took my luggage and directed me to the parking garage just 8 buildings up on the same block. If you've stayed at at Hyatt Place, this location is sure to please. Good neighborhood, lots of restaurants and bars. Safe and convenient. I highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Well what else can I say but fake fake fake. I was on business. As soon as I hit the lobby I was greatted by bell manHe grab my bag and gave me a card talking about if I could give a review and if I needed a cab to airport. I just wanted to check in. I ask for a card and they gave me one when I called and ask for Katie they said she didn't work here and hung up. To top it off that night I tried to order food that night and the front desk agent Luis told me the kitchen was closed. I went down to get directed to some food and his breathe smelled like liqour.I was checked in by thomass who greated me and Explained to me that my room was not ready yetHe told me he could check my bags. Raul came back to check my bags and I swear he came back whith his hand out. Like really. As soon as I left I over heard the staff laughing and making fun of my stuttering. Fake fake fake.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is 1 year old, but still looks and feels as if it opened yesterday. The room was spotless and comfortable, with an amazing view of the Empire State Building filling our window. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was tasty (and free).The room is extremely quiet despite being in the heart of it all, a close walk to the subway at Herald Square. The shades block out all the sun early in the morning, and the room a/c has a nice, mostly quiet white noise sound. Not a super huge room, but for Midtown it's a decent size. Parking at the nearby lot is easy and a decent deal for the area.The two queen beds with pull-out sofa bed room is perfect for families. We'll definitely be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I recently stayed at this Hyatt Place for a business trip and it was great! I usually stay at Hyatt properties, as I believe they have a fantastic loyalty rewards program with the Hyatt Gold Passport. The location of this property was great--right in the heart of Midtown!Although the internet was a bit slow, I checked with the front desk and they were ever so helpful and had someone check it out right away. The breakfast in the morning was a great feature too.The service was outstanding. I'd like to give props to Raul, who was super friendly and helpful during my stay. He helped with my luggage, along with hail cabs when I needed them. Overall, the staff was great and it really helps to stay at a place that you know you'll be taken care of.I'll be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Kevin at front desk was so helpful when I arrived and throughout the entire stay. He was my favorite front desk helper and the most professional. Needed dirctions andDulce was very rushed to tell me directions and didn't feel like I got best directions other than handing me map. Sunday day the doorman in black suit and red tie was texting and not helping people with suitcases in front struggling. He was also in the breakfast area texting away throughout the morning. This is unprofessional. Mr. Khan, kitechn manager - Goes Extra Mile for customers and truly understands customer service. He was always helpful and smiling and very hospitable. Hotel is in good area and can walk to Macy's and other stores nearby. No taxi's drive down this street but you can walk block or two to get taxi's. The front desk coordinated driver to airport which was nice when we left. I liked the breakfast options. Nice place and I will come again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I arrived a few hours before check-in after walking a short distance from Penn Station. I was able to get into my room early with no problem at all. The staff was helpful and courteous throughout my stay. The room was small (which I liked) and the layout and furniture were perfect for the space. I arrived at breakfast right at 10 and the selection was still good and hot. I would stay here again without question.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here in February. Staff was really nice. Especially Michelle and Raul who went out of their way to help us. Wifi is great, which is rare in NYC. Rooms are decent size. No real downside discovered. Style is not exactly my taste but that is the euro vs US thing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time! It was a perfect location in midtown. Rooms are very clean. Hot breakfast was always busy but a great start to the day! Staff was great! Front desk was helpful, in particular Raul. He gave us directions for the subway, helped with luggage, and always asked about our day. He is definitely a key to success at the hyatt place! The whole staff was very friendly and ensured that we were enjoying our time in NYC. we will be returning there again soon!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location was great. HOTEL Rooms nicely decorated..we stayed at 23rd floor, and had a nice city view..breakfast was wonderful to start the day..5 min walking distance to bryntpark 10 min to times square and broadway..there are very nice pub and restaurants just next to the hotel..starbucks was around the corder..2 min walking distance to macys..

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past year. Every time I stay I am treated royally by the staff. This week it was Dolce for check in and Raul with bags and car service. They really seem to care that my stay and experience is exceptional. The location is perfect with the subway right around the corner, Macy's 1 block away, many places to eat. I will continue to book my stays at this hotel. Thank you Hyatt Place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff is great at this hotel. From check-in with Dolce, to help with bags and car service with Raul, service was excellent. They seem to really care about making things easy for their guests. I will continue to make this my home away from home when working in Manhattan. Thank you Hyatt Place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just came home yesterday after spending five nights at Hyatt Place. It was an incredible hotel experience for New York. The room was extremely clean, new, and quiet. We arrived too late to receive a picturesque view but the view we received on the 9th floor was an iconic NY building and street view just the same. If you don't want to be surrounded by old buildings, then don't go to NY! Loved the breakfast every morning and the cafe up the street towards 5th Ave. This hotel is perfect for shopping. Walked to everywhere: Times Square/Broadway and Madison Square Garden included. Felt safe and secure the entire time we were there. Hotel staff is fantastic, especially Raul the bellman in the lobby. My only complaint is one that I regularly have with most hotels: Do-it-yourself laundry facilities would be appreciated. Will stay there again (and again and again).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for three nights in February to attend the Westminster Dog Show and had a really positive experience for a really good value. As a Hyatt Gold Passport member (basic level), we got two complimentary drink vouchers upon check-in for coffee, soda, beer, wine, whatever, which was unexpected but appreciated. There are only two elevators, but they were quite fast and we didn't experience any long waits. Our room on the 12th floor was clean and quiet and included a small refrigerator, and the wifi connection was good. (I agree with a previous reviewer that the ambient lighting leaves a little to be desired, but it's nothing that should deter you from staying here.) Breakfast was ample and decent--traditional buffet-style stuff like cereal, oatmeal, toast, fruit, small pastries--and every staff person we encountered was friendly and professional. Parking is available at a garage just up the street, and you can get your ticket validated at the hotel for a reduced rate, which we thought was reasonable at $35/day. The hotel is within a few blocks of Macy's and Madison Square Garden, and Keen's Chophouse a few doors down from the hotel is excellent, though pricey. Highly recommend and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I'm a Hyatt Gold Passport Diamond members and I have stayed in MANY Hyatt hotels in the past. Hyatt Place hotels are identical in almost every area except the intangible Staff Services. Hyatt Place New York Midtown South excels in Staff Services and special call out to Raul and Dulce. In addition to the expected giving their utmost prompt professional services to my family, they did it with a wonderful SMILE on their face at all times !! They took little initiatives such as go out in the cold weather to help us call a cab, offer to safe keep our bags in hotel while we go out cruising, which we really appreciated it to make our stays at the hotel a very pleasant experience. If you ask me if there is any low about this hotel, I will say that when we were in a room on the 16th floor, it took 15 minutes of running tap before we could get a hot shower. Strangely, we didn't face this issue when we were in a room on the 25th floor.Kudos to Hyatt Place New York Midtown South Staff Members !! You are the Differentiators !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location! Walking distance to train stations, Empire State Building, Broadway, and Time Square! Staff was friendly and efficient! Raul and Lauren were very welcoming and helpful. Breakfast staff kept dining area nice and tidy. Food and beverage were replenished promptly. Complimentary internet and breakfast was a plus! Room was clean and we had an awesome view of the Empire State Building. We stayed in a double room. I thought the space was comfy and not too small. This hotel has all the basic necessities a traveler needs! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My most favorite part of this property was the staff! Katie, Raul, and Dulce, each of whom I spoke with at one time or another was upbeat and VERY friendly. They really care about your happiness. The room was very spacious for NYC standards with an AMAZINGLY comfy bed, but was lit entirely by horribly colored compact fluorescent bulbs--so everything looked dull, green and washed out (I know they are efficient, but these were especially ugly). It was handy to have a refrigerator. With only 2 elevators for this very tall property, you can wait up to 15 minutes during busy times (morning breakfast rush). Otherwise, the facility is modern and attractive, breakfast area is quite large and comfortable and offers many choices including healthy and fruit options (FOR FREE!!). The only problem I had was with their "satellite" TV--most local channels were out (and many others) and if you found a working channel, it would often freeze. An engineer attempted to "fix" mine, but to no avail--with such a HUGE, gorgeous TV, it was sad that I barely could watch it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel. Good location. Staff very friendly. Hotel room larger than usual in NYC. Their room with a view had a view. Bed was comfortable and it was quiet. Breakfast was great. Price was very very reasonable. Would highly recommend hotel to anyone for any reason they are in NYC,.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, near subway, Grand Central Station, Macy's, good restaurants. Very friendly and helpful staff. There is a breakfast Buffett included that was pretty good, lots of choice. Nice clean rooms. Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In addition to this being a spacious, clean, modern and affordable place in NYC, they took great care of me. I left my bag for for the day at the bellstand while I attended meetings and then forgot to pick it up before I left town again.Luis Martinez was a huge help and even with phone problems, he found a way to contact me to make sure he had the right information to ship my bag back to me. Even sent me the tracking number for fed ex by email. THANK YOU LUIS! I will stay here with my colleagues every time in NYC now.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
