review_body: Long time Trip advisor reviewer here. I don't give five stars lightly, but I just stayed at this gem of a hotel a block or two away from Macy's, midtown NYC. Not luxurious, but just NICE! Lauren, Vanessa, and especially Raj/Rog made my stay EXTRAORDINARY. The king size room was clean, the breakfast was fresh (and huge), the internet was free, the staff was wonderful and RESPONSIVE, and what an awesome rate for Hyatt Gold members. I will definitely visit again. Just don't change a thing about this place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Three teens (2 are small adults really) plus my husband and myself were comfortable in a Hyatt Place deluxe room. The rate was about $200 higher than what I would normally pay but we saved at least half that thanks to the included breakfast. The room was above average but not luxurious.The location is ideal, the staff friendly and view from our room was outstanding - Empire State Building during the holidays.Disclosure: I publish TravelingMom.com and this room was provided to me to review. I hope you find it candid and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location on 36th Ave. between 5th and 6th is ideal with an MTA station a couple of blocks away. It can be a bit difficult to hail a cab quickly in front of the hotel. The hotel is very clean, the staff competent (but certainly not overly friendly) and the rooms a decent size for Manhattan. The internet worked well. Basic cable essentially, no DirecTV selection of multiple channels. I wanted to watch the Daily Show but no Comedy Central in the package. A small quibble, I know. The only significant problem I had here is that most of the time during my six days here the water from the sink faucet was a milky color. The engineer couldn't solve it and brought a couple of bottles of mineral water. The front desk was made aware of the problem and offered to change rooms but I didn't want to repack and unpack. They should have restocked my room with bottled water every day but did not. When I checked out and told the front desk they shouldn't book anyone else in the room (1808) until the water problem is fixed the clerk said she wasn't aware there was a problem but rang the engineer immediately. So there's certainly a lack of coordination, especially for a guest with a significant number of Hyatt stays (OK, I'm platinum but not diamond level). Even though I was on a high floor, I could hear people yelling on the street from time to time. But midtown Manhattan is not Big Sur. All that said, I would probably not object to staying here again. If you get a competitive rate it's probably one of the best hotel bargains in New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My apartment was having some work done to it, so I moved down the street to this hotel for a few days and was very impressed with how clean it was for being so cheap. Paying 140 dollars in manhattan for a decent room like the one I had is unheard of. I am very picky when it comes to hotels, so trust me when I say it's great- especially for the cheap rate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is one of the newer hotels in Manhattan and is in a very busy location just outside Herald Square. But near Macy's and the subway helps as well. But the staff was wonderful - every time you walked into the hotel or off of the elevator, the lobby team was always welcoming you and asking about your day. That makes all the difference in my mind. I will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: What a great little hotel! I've never stayed in a Hyatt Place, but this was a fantastic first experience. We found a cheap rate via Hyatt's Best Rate Guarantee program for a Friday on a holiday weekend and were consistently impressed. Very friendly staff at check-in in an inviting and cozy lobby.The room was fantastic, very clean and nicely decorated. The designers made good use of the smaller spaces in this building and makes it feel more roomy. The amenities of the room were great, from the fridge to the specific TV ports to connect your own electronics. Very convenient!Our complimentary breakfast was also a nice perk, with a great spread of dishes to chose from, all pretty delicious. It was great to finish breakfast then walk right outside to Herald Square. The hotel's location was swell, close to major attractions and all major subway lines. It's right off the main avenue too, so it's not particularly loud.We encountered no issues at this wonderful little hotel and would recommend it across the boards!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here the last two time we visited the city I doubt we will ever stay anywhere else. The staff here went above and beyond what we have experienced in the past. Breakfast was good never waited in a long line rooms very clean and comfortable. The location was only blocks away from Penn station and never had a problem getting a cab. Really enjoyed our stay here highly recomend it,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed in this location when it first opened and I will say it is greatly improved across the board, especially the service. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The rooms are on the small side but adequate and nicely appointed. I lacked for nothing. Our room had two double beds, a flat screen TV and a mini fridge. We were there for business and pleasure. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was free and area was clean. The staff was very attentive at breakfast and kept things clean. We stayed for three nights and had consistent service. The location is excellent. We were close to the train, shopping, and Time Square. Housekeeping was very accommodating when I needed them to come back at a different time. There is a bar area and and ordering of meals available. I didn't use this service. You can also purchase snacks and drinks in the lobby. There is also a great place next door to get food too. There is a work out room which is adequate. It didn't have a TV but the machines were nice and it was clean and secure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here over a weekend(1/17-1/19/2014) for the first time. I like Hyatts but had never stayed at a Hyatt Place. The front desk staff was pleasant and check-in went quickly. I asked for a room on a high floor and was given one on 17. It was quiet and larger than I anticipated. There was room for a bed, couch, ottoman, desk and chair and drawers. The bathroom had enough space for cosmetics and travel accessories. Everything was clean and the bathroom was spotless. The mattress was very comfortable; lots of pillows, towels and washcloths were provided. I appreciated the small safe in the closet for valuables. Iron, ironing board and full-size hair dryer in the room along with a small refrigerator. I had read the comments about the crowded breakfast room so I arrived at 8 am and found a table with no problem. There are also 2 long counters with seating. There are lots of selections for breakfast and plenty of food. The dark roast coffee was delicious. There was a wait for the elevators sometimes but not overly long. There is free wi-fi and 3 public computers in the lobby. The location is excellent--between 5th and 6th Avenues--within walking distance to shopping, theaters, restaurants and Penn Station; subways are nearby. There were only 2 negatives. The lighting is too bright and harsh and there is no way to dim it. The wall lamps over the couch turn on/off together; they can't be operated individually. The wall lamps over the bed can be turned on/off individually but can't be dimmed. There are no bedside lamps; you have to get out of bed to turn off the lights. It was apparent the lighting system wasn't designed with the guest in mind. As a result, there was too much glare on the TV to see it without turning off all the lights except for a small desk lamp. The other negative is that the TV is not good quality. The picture was dark on some stations even with the lights off and there was no way to lighten it.I would have given this hotel a 5 except for the problems with the lighting and TV. Nevertheless, I highly recommend it for the traveler on a budget who wants a centrally located, adequately sized room in a high quality hotel chain.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Used Hyatt Gold points for a weekend stay in Manhattan. Great location, close to Empire State and walking distance to Herald Square and Times Square. Young staff at front desk were very friendly and helpful (didn't expect this in NYC!) Allowed us to check in early, and also check out late so we could enjoy our adventures. Had a room facing front on the 14th floor with an awesome view downtown. Very clean and modern furnishings and bathroom. Wasn't noisy at all. Really enjoyed the sights and sounds of the NYC experience! Only downside was the parking, as another reviewer remarked. Hotel has a deal with a local garage for a $35 per 24 hour period. We dropped our car off at 12:30pm Saturday, and picked it up at 1:30pm Sunday (25 hours). Upon paying for parking we were first told we needed a sticker to get the Hyatt rate (which was not mentioned at the front desk). We went back and retrieved the sticker. Then we were told would be charged for TWO 24 hour periods, not the 24 hrs + 1 hr we actually parked, a total of $70! The hotel needs to clarify their policy with the garage and represent it more accurately to customers checking in and also on their website.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: 5 minute walk to Macy's and Madison Square Garden,Rooms are above average size for NYC,,,very clean,comfortable and new feeling.Staff were extremely friendly and helpful,,and house keeping didn't call until late afternoon,,which was a bonus,,as some hotels they come banging at 10am!It has a small little bar,,that nobody ever seems to attend,,but directly across the road there is a bar and grill called The Keg Room,,which is spot on for food and drink!would stay at this hotel again!!!100%

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First the positive:The hotel itself is pretty amazing for the location. I booked using Hyatt Gold Passport points, and so I don't actually remember what I would've paid in cash. I do remember it being very reasonable for New York. I had a street facing room which despite other reviews was not as noisy as one would think. Aside from the occasional horn in the middle of the night I slept pretty well on the 15th floor. The elevators were a bit slow and crowded, but it is a tall hotel with a small footprint. I imagine they did the best they could given the special limitations.Complimentary breakfast: I must say that this was probably the one of the best complimentary breakfast spreads I've seen in all my travels while staying at hotels of various levels (Motel 6 up to W Hotels). They had 2 different types of scrambled eggs (normal and some sort of southwestern), French toast, sausage, fruit, pastries, oatmeal, and cold cereal. Now for the negative:I will preface this by stating that I grew up just outside of NYC, and currently live in Boston. As a result I am somewhat familiar with how pricey garage parking can be. As the hotel does not offer their own parking, they have a deal with a local garage for a $35 per 24 hour period. This seemed very reasonable, and helped me in deciding to drive vs taking the Amtrak down. I dropped my car off at 11:30am Saturday, and picked it up at 1:30pm Sunday (26 hours). Upon paying for parking I was informed that I would be charged for TWO 24 hour periods. The garage clerk said to take my complaint up with the hotel who also explained it's the deal they have with the garage, and only apologized that it was not made completely clear upon check-in at the hotel. I understand that the garage's hourly rate is just as pricey as the daily rate, but I imagine I am not the first person to be blind sided when picking up their car expecting to pay for one 24 hour period + 2 hours. Please be warned, and plan accordingly if you intend to drive to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had meetings around the Penn Station area and absolutely the best value in the area is the Hyatt Place. Not much of a lobby in the front, but plenty of space in the back to meet with colleagues and work. Rooms are consistent across all Hyatt Place's, they are great! They all have an area in the rooms other than the bed that are useful to sit or work. They TV(s) are big and good, the bed is as comfortable as they get, the bathroom is well equipped. The temperature control works! Nothing extravagant, but perfectly comfortable and nothing to complain about.All the staff were friendly and helpful. One guy was extremely friendly and funny and kept us laughing. The gal who was running the kitchen and the Starbucks coffee counter was also very friendly. They both made you feel welcome and as if you were a regular.Anytime I have to be in this area I will stay here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Yep, my experience was consistent with other reviews, too. Slow elevator and erratic key issues (I kept it away from my phone, I promise!). These minor issues were offset by the friendly staff and the hot breakfast that had good variety and was plentiful. Close proximity to Herald Square and Bryant Park and several subway stops makes this a great location. There is a Holiday Inn Express right next door and even though I am IHG member, I chose the Hyatt based on previous experience with the Hyatt Place brand. It did not disappoint.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Didn’t have many expectations on this Hotel, booked with Hyatt gold passport for a couple of nights in NY. The location of the hotel is in Mid Town, right next to the Empire State Building on 5th Ave. Basically, walking distance to anywhere landmark in Manhattan. Plus the subway station is only one block away.Lobby is nothing special, the nice surprise was the room. A wonderful Empire State view, 20th floor, very quiet, clean, spacious and modern.Breakfast included, not bad but too crowded and difficult to get seats.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All the reviews before are accurate. Elevators are slow, street is noisy (it's New York though) and room keys didn't always work. BUT the location is perfect, the staff was helpful, and you can't beat the cost for a newer hotel room that includes a decent breakfast buffet. Tip: turn off refrigerator in room for less noise. Request a lower room floor so you can take the stairs if in a rush. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Being our first time in New York we wanted to be in easy walking distance to Times Square etc and have a comfortable hotel to return to in the evening. Our family of 4 adults and 1 child (sleeping on a pull out couch) were not disappointed. The 2 rooms were perfect in size and clean. Breakfast was very good and plenty available. We also recommend the Keg Room pub across the road for dinner. Thank you for a great time, and will certainly suggest the Hyatt Place to friends visiting from South Africa!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our family of six stayed in two rooms at this hotel. Our family consists of two teenagers, and two toddlers. We were extremely pleased with the location. The room size were not as large as a regular hyatt place,but we were comfortable with the size. Both rooms had a view of the Empire State building. Our family watch the Macy's day parade which was only half block away. We felt very safe and there were always taxis available that can accommodate all of us. All of the employees at the hotel were very kind and helpful. It was a very busy time to be there, but they made sure to e as accommodating as possible. Even during breakfast time on thanksgiving day, there were employees helping and directing the lines and tables.We were able to walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square.The doormen were superb in giving directions and helping us schedule our days! Our bags were taken to the room very quickly, and even at the very busy checkout, we did not wait long to have our bags taken downstairs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location on 36th street. Great view of the Empire State building from our room. Rooms were small compared to a normal "suite" style but compared to other hotels in NY, it was good. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. Only issue was the temperature. We had the air condition on in the winter and still couldn't get it very cool, although for most, it would be fine. (we just like it cool at night). Nice breakfast with scrambled eggs, sausage, either pancakes or french toast as well as normal continental items. Everything you need within a two block radius. Far enough away from Times Square area & Broadway shows to miss the crazy crowds but close enough to walk if you want. Stayed weekend before Christmas.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am a huge fan of Hyatt hotels especially Hyatt Place. I always have found the properties to be clean with nice (albeit limited) amenities and very comfortable beds (my most important requirement). The hotel did not disappoint. It was centrally located to most of what we wanted to see in NYC and literally a block from the Empire State Building, Macy's flagship, Victoria Secret flagship and blocks to Times Square. We stayed up so late each night that we never got up early enough to sample the free breakfast (6-9am) but really appreciated the free wi-fi. Our rooms were quiet and beds were super comfy. Each room also has a mini-trig and safe. My only complaint is that the rooms don't have enough storage for clothes and toiletries, especially for a five-day stay. The staff was super friendly and even gave us free water bottles one night when they heard us complain of being dehydrated as we walked back into the hotel after a day of sightseeing. Will absolutely stay again. Thank you so much Hyatt for helping us make our NYC trip a memorable experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here December 18-22. The hotel was very clean, and I felt the rooms were a good size, especially the bath room.I asked for a room on a lower floor, and chose the second floor. I did this so I would not have to rely on the elevators. The room faced the street, and yes, there was noise. I was not in the room during the day at all, and in the evening, I turned the fan of the heating/air conditioning unit on "constant". It masked the street noise very well, and was not bothered by the noise. The bed was very comfortable, and I slept very well every night. I did not care for a view. If a view is important and you are bothered by traffic noise, then ask for a higher floor.The breakfast had plenty of choices, including hot and cold items. The coffee is Starbucks, and paper cups with lids are included so people can take their coffee with them. The room also had a refrigerator that I liked so I could keep drinks and fruit in there.There is a bartender in the evenings, so you can have a night cap or a drink before heading out for the evening. The bartender (Vanessa) was very friendly, and I also talked with some of the guests in the evenings.Every person (that I encountered at this hotel) who works here was friendly, helpful and pleasant. I felt very welcomed here. I would stay here again, if the price was right. I paid $206/night, and I was satisfied with the rate. I stayed at another place for my last night, which was $159/night, but it did not include breakfast, the room was smaller, and the people were not as pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our trip to NYC was for my husbands 36th birthday. We stayed from 12/20-12/22. The first night our room faced 36th street and was so noisy we didn't get more than a few hours sleep. We were approached by other guest that were having the same issues as well.We inquired about moving rooms and were told we could do so. On our way to switch rooms we got on to the elevator in the lobby and when the door closed the elevator got stuck. We became trapped with 10 adults in a 5x5 elevator for the next hour. The experience was horrible. When we were first trapped we were able to talk thru the elevator doors to the front desk staff and the manager on duty.After the first 10 minutes no one from the hotel was able to give a time line as to when we would be rescued. As the minutes ticked on the manager on duty said she was going to call the company who serviced the elevator instead of calling the fire department as we had requested. Many of the guests in the elevator were starting to panic and felt faint due to the close quarters. Everyone was trying to stay calm but the feeling of being trapped was overwhelming. Luckily we were able to get phone reception and call the FDNY on our own, and were freed from the the elevator no more than 5 minutes after they arrived. After we were rescued the assistant manager told several guest that the Hyatt would not be charging us because of incident .That seemed the very least the hotel could do under the circumstances. However on the morning we were to check out a bill was placed under our door.When we questioned the manager she told us there was a miscommunication and she was not willing to fullfill her inital offer to take care of the room charges. She said she did not have the authority . A nationwide hotel chain opperating in Manhattan on the weekend before Christmas had no general manager on duty and the assistant manager was clearly not equipped to deal with the very serious issues on hand. The way we were ultimately treated adding insult to injury. Then while sitting in the lobby waiting to check out the hotel fire alarms started going off.The hotel staff started scrambling ,and when asked if there was a fire in the hotel the assistant manager could not provide an answer. She simply didn't know!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were all set to spend a few days in the city to get into the holiday spirit and then.....Ice & Snow... prevented us from arriving as planned. We called the Hyatt and to our surprise found out they would not charge us for the night we missed - how nice was that!! They offered to hold the room if we could arrive sometime in the night or early morning. This hotel opened last March and has had a few bad reviews but we couldn't have been more pleased. When we arrived a wonderful young man greeted us and he was "oh so busy" with check outs but took time to say welcome and that he would be back to us as soon as he could. That was very promptly and filled us in on the hotel amenities and that the elevators could be slow at certain times of the morning. Yes, the rooms are smaller than some hotels we have been to but comfortable as we slept so well we missed breakfast but there is a great cafe next store so no problem.Looking forward to a return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for one night, room was comfortable, clean, breakfast next day was good, the hotel is well located very close to Times Square,Broadway theaters, Met Opera. and public transportation. Only concerned about the elevators, only two, it takes forever to take one.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wife and I stayed here for three nights 12/15-12/18. Two nights through points and one paid. Was first placed in room on 20th floor facing street. Thought street noise wouldn't be an issue being on a high floor but it was. Main noise was the constant horn honking. Don't believe glass has any sound proofing. Called front desk and they graciously moved us to 6th floor facing back of building. Problem solved! No other noise issues.Room itself is kinda small but has all amenities needed.No real issues with room cleaning, except for one day we returned to find we had no clean glasses or mugs. Called and they promptly brought some up. Also didn't get our room cleaned one day until after 2pm. Not a big deal since we were busy doing stuff in the city.Included Breakfast was good and fresh. Does get very busy during peak times....8-9am, but never had to wait for anything. Front desk was also helpful with directions but don't ask for change $$ because they seem to not have any(?)Wi Fi worked very good throughout hotel.Elevators are very small and do take forever in morning during peak times. Believe that would be the same in other hotels.All in all, we were pleased with our stay and would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Having done a good deal of travel, I can say I was shocked to find this gem tucked in Midtown. The rooms and decor weren't overly glamorous but were definitely welcoming, clean and still had an upscale feel. The room was in great condition and the free wifi, readily available starbucks, and comfortable sitting areas seemed a rare find in a reasonably priced NY hotel environment. The staff was friendly, polite, helpful, and attentive! The location is great--you're perfectly situated to come and go as you need to without too much hassle. This is a great option for anyone seeking a humble but more-than-just-comfortable city stay. I will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and MIL stayed here one night to see the holiday sights and celebrate a big birthday. They had a lovely time. The location is great, rooms were clean and comfortable. They were able to check in quite early, giving them a respite from the winter weather. The hotel also sent up some snacks in honor of the big birthday. They went on the early side to breakfast and enjoyed it. Only minor complaint, not at all unique to this hotel in NYC, is the elevator situation. Long waits were common.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are looking for a NYC hotel in a good location, free breakfast and free wi-fi, this is a good place. The rooms are pretty average. The breakfast is great with lots of options and lots of seating. The lobby area is a bit small and the hotel is located in the middle of the block so getting a taxi can be a bit challenging. Overall it's a good option and I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall my wife and I enjoyed staying at this property, however the one complaint I have is that the hours for complimentary breakfast served on the weekend ends are a bit odd. A 10am end time is quite frankly ridiculous -- noon would be much more in line with folks relaxed schedules on a Saturday/Sunday.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location! Right near the Empire State Building (it can be seen from some of the hotel rooms). Also by Bryant Park, the library, Macy's, and several subway stops. Rooms were great! Size larger than your NYC average. My room had 2 queens, a couch/ottoman, desk/chair and TV stand. There was plenty of floor space making for a spacious feel. The window in 2104 offered a great view of the ESB, but at night had shades that closed out all the light perfectly. There was also no noise issue in the room so sleeping was easy. My room was an ADA room which in this case meant the shower was wheelchair accessible - no lip to keep the water from going into the rest of the bathroom. Therefore I had to use just the handheld shower head instead of the one permanently mounted on the wall as that one aimed right at the curtain and couldn't be turned away. The handheld one didn't need to be held, but could be turned away from the curtain so the floor outside the shower area got less wet. The staff were all friendly. Check-in was fast and I was assigned a better room than the one I booked. Ask them for anything from a map, to dinner advise, to calling for a cab. Also on offer: free breakfast, free in room WiFi, outdoor patio in front of hotel, business center, brochure rack in lobby, lower level gym, Wall Street Journal delivered each morning...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Simple review.......Great location, 30 min walk to central park,15 min to Time sqrooms---clean/good size for Manhattan/modern/medium firm bed which I really liked(unusual for US in my opinion)staff-----efficient rates---- very reasonable for New York(although I used points this stay)This is not a full service hotel hence the low rates but for me it's all I need for this city and will definitely use it from now on for future trips.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location. Easy to walk to Macy's &Times Square. Room was large with 2 queen beds and a view of the Empire State Building. Free breakfast was nice. Good choices - cereal, eggs, fruit, pastries and French toast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed here in mid-October for a NYC weekend getaway with the family. My two boys loved it! Room was an ample size for a family of four - much bigger than most NYC hotels. Breakfast was typical for Hyatt Places - totally sufficient for our needs. Would definitely consider this Hyatt Place again for our next overnight trip into NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Right beside macys and the Empire State Building couldn't fault this hotel 5 star service so friendly and helpful spotless clean and breakfast included which tastes good and caters for everyone would definitely recommend an we stayed over thanksgiving and could see the parade from outside the hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My sister and I did a long w/e in NYC to catch a couple of shows. We arrived at @ 6:30 am from CA on a red eye. Our room was ready and Luis was especially friendly and cordial, and checking in was a breeze. The room was well appointed, modern, and spacious (for NY.) During our 3 day stay the staff was helpful and courteous. Kudos to Raoul who went out of his way to hail a cab for us upon our departure. We walked to most of our destinations...this hotel was perfect for walking to theatre district, south to Flatiron restaurants, and right around the corner from Macy's! I will definitely stay here again. Even though we did not have much of a "view" our room, 1103, was perfect. I have some picky friends, and I can certainly recommend this hotel to them. :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just around the corner from Macys and Herald Square.New hotel, so facilities are still fresh.The lines for the breakfast room are a bit long and the food is located under glass covers that make reaching difficult.Only two elevators for about 25 floors. so there is quite a wait.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed for 3 night in November, check-in very was quick and easy, we were on the 23rd floor and we really couldn't fault our room, it was large, modern, clean and tidy, and the bed was so comfortable. Free breakfast and WiFi, would definetely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed the night before Thanksgiving and had a GREAT time. The room even had a sliver of a view to the parade. The staff were kind and helpful, and the room was perfect - better than expected by far. They offered a great complimentary breakfast, and the location was great for the local attractions. Also - it felt very safe.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I were very happy with this conveniently-located hotel in the midtown area. The rooms were large, clean, modern, and quiet, and the staff very friendly and helpful, especially with respect to luggage storage. Thoroughly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I stayed at Hyatt Place September 9 - 15 for the market week. The location was great. However, room clean up was not timely. In addition, my black exercise top disappeared during our visit. No one knew anything about it. We were keyed out of our room two times due to rate changes. It certainly is an adequate place with a breakfast included but I am concerned about the missing clothing. I have not experienced this before. I would think twice about returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: i usually stay at the andaz 5th ave but decided to try this hotel for a weekend business trip. the welcome upon check-in could have been better but the rest of my stay was very pleasant and staff was courteous.the room was a decent size, clean, nice Tv, modern. Towels looked a bit worn. i stayed on the 26th floor and the elevators do take a while to go up and down but that's mainly in the morning when everyone in the hotel is going to the breakfast buffet. the buffet is managed well: a nice selection of items, the hostess is good at seating everyone, u can take stuff back to ur room.the best thing about the hotel for me is the location. its really close to herald square, excellent steakhouse next door as well as a pretty neat deli open everyday for breakfast,lunch and dinner. proximity to 5th and 6th make transport really easy and plenty dining options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed in New York Hyatt Place for two nights, and got bitten by bedbug all over my arm and legs. This is my second bedbug story with Hyatt Place. The first time was the Hyatt Place in Sugarland, Texas. I guess both experience is signaling that the Hyatt Place is having serious hygiene issue.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is centrally located in mid-town only 1 block from Herald Square. The lobby is clean and bright. The rooms are clean, modern and very spacious for a NYC hotel (we had 2 adults and 2 children in the room). Breakfast was included in the room rate. The breakfast was terrific...a great selection of hot and cold items...sweet, savory and healthy. The breakfast room attendants are very good, the trays were kept stocked and the food was fresh. The front desk staff was very friendly and had several good recommendations for restaurants. Parking is extra but it is on the same street, very convenient and reasonably priced. The hotel gives you everything you need for a short trip to NYC. A great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Overall, I was very pleased with the Hyatt Place. I thought the staff made an extra effort to be helpful. Their continental breakfast is exceptional. The rooms were comfortable - big enough to move around in. I was happy they offered food for lunch/dinner. I didn't feel like going out for lunch, but a cup of chili tided me over until dinner. Note: we had a loud intermittent noise in our room and determined it was perhaps the heater in the bathroom. Close the bathroom door when you go to bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I each booked a room from our respective Hyatt accounts. We asked in advance for the rooms to be on an upper floor, next to each other. The room in my name was for my elderly mother. My mother's room was already occupied, and we walked in on someone's suitcase, shopping bags, etc. We hauled our luggage back down to the front desk, and at first, were told that they couldn't give us two new rooms on the same floor. They finally found rooms on a lower floor.When we entered the new room, the phone was ringing. It was the front desk asking for me. I thought they had called to apologize. Instead, after I identified myself, they next asked for Mr. ___, who was apparently the person whose room we had walked into a while earlier. I said again that I did not know him, and that he was not part of my party, and they said that they just wanted to get to the bottom of what had happened.(!) Apparently, my telling them that I didn't know this person a few minutes ago had not been not sufficient. The rooms at this hotel are nice, but the staff needs to be trained so that if they do make a major error, they blame them themselves, and not their guest.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in November! From check in to check out we received great service and encountered a very courteous and friendly staff. We are platinum members and although they couldn't give us a room on a high floor we did have a room overlooking 36th street. We enjoy people watching so it was a plus! We were also given a coupon for 2 free cocktails at the bar. Very nice amenity! The room was smaller than other hotels that we have stayed at BUT the location was super! Better location than the LEX 48 that we stayed at last year. It was an adequate room none the less--bathroom was a good size and clean and the couch was a nice addition. The breakfast was a nice and easy way to grab something to eat..lots of choices and average quality of food. It was Free so its hard to complain about that. We would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I do not have a lot of NYC hotels to compare, but if you're looking for 1. Good price, 2. Comfortable room, 3. Good service, this hotel knocks it out of the ballpark. The rooms were spacious for a NYC hotel room (see: had king bed, closet, and even a desk and couch). The furniture was tight and it wasn't huge, but it was exactly what was needed. I appreciated the mini fridge, and the amenities were spot on. Great beds...and what surprised me the most, VERY little street noise. We were in room 1001, 10th floor of I think 24/25 floors...next time, I'll ask for a higher level in hopes of a better view, but we were not in NYC for the hotel. We merely needed a comfortable, well-located, good priced hotel -- with a great location to everything, and this was exactly it. I am continuously impressed by Hyatt and Hyatt Places, I hope they give the staff a raise for their helpful and kind demeanor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a new hotel with smaller than average rooms overstuffed with just enough stuff to ensure you'll stub your toe.More importantly, my room on the 6th floor was so noisy every night from the parade of garbage trucks that sleeping was very hard.A new building is starting up next door so the rivet guns, cranes, etc will ensure a 24 hour racket.I'd pass on this Hyatt Place (and the other new hotels on W 36 St which is way too noisy for my money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: hotel was quite newly opened. nice modern (good sized) rooms with decent sized bath rooms. breakfast buffet above average and fresh (even the coffee is good). rooms to the north have good views. location is ideal for tourists (walking distance to times square and empire state building).

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I stayed here mid-September for a couple of weeks. It was our first visit to NYC and Michelle, Dana, Lauren, and Luz, employees from the front desk, hostess, to the repairmen, made our stay even more enjoyable. The room is good size with a couch, large flat screen TV, mini refrig, a room safe and good size bath room. The WiFi worked great! The closet was a little tight, just large enough for 8 hangers. This place had very good blackout shades.This is the first hotel I’ve stayed at with complimentary breakfast where you might wait in line to be seated. (This is a good thing.) If you arrive less than 15minutes before breakfast ends, it will be crowed and you will wait in a short line. Luz is the hostess and handles this with a smile.Food wise there’s the usual cold cereal, pastry, toast, bagels, juice and coffee. There is also hot oatmeal with raisins, granola, and other toppings, a mixed fruit cobbler and grape fruit that my wife just loved! They also serve on a rotating basis: egg, cheese, and pesto on a English muffin, scrambled eggs, cheese omelet, and waffles. I read comments about how long it takes to catch an elevator since there are only two. There are 26 floors in the hotel and I could see how you could wait for an elevator if you are on a low numbered floor. (Especially if breakfast is closing in 10 minutes.). Personally, I was on the 21th floor and do not recall people not being able to enter our elevator as we were heading down. The location is great, 1 ½ blocks from the subway. There are small restaurants on both sides of the hotel and many more on 5th and 6th Ave, a half block away. This place opened early this year and is in great shape with a staff who enjoy their jobs. I will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I just read the review from the party from Milan and felt bad for this family, we were also a party of three and I booked through hyatt gold passport, but another hotel in Philly I did a third party and paid for three, but I read about problems with three people so I always call the hotel directly confirm reconfirm and reconfirm and I get names dates even time that I call, and I usually speak to a supervisor. In this case I spoke to a very nice supervisor name Thomas before leaving to make sure I had two beds and there would be three people. I also spoke to Lauren to reconfirm, even though I did not go through a third party and went with hyatt, I still had to make sure. I am not sure why no one brought linens because when I called for toiletries they were delivered in a timely manner. As for the complaints on elevators we had no problems, as for other reviews on the breakfast, we thought for free breakfast it was good how can we complain there were two different types of eggsdelicious link sausage, either french toast or pancake, oatmeal, assorted cereals assorted danish,bagels, muffins, assorted fruits, yogurt, granola, assorted juices, milk tea, coffee, for free breakfast I was very grateful. and if you wanted to take to your room you could take it up with the plate. there was always seating the entrees were always replenished the crew does. fine job in dining. out of the three hotels we stayed in during this east coast trip, philly, wilmington and hyatt my family and I hands down agreed hyatt had the most comfortable bedding. We have been to many hyatts, but because we were told new york was expensive and rooms smaller, we were still satisfied. we found the housekeeping to be neat and clean, the hotel walking distance to many places and also near penn station. the staff and management were nice I did not think anyone was rude, we had met nice people again like Thomas, Lauren, Michelle, Raul, ladies in the breakfast room and the elderly gentlemen who stand behind the fridge section with juices and snacks, sandwiches, pasteries, candies, not sure what their roles are they wear a suit, but thy were still pleasant. hotel is new and clean. we did have issues twice with our keys not working but that was resolved quickly and my daughter said they were very apologetic and nice about it. The only thing con would be when I asked about transport to jfk, they said there is no contact number for yellow cab, but they have contract with private cars and it would be sixty two dollars cash or sixty eight dollars charge, I later on found out after I returned home that there are a lot cheaper transportation with other private cars,I also was not given a reciept, but I did not ask for one either since we were just trying to get all our bags out our driver was nice, but he kept looking ata his phone I dont think it was for directions, because he would know the route so I will not use them next times. My fault did not do my homework before leaving hawaii on the trsnsport back to airport just assumed we could call the cablike all the other hotels, but hyatt said cabs had no number to call. other than that cant think of anything bad to say about this hotel. I feel we as travelers have to also do our homework and if you cant call overseas then at least email prior to arriving and document all your request, because you just cant always trust those third party bookings. and its nice to familiarize yourself with the staff before meeting them in person again by phone or email. thats my suggestion to all travelers just felt bad for the party from milan. anyway thank you hyatt for another great experience and special mahalo(thank you in hawaiian) to Thomas, Puala, Lauren. hope you guys enjoyed the goodies from hawaii. also giving excellent for value because we used points and anniversary and with free breakfast I say the value was worth one hundred stars. oh we also got a room where we could see part of the empire state building very close just right around the corner I think we had room 1203 with two beds. elevators were always ok for us and wait time not long at all also quiet as room is in the corner. but pull your shades since it is also directly acoss another building. and if you are platinum you get goodies from there little snack bar they give you a card.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Last week I stayed at this hotel with my mum and my 24 years old sister. We booked on Booking.com a room for 3 ADULT PEOPLE. When we arrived at the hotel, after a long flight from Milan, we had a bad surprise: our room had only one double bed and one sofa, not even a sofa bed! You can see it in the pictures: it was a small couch (I am 1,75 m tall and I could not stretch out my legs!) and of course there were no sheets. I went to the reception, sure that there was a mistake, but they told me that that was the room that I booked. I insisted so they told me that I had to call Booking.com; we did it and they told me the same thing. The worst thing is that they already had this problem, because one of the two girls at the reception said to the other one: always the same problem with the 3 people room on booking.com! The hotel tried to blame Booking because they have been not clear, and Booking was trying to do the same with the hotel. The only thing I know is that I paid for 3 ADULTS, more than 1.600 $, to sleep one week on a couch!Another woman was having the same problem, but she was with her two children so maybe they managed to sleep in one bed. That was not the case for us, and I repeat that I paid one room for three Adults. There was no way to change the room, and they asked me if I wanted to pay to get a single room!!! Luckily, one of the two girls at the reception was helpful (the other one was even rude) and she managed to cancel my reservation, and we got a room for 3 (that means with two double beds) at the Holiday Inn next door. We had to stay at the Hyatt Place only one (terrible) night, and they charged us € 308 for sleeping on a sofa. We asked to have at least some sheets for the couch, and they never arrived. My suggestion is to avoid this hotel! The rooms are not bad, but really standard. I think you can find something better in NY, and most of all a better service!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are looking for a great location outside of the usual touristy areas, like Times Square and want to be away from the crowds then this is a great choice. There are a few qualifiers, it's NYC so, there are always going to be people but it's not the craziness and all the tourists that you have in Times Square.  However, you are just a few blocks from Macy's and Herald Square which can get crowded but 36th street where the hotel is located is relatively quiet. There is a Best Westen and Holiday Inn on either side of this property, which was interesting, but all 3 hotels are "small" in a good way, by NYC standards. We chose this location for a couple of reasons. We wanted to explore NYC and have a good base to do it from. It's conveniently located, there are subways nearby but everything is so walkable in NY and its less that a 30 minute walk to Union Square. About the same to the Highline park. Our main reason for staying here is we wanted a smaller hotel outside of the usual tourist areas. This was a perfect choice for us. Once you are through the doors, in the lobby or in your room its very peaceful. We have also stayed in other Hyatt Place hotels around the country, so we had some familiarity in what to expect. However, while the rooms are very comfortable and this is a new hotel, the rooms are a bit smaller than say the Hyatt Place at Salt Lake City Airport. But then again, this is NYC and chances are you aren't going to be spending too much time in your room. So, even with smaller rooms you still have your king size bed, large screen tv, free internet etc. I should add that they do a great job with the size of the room. There are also the usual Hyatt Place amenities, like a nice sitting area in the lobby, there is another area outside, which is a nice touch, as well as a pantry and free breakfast. Just a word about that: there are plenty of options to buy stuff, there is a store just a few doors down, a Duane Reade drugstore around the corner which has everything and there are restaurants on the same street as the hotel and all over NYC. But if you forgot to get anything and didn't want to go out, its nice to have stuff available at the front desk.The breakfast is what you might expect and it comes with your stay. So, its convenient and easy. Not too many "healthy" options, and given that this is New York City, you would think they would have better bagels. At best these are generic food service bagels. Other than that its a nice breakfast area, it's clean and lots of seating. Before staying here, I noted that some of the reviews mentioned only 2 elevators and some other complaints. We never had to wait for an elevator. Our room was spotless. Staff at the front desk was friendly, and we enjoyed our stay and will be back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed one night for anniversary to stroll around the city and see a show. The hotel was a short walk from Penn station on a reasonably quiet street just off of 5th avenue. The room was quiet and the bed was so comfortable that we overslept and missed the breakfast! We will definitely be back...

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My last review elicited a response from the then GM that he was sorry about some issues I raised but things would be better the next time! Could they be even more worse? YES. And they seem proud of it!This time I thought I would reach out to the GM and remind him of my last stay letting him know of my return. Also that I needed an ADA room as my wife just had knee replacement surgery First surprise, there was a new GM Brashler who came from Marriott (I was told to write him at his old address). 2 emails to him and no response. Finally a nice note from Ms. Cardone Director Guest Services who not only confirms ADA room but gives some information on parking etc. So I checked in at 2:28 pm today. Rude front office supervisor curtly does not acknowledge ADA room confirmation but reminds me its not 3 pm and she will call me when room is ready. BY 3:22 pm and my room isn’t ready and the front desk says they don’t know when it will be ready. My wife is ready to drop with her knee pain and I go over and mention my prior communications and I'm not going to write a better review this time around. Suddenly 1 minute later, room 2502 becomes available. Doorman has gone by now so we lug all of our luggage and I rush to find ice for the machine. No ADA room and a tub. Now my wife has to very carefully navigate herself around and worry about damaging her leg. All this horrible service for a Platinum member.Weird thing is right next door is a Holiday Inn Express were we have stayed before without any issues.I did reach out social media to HyattConcierge and they indicated they would follow up on this. Not sure what they can do since we are in the only room we were given and not about to unpack everything including the ice machine!My tip...stay at the Holiday Inn Express but give this place a wide pass until it improves.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The staff at the Hyatt Place are amazing, especially Raul who made an extra effort to make our toddler comfortable during her 1st trip to NYC. We would definitely stay at the Hyatt Place the next time we travel to NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The lox atom is superb and for business it's hard to beat if you care about costs. Then public areas are average and the elevators a touch slow but given the price reasonable. If I was travelling with my family I would probably chose another option but price is not the driver then. If you want a good value stay it wins. Great staff and everything you need seems close by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We really enjoyed our 4 night stay at Hyatt Place Midtown South. Our rooms were very clean.Not a very big room, but we didn't expect one in NYC. Great location, easy to get everywhere. Staff was excellent-efficient, helpful and very friendly. Would not hesitate to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Provides nutritious breakfast. Eating area very crowded if hotel is filled to capacity. Only two elevators and long wait to get on at times. Housekeeping forgot to care for our room one night and had to inform them to get it done. Don't know who is in charge as no manager seems to be around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife and I were pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Hyatt Place. We had to make an impromptu trip to NYC and did not have a reservation. About 7:00 pm in the evening we reserved a room mainly because of the proximity to the 34th St subway. Expected only a reasonable room for sleeping but were happy to find many positives that will keep us coming back. We primarily booked the room because of reasonable price. When we were so well received by the staff on arrival I sensed we were in for something special. Booking into the room was a breeze. Staff was helpful and courteous with all of or questions. The room was more than adequate for our needs. Great king bed, full couch. 42" TV, desk with computer access, free wi-fi, nice bathroom with huge shower and every feature we'd expect for a three night stay. Granted ther are only two elevators but we never waited more than two minutes to get access and to our room. One of the best parts of this hotel was the breakfast service. I was expecting the usual coffee, cereal, and bagel type service you usually get at a holiday inn express. Not here. They prepare hot items like eggs, sausage, breakfast sandwiches along with fresh fruit, cereals, oatmeal and Danish. It's more like a restaurant that comps you for your meal. Couldn't have been better. I've read some previous reviews that criticized this hotel and I'm wondering if these people stayed at the same place that my wife and I did? The only item that we couldn't find or wasn't in the bathroom was a blow dryer. I'm sure if we asked they would have had one for us immediately. For the location, services, cleanliness, courteous staff and price I can't think of a better place to stay in NYC. We've stayed in much higher priced NYC hotels with much less to offer. Thanks for making our stay so comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: 25th floor room had a funky smell, perhaps from new furniture? I know another room in the hotel also had the same smell, because I asked to be moved from it (15th floor). In my new room, I was awoken very early in the morning by the alarm in the room - housekeeping should have turned it off when turning over the room. Also, the iron was literally broken. After heating it and starting to iron my shirt, the bottom metal which gets hot was cracked and broken off and it damaged my shirt as I started ironing it. I had to wear the previous day's sweaty shirt to work. I called down and asked for a new iron, and it took about 15 minutes of waiting. Too late at that point had to run out the door with an old sweaty shirt on, and a clean, but damaged shirt - after being awoken very early in the morning by the alarm, which was in the stinky (and tiny) room. Also, my first room that i was given (15th floor) was facing a an apartment building directly across from us, who were so close they could see us in the room. Had to pull the black out shades down for any level of privacy. The room is SOOO tiny, that you WILL get claustrophobic in there - even if you don't suffer from Claustrophobia.So, to stay there, you could not have the shades up to get any sun in the room, unless you were fully dressed and prepared to be stared at from across the street. My least favorite Hyatt property ever.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel has a great location for tourists as it's a fairly short walk to Time's Square, Rockefeller Center, and Empire State Building. You could even walk to Broadway shows if you had comfy shoes. Fancy food is around Time's Square and theatre district. Lots of good cheaper options near the hotel. I've always loved how Hyatt Place is pretty simple but good. And I love that they automatically give you the Wifi info.We did the breakfast once and thought it was just okay. Went 30 minutes before closing and didn't have to wait. It's a combo of continental food and some hot food. I felt it was worth eating elsewhere with so many quick options in NYC. I did not try their other food that you can order. The rooms provide a pod coffee maker and Twinning's tea. Rooms in this hotel are great. They are the size we had staying in Paris, which makes sense. So they are somewhat small, but you won't be hanging in your room anyway. Nice views from higher up and not too bad on the noise. Great tv with hookups, comfy bed, and even a couch! Fitness center was just okay. They have a few cardio things and some weights - not heavy enough for males that lift regularly but you could probably get by.Best thing about this place is the staff. All are younger - competent and upbeat. When we left one of the front office guys actually went down the street to catch us a taxi. And I loved the maid service. She didn't throw out anything we wanted to keep. She didn't try to rearrange our clothes! Always gave us appropriate number of fresh towels! Compared to staff in California hotels NYC people are amazing. In fact, everyone I got service from all over Manhattan was great. Guess they understand the economy's need for hospitality money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I booked this hotel last minute and it was surprisingly affordable, clean, quiet - with a great location and parking just down the street. I'm bringing my wife to NY soon, and this is where we'll stay. The look down views weren't fantastic, the look up views great. Also a superb free breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for 5 nites and I can,t find one thing to complain about! When we arrived I asked if it were possible to get a room with a view and two beds, no problem. We were on the 24th floor with a great view of the Empire State Bld. Some complaints about a slow elevator, not so! I timed it, down from the 24th floor to the lobby took 15 seconds. We never had to wait more than a few seconds for the elevator. The breakfast was great, lots of places to sit and also, no waiting.The room was very clean with two queen beds. The staff was wonderful, very helpful when asked questions about New York. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We enjoyed 6 nights in late August at this relatively new, clean and central accommodation. The free breakfast was a highlight but be sure to eat early to avoid long waits! The service was very good and room although tiny for our family of 5 was clean, serviced well and very modern! A plus for New York standards. So close to the subway (1 block) and Bryant Park (a green oasis in an otherwise cement inner city) Macy's (just around the corner) and Times Square less than 10 mins walk. We loved it!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I'm rating this against the other hotels in its class (e.g. Hilton garden inn, courtyard by Marriott, etc). This hotel is new and it's location can't be beat for tourists and business travelers. As others have mentioned, transportation is no problem to anywhere in the city from here. Subway station is around the corner and taxis are easily hailed from 6th or 5th ave.We stayed only one night (Saturday) and the room with a pull out sofa is spacious for NYC. Seems like the corner rooms are not as spacious and may not have pull out sofas. Even so, it's not a problem if it's just for a night or two. The room itself is clean and bed was comfy. Lighting is good although it's definitely fluorescent white bright. (No dimmers)The staff is friendly and accommodating. Front desk to bell hop to breakfast attendants. Speaking of breakfast it's included in the rate. A simple buffet style with hot and cold options. Table seating could be problematic but the staff tries their best to manage it (people should read the sign for "wait to be seated"). If you don't want to wait for a proper table, I think you could take it to the lobby and outside tables too. Wifi is complimentary throughout the entire hotel and had a decent speed. Certainly enough for web surfing and email. I was able to stream on my phone with no problems. Only two elevators and I agree with other reviewers that it could be slow especially in the morning. Again, we weren't in any rush so we really didn't even care. Overall a great mid-tier grade hotel and would recommend for tourists and business travelers. We used Hyatt points for the room but I would say that real money paying customers have a good value here too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed here 4th of July weekend and we loved it!!! It's very well-located (super-close to Macy's 5th Ave - the original). There are lots of sights and restaurants within easy walking distance. We ate at the Keg Room across the road twice and were very happy. It's also great access off the highway if you're driving in. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My last stay was at the Eventi and this was not as plush. However, I like space and on 21st floor I had full size bathroom, king bed, mini couch and felt like I could move in the room. View was solid as well. Staff was helpful and nice - nothing was unattended to. I got the room for 249 for five nights. No complaints. I even had a room by the elevator and no noise. Housekeeping respected the privacy sign and left a note they'd come back. Was in town on business but for budget this could be a hotel for either. Free breakfast was what you'd expect. Standard and free but something for everyone. Good hotel. Well run.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We asked for a room with a view and we got an amazing view of the Empire state.New clean decent sized rooms with everything you need to make your stay a pleasure.We had not problems with elevators at all and the breakfast options were great way to start the day.Would reccomend the place without hesitation and will go back there on our next visit to NY.Andy,Calgary.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. We weren't supposed to stay there but we had a bad surprise at the next door hotel (I said what I had to on their page). I was glad to arrive in a good looking hotel, with a nice smell in the lobby (can seem like a detail but was great to find when we arrived). We had a good deal for 3 of us.Our room was on the 10th floor. Clean, Spacious, Comfortable. the view wasn't the best, as well as some noise from the ventilation outside but we slept really well !!!!! For those who are interested the TV was huge ! Breakfast was included, simple but did its job before a day out in the city. Location was great next to Herald Square, a few minutes walking to Times Square. The only "bad" thing about the hotel is the elevators that can take ages... but I guess that to be expected in a 26 story building !I was very glad to find the friendly and helpful staff of Hyatt Place, and I will probably go back if I have the opportunity !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location is great - all of the Midtown attractions are walkable. The subway is right around the corner as well and cabs are readily available on 5th or 6th Ave. Room is a great size for Manahttan and everything is clean and new. I would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking for an affordable option in the heart of the island.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My family and I stayed at the Hyatt Place September 21st for a night to enjoy Manhattan. I had made reservation at the Hyatt and used my anniverssary night on the Hyatt card. When I called to check on the reservation it was changed....to a later date... I had checked on the site and the hotel. After an hour we were able to change it back. We were assured of a upgrade... When we arrived they had no room for us....Amanda who was at the desk quickly remedied the situation. She upgraded us immediately! The next day we requested an extended checkout and was kept on hold by Samantha for 20 minutes, I kept an eye on my watch! Samantha answered the phone and put us on hold again! I called back and spoke with Amanda. She immediately gave us the extended checkout. BTW, Samantha was the one who assured us we had the upgrade before we arrived. The property is also located next to ongoing construction, they are constructing a building right next to the property. Luckily we were there during the weekend and had no problems. The room was great! It was very well kept. Beds were new and we had a great flat screen TV. The bathroom was very nice too. It was clean and not a bit of mold. Beware the soap dish though...once that soap is wet it will never come off..(heh). In the morning the air conditioning started to rattle. When we went downstairs I liked the free breakfast and the seating. It was a bit crowded but the staff had a great smile. They were attentive and welcoming. Amanda was at the desk and had a smile and a wonderful attitude. She asked how our stay was and it was great! She had overcome the problems I had by addressing them quickly and with a smile. Kudos to you Amanda! The only item she could not overcome was the crowded elevator. There were only 2 for the whole hotel. I gave three stars because of the construction, the elevator and Samantha. I give Amanda ten stars if I could. It' the staff which give the hotel it's value. The maid, maintenance staff, and restaurant staff all had smiles and wonderful attitudes. I even watched as a maintenance worker gave a guest pointers on New York. He was gracious and funny. I definitely would go back again....if Amanda is there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at Hyatt Place just last week and thought it was a very pleasant hotel. I used my Hyatt points to garner the reservation, and that alone saved me over $1200 for a three-night stay. The lobby is very small, but I was greeted quickly upon entering, and they even had a room ready for me when I checked-in at around 10 a.m.The room that I had over looked 36th Street, and was clean and tidy. As expected, the rooms in NYC are small, and this was no different, but the amenities were great. Big flatscreen, safe in the closet, and a modern bathroom. Beds were also comfortable.As noted in other reviews, they only have two elevators, and the only time that I really waited for one was on Sunday when I checked-out. The property is conveniently located to the subway (just 2 blocks away) and a short walk to Times Square.This is a solid choice for anyone looking for a place in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed September 4-8. I usually stay at Grand Hyatt while in NYC but chose Hyatt Place since we didn't need a full service Hyatt. It is a relatively new property and what a great decision I made. We were late arrival and had asked for view room. We were a bit concerned we wouldn't have the room or the view but we had both! The location is great....away from Times Square, subway down the street and around the corner.Hotel was modern and very clean. Front desk staff were very helpful and dropped what they were doing to assist. And a complimentary breakfast! This was an incredibly good stay! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Let's start with the location - The hotel is located on 36th st. (between 5th and 6th avenue). It's within a walking distance from all major places (Times Square, Empire State Building, Penn Station, Port Authority, etc.). The nearest subway station is located just around the corner (on 35th and 6th). This advantage, by itself, is sufficient to recommend this hotel.The hotel itself is new, and has a new feeling. The room was clean, and all the public areas look at top condition.The room itself was small, but quiet, comfortable and more than adequate to my needs (I travelled with my 10 years old child). We had enough room for our suitcases, and enough storage place. There are two similar hotels just next to this one (Holiday Inn on one side and Best Western on the other). And after staying at one of the others, I can say that the rooms at the Hyatt are bigger (and breakfast better than in the other hotel).There is a free breakfast. The breakfast was very nice, and we found a place to sit, with no problems (even when not arriving very early).I read reviews that criticize the wait time for the elevators. But even though there are two elevators, I can't see it as a problem.I would certainly recommend this hotel, and will stay here in future visits to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As the only property in NYC city that has a low enough category to be eligible for the free Hyatt credit card night, this property was our choice for a recent visit to NYC. The availability was excellent. The reservations were made less than a week prior to the visit, and there was no problem finding a room in the appropriate category which is more than I can say on most NYC hotels. The hotel seems to be a converted apartment building like many other hotels in this range (low-mid range, with free internet and breakfast). As such one can expect to have few elevators, and little space for hotel amenities. As expected the hotels has only 2 elevators, which in the morning time can result in long waiting time (this time it was about 12 minutes). This is to be expected; however the cleaning staff using the same elevator, basically blocking it completely should be avoided during the morning rush hour.Breakfast, as it is, was also a problem. I have come to slightly disappointed with the Hyatt Place breakfasts compared to the competitors. However, the big problem was the limited seating. In order to overcome this problem, there is a sign to wait to be seated. However this does not work very well. I was assigned my seat, and by the time I came back with the food it was already reassigned again (and as there was only one person doing the seating – by the same person). Luckily another seat just become available. “A” for effort, and “F” for execution. The room itself is small, but comfortable relative to NYC standard. For anyone who is used to Hyatt Place standard, it would be about half of the normal size. The bathroom though is well sized and comfortable to use. The designers made every part of the room useable which was nice. Internet was free and fast. As a Diamond I was apparently upgraded to high floor with a view (which was not available for sell); however the Diamond amenity of points is still not posted to my account.We had switched certificate in the middle of the stay, and all what was needed is to re-key the room key. I appreciated the seamless process and the honesty about the need for re-keying (as most place just tell you it is fine, but the key would not work when the certificate change occur).All in all, it would probably not be my first choice in NYC (as location is less than ideal for my need, and the breakfast experience); however using the Hyatt Credit card certificate I will sure be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at Hyatt Places before and I was shocked at first to stay in what has to be the world's smallest Hyatt Place, in terms of rooms and space that is. However, everything I needed was within a few paces inside the 235 square foot room. I had large windows and 2 sets of shades to block the morning sun. There was a small sofa bed which I did not use and the decor to me felt more like a Starwood Aloft hotel including the showers only in bathrooms. There were only 8 rooms on my floor and with only 2 elevators, wait times especially in the morning were lengthy and sometimes you had to wait to catch the next one. The fitness center was in the basement and seemed much too small. I would prefer some hotels simply subsidize a day pass to a nearby health club with more equipment and amenities. This is one of the few hotels that serve a hot, complimentary breakfast which is decent and there were 3 fast computers in lobby to print from. Wifi was very fast too. At first I did not like the cookie cutter concept of newer midtown Manhattan hotels where a new building goes up and is separated into 2-4 skinny hotels, but after staying the property and rooms begin to grow on you.The newness, nice location and pleasant outdoor terrace at front door make these environmentally certified hotels feel more like home. And I would consider it home more often if it were not for the ridiculous prices and high category award levels of New York hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you are not lucky you might get a room with a [--] view and quite noisy,unhelpfull staff. Sleeping was very difficult with the noise from the road and from the air conditioning and fridge , I have asked for a less noisy room but the staff was neither nice nor able to help.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A new hotel in a great location, near Herald Square, so great shopping in the immediate vicinity. Also near many subway stops for various lines, so very convenient to travel around. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Fitness center small and in the basement, but adequate machines with built in video systems, and there are towels and cold water available. Breakfast was fairly good, although crowded in the morning. The elevators were slow to arrive at times; allow an extra few minutes for this, and ask for a lower floor, so you can use the stairs if in a rush. Room was average size for NYC (meaning small anywhere else), but comfortable bed, nice large shower and a big flat screen television. To sum up, a good 'base of operations' for either business or tourist trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I read a lot of reviews about how elevators were slow breakfast was so crowded we didn't experience any of this people just like to complain about everything. This hotel was in a good location pretty close to everything we got a 2 queen room w a pull out sofa bed which is unheard of in NYC everything is usually just 2 double beds it's a newer hotel & rooms were very clean the front desk staff there was great especially Luis I would def return to this hotel next time I'm in NYC !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: If you spent time to do some homework, and is flexible in your vacation days, it is not hard to find very good rates for this midtown Hyatt Place even during busy seasons. You get everything you expect from any Hyatt Place, and more. The atmosphere is lively. The breakfast is above average. The room is spacious and clean. I will not hesitate to choose this hotel again if the rate is good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The location of this hotel is good. The gym is adequate. The complimentary breakfast is pretty good. Two old slow elevators for 25+ floors means you will wait a long time for the elevator. The bar is tiny, but the evening bartender Kevin is awesome and makes a mean martini. The cleanliness of the rooms is average--or so I thought until I found bed bugs in my bed! When I checked out a night early because of the bed bugs, the hotel charged me full price, and said they would need to conduct an investigation that would take 6 to 8 weeks long before issuing a refund. An investigation--even though I brought them a live bed bug in a water bottle and despite the fact that there was at least one smashed one on the bed sheets. But they gave me 10,00 Hyatt points to make it all good, as if I am going to stay at Hyatt in the future. Boo to Hyatt for the bed bugs and their refund policy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: we spent 3 nights in NY City and the Hyatt Place was perfect for us. As a family of 5 with two teenagers we had a hard time finding a good hotel, centerally located, for a reasonable price. This hotel has rooms accomodating 5 people (two double beds and a sofa bed). This was its main advantage for us. In addition, the hotel's location is great and so is the breakfast which is included in the room price. Although the room was quite small, it was very pleasant and clean, and we had a great view of the Empire State Building right outside our window!We would definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This place has a perfect location, closet o everything and surrounded by nice “real” (not only super crowded commercial) restaurants and stores.The staff is SUPER friendly and checking in and put is just a second.Rooms are well appointed, small fridge, nice tv channel selection with the paper view system, and the size is pretty decent for NY.The price is also fair. We will definitely stay here again: We moved from here to a Marriott in Times Square (DH wanted to be in the heat) and we regretted it a lot.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Recently stayed at the Hyatt Midtown for a few days in September. The location of the hotel is great. Its close to Penn Station, Harold Square and 34th street shopping. The hotel was very clean. The customer service was awesome and check in was easy. We were able to get a late check out (2pm) because we were rewards members. The room was a good size for a New York hotel. We stayed on the 22 floor with a view of the Empire State Building. There was also a small refrigerator in the room which came in handy. The internet service was easy to use and worked fine. The bed was comfortable. The hallways are a bit small and the elevators can be a little slow. They also have free breakfast available or you can go to a nice little bakery/sandwich shop right next door. They had very good breakfast sandwiches. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
