hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: What a great stay! This is a perfect example of Good Value. The location is just off the main traffic, so it's not loud, but it is super convenient.Arrived at midnight and check in was a breeze . Breakfast spread was spartan, but did not come across as cheap. There was sufficient variety and quantity of everything.The staff in the breakfast area were so polite and efficient with cleaning.Elevator wait is terrible though. Only 2 elevators, and, I forget how many floors, but there are probably 5-6 rooms on each floor (I didn't count)The gym is adequate, but the location in B1 means no view.Definitely would stay here again over any of the higher priced hotels in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Brand new hotel right in the center of the city. If you are looking for a good base to explore New York then this is the best place. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is brilliant. Great range of items including hot and cold food. Fantastic start to each day! Wifi didn't work in our room. We seemed to be out of range.. kind of annoying. Nearest subway station is 5 minutes walk away. All the main attractions are less than 15 minutes walk away. Very close to the empire state building. We stayed for just $149 + taxes. Hotels in NY are normally very expensive for terrible quality rooms. The owners of this hotel have done brilliantly. Highly reccomened place to stay if you are visiting NY for a few days. It really is the best place to stay if you want to walk about this great city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, great customer service. Rooms are good sized for New York City. Refrigerator in room comes in handy. Rooms are quiet and have dark shades. Free breakfast is great and even though it is listed as being available for a certain time frame they keep it open for last minute guests. Free newspapers delivered to the room and free Wifi. Staff is very knowledgeable about where attractions are and the transportation options to reach them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place for two weeks in September and cannot recommend it enough. I'm a frequent traveller to NYC and have always had horrible experiences at expensive business hotels (I have always found the major $400/night midtown hotels to have lousy service and old, dated rooms). I decided to give the Hyatt Place a shot as I was tired of paying up for shoddy treatment. And I'm so glad I did!First off, this is not a luxury hotel. You're not going to get a large lobby with a pianist; there's no bar, no restaurant, and no mini-bar in the room. Reception is relatively tiny and there's no doorman. In the vicinity are a Holiday Inn Express and a Best Western, so you get a sense of what segment this are appeals to. These are not things that bother me though.Check-in was a breeze, the receptionists were efficient and polite and ironically much better than those I'd encountered at the Grand Hyatt. As I was going to be staying there for 2 weeks, I was given a room on a high floor, which I greatly appreciated. The room itself was great. The hotel is only a few months old so everything in the room was new and modern looking. The TV is huge (47" I believe) and I also had a great view. My room was facing north but I understand the south-facing rooms have a great view of the Empire State Building. The rooms also have individual temperature controls which, for a change, actually work! There is a buffet breakfast every day. It's actually a really good variety, with cereals, fruit, oatmeal, muffins, sausages etc. The only thing is that the spread is the same day-after-day, so you do get sick of the food after awhile. Wifi is free throughout the building and very fast. There is a fitness centre in the basement. It's a bit claustrophobic but it's free, so no complaints. There are computers and printers you can use (for free!) in the lobby.I had a couple of packages sent to the hotel and they were delivered to my room. This is in contrast to more expensive hotels which often ask you to go to the mailroom to collect the packages yourself.Location is great. It's a 3 min walk to the Herald Sq subway stop, which has both the yellow and orange lines. It's 2-3 min walk to Macy's, 5 min from Koreatown, 10 min to Times Square and generally very accessible to all parts of Manhattan.Overall, I had a great experience here. Everyone, from the chambermaids to the bellhop to the receptionists, was polite. The room is large and modern and the free breakfast and wifi are icing on the cake. I will be recommending the Hyatt Place to friends. Why pay 70-80% more for "luxury" upscale hotels when you're likely to encounter indifferent staff and old rooms?

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Love it hereGreat free breakfast 24 hour rite around cornerVery cleanAll newGreat experienceUnexpected pleasureI've stayed in the best in city, this is great Option!Clean new and reasonable Staff truly sincereCAN'T think of a bad thing to say

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A great...excellent hotel! As we entered the hotel we were treated warmly, and check in was quick and our room was ready, and we arrived from the airport at 1 pm. A hot breakfast is available free, the hotel is extremely clean, the staff are friendly, and an excellent location. Close to the Empire State Building, walking distance from Times Square, and lots of restaurants in walking distance.You can order fresh food 24/7 in the hotel, free Internet. They have luggage storage which is safe and secure,and your room is very clean, large flat screen, and safe for valuables. A nice comfortable bed, and a good size bathroom. The only problem we think is housekeeping is very very slow. Our first full day, it was after 4 pm when our room was clean, and on our second day, we had to go to the front desk just before 4 pm and ask to get our room done. We believe that if Hyatt could work on getting this done quicker, it would make it. 101% hotel.We put service as average because of housekeeping......all other areas were Excellent!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Costs a little more than nearby hotels but you get a quieter stay, more space, and more professional service. The location is excellent especially if you need to use Penn Station. There is also a generous lobby area if you need to meet up with people.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel has a great location, very close to Empire State Bldg, Times Square and a short walk to Rockefeller center. It's brand new, nicely appointed, great staff, clean and nicely decorated rooms. We really appreciated the complimentary breakfast! Overall, I would rate this hotel as excellent and give it a high recommendation! Enjoy!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am so happy that I took a chance on this Hyatt in midtown. Super easy to get to from Penn station in a great location near so many things. The staff is courteous and profession and helped with directions and transportation info. The best part of this place was the included hot breakfast every morning. The breakfast host in the morning was cheerful and helpful. A real asset to the place. My room was upgraded to a corner room, was quiet and clean and perfectly furnished for my stay. If I needed any thing, the front desk was happy to accommodate. The only negative was after I got home, I had to sort out the reward points for my stay but that was no fault of the hotel. I will stay here again,

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We weren't sure what to expect with this lower tier Hyatt, but we were very pleased and hope to stay again. We lucked out with a top floor room, and although it didn't overlook the Empire State Building it still offered a fabulous view of the Manhattan skyline which our 8-year old granddaughter loved. Perhaps we were just fortunate, but we had no problems with the elevators. We weren't able to obtain a room with a pull-out sofabed, but the sofa proved to be surprisingly comfortable and the room was more than adequate for our party of 3.We did have to wait for breakfast one morning, but the line moved quickly and the food was good. We walked to Times Square and other major tourist attractions without a problem (did take a cab on a very hot day, and the cost was under $10). The hotel service was friendly and efficient. We will definitely check into Hyatt Place when we next visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for two nights. The room was tiny but the bed was comfortable. The shades in our room were broken. When I told them when I checked our she said they break all the time. The main problem was the elevators took forever. Also the line for breakfast was so long we ended up eating at the cafe next door. All employes were nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Location was great, and many mentioned close to Macy's, blocks to times square and a few blocks to train and hop on and hop off bus. We walked most of the time because there was so much in the area to see. Hotel was very nice, small rooms but NY that is the way it is. We were on the 20th floor facing the top of the building and a water tower not the best view so ask for the Empire state view. We found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. Yes, during busy mornings you wait for the elevators and breakfast can be busy between 8:30 on but not that bad. Free WIFI and they have computers that you can access your emails as well. Breakfast was ok nothing special but nice. People complain about tables but you can take your breakfast outside if you wanted and there were tables there as welll. Overall we thought that for the price this was a very nice hotel and well worth it from nice and new to clean and well maintainted.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Fresh new hotel in the middle of everything you want. The staff was above great, the breakfast was ready and delicious at 6:30am, maybe that is why we had no problems with crowds, but the dining area I thought was bigger than most hotels offering free breakfast. For a small room it did not feel small, everything fit well and the bathroom was standard size. They had no problem holding our bags after checkout so we could do more in midtown before leaving. Elevators can be busy but they are new and move fast so......everyone stop griping about things that are out of anyones control.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed for 3 nights and i love this place. The room is small but nice and clean. The location ia just great becausw is near Macy dept store and also close to korean town . Will certainly going back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Had a good experience there. Location is nice, price was good with breakfast included. The only bad experience was at the breakfast place, where no tables were available and it was crowded. However, the breakfast itself was ok overall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I just stayed here a few weeks ago, and I must say, it was a very nice property. Whoever designed it really used all of their industry knowledge and they have an excellent product in a very central location. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was perfectly laid out; the small closet brilliantly utilized smaller hangers to properly fit in, amenities were very solid, and they include a quite decent breakfast to tie into the trend where Europeans clearly value this immensely. I usually travel on business and really pay attention to detail, and this place is a very good hotel for both business and leisure travelers. Wireless worked very well which is key these days, and their staff was quite friendly. They had one major issue when I was there as one of the 2 elevators broke down which really was painful and many of us had to wait for immense amounts of time, but they did the right thing when I sent this issue in on a post-stay review. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a mid-priced, very convenient nice property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We were very pleased with our visit to the hotel. It's conveniently located close to Times Square and the Empire State building, the hop on/hop off bus pickup spot, subway, restaurants, and shopping. The room was very nice and modern and we had the sense that the hotel staff would happily help us out with anything we might have forgotten. The free breakfast was delicious. It's a large buffet served in a pleasant room with tables and even counters for large groups (or to provide a homey environment). A suggestion for the breakfast - it would be great to see a bit more variety. For 3 mornings there were skillet eggs, sausages, breadstuffs and pastries, fruit, cereal and oatmeal. A little variety in the eggs department would go a long way for people staying more than a night or two. My daughter was also disappointed to find that the oatmeal did not appear to be steel-cut (as promoted).Added bonus: there's a Pure and Fresh restaurant next door that stays open late. Great for everything from fruit cups and bottles of water to full, custom designed dinners of pasta or salad. Prices were great and the food delicious. We ate 3 meals there!Great hotel. We highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We decided to stay at the Hyatt Place on W 36th Street in NYC as we could use a free night we received for having a Hyatt Credit Card. We were given a small, but nice room on the 18th floor. Little did we realize that the two public elevators the hotel had are also used for staff. Hence, it took forever for an elevator to arrive and often when it did you had to share your ride with the cleaning crew and chemicals. The situation was even worse at breakfast. As the Hyatt Place has a free breakfast and the size of the room in which the breakfast was served was fairly small (much smaller than one would expect for a hotel with this many rooms), we had to wait in line for the food and then hunt for seats to eat at. After breakfast it was another wait for the elevators. While the room was nice and the price was right ($75 for the Hyatt credit card), unless you do not mind spending part of your vacation waiting around for elevators, my suggestion is to try a different hotel in midtown New York. Frankly, I do not know how they received a certificate of occupancy from New York City.When we checked out the staff asked how our stay was. I pointed out the long waits for the elevators as well as the breakfast and she says she hears this a lot from guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I chose this hotel for its location and we were not disappointed. It was very close to the Empire State Building, down the street from Herald Square and Macy's, as well as a few short blocks from Times Square. The service was excellent. The staff were all friendly and willing to help out with anything we needed. The breakfast was included with the room which is almost unheard of in NYC and it there was a large selection of food. The free wifi was a bonus which most other hotels we looked at in the Big Apple were charging extra for. We would not hesitate to stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I had to stay here on short notice and was quite impressed. Very new and week done. My room was quiet. The bathroom was super clean. There is a lot near the hotel. A new spot almost next door with drinks, smoothies, fresh fruit, etc....and the room had a small fridge. Just down the street is a Duane Reade and McDonalds if you need it. The front desk staff was friendly and arranged a car for me for the next AM and I was happy with that service also. I booked this through Expedia and it was a real value for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place was located very close to The Empire State Building, two blocks, and had incredible views. We selected this hotel since it was one of very few that would take a family of 5 in one room. It had a convenient location, short walk to restaurants, subway, and Times Square. Room was small for 5 people & luggage, but clean. Breakfast was included every morning, but had to be down there by 8 AM to sit together. I would definitely recommend to other travelers. Also had free wifi which was great for teens and smartphone users.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: From the outside, you may not expect much from what seems like a budget-oriented business hotel. I did. But I was pleasantly surprised to learn what a great hotel this is. Truly exceptional service, across the board. Very nice, clean rooms-- and the higher up you go, with truly great views. And on the corner of 36th and 6th Ave, it's hard to find a more convenient location. Would definitely return, and recommend to friends without hesitation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great concept from Hyatt. No frills, just what is needed. Rooms are small, but hey, it´s New York and rate is under 200... Great location, clean, staff attentive and friendly. Breakfast could be a little busy, expect some lines. Overall, I recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Spent two nights here with my wife and three kids for a quick stop in NYC. I have two teenage daughters, so we elected to get two rooms rather than squeeze into a two queen + sofabed room. Good decision, as the rooms are pretty small. Check-in was pretty easy. We had a car and five people to unload. There is a loading zone for the hotel right out front, and the bell staff did a pretty good job of keeping it clear for hotel patrons. We were met outside by a bellman with a cart who had our car (Yukon XL after 600 miles of family travel) unloaded in 5 minutes. Checked in at 4:00pm, but only one of our two rooms was available (we found out why later). Unloaded all of our stuff in one room while we waited for the second room (which was done by 5:00).Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable. Views from the 9th floor were unexciting but safe. The space itself will do just fine if you're using it as a place to leave your stuff while you enjoy the city, which is what we did. Rooms were quiet at night.Breakfast was a typical Hyatt Place AM Skillet--scrambled eggs, link sausage, bagels, pastries, cold and hot cereal, fresh fruit, and coffee for free. Specialty coffee drinks available right there for a fee. There was no line at 7:00 on the first morning. On the second morning, we arrived at 8:00, and found a line of about 20 people that moved pretty quickly (we were serving ourselves in 5 minutes). This Hyatt Place seems to have plenty of bell staff, but housekeeping seems very understaffed. We were on the 9th floor, and the housekeeping staff arrived in our room at nearly 6:00 pm. When we left for dinner at 7:30, they were still cleaning rooms on some of the lower floors. They work very hard, but seem to be a little overworked for the size of the hotel.It's a nice room for a pretty good price (especially if you shop around--we got our rooms for under $200 each) that is in a very convenient location (2 minute walk to Macy's and Herald Sq. metro stop, 5 minute walk to Times Square). Parking is available in a garage half a block away. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: During my recen t three day stay in NYC I stayed in 3 different hotels. While I truly enjoyed The Standard Highline and I had a not so good experience at the JFK Doubletree, I think Hyatt Place midtown provides great value for travelers on a moderate budget. It's contemporary decor, the great bed and shower, the great view on the Empire State Building and the fact that it is new, make it agreat place. Staff is friendly and corteous (although sometimes a bit pushy to sell airport transfers) and included brakfast is a nice amenity. Would stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in May and had a great experience. The rooms and hotel were very clean. A little tight for 5 women in one room, but we made it work. We had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building from our room. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They provided excellent service. The hot breakfast in the morning was great. The location was can't be beat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a clean and affordable place to stay in NYC. Elevators can be slow as there are only 2, they are small, and are shared with the staff. We didn't really have an issue with them, however. Looking forward to our next stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here in July for 3 nights and are so glad we chose this hotel.It's all about Location and you can't beat this hotel for that, Smack in the middle of Manhattan on 36th Street between 5th and 6th Ave.The staff are very helpful and friendly, they helped us with directions and gave us a great map to get around.We booked a room for 5 and were given a room on the 22nd floor with a spectacular view of the Empire State building. The room had 2 queen beds and a full size pull out sofa, large windows and a fridge.The bathroom was well equipped with plenty of towels and toiletries, both rooms were very clean.Free wifi is an added bonus here and we had no problems with the connection.The free breakfast was plentiful, with cereals, oatmeal, fresh fruit, bread, rolls, bagels, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage. The breakfast room does get busy at peak time which is around 9am but we always managed to get a table as people are coming and going all the time.If there are no tables available, you can take your breakfast and eat it at the tables in the reception area or even take it up to your room.I did see a lot of negative feedback about the elevators and we were worried about this being on the 22nd floor. There are only 2 small elevators but I can honestly say we never had a problem, maybe we were just lucky but we never waited any more than a couple of minutes for an elevator and we used them at all different times of the day and night!This really is a little gem of a hotel and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice hotel because its new, nice staff, and the price is decent. Good sized room for NYC and nice bathoom. Elevators are slow, but what's more annoying is the free breakfast is impossible to get at....lines out to the lobby, just an absolute circus. Went down the street and bought breakfast instead.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The Hyatt Place segment of the Hyatt empire has a lot going for it. And this hotel keep up that image. 36th street is slowly being reclaimed from ugly to decent and the new hotels like the Holiday Inn express right next door. and Hyatt Place are good additions. The room was typical new NYC hotel, small but clean and bright with it own mini refrigerator. The breakfast kitchen in the morning is fantastic with really good food but can be a zoo if you eat after 8AM. The bath was fine, the bed was great. The staff very friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We chose this hotel for a two night stay in New York based on using the chain in other states. Understandably the rooms here were smaller, (this is NY!). The room was larger than many we had in posh Fifth Avenue locations. The decor was lovely, the lighting made it easy to read wherever you were in the room. The staff was very helpful, we were given a room on the 22nd floor facing the Empire State Building, an extra perk. Breakfast had many choices, and thoigh crowded we were able to locate a table each morning. If the worst thing I have to say is the shades were a little difficult to maneuver, you can see this was a great hotel experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location in Koreatown/Garment district area. Very attentive friendly staff at the front desk, who gave us an upgrade to the top floor, thanks! Beautiful clean room with plenty of space and a great view across Manhattan. Now the down side, the breakfast area is way too small for the number of people using it, and it quickly turned into a scene from a high school cafeteria. There was food left everywhere, on tables, on the floor. No reflection on the staff, but there were not enough cleaning to cope with the number of people (and quite frankly, their table manners). The two rather sluggish elevators were also somewhat overloaded during peak times (check-in/check out), requiring a book to read while you waited (sometimes as much as 10 minutes) for the elevator to reach the top floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at the hotel for three nights and enjoyed the easy commute to Times Square (less than a 10-minute walk on Broadway) and Bryant Park (under 5 minutes). Subway lines were nearby and Penn Station was a short walk away. We had a room on the 18th Floor with a view of the Empire State Building which was nice...this location also afforded us a VERY quiet room - something almost unheard of in a Midtown hotel! Yes, the elevators are just as slow as other reviewers have posted but that was really my only "negative" about the hotel. Tip: Hair dryers are in the drawer under the TV.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First time ever in NYC and this is the place that greeted me; BEST service, BEST location, and BEST atmosphere. From the front desk check in to the front desk check out everything and every one was amazing. Special shout out to the boys and their Hyatt "hi". Raul, was our personal guide and consultant, what they do not have those, well fooled me. He answered ever question and gave us ideas for our sight seeing with an excitement that made us feel that he truly enjoyed what he did. Honestly, the entire staff was amazing. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks for making my first experience in NYC the best ever.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hyatt Place opened about 5 months ago, so brand new and very nicely done in contemporary style. Rooms on the small side but big enough for a bed and sofa and very well designed and comfortable. We had one on the 19th floor with great view of empire state bldg so ask for that. Bathrooms nice but no tub, just shower. Great complementary breakfast with many choices hot and cold - not your average hampton inn or holiday inn express ( there's one right next store incidentally). The location on west 36th street while not as nice as upper east side (e.g.) is quite convenient for theater district, herald square, no far from fifth ave and madison ave. shopping. Looked like a nice heathclub although we did not use it. We paid about $200 with senior discount in July, so very good value for NY. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Wonderful stay at the Hyatt. Staff was friendly and very helpful when it came to directions and subway routes. Rooms are brand new and have very comfortable beds. The breakfast was the highlight, not just the usual continental breakfast. There is a variety for hot dishes, eggs done 2 ways, sausage, either pancakes,or French toast, loads of fresh fruit, yogurt, hot and cold cereal, pastries, bagels and breads, a great start to a full day of sightseeing. Location was good to close to a lot of attractions. We never had a problem with seating for breakfast, but we are early risers and were having breakfast by 8:00 or 8:30. The view wasn't the best (tops of other buildings) but we didn't go to New York to see the view from a hotel room. Would recommend this hotel to friends and would stay again on our next trip to the Big Apple

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As long as you're not expecting a four star experience, this is a good choice. The fairly-extensive breakfast is a plus as is the newness of the rooms. It's also nice that the number of rooms per floor is low, so it is quiet and you don't get that institutional feel of bigger hotels with the endless hallways. The immediate neighborhood is not very attractive but is central to transportation and midtown businesses. Clientele appeared to be a mix of European tourists and mid-level accountant-types. The staff was polite and attentive.On the downside, every morning from 6:30 am on, the housekeeping cart was parked next to the elevator. Not the best sight. Also, the milk in one of the breakfast pitchers was starting to sour two different mornings. Views are non-existent, although that isn't uncommon for NYC hotels. And as others have noted, the elevators were crowded.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We spent 2 nights in Hyatt Place and it was a great stay. Hotel is located just perfectly and the price is very reasonable. We enjoyed breakfast every morning, which was delicious. This is not simple continental breakfast with super-processed muffin from a plastic foil, but good meal to start your day. Oatmeal (steelcut, not instant packages to mix with boiled water), eggs, sausages, cottage cheese, yogurt, fruits and pastries (different each day) + all kind of regular continental breakfast stuff like peanut butter, jelly, bread, cereales etc. Coffee, tea, milk, OJ, tomato juice and water. The sitting area is bigger than usually, still could be better, but you don't have to take food to your room or eat standing. We had to wait once, but not too long. The hotel looks pretty new, very clean, nice lobby area, very friendly and helpful staff.Our view from the room was not amazing, some roofs and airconditioning vents, but we didn't spend much time watching views from a hotel room:) Wifi is free! The only thing that was pretty annoying was elevator. There are only two, and many floors, what makes it impossible to get into one during breakfast time. On the other hand morning 10floor climb is good for your body so I liked it at the end of the day:)Rooms are not the smallest in NYC but also not the biggest, they're ok. There is a good steakhouse next door. Also menu of hotel bar looked good, althought we didn't have a chance to try. We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is another solid Hyatt Place that makes the brand stand out from similar chains. The rooms were clean and the staff were very helpful all the way around. The location is really great too - only a short walk to Penn Station. A few issues to point out, none of which were all that bad. First, the rooms are a bit small, but only because they are packed with excess furniture. If traveling with a baby, I would avoid this hotel unless you get an accessible room which has a little more floor space. Second, the travel crib given to us was very dirty...so we ended up buying one of our own. The elevators can get bottle-necked and you end up waiting for a while and packing in with lots of others. Finally, the breakfast area is always jammed, which is a little frustrating. All in all however, happy with the stay and would likely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a relatively new property that we stayed at in late June. The rooms are small but adequate. Our room had a shower versus tub shower combination, but this seems to be the new norm for this category of hotel. Service met our expectations and the morning breakfast included in the room price helped us save money. The hotel is less than a 10 minute walk to two main subway stops so it is easy to get around the city with this convenience. The neighborhood is clean and safe.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In it's category, the Hyatt Place on 36th between 5th and 6th ave.s is stellar. A new building helps, but so does a staff who is truly there to serve. the rooms are very clean, comfortable and quite spacious for Manhattan. The inclusive breakfast is top notch with lots of variety. 2 types of well made scrambled eggs each morning, several choices of fresh fruit, oatmeal (this was instant type), many choices of quality teas; and it is open and well stocked PAST closing time. They allowed us to check in early, and with a smile. Kept our luggage for us after we checked out until we picked it up for our trip home. An excellent value for it's location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Staff super nice! Very clean, quiet. Perfect for my kids, 10 and 12. Excellent location to see sites. Hit breakfast before 9am. Too crowded later. Convenient kid friendly places to eat in 1 block pr less.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was able to get room for $150 before taxes, which made this one of the best NY deals going. The rooms are clean and modern, with free WiFi. Location is great for getting around the city, with Penn. station with access to the subway or the LIRR to Jamaica for JFK. As other reviewers have said, the elevator can get backed up. I must have waited over 5 minutes for the elevator on my way out one the morning. Staff was friendly and courteous. I will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was there for two nights and it was a very good experience. The breakfast included hot items that were very good. The room was small but very clean and had everything I needed. At times the elevators can get backed up - only two elevators for the entire hotel. Next time I may stay on a lower floor to give me the option to walk but I will definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt for 5 days and it was amazing! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (especially Raul). They were able to give us directions and suggestions on places to go. They held our bags even after we checked out so we could walk around while we waited for the airplane. There was a nice hot breakfast every morning. Housekeeping was very nice and on top of any requests we had. The hotel is newer and very clean. This was the only hotel that we could find that had a pull out couch and allowed 5 people to stay in 1 room. The location is great. It is very close to the Empire State building. We also walked to Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, and Time Square. I would definitely stay here again and suggest it to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My wife an I just returned from six nights at the Hyatt Midtown and feel it offers an excellent location and good value for the money. The breakfast buffet is included in your room rate and offers freshly prepared hot items as well as cereal, fruit and pastries. We would absolutely stay here again, mainly because of the terrific service. The staff were all engaging, pleasant and helpful. Although the hotel had only been open since March, everything seemed to be running smoothly. No pool, a small(ish) fitness room, but a good price for the area and for the service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: What a wonderful experience we had at the Hyatt! We went for the weekend and the staff is exceptional. A special thank you to Raul, he was always ready to assist our group in any way he could. His professionalism and friendly demeanor made our trip even better. Very clean rooms and the location was awesome. Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I should first qualify this review by sharing that I used points for my stay. I also have Platinum status with Marriott and Gold with Hilton. I currently do not have "status" with Hyatt. However, I've stayed at 10+ Hyatt Places when traveling for business in the past, and since I had the family with me, thought this particular hotel would be a great choice. Given the raving fans, I had high expectations. That was a mistake. Yes, the staff is friendly and responsive but frankly, they didn't really seem to be on top of things. Issue #1: when checking in (after 4PM), room we were assigned was not ready as there was still food in the mini-fridge, personal items left by the previous guest, and linen service was not quite finished. Yes, we were assigned another room, which was great but point is whole situation could have been avoided. Issue #2: I was told parking on the street was OK so long as you read the signs, which I did. What I (and apparantly the staff) didn't know was that due to a parade on the Sunday of my stay, all cars left on the street Sunday morning were towed. The parking authority said signs were posted for days. Problem is I was only in town for the weekend and didn't know or see any signs. Perhaps the staff missed them too. Issue #3: For no apparant reason, we heard dripping (think bad faucet) noises coming from the bathroom starting around 2AM. When we checked, source of the noise was a small but persistent leak coming from the ceiling. Suffice to say by morning, all towels were on the bathroom floor, soaked. We elected to leave first thing in the morning but after waiting for the elevators for 15 minutes, decided to walk down the stairs. Good thing we were not not on a high floor, but 18-20 flights of stairs does take its toll. So in short, my experience can be summed up as not so easy check-in, little to no sleep, no shower in the morning, unanticipated exercise (which I guess can be a positive), and a missing car in the morning. In situations like this, I guess I should ask for a refund, but since I used points, I doubt I'll get any consideration. I am especially disappointed since this is a new facility. I have to believe this is an isolated experience, but for travelers considering this facility, don't believe the hype.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: this hotel sets an example for all hotels....we arrived very early in the morning, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They tagged our luggage and safely stored it so we could visit New York without worry...they even allowed our group to enjoy the exceptional breakfast they serve daily...amazing selection that you wouldn't expect at a hotel. I cannot express enough how friendly ALL the staff were. The rooms were a little small, but you are in New York...but we managed with 5 people in the room anyway. The location was perfect and within walking distance of most everything you would want to see and do...Empire State Building was a perfect view outside hotel window. Anything else you may want to see is a short cab or subway ride away. Upon checking in later that day, the staff again was most helpful...very, very friendly. The next morning, we were again treated to an exceptional breakfast, served hot and delicious. We were allotted a late check out..2pm...at no additional cost...and upon checkout, the staff again tagged and stored our luggage. Our train did not leave until 8pm and what do you think the hotel allowed us to do????After we did our sightseeing for the day, and needed someplace to rest our feet until we needed to head to Penn Station....we hung out in the lobby of the hotel and continued to be treated as guests.....unheard of....EVERY SINGLE EMPLOYEE at the Hyatt Place Midtown deserves to be congratulated on their kindness to us, and I want to personally "Thank " each and everyone of you...What a wonderful experience!!! Highly recommend this hotel....I have NOTHING negative to say about this hotel...I Love New York and the People

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Visited the Hyatt Place Midtown with my husband for a three night birthday getaway! I've been to NYC four times before, however this was my husbands first time. I tried to prepare him for the minuscule hotel rooms, and the usually rushed and sometimes rude hotel staff. Boy did the Hyatt Place prove me wrong!!!We arrived at 1pm and got a room right away on the 18th floor with a perfect view of the Empire State Building. The room was very spacious for NYC standards, new, spotless, modern, HUGE TV and perfect water pressure!Free in room Wi-Fi, which is almost unheard of in Manhattan, came in handy and always worked. Free breakfast was perfect, also almost unheard of in the city. Eggs, sausages, breakfast sandwiches, cottage cheese, yogurt, fresh fruit, whole wheat and white bread, bagels, cereal, oatmeal...oh and let's not forget the sweet pastries! Honestly, what more could you ask for?The staff was always friendly, smiling and happy to help. The location was PERFECT. Bryant Park, Herald Sq (Macy's), Empire State, Times Sq, Rockefeller, all within walking distance. Central Park is 20 blocks uptown, which really isn't that far if you don't mind walking, with lots to look at (and shop) on your way! Or, just hop on the Subway. I can honestly go on and on. There are only 2 elevators, which a couple times took maybe a 5min wait, but really if thats all you can complain about...please! My husband and I will definitely stay here again and will recommend to anyone! Thank you, thank you, thank you Hyatt Place!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We have a Hyatt card which gets us free nights each year. We used them here and we were very pleased. Good breakfast, good modern room, great location with the subway just a block away. Make sure you have cash in tens, 5s and singles if you want to buy your metrocard from this subway station because the machines weren't taking credit card or giving change. Definitely recommend getting a room as high up as possible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All Staff high quality and good communication with customers , specially Raul is good person and he has a good communication and really he is nice person. Rooms are clean and the restaurant is good for the phreak fast . I recommend this hotel for all cause a lot of reasonStaff are goodLocation is excellent Price is OkHave a good time in this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great hotel and excellent location. Excellent service, pleasant staff. Would stay again!!! Great deal for 5 guests in midtown. Great amenities near hotel and very close to subway. Great view of Empire State Building on 14th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Place for 9 nights from end May - early June.Location : Perfect. 34St Herald Square Subway stop just round the corner, which is served by N,Q,R and B,D,F lines so it was very convenient to go to all the places we needed to go. We explored NY city on our own. Downloading the subway map onto our smartphone was the best thing we did. Macy's and JC Penney was just round the corner.Room : The room was very clean, the bed was most comfortable, and we had no elevator issues at all. One thing to note was the shower water pressure - there is no control for the water pressure. You can only control the hot/cold temperature but the water pressure is fixed, which we found it to be a tad too low but it wasn't a major issue. There were only 2 of us, so the room size was just right for us. Besides, we only got back after dinner each day just to sleep.Breakfast : The free breakfast was a major plus. We saved heaps by having breakfast in the hotel. And we really enjoyed the NY bagels. We got to the breakfast room early, around 8.30am and always managed to find a seat, but those who came around 9ish had problems finding seats. And no, we didn't get sick of the breakfast eventhough we had it for 9 straight mornings. The hotel lends out adaptors, hair straighteners, curling irons etc for free. We requested for an adapter the first night we arrived, and were told they had loaned them all out. We left our names and checked with front office on 2 other occasions but the answer was always the same : they had loaned them all out. We were hoping to be given priority since we were staying for 9 nights. But even when we checked out, we never got to use the adapters.We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This new Manhattan hotel on 36th st. between Fifth and Sixth is modern comfortable, and centrally located. Rooms are of a good size. 42 inch TV, wifi are provided. A good buffet breakfast is included in the room charge. Staff is pleasant and helpful. The rack rate for a single room was $565 in June, so you are advised to look for discounts.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Our first stay in the garment district of New York City, and we were delighted by the location. It’s an easy walk from the Port Authority Bus Terminal, around the corner from Macy’s and other big retailers of Herald Square, near all subways, easy walk to theaters. Our room, #1807 had perfect crisp linens, good bed, a small but well-lit desk with wall outlets for electronics, small refrigerator. A large window gave great light to the room and opened just enough to get fresh air. With the windows open, the street traffic noise came in loud & clear—ok for us former New Yorkers, but almost perfectly blocked just by closing the windows. Air conditioning worked fine when windows were closed. Couch and leather hassock nice for reading, well-lit with wall sconces, same for bed. The small hanging closet had a full-length mirror inside, an ironing board and iron and a safe. Our only issue was maneuvering around each other—the room looks spacious but has some tight corners. Making my way from the side of the bed nearest the wall to the couch area, for instance, I almost always caught my foot in the bedding at the “open” side of the bed. Be careful. Excellent Wi-fi. Shower in our room, no bathtub, super-clean. Free breakfast was the most imaginative encountered—I had a spinach, tomato, egg, ham, cheese open-faced hot sandwich, strong starbucks coffee, fresh OJ . Fruit and pastry (tiny Danish, small donuts, muffins) were available along with usual cereals, etc. A surprisingly large breakfast area—we came down around 8:30 am on Friday morning, joined a short line for the buffet, easily found a table. However at 9:30 am the dining area was completely full. To make room, we took our second cup of coffee and newspaper into the lobby seating area, which was virtually empty. This area was full of hotel chains—next door was a Holiday Express, around the corner a Marriott and a Hilton Garden Inn. The neighborhood is also known for Korean food—we cut through a parking garage to 35th Street in a downpour and had a good meal with cheerful service at Hanbat Restaurant, 53 W. 35th St. Loved the classy wood décor with low moveable partitions for flexible seating. Our Pajun pancake would have served six, the pork in a spicy sauce (don’t recall the name) was delicious. Immediately next door to the Hotel is a very clean & well-stocked kind of fresh-food deli, from which I had a take-out chopped salad the first night. Since our three-day stay was on “points” I can’t speak to price—When I checked the online Hyatt and Priceline list prices, I found a weekend rate of $148—a terrific bargain—but this changed radically for weekday stays. We would definitely stay again if we could--staff was friendly and accommodating, lobby is comfortable with plenty of seating. If you feel like relaxing outside, there are nice metal tables and chairs outside the front door. There are exercise machines on the Lower Level--we didn't try them, but they looked in good shape. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: A great location and excellent breakfast included.Our only issue was that we poked this hotel because it said it could accommodate a family of 5 (2 adults & 3 children). However when we got there, we were given 2 rooms that weren't even together. So my husband and I had to separate and have the kids in with us! Not exactly a romantic New York holiday.. 3 doors apart! Other than this and the fire alarms going off accidentally at 3am, I can highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Not enough good things to say about this hotel stay for a best friend weekend! Perfect location. Close enough to the hustle & bustle of midtown, but far enough to have some solace at the end of the day. Staff is INCREDIBLE. Honorable mentions are: Lizette & Amanda at the front desk. However, ALL front desk staff were ultra helpful! They answered all questions and made lots of recommendations for us! Air was not working in the room on the first night, reported it and it was back on by the end of the day when we got back. Plus, they kindly adjusted my bill for the inconvenience. Clean & spacious rooms for NYC. Loved the shower! Comp. breakfast was a bonus/pretty good quality, because after all, you are in NYC and it is nice to save on breakfast!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed at this BRAND NEW Midtown hotel in May 2013. Greeted by great staff who genuinely wanted to ensure I had a nice stay. Room was surprisingly spacious with very comfortable beds and crisp linens. Breakfast was a treat. Lovely egg entrees, fresh fruit and fresh pastries. Coffee was hot and excellent.Thomas at the front desk was fantastic.Only negative was the extremely long line for the lift.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: New or redone recently, very nice hotel well situated despite having to wait for the elevator (2 lift for 26 floors) and the breafast is "help yourself" kind where you have to be patient enough to get your "american" coffee and lucky to find a place to sit to drink it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Place New York because the property was new and we wanted to check it out as we frequently stay at Hyatts (we are both Diamond level in the Gold Passport program). The location was great--an easy walk to shopping, theatres and restaurants. The hotel has been open for a few months now and everything was new. Despite the newness of our room, housekeeping could do a better job focusing on the details in order to ensure that the rooms look good for years to come. Some examples in our room include--vacuuming the baseboards of the bed (there was a press-on fingernail lying here), wiping down the shower drains to remove the long hair, and cleaning or replacing any obviously dirty items (the white pen and stationary were neatly displayed on the desk and it's difficult to see how anyone could have missed the brown sticky soda blotches on the pen when setting up the desk for the next guests).The other complaint we had was that the hotel website uses a lot of standard Hyatt Place pictures, including showing the typical Hyatt Place room that has the large sectional sofa that converts into a bed. The implication being that if you are used to Hyatt Places, you would expect a larger room with a separate sitting area. Therefore, we were surprised to discover that our room was extremely small and cramped for two people. We can understand that space in New York is tight, but management should use accurate pictures of the rooms on the website so as to set proper expectations. Had we known space was going to be an issue, we would have stayed at another Hyatt property since we like to hangout in our rooms during down time.The service was friendly and the staff acknowledged our Diamond status on check-in. The only improvement we can suggest is to add more staff to the front desk--we usually had long wait times whenever we called. The Hyatt Place is not a full service hotel, so we didn't interact with many other staff.We stayed here because we were curious. For the price we paid, we will probably stay at another Hyatt property the next time we visit New York. Overall, we'd give the property an average rating in light of our experience with Hyatts.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My daughters and I stayed at the Hyatt Place during our most recent trip to NYC and loved it. The service was friendly and responsive which says a lot especially in NY. The hotel was clean,modern, and the rooms were quiet and clean. I don't understant the negative reviews regarding the hotel. The elevators are a little slow during peak hours but not a big deal.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The title says it all. I went on a trip with my boyfriends family and this hotel could not have been any more perfect.It is a new hotel that just opened in March of this year. The rooms were very nice and extremely clean. The staff were very friendly, kind and extremely helpful. They provided excellent suggestions for 1st time visitors in the Big Apple! This hotel offers a full continental breakfast included with your stay and free Wi-Fi! I will definitely return to this hotel for my next trip to N.Y.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at Hyatt Place in Midtown on May 18th. I had just flew in from Hong Kong and it turned out that I caught some sort of stomach virus. I felt awful but Ray and Amanda were so helpful and provided what I needed for a comfortable stay. Even the chef cooked up a bowl of oatmeal just for me! The service is very good and made my stay a memorable one (in a good way). - Yi Zhou

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is new so it is fresh, clean and modern.The room and bathroom is a good size for NY, the bed and TV are large. The room has a coffee/tea machine something you don't see to often. Breakfast was included, it had a greta selection of hot and cold food, baked goods, cereal, Starbucks coffee, juices and more!The front desk was very helpful and efficient.For me it was the perfect location right in midtown so easy to go in any direction and still in the middle of it all!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here with my 18 year old son and his best friend. They were attending the NFL Draft and the location could not have been better! Both of our rooms were a decent size and very clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The prices of drinks in the hotel bars are outrageous, even for NYC. But overall, we had a great stay and will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I took my mom to NYC as a Mother's Day gift for 4 days/3 nights. I spent 2 weeks researching this trip and looked up many hotels. The Midtown Hyatt was one of the least expensive and definitely the best deal. We arrived by train at Penn Station. It was a first time visit to the Big Apple for both of us. The hotel is close to the train station as well as the subway and right around the corner from Macy's at Herald Square! Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff could not have been any nicer. We were given a free room upgrade and our room was amazing. Clean and comfy. The view from our beds was the Empire State building. We slept like babies which for me isn't easy to do. I have had 3 lumbar back surgeries since 12/2010 and how I was going to sleep was a concern. The elevators were not a problem for us and we met the cleaning staff more the once. They were friendly and very helpful with supplying us with whatever we needed for our room. We enjoyed the free breakfast- as my mom commented- with real silverware and dishes :) The food was good and the coffee fantastic. After running around seeing as much as we could see everyday- returning to the Midtown Hyatt was a joy. We will be staying at the Midtown Hyatt again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: NYC Hotels are expensive so we obtained the Hyatt Chase Credit Card and stayed at this property free for 3 nights (using multiple individual free nights). This is a deal ... check it out !!This is a newly opened property so everything was in excellent condition. It's the perfect location for short travel time to Lower Manhattan or the Upper West Side. There are nice bars and restaurants close with the world's largest Macy's only 2 blocks away. For those Victoria Secret Fans there is a very large store across from Macy's that has an awesome "Pink" section with many New York items that are far cuter than the basic NYC items you'll find every 5 feet throughout the city.Our group really loved this property ... we were lucky to receive a view room on the 22nd floor looking directly at the Empire State Building ... what a view !! Our room was quite large for New York and the amenities were great. The complimentary breakfast area is very nice with a wide variety of options that should satisfy anyone.Regarding the Hyatt Staff at this property ... We LOVED Paulina and all the staff at the front desk ... these young adults always had a smile on their face and were helpful with all our questions. It really does make a difference when you are greeted and responded to nicely. Hyatt Management is extremely fortunate to have this staff ... so please don't forget to reward them for all the nice reviews !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My husband and I enjoyed our weekend stay. Good location - the subway station is around the corner. Easy access to most of Manhattan. Just opened not long ago. The rooms/public areas were modern, clean. They are on the small side but that is typical in New York. Not a lot of frills but it has everything you need. The breakfast was very good, hot items (eggs, toast, pancakes, sausage, etc.) along w/cold (cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc.) The egg sandwiches served weekdays were especially tasty! The business center in the lobby w/computer access was handy as was the free Wi-Fi. There is a small seating area out front and a good restaurant next door for a quick bite.Very friendly, helpful staff. They were very accommodating. Maria in housekeeping went above and beyond. She helped me with not one, but two trips to bring breakfast up to the room. They also accommodated us when we requested to be moved to a higher floor due to noise. When we asked for information that the gentleman at the front desk did not know, he made a point to find it and contact us with it.In reading previous reviews, we initially chose a room on the second floor which faced front to avoid long elevator wait time. This was a mistake! You could hear people talking outside all hours, traffic was much louder than on a higher floor. We requested a room on a higher floor and were moved to the 24th floor. This was much better. You could still hear traffic but nothing like before. The elevator wait was not a problem. Of course there was one but no more than a few minutes.Overall, it was a good stay. We would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I feel this is a typical NYC hotel. The one good thing going for it right now is that it's almost brand new so the room and bathroom are still in excellent condition. We did have the complimentary breakfast the hotel offered, and it was just average. Eggs were horrendous (powdered?). They offer breads and pastries, fruit, juices, hot and cold cereal, breakfast sausage and pancakes. Coffee was good. We drove in from Long Island, and the hotel has a deal with a parking garage on the same block. I would stay here again, but it was not cheap.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here Saturday thru Tuesday and could not say enough about the hotel and staff. Service was beyond what you would expect. They were so friendly and geniuely nice here. It is close to the subway and easy access to alot of things. Bar/restaurant across the street, shopping very close and they give you breakfast in the morning included with your stay. Not the cheap donut and rolls but Hot delicious meal. Anyone traveling will like this place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I enjoyed my stay at this location in New York. It was very close to where I do business and really enjoyed that. The room was cozy and clean! The staff were very friendly and inviting! The only thing that wasn't my favorite was the food. It's ok but not my favorite and I don't understand why if you order food they can't just bring it up to the room. You have to go to the lobby to get it. Elevators do get pretty crowded in the mornings too!Overall it was nice and I would definitely go back! The restaurant next door has really good salads, soups, sandwiches and pastas!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the new Hyatt Place in New York City. The hotel is very new, but has definitely worked out the "kinks" they had that were mentioned in previous reviews. The rooms were very comfortable with nice linens and amenities. The breakfast was very good and had choices for everyone - juices, fresh fruit, egg sandwiches, oatmeal, cold cereals, toast, bagels, yogurt, Danish, etc. It does get a little busy at breakfast (not unlike any other hotel that includes breakfast), but the difference here is that the staff are refilling things constantly and even the General Manager (Jason Crotto) pitches in and helps at breakfast - he clears tables, refills the food stations, seats guests, etc. He truly cares about the hotel, the guests and the staff. The location is great- close to subways, buses and walking distance to most NY attractions.The free WiFi and the 3 free computers in the lobby are great amenities also. The elevators were only a problem at breakfast time and then only a short wait of 2 - 4 minutes when busiest - certainly tolerable. The closet was also a bit small, but adequate. Very nice bathrooms with a fabulous shower. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay here again!I think the Hyatt properties has developed a great mid price option in this line of hotels. We stayed at another Hyatt Place near Boston and are now converts to this hotel line and will try them whenever they are available when we travel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We just returned from NYC and stayed at this Hyatt Place. We chose this property for the location and free breakfast. Upon arrival they informed us there was only 1 room left with two queens (which is what we requested). But it was a handicapped room on the 7th floor. The room was huge because it was a handicapped room. We also found that being on a lower floor at this property is a MUST. The elevators are horrible and it takes 20-30 min to wait for one. I would come back but would say on the 2nd or 3rd floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Was there to party in town, just found this wonderful little place with no overpriced room. Modern, new, comfortable. Pretty large room for NCY, Large shower, super shade system which makes the room super dark to sleep in the morning. Yeah elevators are slow... but are you aware that you can use the stairs... request a lower room. They have a gym and continental breakfast !

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I love this hotel. Its the newest hotel in town and is very clean. It provides you with everything you need at a great price especially with a locatioin that is close to all Manahattan places of intest including the Times Square, of course. Room was super clean with a frig and a sofa bed. Small but space is very well designed. Shower (Both cold and hot water) was great. The room has cental heating/ air conditioning with thermostat. Food was good with good variety. However, the bed was firm and uncomfortable. Also, the elevator is small and slow. Other than that, it's a great hotel. Finally, I have to mention Amanda, the hotel receptionist, who took care of us from A to Z including extending check-out until 2:30 PM. Thanks Amanda!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: While staying here for work I left an expensive item in the room. When I called to try to get it back, it was completely unaccounted for. Even after speaking with Hyatt corporate, there was no way to get it back as it had seemingly disappeared somewhere in the housekeeping department.Someone here has sticky fingers. I would highly recommend staying away from this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed 3 nights. Got there about noon & expected to drop off luggage till room was available. They had one ready on 2nd floor, so we took that one & checked in. Not the biggest but it worked for us. Everything was clean & fresh & we could use the stairs to come & go. Now for the breakfast!!! They had 3 juices - cereal - donuts - english muffins - fresh fruit - mixed cut up fruit - yogurt - then every day there was a different main dish - eggs & sausage - breakfast sandwich - french toast. What more do people want??? Also there were always 2 or 3 servers keeping the room clean because a lot of people were to lazy to clean up their table for the next guest. I would also say that there were about 75-80 places to sit. Not a long wait if everything was taken. We never had to wait for a table. We didn't have any problems with anything while we were there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We recently spent the week-end at this Hyatt property and were delighted with our experience. The location worked well for us, with a wedding in Central Park and reception on Bond St., it was centrally located, and having Macy's around the corner was a draw for many. The entire staff could not have been nicer, nor more helpful. It was nice that it is a new property and everything is immaculate and in good working condition, bed was wonderful, size of room for NYC was quite adequate and we had a lovely view. What more do you need? We found the breakfast to be plentiful and tasty each day, so nice not to have to go out to eat in the morning. By mistake, we left a cell phone charger in the room, which the housekeeper found and turned in and which was returned to me, thereby saving me $30.00 to replace it. I am quite sure that that would not have been the case in all hotels! So...we shall return to this property and shall recommend it to our friends!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great location, VERY roomy rooms given it's NYC, refrigerator, great customer service and the morning breakfast buffet is the bomb! Plus, we had an amazing view of Empire State...beautiful at night! We have a family of four, with two six-foot teenage boys in the mix, and we had room to move for the first time in a long time given we were in a room in the City. I can't recommend this hotel enough, and it will definitely be our go-to property from now on...thanks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This place is new and has clean modern rooms and bathrooms. The location is nice as well, especially for tourists. The free daily breakfast was nice, except the OJ tasted like Sunny Delight. However, it was downhill from there. We had no house keeping during our entire 3 night stay for some reason, though we were out of the room plenty. We had to call downstairs for extra towels, soap, and toilet paper. Our room key quit working half way through our trip; that was annoying. The bell hop was not very helpful, but expects tips anyway. Check-in took forever. Though the overall stay was fine, there are probably better choices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Yeah... if you are a fan of motel 6... but this place is a big embarrassment for Hyatt... what a huge disappointment.Positive:It's newFriendly, helpful StaffLocationNegative:God awful slow cheap elevatorsTiny closetssmall roomslighting sucksFood is disgusting In the end... great staff to bad they ended up at this cheap Hyatt dump... The new Best Western and the Holiday Inn Express next-store are far nicer... did I mention the elevators are painfully SLOW!!! This place is a big deal to the budget traveler... but for you Hyatt loyalist it's a big disappointment Hyatt missed the ball on this property!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Place one night recently and found it to be a good deal for a last minute stay. It is brand new, so everything was in perfect condition.The room is a nice size for NYC and the bed was very comfortable. We were on the 18th floor, so we had a nice view of buildings around us. The free wi-fi was pretty lousy so I stuck to my Verizon LTE connection. We skipped the breakfast, so I can't comment on that. We had no issues with the elevators, but perhaps we were coming and going at odd times? I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel we were a little apprehensive about a family of five (3 teenagers 16, 18, 19) staying here. We booked the room with the two queens and the pullout couch but decided last minute to book an additional room with a king bed. The rooms were of decent size and we could have all stayed in the one room no problem. The king room was perfect for a couple. I don't really understand the complaints as the hotel was excellent. Quick check-in, nice clean rooms and a fantastic level of service from all staff. The free breakfast in the morning was an added bonus and there was lots to choose from. Staff in the buffet area were very attentive to making sure everyhting was spotless.Location was perfect as it is right near Herald Station for the subway and a ten minute walk to Times Square. I would definitely recommend getting the New York city pass and the Metro pass. Subway is very simple just add either hopstop or metro app to your smartphone and you can navigate the city easily.We had a fantastic holiday and would like to thank all of the staff at Hyatt Place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place Hotel for six nights recently and found it to be a good find in price and location. Because it is new, everything was in perfect condition.The room is a decent size compared to some in NYC, and the bed is very comfortable. There is a good safe, a little refrigerator, a desk, a couch, and a large tv. The only drawback was the small closet and only three drawers for clothing, which made it hard to unpack for a longer stay. The bathroom has a good shower and plenty of towels. The free wi-fi and breakfast made the stay an especially good one for the price. The breakfast beats many of the lower end chains, and the staff worked very had to keep everything fresh and available. The staff throughout the hotel were friendly.I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After reading many reviews, I was pleasantly surprised upon my arrival to the hotel. Being new, the hotel is clean and well kept. The front desk staff, especially Matthew, went out of their way to be helpful. Annette in the housekeeping department was quick to remedy a situation and had a very pleasant demeanor. The room was large for NYC standards, the bathroom was acceptable and we had a great view from the 25th floor. The beds were perfect. I am always happy when there is a coffee/tea maker in the room. There was even a small refrigerator which is a plus. I will agree that most reviewers were correct about the elevator. At certainly times of the day, sharing only two elevator with the housekeeping staff, made the wait very long. If I were in a great hurry , I would have been in trouble. The free breakfast was nicer than would be expected under the circumstances and there were a good number of choices. The breakfast room is pleasant. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel and would stay here again at the right price. The hotel can not be compared with the Hyatt Andaz 5th Ave. or Andaz Wall Street which are my favorite Hyatt hotels in NYC and which I have stayed at often. Staying in a new hotel was a bonus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I travel to New York every month or two and being a Hilton/Marriott rewards member I hesitate to look outside those hotel families. But I have stayed at a few Hyatt Place hotels and wanted to give this a try since it was close to 34th Street & Penn Station. I arrived late on a Sunday night and after a long delay got checked in. The room was new and spacious for NYC standards and I had requested a king and got it but it was also handicapped - which I did not ask for nor did the front desk clerk tell me. When I went I called the front desk to ask for a non handicapped room he gave me another room but when I got there it was also handicapped! He claimed I had requested it in my reservation but I clearly had not and didnt seem to know which rooms in his system were handicapped or not. On top of this the air conditioning was not working very well and stayed at 79 all night. The breakfast the next day was delicious.I changed to 2 queens with a good air conditioner after the engineer could not fix my room the next day but for a new hotel I was very disappointed in this type of problem occuring. I would stay here again when prices are $250 or less but they need to work on their room management and maintenance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I recently stayed at this hotel for a short weekend jaunt in NYC. While there is nothing inherently bad about this hotel its low quality and low class feeling does not make it feel like it is part of the Hyatt family. Instead, you feel like you are staying at a Holiday Inn. On a good note, the rooms are spacious (at least for NYC). The beds VERY comfortable. And the staff are friendly. If I were paying $150 a night, it would be more than fine. But for over $300 - just not satisfactory!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Great Hotel, great location and a great price. This is a new Hotel, everything was new, clean and fresh. The staff was great and very helpful. The breakfast was very good and it was nice to see the Manager, I believe his name was Jason, was there to insure everything went well. We we able to walk everywhere and we did. I was impressed and will return. I do not understand some of the negative reviews I read as we have nothing but praise for the Hotel and Staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here while on a trip with the HS band/Drama club from our local HS. We had a wonderful time while in this magical city. All of the staff went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. Yes the elevators were slow, but with 56 people trying to use them plus all other's staying there, it was manageable. Would stay here again if possible when visiting NYC again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights in April. The room we were allocated was very clean, modern and the bed was huge and comfortable! I would of liked a bigger wardrobe to hang my clothes but as there was a large chest of drawers I was able to put most of my clothes in there.It would have also been nice to have a shaving mirror in the bathroom. I know previous reviewers have complained about the lifts but we never experienced any problems when we were there. Perhaps this may of been because we never used them at busier times i.e breakfast. The staff we had contact with were all helpful. The hotel is in a great spot and is close to Macey's, Empire State and Times Sq. I am not sure why people have complained so much about this hotel? One of the previous complaints were about local take aways putting their menus under the hotel guests doors. We actually found this very useful as we spent one day sightseeing and were too tired to go out in the evening so ordered in. The delivery was quick, reasonably priced and the food was very tasty!Besides the jet lag issue impacting on your sleep pattern. We found the room very quiet so we were able to get good sleep when we could!I would recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: After thousands of nights in and out of Hyatt's for decades I had great expectations for what is certainly the most anticipated opening of the exceptional Hyatt Place concept in a city that begs for the original HP concept Typically I am a huge fan of the new build Hyatt Place properties when they get them rightThis one sadly is a miss most things considered.Hyatt had an opportunity to showcase its Hyatt Place limited service brand in the most important city in the world. Unfortunately Hyatt allowed ownership of this property to change the concept to water down almost everything possible that is positive about the Hyatt Place brand. No doubt it will appeal to those who want to put as many guests into a two bedded room as possible at a price point in a very expensive city where poor quality sells for as much as high quality!Its a demand situation which is why hoteliers fight to open properties in New York.If you are a premium 3 star and up traveler you will most likely dislike the outcome of your experience even if you have had positive Hyatt Place experiences previouslyIf you are budget traveler or youth hostel or Holiday Inn fan you may be wowed or simply never stayed at any Hyatt at allPositives• Reasonably friendly hospitable staff trying to overcome the shortcomings of the property • Large flat screen TVs• Excellent location• The property is new• The bathroom is successful as any Hyatt Place property goes minus the counter space• In room small fridge & safeNegatives• Slowwwwwwwwww budget elevators with 25 plus floors and long waits during peak hours that can be cramped• The breakfast hours are unacceptable they close at 9:00 AM with lack luster offerings• It’s inconsiderate for International and domestic travelers on different time zonesThe hotel does not inform guests of the operating hours and leaves it posted on a sign to one side of the elevator if you happen to read it. This is a shorter time frame to dine then what Hyatt Place properties offer their guests across the nation.• Even the best view rooms are not that exceptional in view or design • Rooms are the smallest in the nation of any Hyatt Place property • Hyatt Place is meant to be in concept an all suite property yet these are standard small NYC guest rooms which is misleading when the brand features a suites concept like Embassy Suites nationwide• The beds are hard as a rock with no box springs for comfort • Box springs are typically a standard at every Hyatt Place nationwide. • These are uncomfortable. Cost cutting?• Almost no room for a luggage rack for one person one must get mighty creative• The closets are the width of the in room safe • They shoved to much furniture into a very small space/room• The lighting is poor,cheap and glary• Numerous rings and your lucky if anyone picks the phone up at the front desk at peak times. Final assessment I have seen nothing but crazy high prices on their website from 250 to 600 a night something I would never consider for the quality/size of rooms offered.
