However at the rates others have mentioned at 150 or below then the defects and disappointments make this property a steal.Good luck at finding those rates.I highly recommend Hyatt 48 Lex and Andaz Wall Street when in New York and choosing to stay Hyatt which are outstanding and offer exceptional value especially to Hyatt’s most frequent guests of their Gold Passport program.There are certainly much better choices all over New York with better design elements and more amenities to make for a more pleasant and enjoyable and comfortable spacious experience No doubt there will be some happy with Hyatt Place just as it is today in a city where anything will sell with the highest demand in the country for hotel roomsHeres hoping if Hyatt does open more Hyatt Place properties they build them similar to all things great about the Hyatt Place brand just as they should of this time around.The hotel and the website should be more transparent, honest and clear that this is a radical departure from what guests come to expect from a Hyatt Place property. There will certainly be an audience happy to get a clean new room none the lessCalling this property amazing in any capacity is a big stretch and misleading for others It certainly will be adequate for some and could be considered a tad better than average if one is being generously nice.Cheers

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed here for a couple nights last weekend. I have stayed at many Hyatts in NYC, the Grand Central Hyatt, 5th Avenue Andaz, and the Wall Street Andaz. For only paying $150 a night, I curved my expectations. Not sure why people are so upset about this hotel. Yes the elevator wait can be long for breakfast, but other than, the wait is less than a minute. Yes the hotel staff is undermanned, but they were pleasant in my interactions with them. The closet and room is small, but not sure what people were expecting for such a cheap room. The location is great with plenty of places to eat, and you can take the subway anywhere anyways. There's also a great bar across the street. If you want luxury and people to pamper you, this is probably not the hotel for you. But if you need a good place to eat and sleep, this is.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I will stay in this hotel again and again. A comfortable bed, great location, large flat screen tv, and very little street noise - all very important after a long day roaming the streets of the Big Apple! This hotel is located in the heart of the garmet/fashion district. Lots of small food establishments, shops and convenient parking and public transporation are all reasons why I gave this new hotel a 4 rating!This hotel was opened during the winter of 2013. The rooms were very clean (although small), with a spacious bathroom (w/walk-in shower). The desk employees were great, answering questions, helping us store our luggage and checking us in. The lobby has a business area with printer and computers. Very nice. The hotel had free wireless - a bonus! Our room had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building (although we also looked right into the apartment building that was next door). This hotel did not have the feel of a cut-rate budget hotel, yet our rate was only $145/night. After-all this is NYC, where hotels are considered a bargain at $300/night!Other reviews were spot on, the elevator usually had a wait (there are only two!), the decor is very modern and rather like walking into an Ikea store. The check-in/check-out process a little cumbersome. But the location and cleanliness outweighed these negatives.Although we did not use the fitness room, it looked clean with decent cardio machines. The dining room was simple and small. We passed on the breakfast and hit the streets of NYC in search of the perfect bagel and cream cheese!Can't wait to return to the Hyatt Place on 36th!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: As a Hyatt Gold Passport Diamond Member and well aware of the Hyatt Place brand I struggled to give this hotel 3 stars, so I was going to give it a 2 stars, but as I wrote this review I lowered it to 1 star. (this is compared to other hotels in NYC at this price range).Here are the PROS:The place is newLocationNice helpful staffI paid $134 AAA rate... WHOOO HOOO!!!!The view from my room.Here are the CONS:HOTEL WEBSITE:On the website it's branded by it's photos as a second generation Hyatt Place with upgraded lighting and rooms. When I arrive I was disappointed as it resemble the first generation Hyatt Place with the god awful motel 6 type lighting. The dinning area and bar have this cafeteria type ambiance... The rooms are very small and closet TINY, can't even fit your 32 inch carry on in it!!!.... THIS HOTEL SCREAMS BUDGET HOTEL. Photos on the website are not legit! ELEVATORS: SLOW SLOW SLOW.... plan to wait 20 minutes or longer in the AM during the free breakfast mob rush.FREE BREAKFAST: Ok if you are cheap... ENJOY. This has to be one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. Everyone is rushing down to the dinning area for these horrific breakfast skillet sandwiches and cheap fruit salad. The breakfast is not enjoyable, it's a nightmare, a mob type mentality takes over the guest at this hotel, it's like they are handing out $100 bills. There is this mad rush and mob scene for the free breakfast.MENU: Typical Hyatt Place Menu... ok for a suburban freeway exit budget hotel, but for god sakes Hyatt this is NYC, add a little excitement to the menu!!!Will I stay here again? for $134 yes... but the hotel does not merit a price point over $200 a night.... If this place is charging close to $300 or more I would strongly suggest you look elsewhere, there are many fantastic hotels in NYC around that price point.In the end the hotel gets one star... it sort of reminded me of the days when I was a student traveling on a budget and staying in those cheap tourist hotels in Europe, you know the ones with the rude German Tourist with the shared bathrooms, and free toast, butter and jam for breakfast!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: All is new and pristine here and the staff is outgoing, professional and helpful. The publicity and website photos of this property, however, are not accurate. They continue to show an exterior shot of a large Hyatt Place along a highway in Anywhere, USA. Interior shots are of of spacious rooms with a partitioned off separate seating area and large bathrooms with expansive counter space. This is misleading to the public. Rooms are very compact as are the bathrooms with limited counter space. The hotel has been opened long enough now to remedy this situation and show what guests will actually be experiencing. This would avoid the disappointment that I experienced here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Stayed couple nights at Hyatt Place Midtown South and were very well taken care of starting with Thomas at the front desk. The room was very pleasant and nice size looking towards the Empire State Building. Two queen beds and one convertible sofa bed can easily accommodate more but it was great for just two people. Breakfast was just excellent, especially for an inclusive room rate one. Lobby was modern and efficiently designed but don't expect a grande entrance or space. Overall, the hotel was more pleasant to stay than many if the four star hotels I frequently stay uptown. For this stay at least, the value/quality ratio was very high!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The rooms were a little small, but definitely a lot larger than many other NYC hotels. Room feels very clean and fresh upon entering. Bathroom was good too! Location was great and convenient. We had to do some printing and scanning of documents, and this was easily done for free using computers on the ground level . Staff were approachable and willing to assist. A very enjoyable stay indeed

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: What a great hotel! Very clean and great staff! Rooms are great, so cozy! Brand new. Parking down the street only $35. Breakfast was great. Go and enjoy! The elevators were a bit slow but no problem. Housekeeping staff very friendly and willing to answere any questions. We will be back soon!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Reserved for 3 nights 11 till 14 april. During ckeck-in found out they charged me for a no-show from the night before. Receptionist told it was fixed and i would have no further problems...During check out the no-show charge was again showing on my bill.The location is good and they offer free wifi. Since it is a new hotel , towels were good... But don't expect anything else. GAP of Supervisors, bad breakfast area, small rooms. Only 2 elevators for more then 20 floors!!Not comming back nor recomending

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Hi, Stayed at this hotel for 10 days with my wife and 3 kids while on holiday in New York, staff were amazing, complimentary breakfast was really good and the staff at the breakfast are so helpful.Really clean hotel, absolutely no problems, clean rooms, clean bathroom, free wifi in hotel Close to all major attractions in NY, enjoy your stay at this lovely hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Place April 8 & 9 and had a great stay. The hotel is centrally located and clean. It was worth the six block walk to Times Square if it saved $100 per night. Penn Station is close by and so if Madison Square Garden.My room was on the 25th floor and faced the Empire State Building. (See Photo) When I walked into the room, it felt like home. I spend a fair amount of time in hotel rooms and there was something about this room that felt welcoming. The furnishings were modern, the shower was huge and I enjoyed the room.Maybe it was the timing that I arrived and left the room, but I never had a problem with the elevators. Everyone is correct that there are only two elevators for 26 floors and I had concerns about availability of them during the busy times of the day. I do not think I ever had to wait than 2-3 minutes for an elevator. .I travel to NYC 4-7 times a year and am looking to my next stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. If you do not care about customer service and getting to places on time do not stay here. The staff besides one person was rude! The manager was not accommodating at all and did not do anything to help make our stay better. We were promised a king room with a pull out bed and did not get it. She was supposed to call Hotel.com and get back to me and she never did. She told me to go find another hotel. What kind of manager is that? She needs to be fired! The elevators suck just as much as she does. You can press the button to call the elevator and then go watch a show because by the time it comes I'm sure the show will be over! Room service, there is none. The "cafe" they have available 24/7 is the receptionist and there is only one person on duty at night. I waited a long time for a cake that could have been done in 30 seconds. Never again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Having read some of the reviews prior to our visit I have to say that I was wondering whether or not I had made the right choice of hotel for the trip my wife and two kids (11 and 14) were making from the UK. Thankfully, there was nothing to worry about. While there's no grand marble entrance and glistening chandeliers (which, for an extra $250 per night your could easily have) reception is clean, efficient and staffed by some very enthusiastic Hyatt employees. We had an issue straight away as our first room would only sleep two, but the staff were quick to react and resolve the issue. The hotel location was perfect for our trip. Within 5-10 minute walks we could be at Macy's, Times Square, Penn Station, 5th Avenue, etc. We ended up in the double queen room. The room was very clean and presented extremely well, the TV was great and had the option for us to hook in our iPad to watch some of the content we brought with us. Bathroom was a good size, nice shower but no bath. I would request a room with a bath next time rund after all the walking we were doing!We took advantage of the a.m. Skillet each morning which provided a great range of food, something for all the family from fruit/cereal to hot sandwiches from the hot plate. This being free would save a family like ours about $30-$40 a day on having to eat out for breakfast. Staff were constantly ensuring that nothing ran out, even though it was a pretty busy place around 9am each morning. The potential drawback is how busy it can get in the morning. We were lucky in that we always found a table, but I did notice times when people were having to hang around for a table to clear. It's not the biggest eating area in the world so I'd definitely be tempted to beat the rush each morning and get downstairs for 8:30 at the latest. Means you'll have more of the day to enjoy in the city.Overall, I would not hesitate to use the hotel again, either for business or pleasure. The combination of location, price, cleanliness, facilities and staff make this a hard place to beat. As for the elevators, we didn't have any issue with them at all, and we were on the 23rd floor. I think the problems have to be down to snagging given that the hotel is so new.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I stayed one night, traveling solo. The location was excellent as I had an early train out of Penn Station.After reading about the elevator issues, I asked for a room on a lower floor. However, the elevator situation appears to have been resolved. There were no lines or waits during my stay.The front desk staff were super friendly. My room was surprisingly spacious (even for a hotel in the City!). Free wifi and a mini fridge are nice perks. I found the breakfast included every I could want. It's definitely a nice touch for a mid-priced hotel.There was indeed a fair amount of street noise, but I'm originally from the city so I'm used to it. I was actually surprised when the street noise subsided at 11:30.I want to commend and thank the staff for keeping breakfast open for me after its official closing time and for offering to bring coffee up to my room after I noted that the coffee maker in my room was broken. Thanks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Three of us stayed at this hotel for the first time. Great location with ample parking garages nearby. Wonderful restaurants especially Korean.. Breakfast was great and Mr. Mohammad Khan and his crew are outstanding and provide excellent service. Mr. Khan definitely made a difference in our stay. We would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I was really hoping that this would be our family's new hotel, but i would not stay there again. As almost everyone else has noted, there is a real problem with the elevators, even when they were both working. I built in an extra 30 minutes to our departure time each day because we were touring colleges and could not be late for appointments. We were on the top floor so once the elevator arrived, it was empty and we could get on, but people on lower floors did not fare as well since it would fill up after 3 or so stops. We would then have to stop at almost every floor since people were waiting so long and no one could get on--I felt bad one family missed their train. There were definitely a lot of upset travelers. The breakfast is mediocre. if you get down there before 8:00 there is usually no problem and a couple of days we went down at 7:30 got our food and brought it up to the room. I booked a double queen with a sleeper sofa for me and my teenage daughter. We had a view of the Empire State Bldg., which was great, but the rooms are very small and you can really hear the street noise. We usually stay at the Doubletree Suites on Times Square which is a much noisier location and i never notice the street noise. Also beds are very hard, there are not enough plugs for charging electronic and there is no counter space in the bathrooms. They could have easily put a shelf under the sink so you could store your toiletries but didn't and there are no towel bars, even though there is plenty of room on the wall for two bars. Note to any hotel interior designers, if you're going to leave guests a card asking them to re-use their towels to help save our planet, you should probably install a towel bar for them to put them on so they can dry. Finally, there is virtually no service at this hotel. Front desk staff is friendly, but very weak. While I was checking in, the desk clerk answered a call for a food request and had no paper available to write it on. She forgot the room number but had said it out loud so i was able to repeat it to her. Also, My husband was joining us mid-stay so we left a key for him at the front desk in an envelope with his name. when he got there no one could find it so they gave a new key, but rekeyed the room so i was locked out. no big deal but going back down on the elevator to get a new key was a half hour outing. This hotel is way overpriced for what you get.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: In truth, the Hyatt Place in Midtown deserves a 3.5 rating. On the plus side, furnishings in the room are very good, the bed is very comfortable and the bathroom fittings are modern and stylish. I did in fact have a good nights sleep, which is not easy in NYC for under $300 a night all inclusive.On the minus side, breakfast is not up to standard -a very small area with simply too many customers, too few people serving and not a very wide selection of options (see NH hotels breakfast range if you want a reference in the 3* hotel segment). The elevators are inadequate -queues are just offputting. I was on the 5th floor so even though I had no view, I could walk down the stairs if need be (almost always). Finally, customer service was a little hit and miss -sometimes good sometimes frustrating (how difficult can it be to print me a hotel invoice with my company name on it?) and the hotel just lacked the little touches that make it special, such as a complementary bottle of drinking water in each room (I had to fork out $3.50 for one). As this hotel is not cheap, these little touches should be in the package.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Place Mid-Town South in New York for three days while attending WrestleMania 29 in New Jersey and it was the best, most personal experience we've ever had a major hotel. We were originally going to stay at the Marriott New York Downtown, however the restaurant and a lot of amenities were rendered inactive by Hurricane Sandy. We decided to look at other options and found the Hyatt for the same price. Before booking the room, we looked up some reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites to determine if it was a good choice. We saw nothing but bad reviews, but we found out that the hotel just opened two weeks prior and a lot of the reviews were written a day or two after opening. The reviews mentioned rude staff, long 10-15 minute waits for the elevator, and long lines for free breakfast. We didn't experience any of this. The staff was amazing! We were able to check-in 3 hours early. I specifically want to thank Matthew, who saved our butts! I was using a pre-paid MasterCard to cover the room. I called ahead to ensure I put enough on the card to cover authorizations and a little extra incase of emergency. What I didn't know, is that my card company adds a 15% authorization of their own for hotel stays. My card was declined and we came in from Canada. I called the card company and they would not relent. Matthew, who checked us in, did everything possible to help us correct the problem. In the end, they made an exception for us and they allowed us to put down the incidental authorization in cash, which would be transferred to the room account. The difference would be applied to my card, which worked! I thought we'd be SOL! He earned his tip, though I felt that we should have given more (if I was able to afford it). Our interactions with the rest of the staff was equally pleasant. We never had to wait more than 3 minutes for an elevator, even though the hotel only has two, and we went up/down several times throughout the day. Even during the breakfast hours, the elevator was fairly quick. It may be slower during the final hour of breakfast, but we never had an issue. Breakfast was not very busy in our experience, but we got there very early. Breakfast was great. A staff member greeted us when we went down and dire ted us to the breakfast area. My only issue was that the pancakes were cold, but I can't complain. My girlfriend noted a lack of sandwiches but that wasn't an issue either. The sausage was hot and fresh. The greeter also greeted us on the way back out and asked how our breakfast was before getting the elevator for us. If you want something different, there is several McDonalds, Starbucks, and stores near by, that carry sandwiches and fresh fruit. Try Herald Square Market for a buffet style lunch (charged by weight) or order from the gallery downstairs. Finally, the location was amazing, but has a caveat. The hotel is less than 5 blocks from New York Penn Station, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, and Macy's. The only issue, which isn't something that the hotel has control over, is that taxi's rarely come down the street in front of the hotel. You can ask the gallery host to call a car for you though, which is operated by a private company. Upon leaving our room to check-out, a woman from housekeeping greeted us and we've never experienced that at a Marriott or Sheraton. A nice touch! We were taking the bus at 7:30pm on the day of check-out and we needed a place to store our bags because the Port Authority Bus Terminal didn't provide lockers. The hotel stored our bags for us, during the afternoon. Over all, the hotel provided us with 5-star service from check-in to check-out. Better than any 4-star hotel we've stayed at, and it's only 3.5 stars! Matthew, the guy that checked us in, asked us if we sorted out our card issues when we checked out and we had a brief conversation with him before leaving. My girlfriend and I agreed that if we end up in New York City again, we will be staying at the Hyatt Place Mid-Town South.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This was my first time staying at a Hyatt hotel and it will be the last time. I reserved online and booked a suite. We were 5 people. The info on the web site said 2 queen and a sofa bed. The picture showed a nice sized room the 2 queens together then a little partition and the sofa on the other side. Perfect we thought. Instead when we got there, we got a tiny room 2 queens and the sofa bed crammed in there that when it was opened we had absolutely no room left to move around . We called the front desk to see if we can get a bigger room like what we saw on the internet. They said all the rooms are the same size. We dont know why it showed a bigger room. False advertisement if u ask me!!!! Then to wait for an elevator took about 10 minutes and more because there are only 2 and one was always stopped. So if you are above the 10th floor be careful you'll be using the stairs a lot. We had dirty dishes in front of our room all day every day. The staff working the front desk were not helpful. They are still in training from what it looked like. I understand the hotel has just opened but train your staff a little more. The only good thing was the breakfast. There was always enough food and coffee available for everyone. The location was great too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We had made reservations for 2 rooms at this hotel in March 2013. On the website it stated it was a new hotel and was opening the end of March. Approximately 2 weeks after I made online reservations someone from the Hyatt Consumer Affairs office called me. She told me the rate I had booked at was a mistake and that our rate would actually be $47 per night per room more. After I threatened to contact the BBB and Chamber of Commerence I was told they would issue me a refund after my trip was completed if I would email the bill to them. I thought that was weird because they should have access to the bill since they were in the corporate office. I just returned from our stay and have sent the bill to them. So we sill have not resolved that part yet. When we made the reservations online we called the hotel directly and told them we would be traveling with 3 small children and we needed our rooms either across or next to each other. One we got to the hotel we found out we were on different floors. Again, after much arguing with them they moved us to another floor and we were told we were next door to each other. Once we got to the rooms we found they were at opposite ends of the hall. Again, not beside or across from each other. The desk clerk said that was the best they could do. Because of the time of day it was we just took the rooms. The next morning when we went downstairs to breakfast ( it was included with the room) we could not find a place to sit anywhere in the dining room, lobby, etc. We finally had to sit on the floor and the children put their food on a stool to eat. What a mess !!! The next day we went downstairs and ask the front desk clerk ( we tried to reach them on the room phone but they never answered) where the pool was. We were told "there is no pool". I said on your website (not the Hyatt's website) but this specific hotels website it shows a pool. He said sorry we do not have a pool. The same night we were leaving to go our for dinner ( we were on the 20th floor) and could not get the elevator to go down. The elevator kept opeining and closing but would not move. So we walked 20 flights with 3 children down the stairs. I wish I could say we only did this once but we wound up having to do it 3 times during a 4 day stay. There were 2 elevators in the entire hotel but only one worked. Remember this is a NEW hotel !!! The only positive thing I can say about this hotel was that the Empire State Building was right outside of our window. We had a beautiful view at night when it was lite up and during the day when it was not lite. This was my first stay at a Hyatt ( I always stay at Hilton's) and it will be my last. I can only hope they get some of these items worked out. The rate was ok but not terrific so I am not sure why they felt like they needed to increase it. Just be prepared for some bumps in your stay if you stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Lobby is a bit threadbare with very institutional look and feel. Room are nice. Two elevator service is minimal for this size hotel. During my stay one elevator was out of service creating big delays; staff did little but apologize for the inconvenience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Nice and clean, good location , but not enough elevators to service the number of people and rooms. Expect to wait a long time during peak departure times, especially if you are on lower floor. Many guests from 10 floors up opted for stairs vs 15 minute wait

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: First the positives, a Hyatt that allowed me to use my free yearly Hyatt Visa certificate after losing them 2 years in a row. Great location, new with a very good gym for this category of Hyatt. Free WIFi and rooms very decent.Not so good as it did not honor "•Extend your stay until 2:00 p.m. with a late check-out request", free breakfast but not enough staff to allow all to eat in inadequate space and staff too overworked to provide good customer service (phones ring for 10+ minutes without any pick-up).All in all, value for the free certificate but don't expect full Hyatt service.BTW if you are driving and you use their recommended parking lot, get a voucher or a business card as the process was horrible. To save money go to Groupon for a $19 rate at a lot just as close to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Maid service was excellent in spite of our 8 plus bag explosion! Rich took care of all our stuff when we first got there so we could run and see the city.Rich was warm and friendly all the time! (I will remember him)Good breakfast. Taxis were called for us on Easter to get around. Hotel did not disappoint.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Being a Platinum Hyatt Passport Member, i do care that the below (Cons) are looked into:Pros:- Location is excellent, very close to subway station, across the street from Macy's and a 10 minutes walk to Times Square- Property is brand new, rooms are nicely done and clean, beds are comfortable.- Free Wifi was good and did the required job- Staff are friendly and helpfulCons:- Only two elevators to service 26 floors x 8 rooms.- One of two elevators was not working, it took us once 25 minutes to get into one as it was impossible to go 22 floors up with bags and kids!- The same elevator is used by house keeping. After long waits, it is very disappointing for the door to open and you find a maid with her huge tray filling the whole cabinet!- Closet in room is so small that it cannot fit a carry on. So it was a bit inconvenient for us family of 4.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Two elevators for 24 floors and no service elevator are you kidding!!! And one broke down!! We had no need or stamina for the fitness room because of the 10 storey walk down each morning. Small but clean and well equipped rooms. Free breakfast for everyone which meant it was a zoo!! The price we paid made this a VERY disappointing stay - won't do it again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend (Fri-Mon) in New York City. Being a brand new hotel, everything was clean and fresh. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and had a lot of variety. Hotel staff was also very friendly. The location for us was great. You are just around the corner from Macy's, the subway and not too far from Times Square. The worse thing about the hotel were the elevators (there are only two for 26 floors). They took forever. Plus - one broke down so it was out of commission for Sunday and most of Monday. Luckily we were on the 4th floor and ended up using the steps a lot. Knowing the wait would be so long on Monday - we allowed ourselves extra time to wait for the elevator - and when it did come - it was full. We put our luggage on the elevator with strangers and ran down to meet it in the lobby to retrieve it. We beat the elevator from the 4th floor to the lobby. Also, if you go during the peak breakfast hours, be prepared to either wait in line or wait for a table to open up. Giving them the benefit of just opening - the buffet staff was very nice - but seemed to have a hard time keeping the food items stocked. We had a pull out sofa bed. In the drawer was a bag that only contained sheets. We had to call down for a pillow (they only had 1 to give us - they did not have 2) and blankets. I also had to request that they fix our window shades because they were stuck as well. In both instances - the service was quick - but those are things I shouldn't have had to call about. Would I stay there again - likely - but I would request a low floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I have stayed at all levels of Hyatt, including several Hyatt Places, so am familiar with what each level typically has to offer (or not). I am coming to NYC with a small group of friends in a few months so I stayed at the new Hyatt Place this week to check it out. I had a reservation for five nights, but just couldn't stay more than three.For starters, Hyatt should not have posted the pictures of another Hyatt Place on the web-site, because the building and its interior is not at all like some of the photos. They do have some good basics: reasonable price (for NYC), good location near midtown, comfortable bed, good lighting, free wifi, a nice TV, a safe and a fridge. However there were just too many other issues I had problems with.During the time I was there, there were huge lines for both the (admittedly free) breakfast and the 2 tiny elevators. I ended up going to Starbucks for breakfast instead, and a few times I walked up to my 14th floor room, or walked up to the 3rd floor and took the elevator down then up again instead of waiting. In my room, the thermostat was permanently stuck at 74 degrees, and the stopper in the bathroom sink was not working properly. I could not get the shades to work at all, so never saw daylight. There were always things left behind in the halls by the housekeepers.Every morning I also found takeout restaurant menus pushed under the room door; when I mentioned this to the front desk staff they said that people were sneaking into the hotel to distribute the menus to every rooms. This place has 24 floors, and I would have thought security people should have spotted and questioned someone going from room to room wandering around the hallways.This is a brand new place but its already showing little signs of wear and tear, and although some staff are quite nice, others need to be educated in the basic courtesy that loyal customers expect from Hyatt brand hotels. To be fair, many of the employees seemed overworked and overwhelmed by the crowds of guests, mostly noisy groups of tourists. When I asked for help with issues in my room, staff were typically too busy to assist.In June my group will not be staying here, but will go to the Hyatt 48 Lex instead.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Firstly, wee were first greeted by a staff I believe it was his first day because he did not know how to operate the hotel's check in software. Secondly, we specially advised the the front desk that we were expecting an additional guest for the reservation at a later time that day and instead of an add on to the door keys, ours were deactivated after. But the most frustrating and disturbing thing is that we got knocked on the door at 9AM on a Saturday morning from maintenance to see if we have hot water AND literally 5 minutes later we got another knock from a staff asking what time we will be checking out. It was very rude and got disturbed so early in the morning. It was a horrible experience from a Hyatt chain hotel and very disappointed as a Hyatt Gold Passport member. Confirmation No. 2033484101

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I do a fair amount of business and personal travel and have yet to experience the level of frustration as is the case with my current stay at this hotel. The hotel has approx 24 floors and only 2 small elevators to service those floors. Cleaning staff also uses these same elevators to transport huge cleaning carts from floor to floor - when there is a cart in the elevator perhaps 2-3 other people can squeeze in assuming they don't have any luggage. On average i've waited approx 10 minutes for an elevator when both were "working" and to add to the fun one elevator was not in service on Sunday march 31st early afternoon. To my surprise when I got back late evening it was still out of service. It appears management doesn't care enough to ensure elevator issues are addressed in a timely fashionI check out tomorrow - what fun that will be with luggage. Had I not been on the 19th floor I'd take the stairs. Do yourself a favour and stay elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Checked in at about 9.30 pm and I got to the room to find out the air conditioning fan was broken and made a very loud rattling noise. The technician tried to fix it for an hour ,unsuccessfully and called the front desk to change the room. The only response I got back was they don't have any other rooms available and I could speak to the manager in the morning! To compound sleeping in a cold room in NY in winter there is a loud " drilling " noise that comes around midnight from right outside the hotel which goes on for about 20 minutes. Called the front desk for earplugs and their response was its the garbage pickup , the noise should stop shortly! Next morning the breakfast line is very long, and no place to sit after you get your breakfast.Doesn't end there , the elevators in the morning are used by the house keeping staff that starts knocking on your door at 8.30 am to find out when you are checking out! The elevators don't stop often on the 1 st floor because the house keeping staff coming for the basement takes them straight upto the floor they need to go to to! The manager was quite condescending in her demeanor with a " sorry, we didn't have any rooms" and that's it! This is one of the worst hotels to stay at. I would recommend staying away if you can!

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Just got back from a two night stay in this hotel. We are frequent guests of Hyatt Hotels, so we were excited to hear that this one had just opened, and we were going to have chance for a quick trip. After arriving at the hotel on our first night, we were asked to come back later as check in wasn't until after 3pm. The staff quickly secured our luggage, and we went to explore the city. We returned at 5pm tired and ready to check in. Our room's view wasn't that great as we were on a lower floor, but the room was clean and spacious. We had two double beds and a pull out sofa. I have stayed in many hotel rooms in NY, and was surprised at the size of the room, we also had nice size fridge. Our first night was disturbed by fire alarms going off at 1am, due to a boiler issue. This resulted in no hot water the next morning, which was quickly resolved by 11. Not a big problem, as this gave us chance to run down to the restaurant and pick up a yummy breakfast. Open faced egg, cheese and avocado skillet sammies, pancakes, fresh fruit, etc. - my hubby is on a low carb diet, and was able to eat something. The coffee was hot, and delicous (starbucks) - I worked for Marriott hotels for many years, therefore had the luxury of staying in some of the best hotels in NY. I would have to say - if I was to visit again, I would probably choose this hotel over the big ones in Times Square. The location is fantastic - Empire State, Broadway, Macy;s Times Square all within a couple of mins away. Again, this is not one of the big fancy hotels, but more of an intimate boutique hotel, but well worth checking out. Big fancy foyers and doormen dressed to the nines is very impressive, but let's be honest, what is the most important part of staying in a hotel - COMFORT - and this place has it..... Before I forget, the staff are #1. Sorry, I should have mentioned them first - from the second we checked in to the time we left we were well taken care of and always met with a big NY smile.... This is now my official #1 hotel in NY - Thank You

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This just opened hotel has some pros and cons.Pros- Great location, Easy Walk from Penn Station, Nice rooms (Had a view of Empire State Building), Included Breakfast.Cons - Only 2 lifts and for the 3 days I was there only ever one in working order, consistant 10-15 min waits then overcrowded!, Breakfast bar jammed into a narrow space behind a bench and a pillar making getting any food items a WWF match! (Hyatt there is room to move this!) Staff a little disorganised (benefit of doubt as just opened)Summary - Probably worth a go if you get at the right price otherwise look at Hiton Garden Inn just behind on 35th.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel itself is nice. The room was small but nicely appointed. We had a view of the Empire State Building from our window. The lobby/business area is small, but as expected, for the price.There is a bar area, and a free breakfast with a comfortable dining area. In general the hotel is obviously understaffed and not well trained. That is Hyatt's responsibility. The desk personnel didn't know much about the area, and what was available as far as restaurants etc. They didn't even have a printed hand out. We are Platinum so when I asked about late check-out, the desk clerk said, "Oh I don't think that is possible. We are overbooked, and understaffed." I said, "Do you know that for certain?" since no effort was made to check. He repeated that he was "overbooked and understaffed." Poor service. We also got on an elevator in the morning and started are descent with a lone bag of garbage that was inadvertently left on the elevator. It was grabbed by a maid in mid descent from another floor, with an apology. The breakfast was good, but really understaffed. Beverages were not being replenished. The room was clean and nice, but it was only a few days old. There was a mini-fridge in the room which was not a pay bar, but an empty useable fridge. I would give this hotel another shot for a good price. They really need to train their people.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This is a very newly opened hotel at the budget end of Hyatt's product offering. Very similar to Holiday Inn Express model.On the positive side: The room was modern, reasonable size and equipped with all the essentials: comfortable bed, effective shower, large HD tv, fridge, in-room safe. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was good (midtown is just right place to be located if you want to do the traditional stuff)On the negative side:The elevators (lifts to us Brits)!!!! There were only two for the whole hotel and it has about 26 floors so during busy period you have to wait a very long time. We chose to walk down the emergency exit stairs most times but if you have a room anywhere above the 12th floor that becomes a bit impratical.The breakfast was okay except for the scrambled eggs which were terrible (prepared from packs of liquid eggs) but the eating area is too small for the number of guests so it was always very crowded

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: This hotel is situated in a good location. Good breakfast. It is new, therefore clean too. BUT, we had a bad night , because on the 25th morning( about 1-10am thereabouts!), fire alarm went off! Fire engines and firemen arrived!! Couldn't sleep a wink after that!! And until now, 11.20am, no hot water!! The water is icy cold!! Too cold even to wash our hands or faces!Hopefully, all these problems will be non existent when I am here on my next holiday! I have to leave for home tonight. My room is 1007. Siewkheng Foo , Singapore

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I had room 2406. Never sleep a wink the first night due to road noise and refrigerator running. Night two I took a sleeping pill and unplugged the fridge. Not the usual Hyatt experience, bed was like sleeping on a door. Woke up to "housekeeping" "housekeeping" "housekeeping" "housekeeping" on the door next to mine at 8am. I will say it was clean and a nice size for the price in NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I spend a week on 15-March, the 2nd day of opening. The hotel is new and clean. The rooms in the street are quite noisy and it is better to ask for a room on the back. Breakfast is included in the price which is rare in new york and there is lots of choices. The hotel is not yet in routine period and personnal are still not familiar with all process. I book it via a website offering a very good price for the hotel opening.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: The hotel is very clean, modern & pleasant enough. However, if you have a car, beware. They have an agreement with a local garage, but they refuse to provide a curbside loading area so you are at a high risk of a $115 parking ticket. Do not trust them to advise you of anything. The valet brought the car, packed at the front door along the curb & delivered keys to the front desk. I was standing in the lobby but waiting for an associate to come down, as the car arrived in less than 10 minutes, not the predicted 30 as advised by the front desk. I less than 3 minutes a ticket was issued on the car within the view of desk personnel. They did nothing to stop it or even point it out. Had I not been on the lobby the car would haw been towed immediately. Instead, the $115 parking citation was in my hand and the GM simply said " it's not our responsibility after the valet delivers. It is your car "I would have made this location a regular when in the city for business each month. Now I cannot ever justify patronizing a hospitality business when they have no regard for guest hospitality

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: I am so glad Hyatt Place has finally come to NYC. This hotel just opened a few days before my March 18 arrival. The place was ready for guests! The rooms were spacious and tastefully done (we had a double double view) with wonderful beds and a great view. We slept well!The check in was seamless and everyone was pleasant and professional. The next morning we woke up at 8:30 and went downstairs for breakfast at 9:35. Oops, breakfast ends at 9:00. No problem, really. I should have checked (or maybe I was told and forgot).The off putting incident came when I helped myself to a cup of coffee (the dispensers had not been removed) and a scowling odd little man in a suit came over and said "you must pay..no more free coffee." Er, ok. I asked what time the free coffee ended. He said 9:30. I shook my head and said "really"? He glared at me for a second then waved his hands and said, "ok, ok, just one cup." There was another guest that heard the whole exchange and he shook his head and said to me, "whoa, that was not pleasant." Yeah.So, I'll be back for sure but they really should consider breakfast till 10 (it is NYC after all) but even if they don't, at least tell the little guy in the suit to smile and be a bit more hospitable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Place New York Midtown South
review_body: Whilst part of the reputed Hyatt chain, the friendly, personal service offered by the staff, (led by Devon Alexander, the Director of guest services) gives one the impression that it is a boutique hotel. Always smiling & happy to help, NOTHING is too much for the staff here. The hotel is perfectly located to start sightseeing almost as soon as you leave the hotel doors. Which one can only do after filling up on the hearty hot & cold buffet breakfast - you really are set up for the day after this! Being brand new, having opened its doors a few days ago, the whole place is spotless. Contemporary, chic rooms are spacious with a luxurious feel (huge bed & incredibly comfortable; 42 inch LCD tv, tea & coffee in room & a fridge - rather unusual for NYC). Free wifi throughout & computers in the foyer for all to use. And then there's the view. Our room was on the 25th floor, at the back of the hotel - so we woke up to The Empire State Building right in front of us! At night, the whole City twinkles & you can see all the way down to Wall St. Having visited NYC a few times before & stayed at the Waldorf Astoria & Marriott hotels, I would always come back here in the future. It may not have the grand foyer, but the rooms are beautiful & the staff really do go that extra mile to make your stay perfect. Being from London & having travelled around the world, I expect a first class service. That is certainly what you can expect here. In fact, during our stay we decided that Devon Alexander never sleeps! She is ever present, leading her team by example. This whole review may sound too good to be true, but this hotel really did make our stay. When you've found a little gem in the heart of New York, its only fair to share the details so that others may also have the happiest stay. We're both seasoned travellers, but the team here have seriously impressed us. Why go anywhere else? We will certainly be back!
